description:
NZAC Wellington: Three Terrific Talks, This section night we're delighted to host four of our wonderful club members to share three talks on their respective adventures this alpine season.

Talk one: Cumulonimbus Corner by James Sales
James tells us about his trip up the Cumulonimbus corner on the South Face of Girdlestone, a tricky ascent requiring skills in rock and ice climbing!
Talk two: Taranaki East Ridge by Jon Keyzer
A group trip whittled down to two. Jon tells us about the mission up Taranaki's infamous East Ridge, the decision to keep going and the challenging conditions at the top.
Talk three: Angelus Hut - Leon Lim & Jim
Leon and Jim tell us about their adventure to Angelus Hut just last weekend! A trip down south and three days in the stunning Nelson Lakes area.

Join us for these exciting talks and our usual section night pizzas
We look forward to seeing you there!

description:
Just Wear It! Raising funds for Ovarian Cancer, Cocktails and Canapes, in THAT outfit you never get to wear?! What more could you want in a fun-raising event!
Think NYC art gallery opening meets cocktail soirée: stylish but social, a little bit glam, and a great excuse to get dressed up for a night out with friends!
The ticket price includes a signature cocktail on arrival and canapés walked throughout the height of the event, where guests can bid on a silent auction of irresistible treasures from our favourite Local businesses!
Connect over great conversation and classic beats while raising money for a great cause!

description:
Titahi Bay Surf Hui, Titahi Bay Surf Hui – About the Day
The Titahi Bay Surf Hui is a celebration of surf and community at the Bay. From beginners catching their first waves to advanced surfers pushing limits, everyone’s welcome. Surf heats will run all day with trophies, prizes, and spot prizes up for grabs.
On land, the iconic boatsheds and Mana Island backdrop set the vibe with music, food, and good times. The Hui is about more than just competition — it’s about celebrating the Bay and bringing whānau and friends together.
Save the date – Saturday 11th October 2025.
Registration will be available soon via LiveHeats.
Follow, like, and share our Facebook page to stay up to date with comp news, registration, and event updates.
Keen to support? We’re welcoming local sponsors — reach out if you’d like to get involved.

You can choose to watch the Showcase at 3pm or 6pm.

description:
Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington, Running into the Sun - Te Auaha, Wellington
https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

After winning Best Theatre at the Melbourne Fringe, Running into the Sun comes home to Pōneke for the first time. The 10 creatives in a2 Company create an “exhausting but exhilarating” story of what it means to be alive right now with live music, dance and theatre.

The story follows Ash (Ben Ashby), Morris (Ethan Morse) and Mary (Jasmine Susic), at their university graduation house party. As they deal with personal heartbreaks, surprises and betrayals they must also reckon with a climate disaster unfolding in their hometown and a global future filled with war and political unrest. Dance, Clown, Live Music, Film and Physical Theatre weave together to catch the feeling of hope in the face of oncoming doom.

Running into the sun was developed by a2 Company; The Dance & Theatre production house co-directed by Nadiyah Akbar (Footnote NZ Dance, Joel Bray Dance) and Ben Ashby (Artistic Director of Long Cloud Youth Theatre 2020-2023).

“messy, joyous, heartfelt and completely off the chain.” - Melbourne Fringe Festival: Judges’ Picks.

“...suffocating and comforting …exhausting but exhilarating” - My Melbourne Arts

https://www.teauahaevents.com/home/running-into-the-sun

Credits

Ben Ashby - Writer, Director, Producer, “Ash”

Nadiyah Akbar - Choreographer, Rehearsal Director, Dancer

Ethan Morse - “Morris”

Jasmine Susic - “Mary”

Alec Katsourakis - “Jack”

Luke Romero - Dancer

Toby Leman - Composer, Saxophone, Synths

Seth Boy - Double Bass

Lennox Grootjans - Composer, Drums

Asha Barr - AV, Cinematography, Stage Design, Technical Stage Manager

Cleo Copplestone - Graphic Design
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour), Pub Choir - Wellington, Aotearoa - Michael Fowler Centre (Average at Best Tour)
Do you have the best singing voice in the world? Unlikely. But do you have the WORST singing voice in the world? EQUALLY UNLIKELY. Your voice is probably average (at best), and at Pub Choir: we think that’s great!

Now in it’s 8th year, Pub Choir is the easiest, funniest, largest music lesson in the world. Created and led by the human rubber band Astrid, be snapped into shape and flicked by her quick humour as she teaches everybody how to make a BRAND NEW PIECE OF ART TOGETHER.

What will happen at the show? An entirely improvised, comedy music lesson, where you are the main attraction. Astrid will teach you one song (yep, just the one) in 3-part harmony, and you will do your best to follow her instructions and not to cry.

Generally, you should prepare yourself to learn something new and to not be a dickhead in public. But what should you specifically prepare? Nothing. It’s not that kind of choir. There’ll be no auditions and no homework. Just bring your mouth and we’ll do the rest.

So come and bring your average-at-best self, and your average-at-best friends, and let’s try to worry less and feel better. Also worth mentioning, Astrid wrote a book, and it’s called Average At Best and signed copies will be available for pre-order purchase with Pub Choir tickets, to be collected at the show. Vocal health depending, Astrid plans to sit at the merch desk and sign these books after every show until her audience grows tired of her.

This show is 18+ Please be aware that this event will be filmed & photographed. By purchasing a ticket and attending this event, you are giving your consent to be filmed & photographed during this event.

Tickets on sale here 10am local time 3 July 2025:
https://www.ticketmaster.co.nz/event/240062D286A9097D

description: Winemaker's Long Lunch, Sip, savour and socialise at Noble Rot's legendary Long Lunch. Fresh from this year’s prestigious Pinot Noir conference held in Christchurch in February, Noble Rot are so excited to host some of New Zealand's finest winemakers as Central Otago meets North Canterbury. Enjoy some special treats from the winemaker's own cellars as you while away the afternoon with with three generous courses served sharing style. Is there a better way to spend a Sunday afternoon?

description:
Small Towns, Kiwi Summers, Small Towns, Kiwi Summers
Presented by Tempest Theatre Co.
Directed by Emma Maguire

Forests, beaches, unbearable ennui — it's no picnic being from one of the most rural places in Aotearoa. Sometimes the best day of your life is sitting in a horrible carpark outside the Warewhare cause there's nothing else to do.

There's a tragedy in being in a place that's so far away from everywhere else. On the longest day of summer, join my friends and yours as we dream, wonder, and hope that things aren't going to change too much come February.

An improvised dramedy about leaving home, finding your feet, and fighting your way out of the wop-wops.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content. The show may contain strong language and mature themes, including but not limited to mental health and homophobia. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Saturday Laughs with Kajun Brooking and Sera Devcich, Saturday Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone is a showcase of some of your favourite comedians in the heart of Petone

With Kajun Brooking
Raised on the gang infested streets of Hastings, Kajun moved to Whanganui in search of a better life. This is where he cultivates cunning comedy and hustles sticky punchlines based on life experiences. Described as slippery, quick witted and punchy, his mission is to make at least one person laugh. If he can do that, his job is done for the night and he can continue to prove to his 17 year old daughter that Dad is actually funny.

Sera Devcich
With a strong background in theatre, award winning actress Sera Devcich has turned her stage prowess to the dark art of stand up comedy. Since then she has rapidly climbed up the comedy rank, performing across the country with NZ's top comics.
Sera Devcich is a must see act.

More performers to be announced

Culture Embassy band Live at Nui Hui Festival, Culture Embassy is a Wellington-based 10-piece band, comprising musicians from diverse cultural backgrounds.
The ethno-cultural diversity of the band is also reflected in the sound of the music, hence the name "Culture Embassy"
A fusion of African musical styles, Roots Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro Latin rhythms.
Nui Hui is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge and a host of genre fusions and musical styles.

description:
THE DEVILS ARE COMING August 2025, After a sell-out first go of it WE ARE BACK with our hit late night sketch comedy brought to you by RUFF AS GUTZ- a local theatre company behind the MILK saga, Hardly Workin'!, DOGS IN THE HOLE and other things, I'm sure.
This could be considered a curated scratch night. It could also be considered a low-budget SNL. One thing's for sure: It's happening and it's happening SOON.
Hosted by local devil Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin, and featuring some of Wellingtons up-and-comers, this show is a new ensemble premiering works to make people either laugh or at least exhale out their nose a little.

description:
Scene Painting, Scene Painting
Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's the final show of the 2025 New Zealand Improv Festival, and we're bringing together some of our favourite performers for a once-in-a-lifetime show.

Improvisers will often paint a scene, using narration to conjure images in the mind of the audience. But what if they could actually paint the scene?

Thanks to the generous support of Resene Paints, we'll be doing just that: actually painting our scenes onto the stage and walls at BATS. Come send off the Festival with a messy, beautiful explosion of colour!

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience, It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Storytelling with the Unicorn!, Stories handcrafted right before your very eyes.

The Unicorn is the last of a long line of spontaneous storytellers, and today he's come out of hibernation to weave tall tales to impress small people. Using improvisation and audience participation The Unicorn welcomes all ideas to create a story that will never be told again. Come be a part of the magic.

As performed by Derek Flores

Inspired by masters such as Groucho Marx and Bugs Bunny, Derek has pursued a life in comic theatre. At a young age he became a student of Keith Johnstone, (author of “Impro” and creator of TheatreSports), and a Loose Moose Theatre alumni which saw him through a life as a street performer and cabaret act throughout festivals in Canada, Australia, Europe, and NZ. Eventually finding himself on at The Second City Toronto where he co-wrote and performed two mainstage shows and shared the stage with Colin Mochrie and Robin Williams.

"...a magnificent improviser and storyteller..." -Theatreview

Suitable for ages 8+
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Sophie Thorn – Victoria University Photography Collection, A tour of the photographs from Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington Art Collection
Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington holds a nationally significant collection of works of art which is under the care of Te Pātaka Toi Adam Art Gallery. Known as Ngā Puhipuhi o Te Herenga Waka, or 'the feathers which adorn the waka', over half of this collection can be found on display in the various buildings on the university campuses at any one time.
For this special outing, join the gallery’s Kaiwhakarākei, Curator Collections, Sophie Thorn, for an afterhours tour of the Hunter Building focusing on the photography in the collection.
We will see photographic works by Lucien Rizos, Ans Westra, Peter Preyer, Joyce Campbell, Fiona Pardington, Ann Noble and Chris Corson Scott.
We are meeting at the foyer of the Hunter Building. This is the big set of glass doors off gate 2 between the two sets of lights on Kelburn Parade.
As the tour begins at 6pm we would suggest,that people park in the Hunter Building carpark (coming in Gate 1 (right at the bend between Salamanca Road and Kelburn Parade). While these are reserved spaces for staff after 5:30pm parking is a bit of a free-for-all on campus after hours.
Thursday, 11 September, 6:00pm start, Meet at Hunter Building (Main Entrance off Kelburn Parade)
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky WELLINGTON, ✨ Chiron: The Wise Centaur – Myth, Medicine, and Sky
Discover the story of Chiron, the immortal centaur unlike any other: healer, teacher, prophet, and guide to heroes from Achilles to Asclepius. We’ll explore Chiron’s legendary skills in medicine, music, hunting, prophecy, and ethics, and why ancient storytellers remembered him as the gentlest of the centaurs.Follow the centaur’s path through your own chart in this astrological gathering of thought-provoking discussion, exploration and discovery.
About The Planet Mechanic (aka Sousa)
Sousa is the only New Zealand graduate of Kepler College of Astrological Arts & Sciences in the USA. With 30 years experience, she is a passionate and insightful interpreter of the signs and seasons of the sky. www.theplanetmechanic.co.nz
New to Astrology?
Consider taking the Crash Course in Astrology - a one day event of self-discovery studying the fundamentals of your astrology chart. This is available online, taught in small groups of ten or less participants. https://events.humanitix.com/crash-course-in-astrology-online
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
THE GRAND KIKI HOUSE OF MARAMA BALL, The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present THE GRAND KIKI HOUSE OF MARAMA BALL 🌙
Proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Te Papa Tongarewa.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of the Kiki House of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom scene.
Join us for a night of high-energy performances and out-of-this-world fashion as walkers compete for trophies and prizes in a display of Black and Brown queer and trans joy, liberation, and Ballroom* artistry.
With a fabulous line-up of Categories, Judges, Commentators and DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap ✨ 🤏 dance 💃 and cheer 🥳 the night away at Te Papa Tongarewa on Sat 4th Oct.
Ballroom Community Walkers & Spectators Ticket Access
Contact our House account on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code for Fem Queens FREE access for FQ who are not walking/competing, please contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
Categories & Themes
Virgin Vogue - A Marama Storm (Treasure)
Bizarre - Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (FQ, TM and BQ) - Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance - Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) - Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem - A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (FF, MF and GNC) - Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA Best Dressed - Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator - Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance - A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway - The Phases of Marama
House of the Night (no theme)
Judges, Commentators & DJ announcement coming soon...
Please do not hesitate to contact us via houseofmarama@gmail.com or on all social media @houseofmarama for any questions or concerns.
⎯
Ballroom* is a safe space created in the 1960's, forged by the Black, Latinx and queer Americans in protest against the racism and queerphobia that they faced from the non-queer community and white queer community. It is a space held to protect trans womxn of colour, so as guests and participants within this culture it is imperative that we all do our best to respect and honour this sacred space. Homophobia, Transphobia, and any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
To learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom check out this link: https://artsandculture.google.com/project/ballroom. Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Conditions of Rapture: Amy Marguerite, Sophie Van Waardenberg & Emma Barnes | Writers on Mondays, Three extraordinary poets introduce their new collections, books of poetry brimming over with feeling, and taut with intellectual curiosity. Amy Marguerite (over under fed), Sophie van Waardenberg (No Good), and Emma Barnes (IF WE KNEW HOW TO WE WOULD) talk with Anna Jackson about the conditionality of rapture, the loveliness of loneliness, the difficulty of living in a hungry body, how it has felt to keep writing through a pandemic, heart-break and grief, and why it matters to make space for metaphor and memory, for sparrows and bees and a guinea-pig, eating a dandelion, its mouth full of gold.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf, Experience the world through the lens of award-winning photojournalists at The World Press Photo Exhibition at Tākina. This event showcases this year’s best visual journalism, featuring powerful and thought-provoking images from New Zealand and around the world.
Additionally, visitors can view "The 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf: The Friends, Influences and Inspirations Exhibition," curated by Simon Woolf.
Photos on display will feature images by Ronald Woolf and Spencer Digby (Te Papa Tongarewa Collection), alongside works by Wellington’s own Simon Woolf, internationally renowned photographer Brian Brake, and legendary sports photographer Peter Bush. The exhibition will also display images by Barry Durrant, former chief photographer of The Dominion, as well as photographs by acclaimed recent talents, including Pulitzer Prize winner Melanie Burford, celebrated international photojournalist Simon Townsley, and esteemed photo historian Graham Stewart.
Don't miss your chance to see Kiwi photographers on show at Tākina.
Epson NZ sponsors the 90th Anniversary of Photography by Woolf.
Event Details:
• 5 September – 5 October: 10 am – 5 pm
• Tākina Exhibition Space
• Host: New Zealand Academy of Fine Arts.
Tickets available online or at the door.
Photo: © DAVID UNWIN / The Post.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Moonlit Market at The Atom - A playful experiment in entrepreneurial leadership, Date: Wednesday 15 October
Time: Doors open 5pm, adventure begins 5:30pm sharp. We’ll wrap up around 7:30pm.
Location: The Atom, Rutherford House, Victoria University, Wellington
Cost: Free (but only 25 places - first in, first served)
Step into a fantasy world where business plans mingle with strange enchantments and the market is never what it seems.
This event is designed with entrepreneurial leadership in mind - for anyone curious about the messy reality of building ideas and leading through uncertainty. If you’ve ever wondered what it really takes to test, fail, and adapt on the fly, you’ll feel right at home.
You’ll take on a fantasy character and join a small team of fellow entrepreneurs-in-disguise. Together, you’ll:
Interview strange and unpredictable NPCs to gather intel.
Dream up bizarre products that might just make you rich.
Build your idea with limited time and energy tokens.
Roll the dice and see what magical mishaps or unexpected opportunities change your fate.
The market is chaotic, the customers are fickle, and your product could become a cult sensation - or a village-wide joke.
This playful experience is more than just fun and games. You’ll get a taste of:
Leading through uncertainty
Making decisions with incomplete information
Collaborating under pressure
Turning setbacks into opportunities (or at least good stories)
No business experience required - just bring your imagination, your sense of humour, and your willingness to play.
label: Business & Networking

description:
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball, General admission tickets have now sold out! Tickets for the community and walkers are still available
Whakatau mai ki tētahi pō whakataetae whakaari i te rerehua, ā-kākahu hoki e whakanui ana i te hunga takatāpui, hunga whakawāhine hoki, me te rerehua o te toi Ballroom.
Experience a night of performances, beauty, and fashion as walkers compete for trophies in a display of queer and trans joy, liberation, and Ballroom artistry.
Full events programme: https://tepapa.nz/MaramaBall
The Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama present The Grand Kiki House Of Marama Ball.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball will celebrate five years of Marama excellence and the legacy of the growing Wellington Ballroom* scene.
With a fabulous line-up of categories, judges, commentators, and a DJ, including major local and international Ballroom figures, we invite you to wear your best outfits and prepare to finger snap, dance, and cheer the night away.
CATEGORIES AND THEMES:
Virgin Vogue – A Marama Storm (Treasure Chest)
Bizarre – Nocturnal Creatures of Folklore
Realness (Femme Queens, Trans Men, and Butch Queens) – Date Night Under the Moonlight
Hands Performance – Memoirs from Mother Marama
Body (Slim, Thicc and Luscious) – Heavenly Bodies
Butch Queen Vogue Fem – A Marama Storm (Pirates)
Face (Female Figures, Male Figures, and Gender Non-Conforming) – Beauty of the Blood Moon
OTA (Open to All) Best Dressed – Once in a Blue Moon
Commentator vs. Commentator – Echoes of the Moon
Femme Queen Performance – A Marama Storm (Mermaids)
OTA Runway – The Phases of Marama
House of the Night
JUDGES:
Icon Arturo Mulan (NYC Father of the House of Miyake-Mugler)
Legendary Overall Founding Mother Jaycee Iman
Trailblazing Founding Mother Ella Alexander
Legendary Founding Father Tamatoa Aitu
Founding Fatheir Fang Coven-Aucoin
COMMENTATORS:
Icon Tantine Matyouz Royalty (International Godmother of the House of Gorgeous Gucci)
Orijah Marama
DJ:
ATARANGI
BALLROOM COMMUNITY WALKERS & SPECTATORS TICKET ACCESS:
Contact the House of Marama on Instagram @houseofmarama or your local Ballroom leaders for the access codes to Ballroom Community Spectators & Walkers tickets.
There is a discount code that provides FREE access for Femme Queens who are not walking or competing. Contact us or your local leaders for the discount code.
The Grand Kiki House of Marama Ball is hosted by the Trailblazing Kiki House of Marama and proudly supported by OVĀ Collective and Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.
This event is for adults only.
*BALLROOM
Ballroom is a subculture created in the late 1960s in Harlem, New York. Forged by Black and Latinx trans women and queer communities, it began as a protest against the racism they faced from White counterparts within the LGBTQIA+ community, as well as the transphobia and queerphobia they faced from mainstream society.
It is a space held to protect trans women of colour. Therefore, guests and participants of this culture alike must uphold respect and honour for this sacred space and those from which it came from. Homophobia, transphobia, or any discriminatory language and/or beliefs will not be tolerated. Remember to check your privilege at the door.
Learn more about the culture of Underground Ballroom on Google Arts and Culture.
Be sure to check out the growing Wellington Ballroom scene and community by following @houseofmarama and @ova_collective on Instagram.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:

A peek into the Chi-Coffy journey and what’s next

Let’s raise a cup to flavor, wellness, and caffeine-free joy. Bring a friend—or two—and come say hi!

description:
Temporal Aria, Temporal Aria
A breathtaking contemporary circus spectacle exploring the profound tension between control and surrender.

About this Event


WINNER - Momentous Movement Award (NZ Fringe 2025)
WINNER - Take Your Breath Away Award (Reykjavik Fringe 2025)

Step into a world where gravity bends and the boundaries of the human body are redefined. Temporal Aria is a breathtaking contemporary circus experience that fuses the ancient art of hair suspension with acrobatics to explore the profound tension between control and surrender.
Inspired by performer Nicole Maisey’s recent ADHD diagnosis, the show becomes a deeply personal exploration of distractibility, executive dysfunction, and the pursuit of inner peace. Through feats of extraordinary strength and vulnerability, Nicole transforms struggle into artistry, expressing a journey toward balance and self-acceptance.
At its heart, Temporal Aria is about learning to release control and accept support, a powerful shift from isolation to connection. As Nicole navigates the physical and emotional extremes of her art, she discovers that surrender is not weakness, but a pathway to strength, resilience, and unexpected grace.
Set to a mesmerizing soundscape, Temporal Aria is both a spectacle and a meditation. a poetic intersection of circus, emotion, and identity. It’s not just about the act of letting go, but about what we discover in the process: joy, contentment, and the redefinition of success as peace within.
Prepare to be captivated by a performance that truly takes your breath away.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Monster in the Maze, The myth of the Minotaur is a tale almost as old as storytelling itself, but with The Monster in the Maze Jonathan Dove and Alisdair Middleton have excavated rich, new life from this classic. In this brand new staging by director Anapela Polataivao (Red White and Brass, Wild Dogs Under My Skirt), this story will be told as never before.

When King Minos defeats the Athenians, he metes out his punishment in the cruellest way possible: by destroying their hope for the future. Every year, the king compels the conquered Athenians to send him their youth, to be fed to the terrible beast at the centre of his island’s maze: the Minotaur. As King Minos triumphs, his great monster “will eat your future, it will rip your hope, it will stamp your youth, your children in the sand.”

As the vindictive king will soon learn, however, these youth will not accept their fate without a fierce challenge. The Monster in the Maze is a story about resistance; about justice; about finding power not in oppression, but in collectivism. Fittingly, then, it’s also a groundbreaking work in its form: a community-focused and community-driven opera in which young and community singers and players stand proudly shoulder-to-shoulder with their professional counterparts, and in which both are integral.

The Monster in the Maze has been roundly praised by audiences, participants and reviewers worldwide, and in its Aotearoa debut season, it will serve as a gorgeous articulation of New Zealand Opera’s reciprocal community kaupapa.

Sung in English with surtitles.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show, The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show
Trick or Treat?!
Don’t be scared, it's just The Willies: A Halloween Drag Show!

This Halloween, jump on your broomsticks or ride your headless horses down to The Fringe Bar, for a night you won't be able to forget…

Our ghastly ghouls, maleficent monsters and spooky scary skeletons will have you SCREAMING, death dropping, and chilled to the bone.

Prepare for a night(mare) full of the sexiest scares and tricks at every turn.

Costumes are highly encouraged and will be rewarded…

Gather your coven and take a stab at tickets from just $20 on Eventfinda.

Venue, seating & show info

Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($35.00 per ticket)

GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.

Doors open one hour before showtime.

If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.

The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.

Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.

label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Māori Sidesteps, Māori made mischief

Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

Tuesday 28th October – Saturday 1st November (5 shows only)
$25 – $49
Circa One
Age Recommendation PG
Audience Care: Occasional strong language & themes
Runtime: 95mins plus interval

description:
The Made-Up Smackdown: Favourites Box, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

A long-standing Festival highlight, The Made-Up Smackdown is a thrilling, unpredictable competition of late-night improvisational glory.

For the final night of the Festival, all the teams picked as audience favourites in the previous Made-Up Smackdowns reassemble for one last time, to answer the ultimate question: what will they do to win a second box of chocolates?

Come and enjoy a selection of favourites from previous nights, and decide which is your favourite favourite!

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Wellington Law Revue 2025 - Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes), With the local elections looming, the Wellington City Council is divided. The National-led government wants to intervene, appointing none other than the Monopoly Man (yes the one from the board game!) to the job of fixing the Council. What they didn’t see coming is that this money-grabbing billionaire has his own personal agenda: money, money, money. 
Meanwhile, four flatmates are stunned to find a new Mega Cycle Lane has been built through their front garden. Trying to get to the bottom of this, the flatmates unravel a sinister conspiracy that leads back to one man...
The Monopoly Man!
Can our heroes bankrupt our villain on the Monopoly board and beat him at his own game? Find out at the 2025 production of the Wellington Law Revue: Much Ado About Money (and Cycle Lanes).
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
The Satire We Deserve: Brannavan Gnanalingam and Duncan Sarkies | Writers on Mondays, Two novelists take the pulse of life in Aotearoa and diagnose a hilarious and dangerous arrhythmia.
Brannavan Gnanalingam's The Life and Opinions of Kartik Popat takes the gloves off to better prod the weeping sores of our body politic and social media.
Duncan Sarkies depicts the farcical and chilling demise of democracy within an alpaca breeders' association in Star Gazers.
Join Pip Adam as she asks both writers about the serious intent behind the hijinks, and why it's a good time to wield the satirical scalpel.
Writers on Mondays is presented by the International Institute of Modern Letters and Te Papa Tongarewa. The 2025 series will run from 12.15—1.15 pm each Monday from 7 July to 29 September at Te Papa Tongarewa and Circa Theatre, with two special evening sessions at Meow. Admission is free and all are welcome. The series is supported by the Letteri family.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
AI Forum NZ Launch: AI Governance Refresh,  Join us to celebrate the relaunch of our AI Governance website —fully refreshed for today’s fast-moving AI landscape. Since 2023, this free resource has helped organisations adopt AI responsibly. The new edition brings together global expertise with a distinctly Aotearoa New Zealand focus: updated frameworks, guidance, templates, and real world insights from experts who have been there.
What you’ll get
A guided tour of the refreshed website
Practical takeaways you can apply immediately
Expert panel on governance, assurance, and change
Light networking over refreshments
Who should attend
Leaders, board members, and advisors
Risk, compliance, security, and data leaders
Delivery, product, and AI/ML practitioners
Public, private sector and NGOs
Panellists will include: 
Madeline Newman (AI Forum NZ) 
Colby Raley (Microsoft)
Alex Bagley (G4 Governance) 
Supported by:
G4 Governance, Microsoft and Fraxional

description:
The Wedding Singer - The Musical, The Wedding Singer - The Musical
💍✨ The Wedding Singer – The Musical ✨💍
📅 1–18 October 2025 | Hutt City Musical Theatre

🎤 It’s 1985. Robbie Hart is New Jersey’s favorite wedding singer — until his fiancée leaves him standing at the altar. Heartbroken (and hilariously bitter), he crashes every wedding he sings at… until he meets Julia, a sweet waitress who might just be the one. Only problem? She’s engaged to the wrong guy.

Packed with outrageous 80s fashion, big dance numbers, and a soundtrack of catchy, over-the-top hits, this feel-good musical comedy will have you laughing, dancing, and rooting for love to win. 💃🎶❤️

⚡ Early Bird Tickets 18–31 August ONLY ⚡
Save money and secure your seats before they’re gone!

👉 Don’t miss the party of the year – book now:
https://www.trybooking.com/nz/events/landing/16892

description:
ration the Queen's veges, Sometimes all you need to inspire change is a piece of gum
Co-written by Te Wehi Ratana and Tainui Tukiwaho
Directed by Tainui Tukiwaho
In December 2023 the group ‘Te Waka Hourua’ set the country alight when they painted over the English Treaty of Waitangi Exhibition at Te Papa to read… ‘No. Her Majesty the Queen of England the alien. ration the Queens veges.’ This ‘redaction action’ provoked strong opinions across Aotearoa – some sang their praises, others called for blood. While all of the artists were charged, only one received prison time: Te Wehi Ratana.
This uplifting new one-man play is inspired by true events, and shares the remarkable experience of the abseiling activist during his 48 hours at Rimutaka Prison.
Ration the Queen’s veges is a story of how one action can inspire change in unlikely places. It is a story about the quiet voice of defiance that still burns within us even when we are silenced – a piece of gum and Brian, Te Wehi’s ingenious cellmate, were all that was needed to fan the flames and hear them roar.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz
label: Arts & Theatre

Fans and critics called it “the most relatable live show of the year” – with The West Australian praising Abbie’s “vulnerability and hilarious insight” as the secret sauce behind this unforgettable night of laughs, truth bombs, and too-real storytelling.
Whether you're a long-time fan or new to the chaos, this is your chance to see Abbie live doing what she does best – keeping it real and keeping it funny.

description:
Annual Compliance Forum 2025 - Wellington, Solving Compliance Together – From Chaos to Confidence

Audience: IQPs | Facility Managers | Council Staff
Purpose: To deliver updates, explore common compliance gaps, and model a solution pathway through real-time, cross-role collaboration.
Your Host: Rosemary (Rosie) Killip
Rosie is the go-to expert in building compliance training. With over 30 years of experience breaking down complex rules into actionable insights, she has been a trusted authority in the field since the 1990s. As the founder of Building Networks in 2000, Rosie has dedicated her career to making building law accessible and practical—whether on an international platform or right here in New Zealand.
Plenary: Compliance in 2025 – What’s Changed & What Still Trips Us Up
Start the day with a high-level overview of recent changes in compliance legislation, audit findings, and council trends. We’ll explore how the same problems show up differently for IQPs, FMs, and Council staff, and introduce the 5-Step Compliance Navigator Blueprint to help untangle the chaos.

Session 1: Group Problem Solving – “Start with the Schedule”
Activity: Fix the Faulty Building
Join a mixed-role group and work through a fictional building scenario with missing links, handover gaps, and a messy compliance schedule.
Facilitators will rotate with role-based prompts as you:
Identify what’s gone wrong
Map who's missing what
Explore how the CLARITY phase of the Blueprint can get things back on track

Debrief: The Real Cost of Getting it Wrong
Explore real-world case studies of where compliance failed, from fines to stand-offs to failed inspections.
This session highlights how better role clarity and cross-role collaboration could have prevented most issues.

Session 2: Step Into Clarity – Your Blueprint in Action
Format: Guided Workshop
Get hands-on with the first step of the Compliance Navigator Blueprint: CLARITY.
Through self-assessment, small-group reflection, and practical tools, you’ll uncover where your current system is falling short, and how to start fixing it.
You’ll receive:
A CLARITY self-assessment questionnaire
A sample Roles & Responsibilities Matrix
A “Top 10 Common Gaps” cheat sheet
A quick-start guide to the 5-Step Blueprint
Walk away with a clearer picture of your compliance gaps—and the confidence to tackle them.

Final Session: Your Compliance Compass – Staying Aligned Over Time
Format: Mini-Workshop
Compliance doesn’t fail because people don’t care, it fails when teams fall out of alignment.
In this closing session, you’ll reflect on how to stay connected across roles, adapt to change, and keep compliance on track.
Using a simple but powerful worksheet, you’ll map:
What you know vs. what you’ve assumed
Who’s responsible
What’s changing
You’ll leave with a simple monthly or quarterly alignment ritual you can take back to your team.
label: Business & Networking

We are now meeting every 2wks to finish all of the season over the next few screenings.
Next up we have the episodes 10, 11, 12 and 13.

Short Recap  "Previously...on Twin Peaks"

Intermission

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. Louise Pirini - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. Peter Holmes - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. Dan Young - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. Andrew Webber - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!

Our market offers a vibrant atmosphere, showcasing an ever-evolving mix of global cuisines, handmade goods, and live entertainment - from buskers to magicians and cultural performers. It’s this unique blend of flavour, fun, and family-friendly energy that’s helped us become a staple in the weekday and weekend plans of thousands of Kiwis.

Journey to Self through Art, Journey to Self through Art
You are invited to attend workshops with Rebecca Sinclair of Camellia Healing Art to be guided to the very essence of who you are. Learn to create space to truly understand what it is your soul wants you to know. Each workshop will introduce you to at least two intuition building activities that will delight a different sense each month. Every workshop is a build on the last but also a new beginning should you be joining for the first time.

Allow yourself to create a beautiful space to truly honour your very essence through anchoring deeply through grounding in nature. You need no artistic experience. Art is the medium and vehicle to learn and grow.

The first hour will be spent with a channelled message and healing drawing for the group by Camellia, followed by at least two exercises in raising frequency, working towards bringing alignment and fine tuning intuition. The second hour will be spent creating drawings from your very essence with time for discussion at the end.

COST: $30.00
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL
Email Rebecca:
CONTACT: Rebecca 027 246 0405

Workshops held every second THURSDAY evening of the month and every third TUESDAY morning of the month.

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Simon Watts, Join us on Thursday 18 September for our next Beehive to Business event with Hon Simon Watts, Minister of Climate Change, Minister for Energy, Minister for Local Government and Minister of Revenue.
With local Government decision making in the spotlight as we head into local body elections, there is no better Minister in the Government to hear from than Minister Watts.
Minister Watts is at the forefront of some of New Zealand’s most pressing issues – be it the energy market, water service delivery, or taxation, the decisions Minister Watts heads up are pivotal to New Zealand – and your business.
A recent Cabinet promotion, Minister Watts is seen as a critical cog in the executive Government – a chance to engage with the Minister on the issues that matter to you most is not to be missed.
This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.
Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes
Can't make it? Click here to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

description:
The Wellington Calling Open Mic: Daylight Savings Theme!, Wellington's premier event venue Whisky and Wood is hosting its 5th open mic event: Wellington Calling and we're looking for diverse acts to contribute!

Our last event event had 15 performers and we want you to contribute to the next!

Each performer gets the chance to have a six- minute set with a microphone, guitar and keyboard provided.

This is an originals only event. We want to encourage new creative voices to be heard.

“We want to provide a positive and encouraging environment for established and fledgling acts to shine in. It's a pretty inspiring place to perform,” says host Steven Hood.

Each performer will need to sign up in person before 7pm and registrations of interest need to be emailed to openwandw@gmail.com before May 25.

The feature act is Mustang a upcoming three-piece with dreamy harmonies. Their songs are emotional tributes to clarity, light and wonder. Expect to be moved!

Their music can be heard at: https://www.instagram.com/mustang_band24/

Entry is with Koha.

Light food and drinks will be available to purchase.

description:
BIMinNZ Wellington: Project Spotlight - Digital Workflows on Heke Rua, Pōneke — Mark Your Calendars!BIM in NZ is thrilled to announce our next Wellington event.
Join us on Thursday, 28 August at GHD for a Project Spotlight on the digital delivery of Heke Rua Archives — one of Aotearoa’s most ambitious façades, and a truly industry-leading example of BIM in action.
Hear from Revizto, Thermosash, Warren and Mahoney, and WT as they share how digital technology helped overcome the project’s extraordinary complexity — enabling seamless collaboration and unified digital workflows that crossed traditional disciplinary boundaries.
Revizto will kick things off with a short sponsor presentation, highlighting how their platform supported project delivery from design through to construction.
Roja from Thermosash will share how their team continues to evolve digital workflows to meet the demands of an ever-changing, collaborative landscape — and the unique challenges of delivering a façade of this scale.
Finally, Alex and Anton — fresh off a headline talk at DigiComm25 — will dive into the BIM coordination process and digital twin, exploring how this project sets a new benchmark for digital delivery in Aotearoa.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Whenua Tapu Crematorium Open Day, Whenua Tapu Crematorium Open Day
Built in 1982, Whenua Tapu Crematorium is a beautiful facility that has served thousands of families.

Hear about the history of the chapel and what it’s like to operate a crematorium from the staff that operate it. You can also do a walk-through of the crematorium (optional).

Cremation is the common choice is NZ when it comes to death, with over 70% of Kiwis choosing it. Traditionally Māori and Pacifica families always chose burial, however there is a slow change happening in that space also. We are passionate about de mystifying what cremation is so families can feel informed about the choices they make.

Come along as we open Whenua Tapu Crematorium to the public and answer any questions you may have.


Cost: Free
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/whenua-tapu-crematorium-open-day/


Health & Safety:
Fire alarms on site, first aid kit on site. Staff will act as wardens in emergency.

Plenty of parking on site and toilets on site too.

description:
Build your Professional Board of Directors, You’ve got colleagues to vent to, friends to debrief with, and maybe a podcast or two for inspiration… but when was the last time you had an intentional conversation about your career? It’s time to change that. 
While coaching and courses get all the attention, there's another powrful tool that often gets overlooked: a Professional Board of Directors. The women who navigate pivotal career moments best? They don't do it alone.
Just as companies need a board to guide them, you deserve a trusted circle to help with career decisions, fresh perspectives, and ongoing accountability.

This interactive 2-hour session is for women at every stage - from new graduates to senior leaders. Over a few drinks and snacks, you’ll:
Learn: What a professional board of directors is, how they work and why they’re so impactful.
Connect: We’ll pre-match you with 4-5 others at a similar stage and situation. This will be your board for the evening!
Experience: Your first board meeting. We'll provide instructions and a simple agenda.

Bonus: Your ticket comes with a free 3-month Powrsuit membership (worth $147). Designed for busy people, Powrsuit combines bite-sized learning, peer coaching, and micro-networking in one all-inclusive membership. With weekly live events and on-demand access through our web and mobile apps, you will make step-by-step progress in your career, on your terms.
Note: While all genders are welcome in the Powrsuit network, this event is for Women+. Want to join as an Ally or learn more about what we do? Get in touch.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival, Blossom Valley: Wellington's Cherry Blossom Festival
Wellington's annual spring cherry blossom festival is back this September 🌸 A must-see event with 350+ cherry blossom trees creating a sea of pink 🌸

⭐ 'After Dark' evening light experience tickets now on sale.

📷 Capture gram-worthy photos and videos under the blossoms, and find our viral style photo spots including a giant living love heart, a swing, a boat (new this year!), a giant frame, and more

🛏️ Book a night in our chalet accomodation and wake up to a sea of pink 🌸

☕ Pre-purchase a delightful high tea alongside your ticket for the full experience (bookings required)☕

Weekends often sell out so make sure you have pre-purchased tickets online to secure your car park as spaces are limited. We hate to have to turn cars away when tickets are sold out so please do pre-purchase your tickets this year for weekends!! 🚗

🌸 New This Year - Flexi Passes
This pass allows you to come on whichever day you like. Not sure about the weather or at what level of blossom the trees are then this is for you. Purchase this ticket and come during the day on whichever day and time you like. (These tickets do NOT cover the After Dark experience).

Shuttles are available from Wellington, Palmerston North, Masterton or (anywhere!) with Capital Shuttles. With bookings available from 1 person, up to a 54 seater bus, they are the ideal way to get to and from Aston Norwood Gardens 🚌

Our in house photographer Lilia will be back again offering affordable professional photography sessions - perfect for family photos, couple photos, solo, friend groups, or even secret engagements! 📷

🌸 Blossom Valley is more than an event—it’s a fleeting moment of beauty, peace, and connection with nature. We can’t wait to share it with you. 🌸

-
In 1994, inspired by visits to Japan, owners Mark and Fiona Rammell planted over 350 Sakura Cherry Blossoms and are now seeing their dream burst into life each Spring.

Blossom Valley is an annual spring celebration sure to put the spring in your step as you explore the 14 acres of garden with New Zealand’s highest number and density of mature cherry blossom trees in the one place. For just a short amount of time each year at Aston Norwood Gardens in Kaitoke, Upper Hutt, hundreds of cherry trees come alive creating a canopy of pink blossom.

The event is carefully scheduled around the natural blossoming of the trees, with data from previous years informing the date selection. While the team at Blossom Valley do their best to ensure the ultimate blossom experience the timing of the bloom is up to mother nature.
label: Festivals

description:

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

description:
Wellington | Food Lovers Masterclass, Wellington | Food Lovers Masterclass
Are you finding that you're constantly throwing away un eaten food? It's time to level up with our Food Lovers Masterclass! You'll learn how to store food like a boss, decode those pesky best before dates, use up leftovers, and save enough to buy a yacht (okay, maybe just a canoe).

This is a fun but informative session and you will leave inspired with a cool goodie bag full of samples to get you started.

Ticket price - $10, get a goodie bag worth $40

description:
Pottery Wheel Throwing & Hand Building - Creative Arts Holiday Program, Explore the techniques of pottery making including creating a mug using handbuilding processes and making a small bowl using throwing techniques on a pottery wheel. Students will be shown how to centre clay and make a small bowl on the wheel and trim it. Cups and bowls will be glazed by the tutor and ready for pickup approximately 3-4 weeks later depending on drying conditions.

This workshop is limited to three students only to ensure each person has individualised attention.

Suitable for ages 12+.

Tuesday - Thursday, 30 Sept - 2 October, 10 am - 12 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Business Strategy & Growth Planning Interactive Seminar, Are you ready to take your business to the next level?
Join us for an interactive seminar designed to help business owners like you create clear, actionable strategies for growth without the guesswork.

Your Speakers:
Ron Lal – With over 25 years of experience across entrepreneurship, consulting, NGO, governmental, and corporate sectors, Ron has helped business leaders solve complex challenges, discover new customer segments, and achieve 7-figure results through innovative Design Thinking strategies.
Learn more about Ron: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ron-lal-20168041/
Maria Pooley – A business operations and management expert with over 20 years of international experience across eight countries, Maria specialises in identifying business obstacles and delivering practical solutions that drive sustainable success.
Learn more about Maria: https://www.linkedin.com/in/pooleymaria/

In this 3-hour session, you will:
Learn actionable strategies that have worked for other business owners
Discover fresh perspectives to tackle your biggest growth challenges
Connect with like-minded business owners in a supportive environment
Leave with new insights and ideas to implement into your business

What’s included:
Hot beverages and snacks
Free parking
Networking opportunities with fellow business owners

Activities:
Networking & Icebreaker – A chance to connect with like-minded business owners.
Business Session – Ron and Maria share insights and strategies for sustainable growth.
Strategy Insights Session – Gain strategic ideas tailored to your business, learn the difference between strategy and planning, and understand how to identify the right strategy for your goals.
Closing & Networking – Share ideas, ask questions, and connect with potential collaborators.

Late bird: $35*
Normal price: $50

description:
Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing - PART 2, Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing – Part 2

We’re back for Part Two of our popular “Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing” workshop and you’re invited! Whether you joined us last time or are coming along for the first time, this free, hands-on session is designed to help you feel confident and in control of your digital marketing.

Led by Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa), you’ll dive deeper into practical tools and strategies to make social media and digital marketing work for you. Expect a friendly, open environment where you can ask questions, share experiences, and learn alongside others. And yes, we’ll have refreshments and kai catered by Amilagi’s to keep you fuelled and inspired!

By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with real, usable tools to grow your online presence, simplify your marketing, and boost your confidence.

This workshop is part of the WLG NZ RPBN programme, where Katie’s full course supports your next steps in building a powerful digital presence.
Spaces are limited so book your spot today and take the next step in your digital journey!
**Doors open at 5.30pm, session begins at 6pm**

About the Speaker:
Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa) brings over 15+ years’ experience in social media, digital strategy, and communications. She’s the founder of Social Good and has held key roles in government and corporate spheres, including setting up ACC’s social media strategy and leading Aotearoa’s all-of-government digital communications response during COVID-19. Katie is also a certified Meta (Facebook) Community Trainer and regularly delivers workshops across Aotearoa, helping organisations to tell stronger digital stories.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Soundscape Series: The Weather Machine, The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers wanting more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.

description:
Dare to Lead™ | Wellington | 22-24 September 2025, The ultimate starting point for brave leaders, courageous cultures and organisational change.

"Highly recommend."
"Inspiring."
"An amazing experience."
"One 'aha moment' after the other."

Founded on the research of Dr. Brené Brown, Dare to Lead™ is an empirically based courage-building programme, delivered by Boma New Zealand CEO and Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator Kaila Colbin.
Brené has spent two decades studying shame and more than seven years specifically looking at leadership. During her research, she interviewed leaders from all over the world — from Fortune 100 companies, non-profits, public sector entities, and more — and asked one question: what is the future of leadership?
Remarkably, their answers pointed to one thing: we need braver leaders.

We need more courage.

The most significant finding from Brené’s latest research, and the foundation of Dare to Lead™, is that courage is a collection of four skill sets that are teachable, measurable, and observable.

After completing the three-day Dare to Lead™ programme you'll understand how to:
Effectively navigate vulnerability and unlock change
Turn values from fluffy language into tangible, practical behaviours
Build a common culture of trust in your team
Cultivate the skills to rise from setbacks and be more resilient

This curriculum is essential for teams who want to:
Be better equipped to deal with difficult conversations
Reduce unhealthy and unproductive behaviour
Be more creative and innovative
Build resilience and improve alignment
Foster a culture of accountability and trust

This experience is for you if:
You're in a position of leadership within your organisation
You see the potential in people and processes, and are willing to take responsibility for achieving that potential
You’re passionate about accelerating performance in yourself and others
You have to navigate organisational change as part of your role

Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special price of $1,995 + GST when you register.
We also have partial scholarships available to attend the programme. Apply here and we’ll be in touch.
Boma is a Regional Business Network Provider. Your organisation may be eligible for funding support to attend this programme. Find out more at regionalbusinesspartners.co.nz

Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.

description:
Customer Service Essentials, This course will cover the importance of creating a customer service mindset when dealing with your most important asset in a business, your customers. It introduces the key requirement to have a strong product knowledge, effective communication and listening skills, and polished customer service etiquette.

Key audience:
This course is suitable for employees who interact with customers on a regular basis, whether by phone or in person, and people who would like to gain a strong, foundational level of knowledge about how to deal effectively with customers.

Learning outcomes:
Understand the importance of a customer service mindset.
Learn about customer service etiquette and how it’s unique for each business.
Explain the requirement for a strong product and service knowledge.
Demonstrate the pivotal role of good communication and listening skills.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course Detail
Duration: Half day, in person
Time: 9am - 1pm

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee and morning or afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Jewellery Making In 4 Weeks - Sunday Afternoons, This inspiring Sunday afternoon jewellery blocks are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment! The course starts on Sun 2 November and runs for 4 weeks until Sun 23 November, 2pm-5pm.

Beginners will practice the basic techniques in copper or brass and then move on quickly to working in silver. An excellent first project for beginners in this class is to create a simple textured ring band - but once you have the basics down, it is fun to create earrings, pendants or other simple items.

Learning to cut, heat, form and texture metal - to solder using a jeweller's torch and silver solder, and finally to polish your work up to a beautiful finish: these classes are super satisfying.

These blocks are also a great way for existing students or more advanced makers to join into a class in our well-equipped warm and bright studio!

Basic materials are supplied and there are extra materials available to purchase as you need in class.
label: Classes & Workshops

Event welcomes those within the NZIA and NZRAB fraternity to join the discussions.
Event is expected to be around 2 hours at each location with nibbles and drinks provided.
Registration esssential as spaces limited.Registration esssential as spaces limited.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Dealing With Difficult People & Situations, Transform conflict and difficult situations with co-workers and customers into opportunities by equipping your staff with the skills and techniques required to manage these situations with confidence, professionalism, and pride. Learn ways to resolve conflict with customers and co workers, influence successful outcomes and develop a peaceful workplace. We have all experienced the stress that comes from having unresolved conflicts with our customers and co-workers. Conflicts that are ignored or resolved poorly don’t go away, they cause people to feel resentful and to avoid each other. The effects on the business are a loss of productivity, turnover, and absenteeism. Wherever two or more people come together, there is bound to be conflict. This workshop will give participants a six-step process that they can use and modify to resolve conflicts of any size.

Participants will also learn crucial conflict resolution skills, including dealing with anger and using the Agreement Frame. Key Learning Outcomes: - Transform conflict into opportunity - Develop constructive strategies for dealing with difficult behaviour - Develop communication skills to diffuse the situation - Increase confidence and assertiveness in dealing with difficult behaviour - Manage your emotions and deal with stress - Understand the power of words and how to use them to your advantage Workshop Overview: - What are the behaviours that we find difficult to deal with? - Develop an understanding of how flight or fight reactions prompt difficult behaviour - Controlling your reactions and choosing how you respond - Strategies for staying calm and keeping your cool when dealing with difficult behaviour - How attitudes play a part – What’s it like being on the receiving end of me? How do I come across? - Dealing with the situation/problem, not the individual - Dealing with anger, your own and others – Be able to use basic anger management techniques - Developing communication skills, such as the agreement frame, active listening and open questions - Applying techniques to deal with difficult behaviour - Understand what conflict and conflict resolution mean - Understand all six phases of the conflict resolution process -Understand the 5 main styles of conflict resolution and be able to adapt the process for all types of conflicts - Speak up assertively and confidently when dealing with difficult behaviour To book: email info@biztraines.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.
label: Business & Networking

Meet a range of successful sales professionals, hear their personal stories and career journeys, and gain practical advice on what it takes to thrive in this dynamic field. description:
Entrepreneurship in the Age of AI with John Chow, Join John Chow — entrepreneur, investor, and co-founder of Stonewood Group — for an evening of real-world insights into entrepreneurship, innovation, and the future of business in the AI era.

Whether you’re a founder, freelancer, investor, or simply AI-curious, this is your chance to hear directly from one of New Zealand’s boldest business leaders and walk away inspired.

What to Expect:
Keynote: “Lessons from the Past, Eyes on the Future: A Founder’s Take on AI”
John shares his entrepreneurial journey and how he’s thinking about AI as a tool for the next wave of business growth.

Fireside Chat: “The Future of Business with AI”
A live podcast-style conversation between John Chow and Bin Wang (Head of AI, Stonewood Group), unpacking how real companies can embrace AI without the hype.

Networking + Giveaways
Mix and mingle with fellow professionals, founders, and AI enthusiasts. Enjoy drinks and enter the draw to win prizes!

Presented by:
Urban Hub Wellington
Workspaces built for entrepreneurs, growing teams, and professionals who want to do more with their day.
