description:
Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show, Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: Dimebag & Ozzy Memorial Show
Featuring Tributes to: Pantera, Ozzy Osbourne, Megadeth, Faith No More and more bands TBA.

About this Event



Ultimate Tribute Fest 2: A Memorial for Metal Legends

Rail Records, Wildkiwi Distillery, Women's Refuge, and Riockstock present a monumental night of heavy metal in honor of two of the genre's most important and beloved figures: the legendary guitarist "Dimebag" Darrell Abbott of Pantera, and the recently departed Godfather of Metal, Ozzy Osbourne.
Join us on Saturday, December 6th, 2025, at Wildkiwi in Upper Hutt for a memorial show that will shake the foundations. This date holds a special importance to us metal heads, falling just three days after what would have been Ozzy's 77th birthday (December 3rd) and just two days before the anniversary of Dimebag's tragic passing (December 8th, 2004), giving us all a chance to raise a glass and celebrate both legends in the loudest way possible.
This is a night to pay tribute to the artists who defined a generation of heavy music. From Dimebag's revolutionary groove and unmistakable harmonic squeals to Ozzy's haunting vocals and iconic stage presence, their impact is eternal. We invite the metal community to come together for an unforgettable evening of remembrance, unity, and blistering riffs.


The Lineup
Prepare for a full-throttle sonic assault from four of New Zealand's premier tribute acts, performing the anthems that have become the soundtrack to our lives:
•Hell's Wrath delivering the ferocious power of Pantera
•Zombie Stomp (ft. Danny Rascal) channeling the madness of Ozzy Osbourne
•Angel Dust performing the eclectic genius of Faith No More
•Demon Foetal Harvest unleashing the thrash mastery of Megadeth
(More acts to be announced!)


Event Details
•Date: Saturday, December 6, 2025
•Venue: Wildkiwi, Unit 13/27 Blenheim Street, Maidstone, Upper Hutt
•Time: Doors open at 6:00 PM
•Age Restriction: This is a strictly R18 event. ID will be required.
•Charity: We will be accepting donations at the event and at point of sale on behalf of Women's Refuge. Your support is greatly appreciated.


Ticket Information
Secure your spot to witness this massive tribute event. Tickets are on sale now!
•$20 Early Bird (+GST/BF) - Limited quantity available! Grab them before they're gone.
•$30 General Admission (+GST/BF)
•$40 Door Sales/Lates (If not sold out prior)


VIP Table Experience - Only 6 Available!
For the ultimate night out, gather your crew and secure a VIP table.
Price: $240 per table (includes 6 tickets - works out to $40 per person)
Perks:
•Guaranteed reserved seating for your group of 6.
•Early venue access from 4:00 PM to settle in and have a meal.
•10% discount on delicious bar food from the Wildkiwi kitchen.
•First dibs on the merch table.
•Check out soundcheck and meet the bands (where possible).


Limited Edition Merchandise
•Exclusive Event T-Shirt: $30
•Commemorate this special night with a limited edition T-shirt. There are only 20 of these shirts being made, so this is a true collector's item. Available as a ticket add-on. Don't miss out!
This show is a tribute, a memorial, and a celebration. Get your tickets now and be part of a historic night for New Zealand's metal scene.
Full ticketing TnCs: https://www.railrecords.net/ticketing-tncs

description:
Wellington Folk Festival 2025 - our 60th!, Welcome to Wellyfest!
The Wellington Folk Festival is held every Labour Weekend, celebrated on the fourth weekend of October, at Brookfield Outdoor Education Centre – a beautiful site owned by the Scouts at 562 Moores Valley Road, Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt, New Zealand.
The Festival gate is open from 3pm on the Friday, with events running over Friday evening, all day Saturday through to Sunday evening. You can come for the weekend, for a day, half day or an evening. Children (0 - 12) can attend free.
Weekend passes entitle the holders to camp onsite and there are a limited number of bunks available for sale as well.
PLEASE NOTE - ALL EARLYBIRD PRICING CLOSES AT 11.55PM ON SUNDAY 28TH SEPTEMBER. Full-price tickets can be purchased on-line until Sunday 19th October.
After ticket sales close on Humanitix, you can purchase at the gate, from 3pm on Friday 25th of October.  Weekend tickets, day tickets and evening tickets are all available at the gate.  There may even be some bunks available still.  You can email registrations@wellingtonfolkfestival.org.nz to find out.
To read our latest news click here, click the Latest News tab in the menu above, or check out our facebook page here www.facebook.com/Wellyfest/.
If you would like to be added to our email list, sign up to our mailing list here.

description:
XCOMMUNICATE, XCOMMUNICATE
The formidable powerhouse duo COMMUNICATE return to Wellington in November with their clubnight, XCOMMUNICATE, for one night only.

Known for their long sets that incorporate decades of sound, Cyril Orson and Heylady have been punishing dance floors across Aotearoa since they joined forces 3 years ago. Off the back of a monstrous summer, which saw them play 19 shows up and down the country, the pair have spent most of 2025 in the studio finessing their own brand of audio alchemy and preparing to release their label, also named XCOMMUNICATE.

Usually XCOMMUNICATE is a 6 hour journey though decades and sonic realms, however as Heylady is still recovering from a mighty dose of burnout they’ve roped in a couple of their good friends, who happen to be some of Wellington’s finest, to join them as they lay down four hours of four to the floor.

Halo is a mainstay on Wellington dancefloors and it was a no brainer asking her to be on this lineup. A DJ since 2000, she has played festivals across the country and never fails to rock her slot. Her set at Taniwha’s Den last summer was a big highlight and one of the best of the festival. Halo’s ability to drive forward thinking sound and her clever construction of sets are just two reasons you need to be on her floor.

DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the trustees of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radio Active. Part of the COMMUNICATE family from the get go (and a longtime collaborator of Heylady’s), DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver. Armed with knowledge , taste and a hefty love of Detroit, DJ Coda is the man when it comes to rocking the dance floor.
First release tickets are on sale now, grab yours before they are gone and come and dance the evening away with four of the best. We recommend arrive early so you don’t miss out on any of the sets, they are all going to be killer.

IMPORTANT INFO:
Our event is a safe space for all. If you or someone you know is feeling unsafe or harassed, please approach one of the DJs or bar staff. If you are behaving badly and impacting others ability to have a good time safely, you will be removed. Please act with respect and care for your fellow attendees at all times, no means no and this goes for conversations as well as more intimate requests.

description:
Wellington Jazz Festival, Soul, funk, jazz, fusion, rhythm and blues — it’s a celebration of sound across the city this spring. The annual Wellington Jazz Festival is back. The event packs over 100 gigs into five days in venues around the city. 
The festival features two major international acts making exclusive New Zealand debuts. Wellington will see two-time Grammy Award-winning jazz vocalist and bandleader, Gregory Porter and five-time Grammy Award-winning jazz singer, Samara Joy. Gregory Porter’s unique and timeless sound blends jazz, soul, and gospel. His influences include Bakersfield Southern Gospel and jazz legend Nat King Cole. At just 25 years old, Samara Joy has become a breakout jazz sensation. She’s redefining 21st-century jazz with a rich, mature tone and refined phrasing. 
The treats in the programme continue with Australian First Nations soul singer Bumpy, and a commissioned work by New Zealand/Congolese drummer, composer, and rhythm master  Myele Manzanza. He’ll be performing with international supergroup, lvdf. The Rodger Fox Big Band returns with a tribute to Ray Charles, and the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra has its inaugural performance with a Duke Ellington arrangement of Tchaikovsky’s The Nutcracker Suite. Many of the hospitality venues in Courtenay Place and its surrounding streets are planning intimate jazz gigs across the festival. Follow the sound of saxophones to find a spot to park up for the night.

Wellington Zinefest Weekend 2025, Wellington Zinefest is hosting their annual two-day zine festival to celebrate the thriving zine scene here in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
We're open to the public from 12 til 4 on Saturday October 4 and Sunday October 5 at Te Aro Campus of Victoria University of Wellington Te Herenga Waka - 139 Vivian street.
Each day we'll have sixty+ unique stalls, loaded with self-made zines, comics, prints, and trinkets. Wellington Zinefest markets are free to attend, make sure you bring cash to buy zines tho!
From 11am to 12pm each day we'll run 'accessibility hour'. This is a chance for any visitors who can't attend when Zinefest is crowded. We'll have no music and try to maintain a low-stimulation environment.

description:
A History of Violence, Details
Directed by David Cronenberg
Starring Viggo Mortensen, Ed Harris, William Hurt, Maria Bello
--- When a pair of petty criminals attempt to rob his small-town diner, Tom Stall (Viggo Mortensen) quickly and easily kills them both. In the flush of news coverage of Tom's seemingly heroic actions, a threatening stranger named Carl Fogarty (Ed Harris) comes to town, fingering the unassuming family man as long-missing Philadelphia mobster Joey Cusack. To the horror of his wife, Edie (Maria Bello), and teenage son, Jack (Ashton Holmes), Tom finds he must confront his violent past. ---

Screening on 35mm

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Christmas Karma, From visionary British director Gurinder Chadha (Bend It Like Beckham, Blinded By The Light), Christmas Karma sees ones of history’s greatest novels - Charles Dickens’ A Christmas Carol transformed into a joyous, colourful, feel-good Christmas musical that celebrates modern-day London and all of its vibrant communities and cultures. With an all-star cast and music from Gary Barlow, Nitin Sawhney and Shaznay Lewis, the film features an eclectic soundtrack influenced by gospel, bhangra, carols, rap and classic pop songs. Christmas Karma is a festive British classic for our times, and for generations to come, that promotes a strong message to be kind, choose love and celebrate the present.

Rating
Violence & coarse language
Director
Gurinder Chadha
Cast
Kunal Nayyar, Eva Longoria, Billy Porter, Boy George, Hugh Bonneville, Danny Dyer, Pixie Lott, Leo Suter
label: Film & Media

description:
Men's Group Tuesday 28 Oct, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple and proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

description:
Breakfast Feast Your Eyes | Jumanji (1995), A magical board game unleashes a world of adventure on siblings Peter (Bradley Pierce) and Judy Shepherd (Kirsten Dunst). While exploring an old mansion, the youngsters find a curious, jungle-themed game called Jumanji in the attic. When they start playing, they free Alan Parrish (Robin Williams), who's been stuck in the game's inner world for decades. If they win Jumanji, the kids can free Alan for good -- but that means braving giant bugs, ill-mannered monkeys and even stampeding rhinos! ---
Upgrade your ticket to the FEAST YOUR EYES | BRUNCH EDITION (FYE) experience which includes themed brunch bap and drink
At Feast Your Eyes, cinephiles and foodies will be treated to a movie and food experience in the cinema, a great way to start your Sunday afternoon.
Admit only tickets are $15, but you can upgrade to a Feast Your Eyes tickets for $45. All Feast Your Eyes tickets include a breakfast roll and brunch cocktail or mocktail.
Schedule:
10:30am – Food and drink available for collection from the main counter on the ground floor
10:20am – Cinema doors open
11:30am – Quick intro
11:35am – Feature begins
*No dietaries catered for
Presented in 4K
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Christmas Karma, From visionary British director Gurinder Chadha (Bend It Like Beckham, Blinded By The Light), Christmas Karma sees ones of history’s greatest novels - Charles Dickens’ A Christmas Carol transformed into a joyous, colourful, feel-good Christmas musical that celebrates modern-day London and all of its vibrant communities and cultures. With an all-star cast and music from Gary Barlow, Nitin Sawhney and Shaznay Lewis, the film features an eclectic soundtrack influenced by gospel, bhangra, carols, rap and classic pop songs. Christmas Karma is a festive British classic for our times, and for generations to come, that promotes a strong message to be kind, choose love and celebrate the present.

Rating
Violence & coarse language
Director
Gurinder Chadha
Cast
Kunal Nayyar, Eva Longoria, Billy Porter, Boy George, Hugh Bonneville, Danny Dyer, Pixie Lott, Leo Suter
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Glenrothan, When his beloved Chicago blues club burns down, Donal (Cumming) returns to his family-owned whisky distillery in the Scottish Highlands for the first time in nearly 40 years.

Donal didn’t leave Scotland on the best terms, having wound up in a violent exchange with his brother Sandy (Cox) and their father on the day of their mother’s funeral.

Joined by his daughter Amy (Alexandra Shipp, Barbie), Donal returns to his homeland in the hopes of making amends with his brother. But with old wounds running deep and the fate of the family business on the line, can inner peace finally be found before it’s too late?

Written by David Ashton (The Last King of Scotland) and accomplished TV writer Jeff Murphy (Hinterland), Glenrothan explores the complexities of familial bonds, set against the proud and timeless tradition of whisky making.

Cumming gives one of his best on-screen performances, opposite Cox who brings gravitas to every scene - both in front of and behind the camera.
Director
Brian Cox
Cast
Alan Cumming, Brian Cox, Shirley Henderson, Alexandra Shipp
label: Film & Media

description:
Bastion Point on film, The Bastion Point occupation was one of the most important events in modern-day Māori protest. Come to the Library to watch two documentaries about the occupation — ‘Bastion Point: Day 507’ made in 1980 and ‘Bastion Point: The Untold Story’ made almost two decades later in 1999.

Presented by the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa in partnership with Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision and Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage.

Photo: Film still from Bastion Point: Day 507 featuring Joe Hawke (right). Stills collection, Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision.

description:
Wellington Folk Festival - 60th Anniversary Edition, Enjoy a holiday weekend of music, dance, craft and folky fun at the beautiful Brooklields Outdoor Education Centre in Moore’s valley, Waimuiomata.

The site opens at noon on Friday and the action runs until late late late on Sunday evening. There will be:
Concerts by our headline guests on the Main stage;
Artist workshops,
Ceili and dance sessions,
Craft stalls on the Village Green, and
A youth programme; plus
opportunities to participate in open mics, invitation concerts, jams, sing arounds and the Festival Choir.

Our headline guest performers will be:
We Mavericks
Adam and Marika
Fiona Ross
Klezmer Rebs
Rhys Crimmin
Two if by Sea
The Trenwiths
For information about them see - https://wellingtonfolkfestival.org.nz/2025-festival-guests/

You can go “full immersion” by camping or sharing a bunkhouse for the whole weekend or treat it as a day or evening (or both) family outing. There is no charge for children under the age of 13 (but they must be accompanied by a responsible adult). The full range of ticket options and prices is available at https://events.humanitix.com/wellington-folk-festival-2025-our-60th?

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Twiggy, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: BFI London Film Festival 2024 -

An intimate, star-studded dive into the birth of an icon, and everything that followed, Twiggy is a look at the life of the greatest ‘it-girl’ of all time.

Director Sadie Frost follows up her 2021 documentary Quant with another deep dive into the story of a fashion legend. This time it’s the model and cultural icon Dame Lesley Lawson - better known as Twiggy.

This slick documentary features a combination of fascinating archival footage and new interviews with stars such as Dustin Hoffman, Paul McCartney, Charlotte Tilbury, Joanna Lumley, and many more.

Telling her story for the first time herself, Twiggy is an exploration of the model’s upbringing, career, relationships, and everything else that has made her the woman she is today.
Director:
Sadie Frost
Cast:
Twiggy, Dustin Hoffman, Paul McCartney, Joanna Lumley
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Words of War, From James Strong, director of the acclaimed mini-series Mr Bates vs The Post Office, Words of War tells the powerful true story of world-renowned journalist and human rights activist Anna Politkovskaya.

Maxine Peake (also starring in I Swear at this year’s Festival) expertly portrays Politkovskaya’s brave crusade, putting her life in jeopardy by fighting to be an independent voice of truth for the Russian people. She refused to give up reporting on the war in Chechnya despite numerous acts of intimidation and violence, including being poisoned.

Sparring with Peake on the silver screen is Jason Isaacs, in the role of Politkovskaya’s husband Sasha - a TV journalist who can barely hide his jealousy of his wife’s success. Irish screen legend Ciarán Hinds also joins the cast as Dmitry Muratov, Anna’s editor of the independent paper Novaya Gazeta.

Politkovskaya’s legacy lives on, and her story serves as a reminder of the importance of protecting the right to report the news without fear of death or reprisal.

Director: James Strong
Cast: Maxine Peake, Ciarán Hinds, Jason Isaacs
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Broken English, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Venice International Film Festival 2025 -
- OFFICIAL SELECTION: BFI London Film Festival 2025 -

Broken English is a bold and imaginative documentary portrait of the inimitable singer, songwriter and icon Marianne Faithfull.

A survivor, provocateur and true original, Marianne spent more than six decades defying expectations, releasing over thirty-five albums while constantly reinventing herself.

Made with her full involvement, Broken English is an intimate and unflinching exploration of a fractured yet unbreakable life shaped by fame, creativity and relentless public scrutiny.

The film unfolds within the “Ministry of Not Forgetting”, an imagined, cinematic institution where memory and mythology collide. The Ministry is presided over by Tilda Swinton as The Overseer, and George MacKay (also starring in & Sons at this year’s Festival) serves as The Record Keeper, poring over Faithfull’s life and career.

Broken English is a genre-defying act of resilience and rebellion — Marianne Faithfull’s final fearless declaration, her defiant swan song.
Director
Jane Pollard, Iain Forsyth
Cast
Marianne Faithfull, Tilda Swinton, George MacKay, Zawe Ashton
label: Film & Media

description:
Lost Wax Casting - 6 Weeks Course, A fantastic class full of fun and inspiration!



Level One: Students learn carving in hard wax, texture forming in soft wax, and how to clean up and finish your metal pieces. Course costs include basic materials for the process, but do not include the eventual metal costs for the pieces you choose to cast. As this is subject to each student's choice of size and type of metal, we leave this up to you to decide.



Level Two: Expand your range of designs and skills with the wax you prefer using. Learn to set stones into your designs and either: Cast them IN the metal (exciting and organic) or, more advanced students can learn to set them in a fabrication class.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The Choral, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Toronto International Film Festival 2025 -

From BAFTA-and-Tony-winning writer Alan Bennett and director Nicholas Hytner, the team behind The History Boys and The Lady in the Van, The Choral explores the humour and humanity at the heart of a community facing an uncertain future.

Academy Award® nominee and BAFTA-winner Ralph Fiennes heads up a cracking cast of character actors in this touching period piece.

As war rages on the Western Front, the Choral Society in Ramsden, Yorkshire has lost most of its men to the army. The Choral’s ambitious committee, determined to press ahead, decides to recruit local young males to swell their ranks.

They must also engage a new chorus master, and despite their suspicions that he has something to hide, their best bet seems to be Dr. Henry Guthrie (Fiennes) – driven, uncompromising, and recently returned from a career in Germany.

As conscription papers start to arrive, the whole community discovers that the best response to the chaos that is laying waste to their lives is to make music together.

With a knockout performance from the always-reliable Fiennes, and a compelling story to boot, The Choral is guaranteed to be a hit at this year’s Festival. Book your tickets quickly to avoid disappointment!

Director: Nicholas Hytner
Cast: Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong
label: Film & Media

description:
Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets, This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI. Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidifying his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.

Film Talks At Aratoi Presents the Bride of Frankenstein (1935), Film Talks at Aratoi presents The Bride of Frankenstein (1935)
Halloween Film Night 2025

Get ready for a night of cinematic chills and festive frights! Since 2022, Film Talks’ Halloween Film Night has brought Wairarapa audiences together to celebrate classic horror in a fun, immersive atmosphere.

This year, join us on Halloween night for James Whale’s masterpiece, The Bride of Frankenstein (1935). Widely regarded as one of the greatest horror films ever made, it combines unforgettable imagery, Gothic atmosphere, and a surprising touch of dark humour.

Doors open at 6:45 pm, and the movie begins at 7 pm at Aratoi, 12 Bruce Street, Masterton. Running time: 75 minutes.

Costumes encouraged! Spot prizes will be awarded for the best dressed, adding to the spirit of the night. Bring friends, family, or come on your own and join a community of film lovers for playful scares, shared laughs, and a celebration of classic cinema.

Reserve Your Seats. Koha welcome — suggested $5. Your contribution helps keep Film Talks alive and accessible for our community.

Presented by Film Talks, and Aratoi, in association with the Wellington Heritage Festival.

Step into the shadows this Halloween and celebrate the 90th anniversary of one of cinema’s most haunting Gothic classics!

description:
He Pō Kiriata: Kneecap, This spring, the Māoriland Hub turns into a cosy little theatre for seven weeks of kiriata and kōrero. From September to November, a selection of Thursday nights will be your chance to slow down, sink into a beanbag, sit back in a chair, and lose yourself in the magic of cinema. Bring your own pillow and blanket if you wish!

KNEECAP Synopsis:

When fate brings Belfast school teacher JJ into the Orbit of self confessed ‘low life scum’ Naoise and Liam Og, the needle drops on a hip hop act like no other. Rapping in their native language KNEECAP fast becomes the unlikely figurehead of a civil rights movement to save their mother tongue. But the trio must first overcome police, paramilitaries and politicians trying to silence their defiant sound - whilst their anarchic approach to life often makes them their own worst enemies.

In this fiercely original sex, drugs and hip-hop biotic KNEECAP play themselves laying down a global rallying cry for the defense of native cultures.

Stay for a chat afterwards where we talk all things activism and what that means today.

When:
Thursday, October 16 2025
Event start: 7:30pm
Q&A session with tea and cookies after the screening.

See you soon!
This screening is R16.

description:
Film screening: GAGA, Film screening: GAGA
Join us for a special screening of the 2022 Taiwanese comedy-drama film GAGA, featuring a Q&A with the award-winning Director, Laha Mebow

About this Event

Gaga《哈勇家》(2022)
Directed by Laha Mebow 112 mins, Mandarin/Atayal/Taiwanese, English subtitles
Among the Atayal indigenous people of Taiwan, gaga is the traditional law and custom, the way of living with the land and organising society, the source of values. When Hayung, the patriarch of an Atayal family, and the senior knowledge-keeper, dies, his oldest son Payang decides to run for election as head of the local district. The film Gaga follows this election, in its raw democratic, and occasionally corrupt, form and the ways – sometimes serious, sometimes hilarious – that it affects the extended family. A groundbreaking film, Gaga is mostly in Atayal language and presents the life and social interactions of these contemporary indigenous Taiwanese people unsentimentally, with humour, with compassion, and with the sharp eye of a brilliant film-maker.
Gaga won Best Director and Best Supporting Actress at the 59th Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival in 2022. Beyond Taiwan, it won the Best Director at the 2022 Singapore International Film Festival - Asian Feature Competition and has been screened at film festivals in Hawaii, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Auckland and New York.

Q&A with Film Director Laha Mebow
We are delighted that Film Director Laha Mebow, Taiwan's first indigenous female director, will be attending the screening and take part in Q&A afterwards.


Laha Mebow is the first female director from Taiwan to win Best Director at the Golden Horse Awards, the most prestigious film award in the Chinese-speaking world. An Indigenous filmmaker of the Tayal people, she is also the first Indigenous woman in Taiwan to direct a narrative feature. Her films explore spiritual inheritance, family trauma, and Indigenous identity through a deeply personal yet cinematic lens.
She has directed three feature films. Finding Sayun (2011) reimagines a colonial-era legend from an Indigenous perspective. Lokah Laqi! (2016), a coming-of-age tale of three Indigenous boys, was selected as Taiwan’s official submission for Best Foreign Language Film at the Academy Awards. Her third feature, Gaga (2022), won Best Film at the Singapore International Film Festival and delves into generational shifts and cultural survival within an Indigenous family.
Laha’s body of work continues to break new ground for Indigenous representation in Asian cinema. Her unique voice bridges traditional storytelling and contemporary filmmaking, making her one of the most important and anticipated directors from Taiwan today.

https://cdn-az.allevents.in/events10/banners/8cd1bb10-7456-11f0-994e-1dce379af11a-rimg-w570-h740-dc090807-gmir.jpg

description:
He Pō Kiriata: Kneecap, This spring, the Māoriland Hub turns into a cosy little theatre for seven weeks of kiriata and kōrero. From September to November, a selection of Thursday nights will be your chance to slow down, sink into a beanbag, sit back in a chair, and lose yourself in the magic of cinema. Bring your own pillow and blanket if you wish!

KNEECAP Synopsis:

When fate brings Belfast school teacher JJ into the Orbit of self confessed ‘low life scum’ Naoise and Liam Og, the needle drops on a hip hop act like no other. Rapping in their native language KNEECAP fast becomes the unlikely figurehead of a civil rights movement to save their mother tongue. But the trio must first overcome police, paramilitaries and politicians trying to silence their defiant sound - whilst their anarchic approach to life often makes them their own worst enemies.

In this fiercely original sex, drugs and hip-hop biotic KNEECAP play themselves laying down a global rallying cry for the defense of native cultures.

Stay for a chat afterwards where we talk all things activism and what that means today.

When:
Thursday, October 16 2025
Event start: 7:30pm
Q&A session with tea and cookies after the screening.

See you soon!
This screening is R16.

description:
Queer Horizons presents Hot Mooch, Hot Mooch is a queer club night. Come to shake up koanga with a night of hot dance music. 
Spawned from the legendary Queer Horizons in Ōtautahi Christchurch, Hot Mooch is happening in te Upoko o te Ika Wellington - Valhalla to be exact - on 11 October. 
!!! THIS LINEUP !!!
🎶 DJ Thank U So Much (Te Whanganui-a-Tara)
🎶 Mr Meaty Boy (Ōtautahi)
🎶 AAKI (Ōtautahi)
🎶 Oil Grace (Tāmaki Makaurau)
Come to kanikani. Toi tū te Tiriti and free Palestine.
About Hot Mooch
Hot Mooch is for the bipoc and queer communities of Te Whanganui-a-Tara and their allies. It is intended as a night to dance and listen to loud music: in safety, as yourself, and with abandon. 
BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ front and centre: always.
Tino rangatiratanga: mō āke tonu atu.
FREE PALESTINE. 10% of sales go to Team Assal for their work supporting people in Gaza.
The night is dedicated to respectful, inclusive, and joyful space: we have no tolerance for any unsafe behaviour including racism, ableism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, fatphobia, or unwanted attention. 
Show lots of love and respect to our amazing performers and DJs and give them space to do their thing.
Take care of those around you, be aware of the space you inhabit and respect the needs of others. Ear plugs are available at the bar, and we encourage you to take time out, and check in with your friends. If you need help please ask the bar staff or organisers. 
  Accessibility details
Valhalla is wheelchair accessible with accessible toilets. If you have other accessibility needs, DM Abby on Insta @emmanuelcunnane

description:
Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets, Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington
Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.

Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.

Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Mother Tongue: A Sri Lankan food story • WLG screening, Motivated by things that are very tasty, Bhagya and Carl travel to the motherland of Sri Lanka to document forest gardens, coconut mills, rice paddies and Aachi’s house. After a couple years bringing Lankan flavours to the people of Ōtepoti - and armed with the cultural knowledge of diaspora kids - they want to know: Who grew this and why is it so delicious?
Follow us on IG: @media_syndicate
A true labour of love, this film was created to honour the people who put so much work into the food we eat. To this end, proceeds will be donated to our friends at The Movement for Land and Agricultural Reform (MONLAR) so that they can continue in their work for a cooperative, ecological and just food system.
MONLAR's mission is to "cooperate towards building a peoples movement by capacity building and mobilizing of small farmers and marginalized communities, who have become victims of the globalization structures, to protect natural resources and human rights and to lobby for change and implement alternative policies that are favorable and sustainable."
Running time: 42 minutes + QnA with filmmaker Bhagya Herath

description:
Hungarian Movie Night in Wellington, Hungarian Movie Night in Wellington
🎬 Film Screening: The Story of My Foolishness (1965, dir. Márton Keleti)
László Mérey and Kati Kabók are a charming acting couple well known in Budapest. On stage, the husband always takes the lead roles and reminds Kati that he is the “smart” and successful one. She stays in the background, playing the silly wife — until a family friend, a writer, helps her step out of this role and show her true strength.
A witty and entertaining comedy about marriage, theatre, and self-discovery starring with Éva Ruttkai and Lajos Básti. Don’t miss it!

🎬 Filmvetítés: Butaságom története (1965, r. Keleti Márton)
Mérey László és Kabók Kati a pesti élet rokonszenves színészházaspárja. A színpadon mindig a férj kapja a főszerepeket, és nem mulasztja el éreztetni, hogy ő az „okos” és sikeres. Kati a háttérben, butácska feleségként húzódik meg – mígnem egy író barát segítségével lehetősége nyílik kitörni ebből a szerepből és megmutatni valódi erejét.
Egy szellemes és szórakoztató vígjáték házasságról, színházról és önmagunk felfedezéséről Ruttkai Éva és Básti Lajos főszereplésével. Kihagyhatatlan!

#HungarianCinema #ClassicFilm #FilmScreening

description:
NZIFF: DJ Ahmet, Ahmet stumbles upon a forest rave at the edge of his local village, where he finds the escape he’s been desperately seeking in Georgi M. Unkovski’s loveable debut, the first ever Macedonian film to be awarded at Sundance.

Still reeling from the death of their mother and wife, Ahmet’s family is broken. His father, struggling to come to terms with being sole provider and caretaker for the family, pulls Ahmet from school so he can care for their flock of sheep; meanwhile, his younger brother has become non-verbal since their mother’s death. Music is both medicine and matchmaker for young Ahmet, who escapes his grief and the grim mundanity of life under his oppressive father by blasting beats from the world’s jankiest stereo system to impress local girl Aya, back from Germany to be betrothed to an older man.

In this modern-day Romeo and Juliet, the Yuruk mountain village of Kodzalia takes the place of Verona, while the Montagues and Capulets make way for an eclectic support cast, with a technophobic imam, a souped-up tractor and a fluorescent pink sheep all taking the stage. If music be the food of love, then DJ Ahmet is a feast of thumping electro and dance-floor anthems that spur on the teenage protagonist as he fumbles through the throes of his first romance. A jubilant first feature and a real charmer. — Matt Bloomfield
label: Film & Media

description:
Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate, Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate
~ Foraged Flavours: From Wild Greens to Plate ~

Step into a full-day, hands-on workshop at Mangaroa Farms, just 40 minutes from Wellington with Expert Forager Felicity Joy from Wild Botanica.

You’ll explore seasonal edible wild greens, learning to identify them, discover their properties, and turn your foraged finds into simple, delicious creations. In the farm’s fully equipped kitchen, you’ll make a range of hands-on preparations: fresh wild green spreads, infused butters, vibrant salads, and pickled or preserved treats, all designed to showcase the flavours of the season.

During the day, we’ll enjoy a shared wild feast together, tasting the seasonal dishes you’ve prepared in a relaxed, beautiful farm setting. This workshop is interactive, practical, and sensory, a chance to deepen your foraging skills, connect with nature, and celebrate the flavours of the wild. All ingredients, tools, and guidance are provided, so you can fully immerse yourself in the experience.

Perfect for those who’ve already attended Wild Botanica’s Foraging Workshops, this is the next step: taking your wild plant knowledge into the kitchen. Also suitable for total beginners, no experience needed.

When: Saturday 18th October
Time: 10 am – 3 pm (5-hour immersive experience)
Location: Mangaroa Farms, 40 minutes from Wellington

What’s included:
~ Full-day, hands-on experience: foraging, plant ID, cooking, and tasting
~ Access to a fully equipped kitchen and all tools
~ Guidance from an expert forager and cook
~ A shared wild feast using seasonal foraged ingredients prepared during the workshop
~ Educational insights into the nutritional, medicinal, and culinary properties of wild greens
~ Beautiful farm setting for a relaxed, sensory experience

Don't delay, call your friends and book your tickets now to avoid missing out:

https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/collections/foraging-workshops/products/foragedflavours

p.s. book your tickets by 20 September to receive $20 off each ticket. Just use the code EARLYBIRD at checkout.

description:
Cèilidh Dance Fundraiser for WMC, Get your dancing shoes on and bring the kids! The Wellington Music Centre invites you to join a vibrant and lively evening of traditional Scottish and Irish social dancing, featuring the sensational VicFolk band! This beginner-friendly, all-ages partner dancing event is designed to bring families and the community together for a night of fun, music, and connection, all while supporting the Wellington Music Centre.

Details

12th September 2025
6 - 9pm
St Patrick's Hall, 17 Rongotai Road, Kilbirnie
Ages 0-99
Tickets:
https://www.wellingtonmusiccentre.org.nz/.../wmc-ceili-dance
(door sales will be available)
Activities
Traditional Partner Dancing: Learn and enjoy traditional Scottish and Irish dances, led by the VicFolk caller*, making it perfect for beginners and families.
Live Music: Dance the night away to the energetic and foot-stomping tunes provided by the sensational VicFolk band.
Raffle: Grab a ticket to our raffle for a chance to win fantastic prizes!
Silent Auction: Bid on unique items and experiences donated by local businesses in our silent auction, including tickets to Roxy cinema, and a family pass to Wēta Workshop, with all proceeds supporting the Wellington Music Centre.
Food and Drinks: Food and beverages are available for purchase throughout the evening. This is an alcohol-free event.
*the caller leads the band and calls out instructions for the dancers, usually with a good sense of humour! They make sure everyone is having a great time, especially those who have never attended a cèilidh dance before.

Supporting Wellington Music Centre:
A cèilidh is about more than dancing, it’s a place to enjoy time with your family and connect as a community. At Wellington Music Centre, we are passionate about bringing joyful and affordable musical experiences to kids and families in South and East Wellington. Proceeds from the event will directly benefit the Wellington Music Centre, helping to fund our great programmes, including the Peninsula Family Choir, the Miramar Kids Choir, the Wellington Music Centre Orchestra, our foundational music courses: Music Explorers and the Ukulele Ensemble, and our free twice-a-year community events.
You can read more about the Wellington Music Centre and our fantastic programmes on our website:
https://www.wellingtonmusiccentre.org.nz/

description:
NZIFF: DJ Ahmet, Ahmet stumbles upon a forest rave at the edge of his local village, where he finds the escape he’s been desperately seeking in Georgi M. Unkovski’s loveable debut, the first ever Macedonian film to be awarded at Sundance.

Still reeling from the death of their mother and wife, Ahmet’s family is broken. His father, struggling to come to terms with being sole provider and caretaker for the family, pulls Ahmet from school so he can care for their flock of sheep; meanwhile, his younger brother has become non-verbal since their mother’s death. Music is both medicine and matchmaker for young Ahmet, who escapes his grief and the grim mundanity of life under his oppressive father by blasting beats from the world’s jankiest stereo system to impress local girl Aya, back from Germany to be betrothed to an older man.

In this modern-day Romeo and Juliet, the Yuruk mountain village of Kodzalia takes the place of Verona, while the Montagues and Capulets make way for an eclectic support cast, with a technophobic imam, a souped-up tractor and a fluorescent pink sheep all taking the stage. description:
NZIFF: Romeria, One of the standouts of Cannes 2025, Carla Simón’s personal exploration of the restlessness of a young woman without parents is a poignant example of the healing power of cinema.

After winning the Best Film in Berlin with Alcarràs (2022), Spanish director Carla Simón looks back into her own memories and heals pains from the past with her spellbinding third feature film Romería.

Eighteen-year-old Marina is an aspiring film student who sets out to trace the fate of her biological parents – who both died during the HIV epidemic of the late 1980s, early 1990s. Raised in Barcelona by her maternal grandparents, Marina visits her paternal family in Galicia, in order to obtain the paternity recognition documents that would allow her to apply for a scholarship. Guided on her journey by the pages of her mother's diary, Marina revisits her parents’ story of love and addiction...

Simón brushes with delicate touches the dynamics of a difficult family reconciliation and the motions of post-adolescent desire (the attraction between Marina and her cousin). While she initially draws from the tropes of summertime family dramas, Simón then turns Romería into a dreamlike fable where the past comes alive through the present thanks to the simple, yet enchanting true magic of cinema.— Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: Sex, Returning from last year’s Festival to screen alongside the rest of his Sex Dreams Love trilogy, Dag Johan Haugerud’s comic drama takes a candid and refreshing look at modern gender roles.

There has hardly been any investigation on contemporary male identity and sexuality as candid, insightful and hilarious as Norwegian auteur Dag Johan Haugerud’s Sex. After winning all major laurels in Nordic cinema with his impressive fresco Beware of Children (2019), the acclaimed director and author embarkson an Oslo-set trilogy simply called Sex Dreams Love.

The first instalment opens on one of the most tantalising and unexpected preludes in recent cinema. Two chimney sweeps frankly open up to each other on a coffee break in their office: the first reveals that he dreamt of being intensely looked at by none other than David Bowie, who was inspecting him as if he was a woman; the other confesses that he recently accepted the sexual advances of a male customer who asked him to have sex with him. But both men are “straight” and married to women. Here, the deft tone of the film and Haugerud’s rules of the game are immediately set.

A fervent admirer of Eric Rohmer’s thickly scripted skirmishes of love and ethics, the Norwegian writer-director infuses irony, depth and compassion in each of his elegantly composed tableaux depicting how the two men cope with the turmoil these experiences bring to their relationships with their partners and family, but most of all with themselves. Featuring some of the brightest and funniest dialogues of 2024, Sex is a real eye-opener. — Paolo Bertolin
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: The President’s Cake, A young girl scrambles to prepare a high-stakes birthday cake for a dictator amidst the dangers and deprivations of the Gulf War in this irresistibly scrappy Caméra d'Or-winner from Iraq.

Nine-year-old Lamia (Banin Ahmad Nayef in a spectacular debut) lives with her grandmother and beloved rooster in the impoverished but tranquil Iraqi Marshes. Despite barely being able to feed themselves due to crippling food shortages caused by international sanctions, the family is randomly selected to prepare a cake as part of the forced national spectacle observing Saddam Hussein’s birthday.

From bucolic wetlands to bustling city streets, Lamia embarks on an ingredient-hunting odyssey that mixes equal parts sweet absurdity and bitter reality. Bartering with hawkers, dodging authorities, and begging the kindness of strangers, the young girl encounters the full gamut of humanity, from good to grotesque, as she approaches her ludicrous mission with innocent determination.

Director Hasan Hadi deftly evokes humour and open heartedness against a bleak background of oppression and war. Cinematographer Tudor Vladimir Panduru summons rich texture from the gorgeous locations, beautifully backed by a flowing soundtrack of traditional strings. — Adrian Hatwell
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: The Teacher Who Promised the Sea, A progressive teacher brings new methods to a village in Burgos on the eve of the Spanish Civil War, whilst in present day Catalonia a woman searches for answers as to the whereabouts of her great-grandfather’s remains.

Catalan filmmaker Patricia Font takes us to 1930s Spain by way of real-life educator Antonio Benaiges, assigned to teach in the small village of Bañuelos de Bureba. Intertwined with these flashback sequences are scenes from present day Catalonia and Burgos where Ariadna, the granddaughter of one of Antonio's pupils, seeks to locate ancestral remains at the mass graves of La Pedraja.

Antonio’s leftist leanings and critiques of the new Francoist government anger the more conservative townsfolk, particularly the town mayor. This is despite his daughter being one of the pupils benefiting most from the free expression encouraged by Antonio’s Freinet method teachings. Meanwhile, Ariadna teeters between hope and despair in her search for closure – a human vessel embodying the plight of a nation still wrestling with the consequences of a brutal conflict.

The closing credits remark that the remains of 12,000 people have been exhumed across the country. Like Ariadna, the film attempts to seek answers from the horrors of a war that took place almost a century ago – one driven by political sentiments that feel unsettlingly familiar as some of today’s most powerful nations shift towards fascism. — Matt Bloomfield
label: Film & Media

description:
Crazy Ladies, Pamela Browne has organised a 25 year reunion for her four best friends from High School. From the moment Kay, now a chocoholic gun-toting funeral director arrives, the wheels begin falling off Pamela’s meticulously planned weekend.
Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.
Guns, gags, cuffs, crucifixes, sleaze-balls , slander, pizza and pinot – everything you need for a great weekend reunion!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
NZIFF: The President’s Cake, A young girl scrambles to prepare a high-stakes birthday cake for a dictator amidst the dangers and deprivations of the Gulf War in this irresistibly scrappy Caméra d'Or-winner from Iraq.

Nine-year-old Lamia (Banin Ahmad Nayef in a spectacular debut) lives with her grandmother and beloved rooster in the impoverished but tranquil Iraqi Marshes. Despite barely being able to feed themselves due to crippling food shortages caused by international sanctions, the family is randomly selected to prepare a cake as part of the forced national spectacle observing Saddam Hussein’s birthday.

From bucolic wetlands to bustling city streets, Lamia embarks on an ingredient-hunting odyssey that mixes equal parts sweet absurdity and bitter reality. Bartering with hawkers, dodging authorities, and begging the kindness of strangers, the young girl encounters the full gamut of humanity, from good to grotesque, as she approaches her ludicrous mission with innocent determination.

Director Hasan Hadi deftly evokes humour and open heartedness against a bleak background of oppression and war. Cinematographer Tudor Vladimir Panduru summons rich texture from the gorgeous locations, beautifully backed by a flowing soundtrack of traditional strings. — Adrian Hatwell
label: Film & Media

description:
The Lighthouse Trio at Inverlochy Art School, Join us as we explore some new interpretations of familiar melodies and unheard compositions! The trio will play original arrangements of favourite tunes as well as come brand new original songs. Expect mysterious ballads, soulful blues, and exhilarating bop.
The Lighthouse Trio is made up of three of Wellington's busiest players; Alex Trask, Jeremy Grant, and Elijah Mulheron. Alex is a highly regarded alto saxophonist who is seen all around town leading bands and playing for some of the leading musical organisations, including the RNZAF band and formerly the Rodger Fox Big Band. Elijah is the busiest bassist in town and often appears with Wellington legends such as Callum Allardice and John Rae. Jeremy is an extremely captivating guitarist and the creative force behind the arrangements you will hear.
The trio is celebrating the release of their debut EP with a tour of their own backyard, playing for the first time in Pito-one and Raumati, and finishing with a gig in central Wellington. Come along for an evening of fresh music presented in a relaxed setting, we hope to see you there!
Door sales available
label: Music & Concerts

description:
NZIFF: The President’s Cake, A young girl scrambles to prepare a high-stakes birthday cake for a dictator amidst the dangers and deprivations of the Gulf War in this irresistibly scrappy Caméra d'Or-winner from Iraq.

Nine-year-old Lamia (Banin Ahmad Nayef in a spectacular debut) lives with her grandmother and beloved rooster in the impoverished but tranquil Iraqi Marshes. description:
NZIFF: Sentimental Value, This film may touch on the familiar theme of how artists draw from their own lives, but Renate Reinsve and Stellan Skarsgard bring incredible tenderness to a story that is ultimately about what children and parents never say to one another — and whether those lifelong silences can ever be broken.
Collaborating again with frequent co-writer Eskil Vogt (now also a successful director), Trier fashions a nuanced look at both a troubled family and a dysfunctional film industry. (Gustav’s comeback project will be distributed through Netflix, and the divisive streamer is the target of a couple of the screenplay’s better barbs.) Much of Sentimental Value takes place in the Borg family’s home, and an efficient flashback, framed as an essay Nora wrote as a girl, explains how they have lived in the house for generations… That slightly fading family home becomes an apt metaphor for the weathered bond Nora, Agnes and Gustav share, although Reinsve’s fragile performance articulates the festering resentment she feels toward her absent father.
Trier’s third picture to screen at Cannes, after 2021’s The Worst Person In The World’s breakout lead Reinsve won Best Actress, the reunion of director and star will entice arthouse crowds… and those seeking a smart, thoughtful tearjerker should be pleased with this sentimental but farfrom-mawkish film.” — Tom Grierson, Screen Daily
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: The Teacher Who Promised the Sea, A progressive teacher brings new methods to a village in Burgos on the eve of the Spanish Civil War, whilst in present day Catalonia a woman searches for answers as to the whereabouts of her great-grandfather’s remains.

Catalan filmmaker Patricia Font takes us to 1930s Spain by way of real-life educator Antonio Benaiges, assigned to teach in the small village of Bañuelos de Bureba. Intertwined with these flashback sequences are scenes from present day Catalonia and Burgos where Ariadna, the granddaughter of one of Antonio's pupils, seeks to locate ancestral remains at the mass graves of La Pedraja.

Antonio’s leftist leanings and critiques of the new Francoist government anger the more conservative townsfolk, particularly the town mayor. This is despite his daughter being one of the pupils benefiting most from the free expression encouraged by Antonio’s Freinet method teachings. Meanwhile, Ariadna teeters between hope and despair in her search for closure – a human vessel embodying the plight of a nation still wrestling with the consequences of a brutal conflict.

The closing credits remark that the remains of 12,000 people have been exhumed across the country. Like Ariadna, the film attempts to seek answers from the horrors of a war that took place almost a century ago – one driven by political sentiments that feel unsettlingly familiar as some of today’s most powerful nations shift towards fascism. — Matt Bloomfield
label: Film & Media

description:
Perfect Days, Come along to our free Japanese Film night, co-organised with the Japan Foundation, Sydney!

Synopsis
Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a cleaner of toilets in Tokyo. Outside of his very structured everyday routine he enjoys his passion for music and for books. And he loves trees and takes photos of them. A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more of his past. A deeply moving and poetic reflection on finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
Director: Wim Wenders / Classification: M / Year: 2023 / Genre: Drama
Language: Japanese with English subtitles

Copyright:© 2023 Master Mind Ltd.

A short Japan Video Topics DVD will be shown from 5:15pm before the start of the film at 5:30pm. Free admission is based on a first-come, first-served basis, with a full theatre capacity of 40 people. No food is permitted in the theatre
label: Film & Media

description:
NZIFF: War Stories Our Mothers Never Told Us, Seven women reflect on the emotional cataclysm of World War II in Dame Gaylene Preston’s landmark contribution to the collective memory of Aotearoa, which has lost none of its raw power on its 30th anniversary.

When young New Zealanders were mobilised as soldiers and sent across the globe to join the frontlines of Britain’s fight against Nazi Germany, the turbulence of the Second World War travelled back into South Pacific living rooms. Distance and death became everyday realities for Kiwis at home – and caused griefs that were at times taboo and suppressed.

Dame Gaylene Preston frames seven women, including her own mother, against a black background that creates a stage for their candid, unadorned and surprisingly intimate wartime recollections, as they look back from the 90s in interviews conducted by oral historian Judith Fyfe. The acclaimed documentary, which combines these shared testimonies with personal photographs and newsreel clips, conveys the immense pressure to conform to the value of stoic sacrifice for the cause under the scrutinising eye of neighbours, and reveals lesser-seen layers of resilience.

Marriages in the first flush of romance were cut short, pregnancies were navigated alone, conscientious objectors were met with ostracisation and American servicemen scorned, in a nation united around support of their boys in combat overseas – a state of affairs in which women were often granted little voice, as they took on more labour, and absorbed life-changing losses. — Carmen Gray
label: Film & Media

description:
The Great Southern BioBlitz 2025, A bioblitz is all about searching for and recording all the species you can over a set time period.
Zealandia is one of the most biodiversity rich places in the motu(show English translation) and the perfect place to come searching for species over the long weekend. You may well find species that we have seldom seen, so this is fun for you and potentially invaluable information for our conservation team. It’s a great reason to go exploring some of the tracks you might not know well, or at all!
All you have to do is upload your observations of species to iNaturalist. It doesn’t have to be done during those four days. In fact, you’ll have a further 14 days to upload and identify all your observations made during the official period.
The Great Southern BioBlitz 2025 is run by a network of keen citizen scientists from across the globe.
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Rongotai Labour Film Evening, For everyone who missed the showing of "Prime Minister' - a film about the extraordinary term of Jacinda Adern's leadership of New Zealand - at the NZIFF, Rongotai Labour is pleased to secure a showing to help to raise funds for the 2026 election campaign.
This film chronicles Jacinda Adern's tenure as Prime Minister and provides an insight into both the political and personal challenges Jacinda faced during those six years. The inclusion of considerable footage from Jacinda's partner Clarke Gayford provides a deeply personal view of life as the Prime Minister in very challenging times.
(Los Angeles Times review) 'Prime Minister' is not interested in wrangling, dealing and lawmaking, or even the nuts and bolts or her progressive views. .. But in the fleet, pacey manner of the editing, toggling between private and public moments with highlight-reel efficiency, the film is a stirring glimpse of top-down kindness as a winning leadership style.
label: Film & Media

description:
Reels for Meals: Pike River, October's Reels for Meals movie fundraiser is Pike River.
Three-time Emmy nominee Melanie Lynskey and acclaimed NZ actress Robyn Malcolm star as Anna Osborne and Sonya Rockhouse; two ordinary women who together stand up and take on the government, justice system and a company that will stop at nothing to protect itself, after the 2010 Pike River Mine explosion takes the lives of 29 men underground.
This is a film about the powerless vs. the powerful, of people vs. money, of right vs. wrong. An inspiring true story of an incredible female friendship and together what is possible when you simply won’t give up.

All profits from this movie fundraiser go to the Lower Hutt Foodbank.

description:
Messy, "Messy", a new play written by Tara Weston-Webb, is coming to BATS this November!

Synopsis:
Flatmates Gracie, deep in therapy and retail work, and Freya, accidental drug dealer, “barely” an artist, struggle with the psychological toll of their art degree and navigate life post-uni.

Gracie’s rage gets the best of her, and Freya is losing hope. The play speaks to how tough it can be not to give up on the arts industry and how necessary mental health support is for our resilience.

Messy is a dark comedy; quippy with fast intellectual dialogue.

It pokes fun at the mundane drudgery of life, and highlights the beauty of creating art and leaning on your artistic community for support.

Content warning:
Themes of mental health and drugs. Mentions of suicide.
label: Arts & Theatre

description: ‘Democracy & Health’, ‘St Peter’s on Willis Social Justice Group invites you join us at our ‘Democracy & Health Hui’ on Thursday 2nd October 2025 from 5:30pm to 7:00pm.  Systems to support health, wellbeing and opportunity, and providing protection when vulnerable are crucial for our democracy.  This hui will focus on the current direction of our public health system and the values underpinning our democracy by discussion with leading experts, including Peter Boshier and Ganesh Ahirao.  The hui will be livestreamed and recorded.’

description:
Iron, Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.
The Cast
Faye - Karen Anslow
Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

description:
Friends of Karori Cemetery - 2025 Wellington Heritage Festival: Our Fair Ladies (April 2025), Our Fair Ladies Tour
Embark on a captivating journey through the history buried in Karori Cemetery with our tour showcasing the remarkable lives of Wellington's women.
This tour offers a unique opportunity to celebrate the resilience, creativity and empowerment of women at a time when a woman couldn't have a bank account in her own name.  You'll hear the stories of women who had a range of interesting occupations. 
Be inspired by the incredible impact of these women's lives in early Wellington.
Our tour has a maximum capacity of about 15 persons. If there are insufficient tickets remaining for your party, please email us at info@friendsofkaroricemetery.co.nz to check if we can accommodate you.
Note:
If we have to cancel a tour due to inclement weather or sickness, we will notify you on the day by 9am by email and on our Facebook page.

Please dress appropriately for the conditions. While we do our best to guide you on a safe walking route, during the winter months the ground can become slippery in places.
Some of our walks require a moderate degree of fitness and are not suited for those with limited mobility. Please read the tour descriptions carefully to check that they will be suitable for you.
We will meet before the tour at the Shelter (listed as Historic chapel on the map)
We look forward to welcoming you to Karori Cemetery.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Rheem training in Palmerston North, We're heading back to Palmerston North to deliver free local product training.
This season of Rheem Training for Tradies events will provide background knowledge of product updates and new models. We’ll cover operation, installation requirements and clear-up some myths relating to installation practices, and warranty.
Topics covered:
Heat pump water heaters –
Benefits, current range, installation, service and warranty
Gas continuous flow –
New model updates, installation, commissioning, service, fault-finding and warranty
Electric storage cylinders –
Benefits of model types for harsh water areas, installation and warranty
Myth busting facts –
installation and warranty requirements
Boiling water –
Lazer and Zip models explained, live demonstration of Lazer operation, sequence of operation explained to help with fault-finding
Refreshments will be provided.
Please select the number of free tickets required as the event has limited numbers.
There's no need to print free tickets, your place is secure once booked!
Product detail links here:
Heat Pump water heating
Gas Continuous Flow
Lazer boiling water
Check out the Rheem Online Learning Management System ›

description:
Textiles and Queerness in a NZ Film! Went Up The Hill at NZIFF Wellington, Hi queer friends who love crafts-have I got the film for you! NZ feature film Went Up The Hill will have its Wellington Premiere at the NZ International Film Festival on 21 August at the Embassy at 830pm-get your ticket now!
Come along and be amongst the first to see NZ feature film Went Up The Hill from queer NZ filmmaker Sam Van Grinsven.
Tickets to the Wellington screening are available for $26 at the NZIFF website:
https://www.nziff.co.nz/.../te.../went-up-the-hill/
The film is also screening at NZIFF in centres around the country including Auckland, Christchurch, Dunedin amongst others!
Shot in Canterbury and funded by the NZ Film Commission, the film stars Vicky Krieps (The Phantom Thread) and Dacre Montgomery (Stranger Things) in a poetic ghost story that centres on two queer characters-a woman and her dead wife’s estranged son -as they are each haunted by her spirit. The film premiered to critical acclaim as a Special Presentation at Toronto Film Festival in 2024 where Sam was hailed by Hollywood Reporter as already having the ‘control of a master’ in a film that is ‘captivating', ‘elliptical' and 'technically stunning’.
Sam Van Grinsven has a passion for queer interpretation of genre and seeing queer characters within spaces that historically have not been explored as diversely.
Here's the trailer link-we hope you can join us!
label: Film & Media

description:
The Lot Fundraiser Pub Quiz, Join us for a fun night of trivia and drinks at The Lot fundraiser Pub Quiz - let's raise some money together!

We are a bunch of Maessey University students and we need you help to fund our third year student film The Lot.

The film follows Riley and her boyfriend Jay, as they attempt to purchase snacks for a party. However, their arrogance and lack of communication turns a simple task into the unraveling of their relationship.
The film is a comical narrative that pokes fun at miscommunication and microaggression, and ends (literally) in a big mess. I hope audiences are able to share a laugh and see a bit of themselves in the characters: whether it’s the cashier who’s just trying to make it through his shift, or the partner who’s completely had it with their relationship.

description:
The Wanted 18 Screening, This spring from the 28th of August to the 2nd of October we will be screening a series of excellent Palestinian films, old and new, every week at two/fiftyseven on Willis Street, with ticket sales going to the Gazan mutual aid group The Sameer Project.
The Sameer Project is an on-the-ground aid organisation organised by Palestinians in the diaspora, which crowdfunds in order to provide tents, medical care and direct cash aid to those most affected in Gaza. They can be found on Instagram at @thesameerproject.
More information about The Wanted 18, screening on the 10th of September can be found at https://www.palestinefilminstitute.org/en/pfp/archive/wanted-18.
label: Film & Media

description:
The World of Nelsito, Movie Spotlight
The World of Nelsito / El Mundo de Nelsito
Country: Cuba
Genre: Drama
Audio: Spanish
Subtitles: English
Synopsis: Dramatic comedy that introduces us to Nelsito, a 16-year-old autistic boy. After running away from home, he is the victim of a car accident. From his stretcher and through his imaginary pen, Nelsito reveals the dark and hidden side of all those he lives with and those around him: perverse children, murderous women, adorable swindling girls… Now recovered, Nelsito returns home. There we will meet those same characters, now simple neighbours, real, everyday people, but which are the real ones, those common mortals or the ones he has imagined?
Rated: M - Suitable for mature audineces 16 years and over.
Note: Violence, sexual violence & offensive language.
Free Entry | RSVP required |

description:
6 Week Yoga Course for Beginners, The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. A wonderful course for new beginners and those looking to deepen their practical experience of yoga.

Some of the many benefits of yoga include: improvement in posture and breathing, increased strength and flexibility, a greater ability to cope with stress, and a feeling of peace and calm.
This course called "part 1" will cover the second half of Level 1 from the System of Yoga in Daily Life.

description:
Oops! All Donkeys, Oops! All Donkeys
Directed by Christine Brooks

Make. Pull. Carry. Work. Repeat.

Donkeys! Are you not tired? Atomised and alienated? It’s time to lay down your burdens and join us at our retreat. Be among friends. Feel the cool gleam of the moon upon your ears. Find and then heal your inner donkey. A most rare vision awaits.

From the creator of Love Isthmus: Dystopia Edition (“a truly bizarre and apocalyptic hour of improv” - The Wellingtonista), Murder on a Boat (“really, really, really good” - Regional News), and The Solarpunk Archives (“creative antics that leave the audience howling with laughter” - Theatreview) comes this festival premiere of the show concept that came to the director in a dream.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Twin Peaks Wellington: Season 2 - Episodes 8 & 9, If the sound of watching Twin Peaks together with a bunch of like minded fans sounds like a good idea, then you've come to the right place!
Last time we met we celebrated completing all of Season 1 together.
I am excited to announce we are now going to watch Season 2! Starting off with the special double length "Episode 8: May the Giant Be With You". Written by Mark Frost, David Lynch and directed by David Lynch. Followed by "Episode 9:Coma". Directed by David Lynch.
This is what we will be watching :
Short Recap  "Previously...on Twin Peaks"
Episode 8: "May the Giant Be With You"  (93mins)
Intermission
Episode 9: "Coma"  (46mins)
With all Log Lady Intros!
WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.
https://www.teauahaevents.com/our-spaces/cinema

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 6th Sept. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.

Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat. Every single screening so far has sold out well in advance, so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing the epic start to Season 2 in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!

RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please. 
2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Please clean up after yourself if you are snacking and help keep the mini cinema clean as a whistle. 
Thank you! And hope to see you there.

description:
WPF presents: The Hunger (1983), WPF presents: The Hunger (1983)
Three of the most beautiful actors to ever live - Catherine Deneuve, David Bowie and Susan Sarandon- star in this ‘80s cult classic about a vampire couple posing as wealthy classical music teachers.

The Hunger is full camp; queer tension and complexity. And beware: the encounters in this movie do not stick to heterosexual norms.

Underworld Tavern in Mt Victoria is hosting this screening in their suitably dark, macabre and industrial surrounds. Prizes will be awarded to the darkest and most vampiric ensemble. A full bar service will be available throughout.

Continuing our run of film fundraisers, The Hunger allows us queers and our allies to engage with a pillar of queer culture. These screenings are organised and hosted by the community for the community. More than just a screening, this will be a queer horror experience.

The event begins at 3pm but come early to get comfortable. The film will start at 3.30. A short comfort break will be provided. Stay for a drink to discuss and dissect.

The Hunger is rated R18. No one under the age of 18 is permitted. Its running length is 97 minutes.

Tickets are $20 waged, $13 unwaged.

ACCESSIBILITY

- Underworld Tavern is fully wheelchair accessible
- The movie will include closed captions
label: Film & Media

description:
Breaker bay Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Breaker Bay Hall, warmly invites you to:
Monthly Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Open session: 1:00pm – 5:00pm (pack down starts at 4:30pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors.
• An old towel
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
• Returning weavers: 30–40 rau of harakeke and your weaving tools
• Some tools are available to borrow
• Shared kai (snacks) welcome but not required
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook
https://www.facebook.com/TeMotuKai

Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:

Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
2025 Screening Programme
Sunday 28 September, 7:30pm – Rear Window (1954)
Alfred Hitchcock’s suspense masterpiece starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly.
Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm – Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019)
Two powerful New Zealand films showcasing extraordinary local storytelling.
Sunday 30 November, 7:30pm – Run Lola Run (1998)
A thrilling, kinetic ride through fate, love, and chance in this German cult classic.
Ticket Options
Three Movie Membership – the best value! Secure your seat for all three screenings and enjoy the full Cinematheque experience. Membership cards will be issued at our first screening, which is REAR WINDOW (1954). Please arrive 15 minutes early to collect your membership cards/ticket.
Single Ticket – perfect for sampling the magic on opening night.
Tickets are available through Humanitix or cash door sales on the night.
Join us in celebrating film, artistry, and community in the Wairarapa.
