description:
Women's Adventure Film Tour 2025 presented by Mountain Designs - Wellington, Presented by Mountain Designs, the Women’s Adventure Film Tour® (WAFT) returns for its 9th year, celebrating extraordinary women and their thrilling adventures. This year’s line-up features an inspiring collection of short films that highlight stories of courage, connection, and pushing beyond personal limits. From mountain peaks to ocean waves, and from the everyday to the extreme, these films showcase women from all walks of life pursuing their definition of adventure.
Each film has been carefully chosen to show women achieving their personally adventurous goals. Adventure doesn’t always mean being the fastest, going the highest, or doing the most extreme things. For most of us, adventure is about stepping outside our comfort zone and climbing our own Everest. The Women’s Adventure Film Tour shines a light on real stories of women from a variety of cultures and sports around the world, creating an empowering and uplifting experience for audiences.
The Women’s Adventure Film Tour® is an official part of Jean Hailes for Women’s Health – Women’s Health Week, proudly presented by Mountain Designs and supported by Nalgene, Sea to Summit, Capital Brewing, PETZL, Osprey and Big White.
label: Film & Media

description:
50yrs Misuse of Drugs Act: What impact & what next?, The 1975 Misuse of Drugs Act (MoDA) has failed to deliver. Data from the United Nations Office for Drugs and Crime indicates the demand for drugs is greater than ever, while the supply of drugs knows no bounds. The failure and harm caused by the so called 'War on Drugs' is acknowledged globally and witnessed first hand here in Aotearoa New Zealand.

Back in 2011 a comprehensive review of the MoDA conducted by New Zealand Law Commission recommended the MoDA “should be repealed and replaced by a new Act …administered by the Ministry of Health”. HRCA wants to see that recommendation enacted.

New Zealand has a history for bold world leading policy reform: Woman’s Right to Vote; Decriminalisation of Sex Work; National Needle Exchange, Same Sex Marriage and most recently Drug Checking.

This half day Symposium will provide clear evidence why major law reform is necessary and detail the foundations upon which Aotearoa NZ can once again be innovative and lead the way with new drug laws based on evidence, research and experience -providing a safer environment for future generation.

Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa are delighted to have assembled a group of respected independent thinkers with vast experience of drug policy in Aotearoa and beyond, to reflect on the impact of the MoDA and to identify the principles and values needed to underpin new drug laws.

Warren Young: Prof. of Law & Former Deputy President New Zealand Law Commission.
Kirsten Gibson: Chair of Harm Reduction Coalition Aotearoa and Qualitative Researcher.
Fiona Hutton: Associate Prof. Institute of Criminology, Victoria University of Wellington.
Adam Dorsett: 40 yrs Living/Lived Experience of Prohibited Drug Use, 25yrs in Prison.
Julian Buchanan: Former UNODC Advisor and Criminology Professor.

NOTE:
This event is free and open to the public on a 'first come first served' basis.
However, eventfinda ticket holders will be guaranteed a seat.
label: Government & Politics

description:
Textured Rings - Welcome Spring!, Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Always a Bridesmaid, Step into the world of <i>Bridesmaids<i> for a three-course feast that brings the film to life, literally. Zephyr is serving up a cinematic dining experience where every bite is perfectly timed with the on-screen action.
Expect to start with Annie’s mum’s famous artichoke dip, and an entree inspired by Lillian and Doug’s engagement party then get ready for the main event: the Brazilian feast (but guaranteed to be without the unfortunate side effects). And for dessert, it’s that cookie. The giant one. Gorgeous to share or go full meltdown mode — it’s your call. All paired with cocktails and drinks that complement the evening perfectly. After all, as Megan says, "I'm gonna climb that like a tree." And yes, by "that," we mean the drinks list. Mocktails available.
Like an exclusive invite to Lillian’s Parisian bridal shower, these tickets will disappear fast. So grab your besties, your worsties, or your slightly terrifying but well-meaning Megan, and join us for a night of food, film, and absolute chaos. Because sometimes, life calls for laughing until you cry, eating until you're full, and toasting to the love of your friendships that survive it all.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Bastion Point on film, The Bastion Point occupation was one of the most important events in modern-day Māori protest. Come to the Library to watch two documentaries about the occupation — ‘Bastion Point: Day 507’ made in 1980 and ‘Bastion Point: The Untold Story’ made almost two decades later in 1999.

Presented by the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa in partnership with Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision and Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage.

Photo: Film still from Bastion Point: Day 507 featuring Joe Hawke (right). Stills collection, Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision.

description:
Resilient Waters: NZ–German Conference, Strengthening Urban Water Systems Against Extreme Weather – German Insights for Aotearoa

New Zealand’s water infrastructure is under growing pressure from climate change, ageing systems, and extreme weather events. Ensuring safe drinking water, reliable wastewater management, and resilient infrastructure requires fresh thinking and innovative solutions.
The Resilient Waters Conference, hosted by the German-New Zealand Chamber of Commerce (GNZCC), will bring together German innovators and New Zealand stakeholders for a high-level forum dedicated to future-proofing New Zealand’s water systems.
At this conference, a delegation of German companies will present cutting-edge technologies and intelligent system solutions designed to improve water resilience in the face of climate change. The programme will feature expert presentations, sector-specific insights, and networking opportunities with a professional audience from water utilities, engineering firms, city councils, and decision-making bodies.
Following the conference, the programme for the delegation will continue with B2B meetings, expert roundtables, and site visits in Wellington, Hawke’s Bay, and Auckland from 17–21 November 2025. These tailored sessions will connect German companies directly with New Zealand stakeholders to exchange knowledge, explore collaboration, and identify concrete opportunities for partnership.
 This initiative is organised by the German-New Zealand Chamber of Commerce (GNZCC) in collaboration with German partner AHP International and funded by the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (BMWE).
label: Conservation & Environment

description:
Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

This is your chance to learn from the best and indulge in an evening of flavour and fun!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Monthly Reiki Circle – Wellington | Energy Detox & Cleansing, September Theme: Energy Detox & Cleansing
Join us for a monthly gathering of healing, alignment, and community.
This circle is designed to help you release stagnant energy, restore balance, and connect deeply with yourself and others through Reiki-infused practices and guided meditation.
What you will experience:• Reiki healing to clear energetic congestion• Guided meditation for detox and renewal• Crystal grid activation to amplify cleansing energy• Oracle card pull for guidance• Closing integration with Blue Lotus Tea, Seasonal Fruit, and Shared Kai
This is a safe and supportive space for both beginners and experienced Reiki practitioners. Come as you are – leave feeling lighter, clearer, and more aligned.
What to Bring
A yoga mat or something comfortable to sit/lie on
A cushion or blanket for extra comfort
A water bottle to stay hydrated
A journal and pen if you’d like to reflect after the circle
An open heart and intention for what you wish to release or receive
Optional: crystals, talismans, or personal items you’d like to charge in the Reiki circle or place near the crystal grid.
Details:When: Every first Thursday of the month, 6:00 PMWhere: Te Aro Ashtanga, Left Bank, Cuba Street, WellingtonEnergy Exchange: $35
Spots are limited – reserve your place today.
Walk away with:
A lighter body and mind, free from stagnant energy
A calmer nervous system and deeper inner stillness
Insights from guided meditation and oracle reflection
Nourishment through Blue Lotus Tea, seasonal fruit, and shared kai
A sense of belonging within a like-minded community
Renewed clarity, alignment, and energy to carry forward

description:
Bar Blanc de Blancs with Martin Bosley's Oyster Saloon, Alexia's special annual Blanc de Blancs celebration returns for a 4th edition with the release of the 2021 vintage of our world famous (in Greytown) Méthode Traditionnelle!

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

It’s always a great day when the new vintage of Blanc de Blancs starts flowing and we’re quietly delighted with how the 2021 vintage is looking!

Essential Details:
- Alexia Urban Winery, 197 West Street, Greytown.
- Leashed dogs ok!
- No bookings required, just turn up. Want oysters? Get there before 3pm.
- Parking onsite, on the street, and lots of parking for bikes. 15 minute walk from Greytown centre.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Cheesy Lovers, Calling all cheese lovers! Whether you're planning a romantic date, a fun night with a friend, or a family treat, Cheesy Lovers is the perfect hands-on experience for two — your chance to craft, taste, and share the magic of artisan cheese together.

Begin the evening by exploring the art of fresh cheese-making — a simple yet rewarding process that will have you creating your own delicate cheese from scratch. Our experts will guide you through each step, from curdling the milk to shaping and seasoning your fresh creation.

Start your journey by making two fresh cheeses from scratch, guided by our expert cheesemongers. You and your partner will work as a team to curdle, shape, and season your own cheeses, learning the art of fresh cheese-making step by step.

Then, put your creativity to the test by building a cheese platter for two. Using a curated selection of artisan cheeses, you’ll design a board that balances textures, flavours, and perfect pairings. An array of charcuterie, fruits, nuts, and condiments will be provided, along with expert tips on plating and pairing to ensure your board is as stunning as it is delicious.

This intimate, hands-on experience is designed for anyone who loves good food, great company, and, of course, cheese!
label: Food & Drink

description:
DILLI-24, A North Indian feast crafted by long-time Loretta head chef Chandrika Khullar.
Named after her hometown of Delhi and her home postcode, this special menu is a deeply personal tribute to her upbringing and a childhood immersed in the rich culinary traditions of North India. Chandrika brings the heart and soul of Delhi to Wellington with a generous, share-style multi-course menu featuring bountiful vegetarian plates and an exceptional lamb raan.

Expect an explosion of flavour, with exotic spice blends, saffron, citrus and native berries woven into every dish. In North India, condiment is king, and this feast will be served with a vibrant array of chutneys, pickles and relishes. To complete the experience, Chandrika has also designed a beautifully curated drinks menu to complement the bold and fragrant dishes.
label: Food & Drink

Sip, Savor, and Explore a Cultural Icon!, Join us for a delicious journey into the world of Chinese milk tea — a beloved drink that blends flavor, tradition, and creativity. description:
Dragons Is My Uso, Chef Jessica Tang and legendary home chefs Litia Lefaoseu and Iutita Mallon are drawing on the century long fusion of Chinese and Samoan cuisine and the way food expresses love, ai, and alofa. In the late 1800s, small numbers of Chinese settled in Samoa and became part of a growing multicultural community. There they influenced local customs, made an enduring contribution to Samoan cuisine introducing contemporary favourites such as sapasui (chop suey), keke pua‘a (pork buns) and of course laisa (rice). 

Dragons celebrate this cultural and culinary fusion by showcasing these favourites and presenting new dishes highlighting the shared love of culinary staples such as taro and noodles, rice, fish, and pork, the magnificent spectrum of Chinese herbs, spices and flavours. Through cooking and sharing food together the chefs honour their culinary heritage, strengthen our connections to one another and celebrate the big and little moments in life. This is a shared-style meal, served banquet style on lazy Susan turntables. 
Dragons is My Uso was one of the sell-out hits of the 2024 festival - don't miss out!

Discounted tables for 10 available for $1000, so get the whole aiga together!
label: Food & Drink

description:
FILIPINO RESTAURANT WEEK, From October 20 to 26, 2025, Filipino cuisine will take center stage in Auckland, Wellington, Christchurch, and Dunedin for the first Filipino Restaurant Week (FRW). This week-long event introduces foodies to the rich and diverse flavors of the Philippines, with Filipino restaurants showcasing traditional and modern dishes that tell stories of heritage and community.
Participating restaurants will offer fixed-price menus featuring Filipino dishes like adobo, kare-kare, and halo-halo, giving diners a chance to experience the rich culinary traditions shaped by centuries of history. These menus highlight the unique fusion of indigenous ingredients and global influences in Filipino cooking.
Filipino Restaurant Week is a celebration of heritage, an invitation to unity, and a singular opportunity to savor Filipino cuisine. It celebrates New Zealand’s diverse cultural tapestry, deepens cross-cultural understanding, and strengthens community through the universal connection of food.
label: Food & Drink

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.
label: Food & Drink

Poverty in Aotearoa New Zealand - A discussion of two new BWB Texts: Pakukore and Hardship and Hope
Speakers include Rebecca Macfie, Tracey McIntosh, Brigitte Bönisch-Brednich and Caroline Mareko
Thursday 11 September
Room RHLT 1

33 Bunny Street
Wellington
Doors open from 5.30pm, event starts 6pm
Nau mai, haere mai. Public event, no RVSP needed.
Contact info@bwb.co.nz for more information.

description:
Feed Your Senses, Step into an immersive experience where nature’s core elements — stone, clay, wood, water, fire, and air — are brought to life through a dynamic fusion of artistic mediums. Explore interactive installations and captivating performances that engage all of your senses with visual art, sculpture, sound, and more. Throughout the evening, enjoy six unique canapés and six meticulously crafted drinks, each inspired by the work of a different artist. Each exhibit reflects the raw power and beauty of the natural world, as local artists push boundaries to bring these elements to life in real-time.

As you journey through Foxglove’s Secret Wardrobe, you'll be surrounded by live artistry unfolding around you, creating an environment filled with raw creativity and vibrant energy. Aphrodisiac-inspired canapés and expertly paired beverages complement the visual experience, bringing each artist’s medium to life while celebrating Wellington’s rich and diverse creative community.

This culinary and sensory pairing will transport you deeper into the world of artistry, blending food and creativity in unexpected and delightful ways.

This event goes beyond simple exhibition — it’s a celebration of Wellington's local talent where the boundaries between food, art, and sensory experience are beautifully blurred. Whether you’re an art aficionado or a culinary enthusiast, this immersive experience promises to engage your senses in an unforgettable way.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective, Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective
✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up at Copperfield Collective ✨

Saturday 6th September · 11am – 2pm · Paraparaumu

For one day only, Lightbody Jewellery is journeying to Paraparaumu.

We’re honoured to be welcomed into Copperfield Collective, bringing with us a collection of our most sought-after treasures.

💫 Meet the maker – learn the stories and symbols hidden in every piece.

💫 Try on sacred treasures – jewellery alive with meaning, energy, and transformation.

💫 Feel the magic woven into silver and gold – creations that choose their keepers.

About Lightbody Jewellery

We are a small New Zealand brand, born from nothing but vision and persistence, built piece by piece, story by story. Lightbody Jewellery grew out of a desire to carry ancient symbols into the present, weaving spirit into matter so that jewellery could once again guide, teach, and protect.

Every pendant, ring, and talisman is handcrafted here in Aotearoa with intention. They are not made to follow trends, they are made to awaken, to empower, to transform.

What began as a spark has grown into a living brand carried by intuition, mystery, and craft. Each piece finds its keeper when the time is right.

This pop-up at Copperfield Collective is more than a display.
It’s a rare chance to meet the maker, hold the work, and feel which treasure has been waiting for you.

✨ Lightbody Jewellery Pop-Up
📍 Copperfield Collective - 17 Seaview Road, Paraparaumu Beach
📅 Saturday 6th September
🕚 11am – 2pm

description:
Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate, Foraged Flavours : From Wild Greens to Plate
~ Foraged Flavours: From Wild Greens to Plate ~

Step into a full-day, hands-on workshop at Mangaroa Farms, just 40 minutes from Wellington with Expert Forager Felicity Joy from Wild Botanica.

You’ll explore seasonal edible wild greens, learning to identify them, discover their properties, and turn your foraged finds into simple, delicious creations. In the farm’s fully equipped kitchen, you’ll make a range of hands-on preparations: fresh wild green spreads, infused butters, vibrant salads, and pickled or preserved treats, all designed to showcase the flavours of the season.

During the day, we’ll enjoy a shared wild feast together, tasting the seasonal dishes you’ve prepared in a relaxed, beautiful farm setting. This workshop is interactive, practical, and sensory, a chance to deepen your foraging skills, connect with nature, and celebrate the flavours of the wild. All ingredients, tools, and guidance are provided, so you can fully immerse yourself in the experience.

Perfect for those who’ve already attended Wild Botanica’s Foraging Workshops, this is the next step: taking your wild plant knowledge into the kitchen. Also suitable for total beginners, no experience needed.

When: Saturday 18th October
Time: 10 am – 3 pm (5-hour immersive experience)
Location: Mangaroa Farms, 40 minutes from Wellington

What’s included:
~ Full-day, hands-on experience: foraging, plant ID, cooking, and tasting
~ Access to a fully equipped kitchen and all tools
~ Guidance from an expert forager and cook
~ A shared wild feast using seasonal foraged ingredients prepared during the workshop
~ Educational insights into the nutritional, medicinal, and culinary properties of wild greens
~ Beautiful farm setting for a relaxed, sensory experience

Don't delay, call your friends and book your tickets now to avoid missing out:

https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/collections/foraging-workshops/products/foragedflavours

p.s. book your tickets by 20 September to receive $20 off each ticket. Just use the code EARLYBIRD at checkout.

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 9th Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
I-Sarn Thai KanTok, Join Daeng from Tuk Tuk Thai for a deeply personal culinary journey to the heart of E-Sarn, the north-eastern region of Thailand she once called home. This one-night-only event celebrates the traditional Kan-Tok style of dining – a communal meal served on handwoven bamboo trays and shared amongst family and friends. This event is made to be shared, the ticket price is for a shared menu for two. 

Growing up in the small town of Tha Bo near the Mekong Delta, Daeng’s childhood was filled with stories of rice farming, village generosity, and dishes cooked from what the garden offered. In E-Sarn, meals were acts of love, shared daily around the Kan-Tok with laughter, music, and warmth.

Now, Daeng invites you to gather at her table and experience the flavours of her upbringing. You’ll be served nine traditional dishes on a beautifully crafted bamboo tray, designed for sharing, just as they are in her village.

On the Kan-Tok:
Hor Mok Salmon – Steamed salmon in banana leaves, marinated with herbs, spices, and coconut milk
Mok Nor Mai with Pork Belly – Pork belly steamed with bamboo shoots
Larb Gai – A celebratory chicken mince salad with fresh herbs and toasted rice
E-Sarn Sausages – House-made, spiced and fermented in true north-eastern style
Nam Prik Tomato – Roasted tomato dipping sauce with chillies, garlic, and shallots
Som Tum – Green papaya salad with a sweet, sour, spicy kick
Sticky Rice – Soaked overnight and steamed in traditional bamboo baskets
Fresh and Steamed Seasonal Vegetables – To enjoy with sauces and mains

Dessert:
Kanom Chan – Thai layered jelly cake
Kanom Mun – Tapioca and coconut pudding

Pull up a seat at Daeng’s table and discover the stories, flavours, and traditions that shaped her childhood.
Single tickets or odd numbers unable to be catered to.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me Wellington Central, Tautoko Tāne is hosting Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me - a nationwide series of free presentations for agencies, service providers and professionals to share information and insights about working with male survivors of sexual abuse to get the support they need.
There will be two sessions on 12 November at Rydges Wellington CBD - 10am and 2pm.
The presentation includes:
Safe access and effective engagement of male survivors with support services
Dispelling some of the common myths about male victims of sexual harm
Navigate the misunderstandings that create barriers to engagement with support services
Highlight the role of lived experience as an effective engagement model
Collaboration and partnerships to welcome and embrace cultural and gender diversity within the male survivor community
Supporting complex trauma requires a shared response from several organisations, each with different skills and experience – no single agency or organisation can do it alone.
As more male survivors present with complex trauma, New Zealand will need even more collaborative sector partnerships to provide the wrap-around services necessary for recovery.
Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me is about bringing those different organisations together to hear from those with lived experience, and share information and understandings about working with male survivors of sexual abuse and violence, to help them get the support they need.
We hope you will join us. Please REGISTER here to attend
https://tautokotane.nz/hoake-tatou-walk-with-me/
label: Health & Wellness

description:
HineHau Breathwork for Women, Join Shannon Rose for this unique three-hour breathwork workshop for all wāhine.

Through story, breath, and reflection, you’ll learn and experience the power of your breath as a wāhine: to cleanse, to create, and to consciously live in alignment with who you are.

Shannon has been immersed in the practice of breath since 2017 and is recognised as one of the pioneers of breathwork in Aotearoa. She is the founder of HineHau, a breathwork training kaupapa supporting wāhine to step into leadership and facilitation through the breath.

In this workshop, you’ll be safely guided on a journey of remembrance, reconnection, and reclamation. Expect to come away feeling grounded, rejuvenated, and more at home in your body.

What’s Included
*Karakia to open and close our space
*Purākau — Māori creation stories on the whakapapa of the breath
*Kōrero — how intentional breathing helps to align your mauri, wairua and mana
*Working with the nervous system to support manifestation and creativity
*BreathWav™ Journey — a 70-minute circular connected breath practice for release, alignment, and deep connection
*Journaling & Reflection to integrate what arises.

What to Bring
Water bottle, a journal + pen and an eye mask. Mats, blankets & supportive props provided.

Who This is For
This workshop is open to wāhine of all cultures who are ready to experience the healing power of Te Hā — the sacred breath.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Riftbound Learn to Play Event, Riftbound Learn to Play Event
Riot Games has brought League of Legends to the collectable trading card world with Riftbound! A game for 2-4 players where you choose your champion and send them alongside your army and your spells to take control of battlefields and win!

If you want to learn how to play Riftbound before the set releases, Bea DnD will be running Learn to Play Events! The event will last for 3 hours and you can drop in any time during the event to try out Riftbound! Our staff are eager to teach you all about some awesome heroes!

Everyone that participates in a Riftbound Learn to Play will receive one promo card of Teemo while stocks last!

description:
Yoga for All at Kai Tahi, Yoga for All at Kai Tahi
Community yoga is coming to Kai Tahi!

Try Sunday morning yoga classes with local yoga teacher, Janie Walker from BeCalmed Studio. Janie specialises in introducing people to yoga and supporting a life-long practice and love of yoga. Come stretch, breathe and feel good; this is yoga for all bodies and experiences.

$10 per class (cash or internet banking), no bookings required.
Please bring a yoga mat.

Every Sunday 9am (starts 19 October)
Kai Tahi atrium

What is yoga?

Yoga is breathing deeply, letting go of anxious thoughts, being kind, stretching the body to reduce tension, being more flexible, focusing and being mindful, and moving into different shapes.

What are the benefits of yoga?

Get stronger, more flexible and re-learn to relax in these Sunday morning community yoga classes. Reduce your blood pressure, improve circulation, reduce anxiety – and find more ease in your body.

How will I feel after my Sunday Kai Tahi yoga class?

Lighter, more relaxed, stronger, more confident, calmer.

What kind of yoga will I be doing?

A mix of vinyasa, hatha, restorative and mindfulness.

Who is the yoga teacher?

Janie Walker is a trained and experienced vinyasa, restorative and yin yoga teacher. She weaves ancient yoga philosophy and breath work with easy poses. Her classes are for beginners and those who want to deepen their own practice. Janie focuses on relaxation, breath and relaxing the mind.

How much does it cost?

$ 10 per class (cash or internet banking)

Do I need to book?

No bookings necessary. Just turn up. Yoga mats provided or bring your own.

Can I do yoga if I am injured or recovering from illness or don’t feel good?

If you have an injury or want to chat about how to look after yourself during your yoga class, please do contact Janie: or phone 0274539099. If you have any other physical or mental conditions that you’d like Janie to be aware of so she can support you, please contact her.

Find out more about BeCalmed Studio and Janie Walker - www.becalmedstudio.com

description:
Love in Scent, Join fragrance aficionado Benny Castles for an immersive journey into the WORLD of love, told through the art of scent. In this exclusive olfactive experience, indulge in small bites and sip on a glass (or three!) of something delightful, setting the perfect mood for exploring the emotional power of fragrance.

Over the course of the evening, you’ll sample up to twelve unique fragrances, each one tied to a captivating love story that inspired its creation. Learn the intimate tales behind these scents and discover how they evoke the passions and emotions that shape our experiences of love. Whether you're a fragrance enthusiast or a newcomer, this sensory journey is sure to arouse your olfactory senses and deepen your appreciation for the art of perfume.

It’s time for a high tea that’s a little spooky, a little cheeky & a whole lot of fun.

Join us for a glamorous afternoon at The Library Bar as we serve up classic high tea with a hauntingly good twist. Expect a delicious mix of sweet & savoury delights — perfect for a catch-up, celebration, or a well-deserved treat-yourself moment.

description:
JETAA Wellington - Brewkaiwa September @ Mean Doses, We will be having our September Brewkaiwa at Mean Doses, a bold and modern craft brewery in the heart of Wellington. Known for its inventive beers and laid-back atmosphere, it’s the perfect place to share a drink and good conversation.
Brewkaiwa is JETAA’s monthly casual meetup for anyone with any connection to Japan.
We’re a diverse group of people who have studied, worked, or lived in Japan or have been invited along by someone who has.
Come join us for a brew and stay for the kaiwa! Bring your friends!
***Japanese or alcohol consumption NOT REQUIRED!***
Brewkaiwaとは
一杯いかがですか？
JETAAがウェリントンで親睦会を開催するとどうなるのか？その結果、BREWKAIWA！
2020年に始まった、ブリューカイワは、ウェリントンの様々なバーで毎月開催されている飲み会です。大人気の国際交流グルップです！！！ 日本で働いたり、住んだり、旅行したことのある人達に人気のあるイベントです！！！お酒を飲んで、友達を出来、素敵なごちそうを食べ、おまけに異文化を知られます！
日本語が話せる外国人も良く参加しているので、日本語しか話せなくても全然大丈夫です！
是非来てください！
label: Food & Drink

description: Love the Wine You're With, Join the team from Matahiwi Estate for a fun and fearless wine tasting. Strip away the pretense of wine while tasting six glasses from new flavours, to old favourites and unique styles all while enjoying a shared charcuterie pairing. No question is too big or small, this is your chance to sip, learn, and explore in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Come curious, leave confident or maybe just a little less confused by wine speak - but most of all, enjoy!

description:
Love Language, Calling budding poets and hopeless romantics - this is your opportunity to share your love of language, with a food and poetry degustation. 
This four-course dinner is a physical manifestation of love and an ode to food. Join Simon Sweetman, Wellington writer, critic, musician and poet, as he reads some of his own poetry, and yours too if you're feeling game. Chefs Tim and Aaron Banks will lovingly create a four-course dinner with ingredients locally sourced and lovingly produced by small scale sustainable farmers... and perhaps they will read their own poems too. 
If you're feeling poetic bring along your own poem specially crafted around this year's festival theme 'Food is Love'. It can be as long or short as you like, as happy or sad, comical or tragic, Keats or Bukowski. Spot prizes for various categories including 'Most Related to the Theme' and 'Most Obviously Foodie' poems. Includes four courses, and a welcome glass of bubbles on arrival.

description:
Maille Sunday Kai, Escape the winter chill and head along to Cuba St Tavern for some Sunday Kai with Maille Mustard, running every Sunday of August. Each week features a different delectable roast, served with either a Maille Dijon Bloody Mary or warming mulled wine, and finished with a house-made dessert. Sunday has never tasted so good! Bookings available from 1pm.

$50 for 2 courses
$65 for 2 courses inc a Maille Bloody Mary or House made Mulled wine

Menu
Every Maille Sunday Kai event will offer a vegetarian option of eggplant parmigiana with buffalo mozzarella, Maille Dijon mustard, tomato ragù, garlic potato and broccolini.

3 August
Free-range roast porchetta served with garlic potato, creamed spinach, broccolini, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and apple sauce.
Dessert: Sticky toffee pudding with custard.

10 August
Roast duck breast served with duck fat roast potatoes, Chinese broccoli, mushrooms, Yorkshire pudding, and Maille Dijon mustard and onion cream.
Dessert: Dark chocolate torte with orange mascarpone.

17 August
Conscious Valley roast lamb shoulder with garlic roast potatoes, honey-glazed carrots, minted peas, Yorkshire pudding, Maille wholegrain mustard jus and mint sauce.
Dessert: Bread and butter pudding with ginger gelato and crème anglaise.

24 August
Half a roast chicken with duck fat roast potatoes, garlic green beans, cavolo nero, Yorkshire pudding, chicken schmaltz and Maille mustard gravy.
Dessert: Steamed honey pudding with custard and honey gelato.

31 August
First Light roast sirloin served with honey-glazed carrots, duck fat roast potatoes, cabbage and bacon, Yorkshire pudding, horseradish, Maille Dijon mustard and jus.
Dessert: Chocolate fondant with vanilla bean gelato.

Whether you're a food lover or curious about Chinese culture, this event is perfect for you. Don’t miss this tasty experience!

description:
Michelin Star to Martinborough, Join celebrated Chef and Union Square owner Adam Newell for a once-in-a-lifetime culinary experience. Take a journey through four decades of his exceptional career, including his Michelin-starred tenure at the renowned Fulham Road Restaurant in London. This exclusive event will offer an intimate exploration of Chef Newell's evolution as a chef and restaurateur, showcasing iconic dishes from four pivotal periods in his career.

Set in the elegant Napoleon dining room inside the historic Martinborough Hotel, each course represents a defining moment in Chef Newell’s career. Paired with fine wines selected by in-house Sommelier Carl Fraser, this evening is designed to be a feast for both the palate and the mind.

Course 1: 1980s – Claridge’s Hotel, London
A taste of the refined sophistication from one of London’s most prestigious hotels.
Course 2: 1990s – Le Gavroche, London
A nod to the classic French techniques that helped shape Chef Newell's early career.
Course 3: 2000s – Zibibbo, Wellington
A celebration of New Zealand’s finest ingredients and a significant step in his culinary journey.
Course 4: 2010s – Union Square Bistro, Martinborough
Reflecting his achievements at Union Square, the course that represents his current culinary vision.

This evening offers guests a unique chance to experience the evolution of one chef's journey through extraordinary dishes paired with wines that elevate each moment.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Le Petit Chef, InterContinental Wellington proudly presents the first official Le Petit Chef experience in New Zealand - an extraordinary fusion of theatre, storytelling, and fine dining.

Step into the whimsical animated world of Le Petit Chef, the world’s tiniest and most determined chef, as he embarks on a globe-trotting quest to source the finest ingredients. Using groundbreaking 3D projection mapping technology, your table transforms into a magical stage, where continents shift, spices fly, and the art of cooking comes thrillingly to life before your eyes.

As the journey unfolds, a five-course menu is served in perfect harmony with the story. Highlights include Wairarapa crayfish bouillabaisse, corn-fed chicken with Perigord truffle, and a decadent Valrhona chocolate dessert. Choose from the Grand Menu ($180), Classic Menu ($140), Vegetarian Menu ($140), or a dedicated Kids Menu $70). While each menu offers a distinct culinary experience, the stunning visual show remains the same for all guests and is centered around the Grand Menu storyline.

Please note, while primarily designed for individual bookings, some shared seating may apply due to the technical nature of the performance.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Westpac Smarts: Go from asking to automating with AI, Many of us have tried asking questions of AI and seen the potential that this technology brings. But there’s a more important question being asked: Now what?

AI’s potential goes beyond being a Q&A tool. Businesses can use AI to start automating existing processes or remove seemingly endless admin jobs – the question now is how you make it happen.

In this second Westpac Smarts event on AI, John-Daniel Trask – founder of Raygun – will help you take the next step forward and explore how to start accelerating your business with AI automations and agents. This practical session will give you the key insights you need to know for streamlining your business.

Event details:
12:00pm - Networking
12:15pm – Presentation
1:15pm – Wrap-up

Join this session on 30 October for an informative event on AI for you, your business and outstanding results.

Chamber members and Westpac customers: Free entry
Non-members: $5.00 donated to Life Flight Trust through the Westpac Chopper Appeal
label: Business & Networking

description:
Netherfield Ball, Step into the enchanting world of Jane Austen’s Pride and Prejudice at Homewood, where the timeless elegance of a Regency-era ball comes to life. This evening of romance, music, and culinary delight invites you to relive the iconic moments of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr Darcy’s fateful meeting.

Guests will be greeted with crafted cocktails inspired by love potions, showcasing ingredients from some of the finest distilleries in New Zealand and the United Kingdom. As the evening unfolds, indulge in a carefully curated selection of canapés, created with fresh ingredients sourced from Homewood’s own garden, evoking the flavours and charm of the Regency period.

The grand setting of Homewood, the esteemed residence of the British High Commissioner, will transport you to a bygone era. With the glow of garden lighting, live music filling the air, and an atmosphere brimming with romance, you’ll feel as if you’ve stepped into Austen’s world. Dancing will play a central role in the evening, allowing guests to immerse themselves in the grace and grandeur of the Regency social scene.

Whether you’re an Austen devotee, a fan of Bridgerton, or simply drawn to the allure of historical elegance, this event promises to captivate your imagination and senses. Don’t miss this rare opportunity to be part of a night filled with charm, sophistication, and timeless romance.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Next Gen Cook Off, The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Racket Lounge: Session Four, Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Rafa Ferrer Noel's: AFROKAN - Wellington Jazz Festival, Led by New Zealand’s foremost exponents of Cuban music, Afrokan marks the latest project from veteran percussionist Rafa Ferrer Noel.
This premiere performance offers audiences a vibrant and
rhythmically rich exploration of cross-cultural musical dialogue.
A central figure in Wellington’s Cuban and Latin music communities for over two decades, Rafa leads an accomplished octet performing a sophisticated fusion of Afro-Cuban rhythms and contemporary jazz.
The ensemble features Rafa Ferrer Noel, Mikey Trujillo and John Rae (percussion), Jacqui Nyman (bass), Ben Wilcock (piano), André Paris and Ben Hunt (horns).
Doors open 6.30pm
Show starts 7.00pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Nutcracker High Tea, QTea twirls into a sun-drenched daydream with a high tea inspired by The Nutcracker. In partnership with the Royal New Zealand Ballet, we’re serving a festive fairytale where Christmas meets choreography – with a Kiwiana twist.

Perched above the harbour, QTea High Tea reimagines its plated treats into a sugar plum dreamland. Think raspberry-layered delights, golden pistachio choux, smoked salmon cups and piroshki that dance on the palate.

Sip in style and cheers to the season with The Mouse King’s Toast, Prosecco and Guignolet fizzing with festive sparkle. Craving something a little nuttier? Try The Storm Master’s Tipple. For pure summer magic in a glass, reach for the Sugar Plum Fairy Fizz.

description:

Get ready for our Kin Favorite: Beef Mince Pad Kaprao with Fried Egg
!
This is the ultimate Thai street food classic, and here's why you need to pre-order:
Tender, savory beef mince is wok-tossed with a fiery, fragrant blend of fresh chilies, garlic, and aromatic fresh basil. The high heat of the wok creates a spicy-sweet, intensely savory glaze that is totally addictive.
Served hot over jasmine rice and crowned with a crispy-edged, runny-yolked fried egg. Break that yolk and mix it all together for a bite of pure happiness!
PLUS! Our signature Chicken or Tofu Satay is still on the menu for the perfect side.

Lunch: Friday, October 10th
Order Cut-Off: Monday, October 6th, 9 PM
Pre-order now to secure your Thai feast!
#ThaiFood #BeefLover #thaicomfortfood #supportlocal #toobusytocook #busyparents #wellingtonfood #thaifoodwellington #kineatwellington

description:
Park Road Pop-Up Eats, Park Road Pop-Up Eats
🍴🎉 Park Road Pop-Up Eats Are Back! 🎉🍴

We’re excited to announce that Park Road Pop Up Eats are returning to the Miramar Peninsula this September!

🗓️ Date: Wednesday, 1st October 2025
🕚 Time: 11am – 3pm

description:
Next Gen Cook Off, The Next Gen Cook Off returns for its fifth year, and things are heating up at Everybody Eats.
Every Monday in August, four of Wellington’s freshest young chefs will go head-to-head in a high-energy kitchen takeover, serving up epic three-course dinners using rescued food.

Each chef will be given the same protein, generously provided by Meat Direct, but everything else is a surprise—ingredients are revealed that morning, based on what’s come in. Menus are created on the spot, and dishes are served to a buzzing, hungry crowd. It’s fast-paced, creative chaos with serious culinary skills on display. Guests get a front-row seat to the action, while supporting a truly game-changing enterprise.

4 August — Jessie Gibberd, Loretta
Originally from rural Waikato, Jessie Gibberd made the move to Wellington to study, but it was the buzz of hospitality that captured her heart. Swapping textbooks for tongs, she left her degree behind to dive headfirst into the kitchen. Now a chef de partie at Loretta, Jessie brings a grounded, fresh perspective to one of the city’s most beloved eateries.

11 August — Felipe Molina, El Matador
Hailing from Chile, Felipe Molina is a professional chef with over 15 years of experience in kitchens around the world. Having worked in several countries and world-class restaurants, Felipe brings a global sensibility to his craft. With a passion for seafood, meats, and bold, expressive flavours, his cooking is shaped by travel and tradition, blending international influence with creativity on every plate.

18 August — Zane Gupwell, Graze
Zane Gupwell began his hospitality journey at just 15, washing dishes at a local café in Mount Eden. From there, he headed to Queenstown, learning from a wide range of chefs and kitchen styles before challenging himself with a move to Wellington. Since then, he’s worked at some of the city’s top restaurants and now brings his thoughtful, evolving style to Graze Wine Bar.

25 August — Lulu Temmuyin, Mr Go’s
Lulu Temmuyin is a chef who loves pushing boundaries, even when they’re unexpected. Lactose intolerant but obsessed with cheese, and not a fan of lamb but winner of a lamb cooking competition, Lulu is all about surprises. At Mr Go’s, she brings bold, sustainable flavour to the forefront, blending personality with punch in every dish.

Everybody Eats runs on a pay-what-you-can model, transforming food waste into gourmet meals and bringing the community together over good kai. The Next Gen Cook Off celebrates and champions this mission, proving that rescued food can be next-level delicious.

The Next Gen Cook Off is proudly supported by The Gas Hub.

description:
Richter City Rebels - Sounds Of The Street, Rammed with their signature explosive beats and good-feel vibe, the Rebels are coming to Jazz Fest 2025!

The Richter City Rebels have a sound that blends RnB, soul, hip-hop, jazz and funk with the heart and soul of New Orleans brass band music. Trumpets, trombones, saxes, sousaphone, and percussion bring the ultimate Mardi Gras party to any venue or festival. Incorporating stylish original melodies and shouts, funked-up pop tunes and bouncing hip-hop, the Rebels’ sound embodies the musical melting pot of Louisiana.

Energy, entertainment, and musicianship of the highest quality: the Richter City Rebels guarantee a rousing New Orleans experience.

“The music swaggers, it's big and it's bold. It's like a hug from grandpa”

The Rebels are brilliant, they fill the room every time. Wild, wild party music, New Orleans second-line is alive and well in Wellington!”

https://www.richtercityrebels.com/

Presales $20, $25 on the door

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
Saturday 'BAKES' By Onslow College, Each Saturday, we offer a variety of sourdough products next to Onslow College. We always have doughnuts, but on Saturdays we offer bread, savoury baked items (this Saturday, we have brioche), and mini-celebratory sourdough doughnuts.
All products can be pre-ordered and picked up on Saturday morning through our website.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
EFTPOS is always available.
Our boxed mini-celebratory doughnuts, 70% of the original size, are available for a sale price of $25 for a box of all six flavours.
Our regular doughnuts cost $6 each or $22 for a box of 4 doughnuts.
We also offer catering at Family Kitchen with Mark, so if you have a function or need for in-house dining, check out all our packages on our website. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase all week. Contact Mark on 021 0223 0824 for next-day pickup.
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
All our doughnuts contain a lively sourdough & biga starter, for a fuller flavour profile and a springy texture.
Have you tried our sourdough doughnuts yet?
Our doughnuts can be pre-ordered and picked up on the day to avoid disappointment (should we run out).
We launch a new flavour every two weeks and have created over 180 combinations since selling three years ago.
Support has been phenomenal, and we thank everyone so very much indeed for the weekly sales.
If you are not following us on our social media channels, please consider doing so, as it helps the company grow and increases the exposure of our products. Thank you.

description:
Sconnoisseur, Get ready to master the art of making Wellington's iconic cheese scones at Pravda Café. Widely regarded as the home of the city's best cheese scones, Pravda's creations are so beloved, they often sell out before you can blink. Now, you can learn the secrets behind their mouthwatering scones firsthand.

In this hands-on workshop, you’ll be guided through mixing and preparing your own batch of Pravda’s famous cheese scones. Once your dough is ready, you'll hand them off to be baked to crispy flaky perfection. While they cook, relax with a cup of tea or coffee, and once your scones are ready, you’ll enjoy the fruits of your labour fresh from the oven.

The best part? You’ll get to take home the coveted recipe, allowing you to recreate these legendary scones in your own kitchen whenever you want. This is a perfect opportunity to learn a piece of Wellington’s culinary history and enjoy a deliciously rewarding experience.
label: Food & Drink

Pre order Thai foods, NEXT WEEK'S THAI COMFORT SPECIAL IS HERE!

Get ready for our Kin Favorite: Beef Mince Pad Kaprao with Fried Egg
!
This is the ultimate Thai street food classic, and here's why you need to pre-order:
Tender, savory beef mince is wok-tossed with a fiery, fragrant blend of fresh chilies, garlic, and aromatic fresh basil. The high heat of the wok creates a spicy-sweet, intensely savory glaze that is totally addictive.
Served hot over jasmine rice and crowned with a crispy-edged, runny-yolked fried egg. Break that yolk and mix it all together for a bite of pure happiness!
PLUS! Our signature Chicken or Tofu Satay is still on the menu for the perfect side.
Delivery Dates:
Dinner: Wednesday, October 8th
Lunch: Friday, October 10th
Order Cut-Off: Monday, October 6th, 9 PM
Pre-order now to secure your Thai feast!
#ThaiFood #BeefLover #thaicomfortfood #supportlocal #toobusytocook #busyparents #wellingtonfood #thaifoodwellington #kineatwellington

description:
Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh., Mystery Feast on Mischief Night! Halloween dinner with Chef Max Gordy 🎃 Supporting Kaibosh.
🎃 Step inside, if you dare... on the eve of Halloween. It's a Mischief Night!
👻A chilling murder mystery unfolds over a hauntingly good three-course Halloween dinner by Chef Max Gordy!

On 30 October, gather your cleverest friends and find your darkest ghoulish attire 🧛‍♀️ Who will crack the case first: the Detectives or the Villains? 🕵️‍♂️
Expect twists, laughter, and a touch of fright 💀 with spot prizes through the night — plus a reward for the best-dressed.

👩‍🍳 Award-winning chef Max Gordy ( @grazewinebar ) will conjure up a frightfully delicious Halloween-themed feast.
🥂 Your ticket includes one complimentary alcoholic beverage (with more available to purchase on the night).
🙌 Every ticket sold helps Kaibosh ensure that no good food is left to die.

TICKET TYPES
Bring a team of six to solve the mystery and devour a fiendishly good feast for $666.
Have a frightening four-some? Book a table for $444.
Spooky single seats available for $111... we will seat you at a mystery table...

VENUE
60 Dixon Street is up a flight of steep steps – with only one way in.

What is Mischief Night?
In parts of Pennsylvania and New Jersey in the eastern USA, 30 October is called “Mischief Night.” The tradition refers to the eve of Halloween in which children and teenagers celebrate the holiday one night early with pranks, tricks and more. While in New England, some call it Cabbage Night...
Join us to experience Chef Max Gordy's culinary take on Mischief Night in Pōneke!

#Halloween #HalloweenNZ #MischiefNight #MaxGordy #EveybodyEats #CharityDinner #FundraisingDinner #WellingtonDining #Pōneke #WellingtonNZ
label: Food & Drink

description:
Wet-plate Photography Tintype Introduction Workshop, *Note, completion needs to be at 1pm
Create a wet-plate photograph with Brian and Jane from Brass and Glass Photographic Alchemy. You will see the magic of silver and light combining to create an authentic, 19th century tintype.

Beginning with a short presentation into the process, you will then have the opportunity to hand-craft your own portrait tintype to take home with you. With care, your priceless heirloom photograph will last for decades without fading or changing colour.

This almost-lost-art produces a one-of-a-kind image, using authentic materials and a bellows camera. Be prepared to experience the need to sit still for up to several seconds, it's not as easy as you may think!

Bookings essential, with a maximum of 5 people for this workshop.

Private, one day workshops in Carterton are available on request.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Sip the Sky: Paint, Sip and Stargaze, Paint:
Begin the evening with a night sky-inspired painting session at Ventana Art Space - 7 Kitchener Street. Whether you're a seasoned artist or picking up a brush for the first time, this relaxed, hands-on experience invites you to create under the spell of twilight tones and celestial charm.

Sip:
Then head next door for a guided wine tasting from the passionate team at The Good Way (located beside the Martinborough Brewery on Ohio Street), showcasing a selection of their elegant, small-batch wines. Find your favourite and grab a bottle to take home—perfect for gifting or continuing the magic later.

Taste:
Indulge your senses with a chocolate tasting hosted by Elly from be happy chocolate. Sample her handcrafted, ethically made bars and select your favourite block to take home. Please advise any dietary requirements when booking. Warm your hands around a velvety be happy hot chocolate and...

Stargaze:
Head outside for a gentle stroll to Considine Park with Charlotte from Wairarapa Dark Sky. Walk in the Dark while sipping hot chocolate. A chance to understand the benefits of the dark sky and finish with some star gazing.

Timing is flexible to allow for moving between locations, if you'd like to order food from The Social Kitchen food truck at the Brewery, etc. The latest finish time would be 8.45pm.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Snacks Amore: Rainbow night - WOAP snack based speed bonding, IRL! Zero dating apps required, We warmly invite you to ditch the dating apps for one delicious night of snack-based bonding. Speed friending is heartedly encouraged along side the serious speed daters so there is no need to miss out on the fun!
Amuse Snack Bar is the new Euro-inspired aperitivo haven on Willis Street. We are making our WOAP debut and singling out the foodie LGBTQIA+ singles and mingles. WE pride ourselves on providing the warmest of hospitality at Amuse Snack bar.
Our gorgeous hosts will provide musical entertainment and a match of perfect Italian wines and aperitivo bevvies. Your heart and bellies will be equally full tonight!
You'll enjoy mini speed dates with our crowd of foodies! Plus 6 courses of Italian-inspired snacklets – cacio e pepe, agrodolce, parmigiana, porchetta, and cantucci, all served in perfect bite-sized form.
A glass of Lambrusco kicks off the evening, with a cheeky mini tiramisu maritozzo to take home and curl up with on the couch.
Our event kicks off at 6.30pm with a drink and a mingle before we split into two areas of the restaurant for the serious dating
• upstairs - she for her

description:
WAITLIST ONLY - Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Photo courtesy of The Pines.
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Body Ocean, Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sourdough Doughnuts & HOT FOOD at The Animal Medical Centre, Each Wednesday afternoon, Family Kitchen with Mark and The Animal Medical Centre team up to offer you sourdough doughnuts & hot, delicious, affordable meals.
From 2:30pm, at 114 Middleton Road, we'll have sourdough doughnuts in six flavours, mini-celebratory doughnuts, plus a hot dish.
This week's hot dish is fritto misto (breaded mixed fish and vegetables) with Italian roasted potatoes and Caesar salad.
Our sourdough doughnuts are priced at $22 for a box of 4 or $6 each. We also offer mini-celebratory doughnuts, a box of all six flavours for $25. The main hot dish is priced at a very reasonable $18 per portion.
EFTPOS is available.
If you want to pre-order, go to our website https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/weekly-menu/
We really appreciate The Animal Medical Centre allowing us to sell outside their new business.
Should you require an excellent veterinary service, contact the team at NEW Animal Medical Centre
https://www.animalmedicalcentre.co.nz/
Family Kitchen with Mark also offers catering. You can visit our website to see our packages if you have a function or require in-house dining. Our doughnuts are also available for purchase Monday to Saturday. Could you contact us to organise?
https://familykitchenwithmark.co.nz/grazing-tables-theme.../
My website has a list of flavours and ingredients for each doughnut. Search weekly menus.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Paritua, The Botanist & Sea Shepherd!, We've teamed up with Paritua Vineyard and Sea Shepherd NZ to bring you a fantastic evening of dining and drinking excellent wine! We'll be serving a four course plant based dinner, matched with Paritua wines, in support of Sea Shepherd New Zealand.
⁠
Each dish draws its inspiration from the sea with a kiwi twist, designed by our head chef Stephanie Hinton. Stephanie has recently moved back to New Zealand after 16 years cheffing in London, and running acclaimed vegan businesses there. Each course is paired with organic and vegan wines presented by Ollie Kettle and Josh Pointon of Paritua Wines. Proceeds from tickets sold will be donated directly to Sea Shepherd to help protect our oceans.
Numbers are limited, so gather your friends and book early for an unforgettable night of food, wine and ocean conservation.
label: Food & Drink

description:
It's in the Ballot - CDC – Carterton District Mayoral Debate -In-studio, Contestants of 'It's in the Bag' become political candidates in 'It's in the Ballot' Meet the Candidates.
Candidates choose a numbered box which has a question that has been submitted online by voters before the show.
It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025
label: Government & Politics

description:
The Love Ferry, Interislander is docking onshore to bring burger lovers something truly special — The Love Ferry a spicy beef and pork patty with melted Kāpiti brie, caramelised onions, roasted red peppers, rocket, truffle aioli, crispy Harringtons bacon and pickled jalapeños in a Poneke Bakery red brioche bun, with smoked paprika and sea salt sprinkled fries.
This gourmet tribute to the love of food is served straight from the iconic Interislander ship box. Back by popular demand, the Interislander pop-up burger truck is making waves once again, offering a taste of the Interislander experience without even setting sail.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Enchanted Ale Quarter, Enter the magical realm of The Enchanted Ale Quarter, a fairytale-inspired pop-up tavern where whimsy, wonder and craft beer collide.

Step into a storybook setting, with twinkling lights, woodland decor, and forest-fantasy touches around every corner. Feast on gnome and fairy-themed comfort food like the solstice salad, loaded forest fries, sirens & ships fish & chips, and a decadent dark forest brownie, all paired with enchanted brews and mythical tipples.

Cosy, curious, and otherworldly, The Enchanted Ale Quarter brings a little magic to Wellington’s winter nights. Dust off your wings and join us for a pint, some sustenance or a potion, no quest required.
label: Food & Drink

description:
The Casual Dram: 19, It’s time for another Casual Dram, and this time we’ll be taking a look at distillation rates - with double, partial-triple and triple distilled whiskies all making an appearance.
If you’ve ever looked at the flow chart for partial triple distillation, you’ll know that this sort of thing can be pretty complex!
But fear not, I promise we won’t be getting too scientific - and we’ll taste an interesting mix of official and independently bottled crackers, across a multitude of ages from some all-time fave distilleries; Mortlach, Benrinnes, Bunnahabhain and Amrut.
Here’s the lineup…
Bunnahabhain 12 years old 2023 Cask Strength Edition 60.1% (Sherry casks) WB 87.27
Mortlach 'Signatory Symington's Choice' 2007 / 17 years old #205 56.6% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Butt Finish) WB 88.23
Benrinnes Adelphi 13 years old 55.5% (1st Fill Oloroso Sherry Hogshead) WB 88.19
Amrut Triparva Triple Distilled 50% (casks as yet unknown) WB 87.19
Mystery whisky WB 88.11
I hope you can join me for another tilt at five tip top drams!
label: Food & Drink

description:
Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ, Tītahi Bay Spring Community BBQ
It's (nearly) summer so it's time for a BBQ! Come and join us at 43 Kapiti Crescent (St Matthew's Hall) for a BBQ on the lawn. If it's bad weather, we will move into the hall.

All welcome! Dinner will be served from 5pm; we will make dinner, so just bring yourselves!



FAQ

Who is this for? Can I come along?

Yes absolutely, please come, we would love to have you. This dinner is for all the people who live in the beautiful community of Tītahi Bay!

What if I can't make it until a bit later?

That's all good, we will be serving a rolling dinner from 5 to 6.30pm so come whenever suits you. If you can only come a little later than 6.30pm, we will likely have more than enough so come anyway!

Can I bring my kids along?

Yes! In fact, please bring your kids along. We will have some games in the room and some options for crafts on the tables along with the food.

Do I need to bring anything?

Nope! Just yourselves, all are welcome just as you are.

But I really want to bring something to contribute?

If you would like to bring a salad to contribute to the BBQ, feel free to email us at and we can chat! We really just don't want this to be a barrier to anyone coming along.

Can I help?

Yes absolutely, this is a community event so help is always appreciated. It is also a great time to meet some other people. We will have some tasks for set up and also some for packing down and cleaning up. If you are interested in helping, flick us an email at

Will my dietaries be met?

We will make sure there will be options for these dietaries: vegan, gluten free, dairy free, and nut free.

If you have a dietary that isn't on there, feel free to check and flick us an email.

Can I bring my friend(s) along?

Yes, please bring your friends along, especially if they live in Tītahi Bay!

Who is this hosted by?

This idea is hosted by us, the crew who run Tītahi Bay Anglicans, but it is run with the help of our friends around Tītahi Bay. The hope is that this can become a recurring community event where others can join in on hosting this.

This is at a church, will I be preached to?

No, we promise that this isn't a Tupperware party bait and switch. While we definitely are a church, this event is for the Tītahi Bay community as a whole to be able to come eat together and connect.
label: Food & Drink

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE LONG WALK (NZ Premiere - Wellington), How far could you go? Be the first in New Zealand see the stunning new dystopian thriller/horror THE LONG WALK – from the mind of Stephen King.
“A group of teenage boys compete in an annual contest known as The Long Walk, and keep walking faster than three miles per hour — or risk being shot.”
Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand
Directed by Francis Lawrence, THE LONG WALK stars Cooper Hoffman (‘Licorice Pizza’, ’Saturday Night’), David Johnson (‘Alien: Romulus’), Garrett Wareing (‘Dead Sea’), Judy Greer (‘Halloween’), and Mark Hamill (‘Star Wars’).
Huge thanks to the team at StudioCanal NZ for this exclusive.
label: Film & Media

description:
King Missile (Dog Fly Religion): John S Hall & Dogbowl (Wellington), Powertool Records Presents ....
King Missile / Dog Fly Religion
John S. Hall and Dogbowl
John S. Hall and Dogbowl are the co-founders of King Missile (Dog Fly Religion) the original incarnation of a group that, in various forms, was a college radio staple in the late 80’s and early 90’s.
In its various forms, King Missile released a string of songs that were resoundingly embraced by American college radio, including “Take Stuff From Work,” “Wuss,” “Sensitive Artist,” “Jesus Was Way Cool,” “Cheesecake Truck,” “Martin Scorsese,” and the hugely popular “Detachable Penis.”
John S. Hall and Dogbowl perform together, and also have separate acts that can be added to the bill: John as a poet/spoken word artist and Dogbowl and a singer/songwriter, whose many albums were released on Shimmy Disc and other labels.

description:
Āhuru Kai Kōhua Poaka: Burger Wellington, The boil-up is a dish of love, traditionally made in big pots for whānau and friends. It brings people together. Te Papa wanted to capture the essence of this traditional Māori kai and give it a gourmet twist.

Traditional boil-up pork roulade, with Pagro lettuce and tomato, puha mousseline, and horopito aioli in a toasted Brezelmania watercress milk bun, with hand-cut kūmara fries, mānuka honey aioli, a shot of bone broth, and a heart-shaped raspberry framboise dessert.

Join us at the Te Papa Cafe on Level 1, walk-ins welcome. Reserve your spot by booking now.

Please note we aren’t able to accommodate dietary requirements.
