description:
LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!, LIFE DRAWING MEETS YOGA!
Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

The Life Drawing session is based on the teaching methods of Cecil Collins, a British artist whose non-academic approach to drawing challenges you to leave your inhibitions at the door and work freely from your creative centre...much like yoga!

“But I can’t draw!,” you say. Then even better! This approach is perfect for the artist and non-artist alike as it asks you to drop your expectations of what art should look like, inviting you to express the pose from within…just like we do in yoga.

Drinks & nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla from South Coast Studio in Island Bay, who studied Cecil’s methods in London and is an artist, art teacher and AWHI-trained yoga teacher. Co-facilitated by AWHI's Lachlan Broughton.

Investment: $75 (includes yoga class, mat & props, art materials, art lesson, herbal tea throughout and drinks & nibbles at the end!)

We've done this workshop before so can confidently say it's a REALLY FUN TIME! Definitely don't miss out!

Mhaw All You Can Handle Flash Event, Taking care of your mental health and expressing yourself through art and body modification often go hand in hand, so this year we are fundraising all Mental Health Awareness Week to help bring awareness to something that affects so many people in Aotearoa.

Sunday 12th - ‘All you can handle’ lucky dip flash day.

How much can you take in one 3 hour sitting?
No breaks, no stopping, no moving. A race against the clock to get as much done as possible.

Bookings essential & full payment on booking.
Bookings must be made before October 10th
All proceeds go to MHAW

Email info@thegallerytattooart for more details and to book a spot

If you want to help us support this very worthy cause but you can’t make it to the studio between October 6th and 12th, you can make a donation directly to our MHAW fundraising page through a QR code that will be available on our instagram and facebook pages from Monday October 6th. The fundraising page will be up all week.
There will also be a donation box in the studio if you want to come in and say hi.

description:
You Should Be Dancing, You Should Be Dancing is back!

A disco dancing celebration. A boogie wonderland featuring classic tunes groovy enough to make even a statue move. A club night of super danceable disco hits!

If you love disco, or just want to shake your thing and have a great time, this night is for you.

All kinds of nice people are welcome. Dress up or down. Good times will be had on the grooviest dance floor with the most glamorous tunes and the greatest vibe. What have you got to lose?!

If you’re into...Earth, Wind & Fire, The Bee Gees, ABBA, Diana Ross, Cher, Boney M, Donna Summer, Kool and the Gang, Chic, Gloria Gaynor, KC & The Sunshine Band, The Trammps, Sylvester, Sister Sledge, The Nolans, The Jackson 5, Shalamar, Womack & Womack, Ottawan, The Village People, Chaka Khan, Evelyn Champagne King, Patrice Rushen, Silver Convention, Divine, Pointer Sisters, Bohannon, Patrick Cowley, Patrick Hernandez, Eruption, Rose Royce, Giorgio Moroder, Evelyn Thomas, Gwen Guthrie, Anita Ward, The Weather Girls, The Whispers, The O’ Jays, The Brothers Johnson, Candi Staton, Amanda Lear, and more more more...you will love this night.

You Should Be Dancing has a love of disco and dancing. We take great pleasure in getting together with friends, playing the best tunes, forgetting about work for a while and grooving the night away. We love to party and we pull out all the stops to keep the dance floor moving to the music. These events are always outrageous fun, so why not come down and get into it.

10/10/2025 - Christchurch - Loons

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents ROCHELLE (2024) + BELLBIRD (2019), Welcome to the Wairarapa Cinematheque
Film lovers in the Wairarapa have a new home for cinema. The Wairarapa Cinematheque launches in 2025 with a curated programme of classics, contemporary gems, and cult favourites — films you rarely get to see on the big screen.
Rochelle (2024) & Bellbird (2019) – Double Feature | Wairarapa Cinematheque
✨ Two powerful New Zealand films, one unforgettable evening on the big screen.
🎥 Rochelle (2024)
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.
🎥 Bellbird (2019)
Set in the heart of rural New Zealand, Bellbird is a tender, funny, and deeply human story of a father and son finding their way after loss. Warm, beautifully observed, and filled with aroha, it’s a heartfelt portrait of resilience, family, and community.
📅 Date & Time: Sunday 26 October, 7:30pm
📍 Location: Regent 3 Cinemas, Masterton
Tickets:
If you purchased a Three Movie Membership on Opening Night, you’re covered — just show your card at the door.
Single tickets are $15 each, available via Humanitix or at the door.
Join us for an unforgettable evening of extraordinary local storytelling, celebrating the richness of Aotearoa cinema on the big screen.

description:
Posture Perfection Is Possible, Are you a computer slouch, feeling stiff and tense at work? Do you find it difficult to maintain a good posture? Does your posture cause back, neck or shoulder tension? Would you like to enjoy more freedom in everyday activities?

Under the guidance of an experienced teacher, we'll explore movement in ways that help you reduce tense unhelpful habits. Movement lessons are done on the floor or sitting on a chair and are based on the pioneering work of Israeli physicist and engineer Dr. Moshe Feldenkrais. This workshop is suitable for all ages (over 16) and fitness levels.

Outcomes
By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Identify and reduce muscle tension
- Move with more lightness and freedom
- Improve your posture
- Describe some basic anatomy
- Have tools to use at home and at work

Bring two blankets (or a mat and a blanket) and wear loose, warm and comfortable clothing. Tea and coffee provided but bring your lunch.

Please note that instructions are given verbally rather than by demonstration, so good hearing and understanding of English is required.

1 Day
Presented by Sue Field.

description:
Parent Support Group – Miramar, Parent Support Group – Miramar
care for a disabled child, a neurodivergent child, or a child with health impairments.

Parent to Parent hosts monthly Parent Support Groups in Miramar to support carers and parents just like you. These groups are a safe space for family and whānau to share their experiences, their challenges, their triumphs, and to learn from each other in an open and 100% judgement-free environment. No topic is too ‘weird’, no question too ‘out there’. We get it, and we are here to help.

So if you’d like to share a struggle, celebrate a success, raise a concern, or simply have a cuppa and chat with other parents and carers in your area, you are always welcome at our Parent Support Group. Children are welcome too! Drop in for as long or as short a time as you want. And did we mention there’s free coffee??

No need to RSVP, feel free to just show up on the day!

Or contact Meredith Dyer for more info:
| 027 808 3947

description:
Real Talk Kāpiti, Real Talk Kāpiti
We are excited to announce that we are bringing Real Talk to Kāpiti. We can’t wait to share space with you all!
🔥Saturday 29th November
🔥11am to 3pm (doors open at 10.30am)
🔥Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, 34a Raumati Road,
Kapiti College, Paraparaumu

This is a FREE event for Rangatahi (14-25years) and also FREE for Rangatahi Service Providers, Kaiako, anyone that works with our rangatahi, Tāngata whaikaha and whaiora.
Click here to register for your tickets:
https://www.eventfinda.co.nz/2025/real-talk-kapiti/paraparaumu

Real Talk Kōrero

We take our audience on a journey, a journey of laughter, a journey of tears, and a journey with absolute passion and purpose.
We create a safe space to speak about what we have experienced in our lives, and that we don’t have to be whakamā, we don’t have to live in silence, we don’t have to hide our secrets anymore.
Because when we speak – we heal, when we speak we free ourselves, and when we speak – we provide inspiration and hope for others.

We provide the following at each event:

❤️Inspiring kaikōrero
❤️Free kai and refreshments
❤️Opportunity to win some incredible prizes on the day
❤️FREE Real Talk pukapuka for every rangatahi in the audience

The subjects covered in our kōrero start with but are not limited to the subjects listed below:

⚫️Suicide and triggers and coping mechanisms
⚫️Mental Health awareness
⚫️Sexual, physical abuse and domestic violence
⚫️Being raised in gang affiliated environments
⚫️Drug and alcohol addiction
⚫️Teen pregnancy & pregnancy loss
⚫️Death & grief
⚫️Takatāpui & tangata whaikaha
⚫️Discrimination – racial, gender, sexual orientation
⚫️Relationship breakdowns
⚫️Career & business aspirations
⚫️Standing strong in who you are

We have a great line up of powerhouse, inspirational kaikōrero/speakers on the day:
🔥Pairama Wright – TikTok sensation
🔥Pania Te Paiho – Wāhine Toa Hunting & Hākuturi
🔥Peleti Oli – Youth Advocate
🔥Elise Niu
🔥Rutu King-Stubbs – Hope Is My Homeboy
🔥Sophie Taylor-Edwards - Kaiwaiata
🔥Kiino Krystal - MC
🔥Hosted by – Tania Carr

description:
Jonathan Kay - Massey University Lecturer/Master of Fine Arts Coordinator, Jonathan Kay is a photographic artist, researcher, and lecturer based at Massey University in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington. His work explores the intersection of art and science, using photography to reveal the unseen and challenge conventional notions of landscape. Over the past seven years, his research has focused on developing a site-specific and responsive approach to photographic interventions within the landscape.
Drawing inspiration from scientific 'fieldwork,' Kay’s practice involves close observation and data collection, using these methods to uncover new insights into specific environments. However, his approach extends beyond the typical scientific framework by leveraging the unique possibilities of the photographic medium. This process enables him to move beyond the traditional, idealized representation of landscapes, offering deeper, more complex interpretations.
September 25, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you’re curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you’re welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It’s a great way to meet the community and see what we’re all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/

description:
Men’s Circle: Real Conversations, Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a world where men are often expected to have everything figured out, this gathering offers a space to be genuine, not perfect.

About this Event

Men’s Circle: Real Conversations
In a society where men are expected to always have it together, this space is for being honest, not perfect.
This is a free offering but there’s the option to stay for an amazing plant-based dinner ($15). There’s no pressure to join, but sitting down to eat together is a simple, powerful way to deepen the sense of connection. Andre & Sri Jiva aren’t running this circle for profit and they are genuinely invested in creating real, meaningful spaces for men to connect.
The Men’s Circle is a gathering where men are able to connect in a safe, supportive space to share experiences, express emotions, and foster personal growth. Free from societal expectations of stoicism or self-sufficiency. Through open sharing and mutual support, participants are empowered to build resilience, self-reflection, and a stronger sense of identity and purpose.
Structure of the Circle
Gathering in a Circle: Participants sit in a circle to symbolize equality and unity.A short meditation or moment of silence may be included to help everyone arrive and connect.
Talking Object: A sharing stick or object is placed in the center. Only the personholding the object may speak, ensuring uninterrupted sharing.
Open Sharing: Anyone may choose to share while holding the object. Sharing is op-tional, and passing is always respected.
Active Listening: While one person shares, others listen attentively without speaking,interrupting, or offering advice. The focus is on witnessing and being present.
No Judgments or Advice: Participants refrain from judging or offering unsolicitedadvice, creating a safe space for authentic expression.
Closing: The circle may conclude with a group reflection, a moment of gratitude, or a simple acknowledgment of the shared experience.
Circle Agreements
Supportive Environment: We are here to uplift and support one another, fosteringtrust and brotherhood.
Focus on the Present: Share whats alive for you now, focusing on your emotions and experiences to deepen emotional awareness.
Use "I" Statements: Speak from your personal perspective using "I" statements topromote authenticity and responsibility. Avoid generalizations like "we" or "us."
No Judgment or fixing: Refrain from judging others sharing or offering unsolicitedadvice, ensuring a safe and non-critical space.
Confidentiality: What is shared in the circle stays in the circle. You may discuss your own experience outside the group, but keep others details private.




Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!

What’s on the menu?
Creamy Farfalle Pasta with Plant-Based Bacon
Toasted Bruschetta with “Cheese”, Tomato and Parsley
Fresh Salad with Balsamic Vinegar
Berry Vanilla Muffins with Whipped Cream




Meet Your Hosts: Andre and Sri Jiva
Andre has been immersed in men’s work since the age of 13, when he first experienced a rite of passage in Golden Bay. That formative experience sparked a lifelong connection to circle work, which he later deepened by returning as a mentor. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and pranayama (breathwork) facilitator, Andre also brings his passion for ecstatic dance, philosophy, and authentic connection into his offerings. He is deeply inspired by the question of what it means to be human—how we can more fully experience our aliveness, our depth, and reconnecting with the beauty of life together.
Since childhood, Sri Jiva has been fascinated by meaning, purpose, and authentic life fulfilment. This, among other things, led him to join a monastery at the age of 19. After years of monastic training, he chose to marry and pursue a career. He felt called to use his monastic experience to help others understand themselves, and to find wisdom, meaning, and purpose in their own lives. Inspired by this calling, he went to university to study counselling. Now, Sri Jiva and his wife live near Wellington, where he works with a small team of counsellors, supporting clients individually and in groups.




Agenda


🕑: 05:30 PM - 05:45 PM
Arrive to Bhakti Lounge

🕑: 05:45 PM - 07:15 PM
Men's Circle: Honest Conversations & Connection
Host: Andre

🕑: 07:15 PM - 08:15 PM
Plant-based dinner and dessert!

we are here for you, for ourselves and for it all. Come all Jah one - individual in our togetherness, together in our uniqueness. Our personal messages and mauri and our collective vibrations and spontaneous moments of authentic expression. From vulnerability to mana, from stillness to ecstasy, the troughs and the crests, the eggs and the fluids. the dub and the deep, the groove pocket and the light tasty treats. well prepped to be enjoyed by all but also unprepped to be raw and pure. digested in reciprocity, fed by those sentients present souls, a gift. Its a Sunday funday, a gathering to reset the weekly cycle, go for a run, a swim, a sleep, take a breathe and connect with te taiao - do some mahi, something good.... for you or someone else and then you have the option of enriching this collective experience by gracing us with your essence, as we sink into the hum of the universe together within the stories of MOON 1. every day is but a little life. See you there, here and now. Hanno, Simon and Nikau x

Come and join Bryony from Heartsong Healing for a powerful Vision Board and Voice Empowerment workshop as we move through the energy of the Celtic festival of Beltane!

This is a Women's Retreat.

This workshop includes powerfully transformative Voice and Energy practices which support manifestation of your dreams and visions.

New dreams, new possibilities and celebrations, all seen within the light and power of this late Spring full moon. Invoke the Source of healing, growth and positive change and new beginnings.

#vsionboard #creativity #healing #specialtimes #transformation

JOIN US FOR A DAY OF DEEP CREATIVE DIVING INTO OUR VISIONS - with specially chosen and composed healing songs, chants, conscious sound practices.

These are enjoyed alongside intuitive drawing, collage and fully guided vision board creation. All of this will be held within a sacred space of Spiritual connection, ritual and energy work.

We will make this sacred space in our lives to explore, clarify and strengthen our visions for our lives, for our selves, for our fullest and highest embodiment on this beautiful and precious Earth.

Sunday 9th November 2025 10am-4.30pm

This special day retreat will draw on the strong astrological energies available at this time, connect with our Spirit teams and Angelic forces and channel in the creative and opening force of Blessing, Balance and Alignment.

Through valuing what we are harvesting in our lives we make space for the next step, the new direction, the new possibility.

Supported by meditation and a guided practice we will each create a new image or personal vision board to focus us and assist us in drawing new energies into our lives as we move further into the new year. description:
Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah, Rain & the Urban Bohemians @ Firebird w/Mercy Lie, Araiyah
Join us for a magical evening of music at Firebird Café, Levin.

Three amazing Wellington acts are coming through to present their beautiful sounds and share their heart and soul with you. We warmly invite you to join us and become a part of this collaboration of creativity and connection; spanning triumph and heartbreak, and everything in between, celebrating all it means to be human.

Our wonderful hosts at Firebird Café will be serving their delicious food and creating a warm and inviting atmosphere.

Tickets are $15 online or $20 on the door.

Mercy Lie:

Driving all night under the stars, along the highways of human experience, the original songs of Mercy Lie will haunt, surprise, remind and affirm.

Mercy Lie is the musical guise of Laura Chester-Murphy. An instinctive sound maker from an early age, Laura just wants to keep the music rolling. There’s a lot of sound from that little acoustic guitar and a voice to match. In the songs, you will find fierce independence, crushing vulnerability and a reflective wit that speaks to a life of figuring stuff out along the way.

With influences ranging across and not limited to folk, funk, country, goth, indie and 90’s rave, Laura puts the focus on crafting percussive earworms that won’t leave your head easily. The music of Mercy Lie is a unique soundscape, sculpted with ambience and depth, the silence unforgettably painted by explorations into the motivations of both the self and fellow travellers.

Mercy Lie is about connecting over the foibles of polite society and the ways we are wired to weave around each other.

Hometowns, journeys, mysteries, ghosts, growing up, messing up, speaking out, moving on. If you like getting nostalgic over something and nothing all at once, buckle up.

“Mercy Lie’s novel approach to the guitar and talent for songwriting make for the perfect storm.”
“I did not expect that voice to come from that mouth.”
“An acoustic delight!”

Araiyah & Izzy:

Born in the coastal town of Patea and raised in the vibrant community of Gisborne, Araiyah’s musical journey is as rich and diverse as her heritage. Now based in Wellington, she is not just a musician but a devoted mother of four tamariki and a proud grandmother to one mokopuna. For the past decade, Araiyah has poured her heart into writing, recording, and performing her original compositions, each note resonating with the depth of her experiences.

Araiyah’s music is a poignant reflection of her life’s journey, weaving together themes of love, loss, and resilience. Her deeply moving compositions are rooted in the lessons learned through relationships and the pain that often accompanies them. Through her art, she shares a narrative of healing, transformation, and the strength that comes from embracing vulnerability.

Influenced by a diverse array of artists such as Bic Runga, Tracy Chapman, and The Eagles, Araiyah’s sound is a fusion of heartfelt storytelling and melodic richness. However, it is her whanau and friends who serve as her greatest inspiration, fuelling her passion and creativity. Their support and love provide the foundation upon which her music thrives, making each performance an authentic expression of her gratitude and connection to those who matter most.

With a voice that captivates and lyrics that resonate, Araiyah invites listeners into her world—a place where pain transforms into beauty, and healing becomes a shared experience. As she continues to evolve as an artist, Araiyah’s music promises to touch the hearts of many, leaving a lasting impact on all who have the privilege of listening.

Araiyah will be accompanied by guitarist Izzy and Laura Chester-Murphy on percussion.

Rain and the Urban Bohemians:

Formed around the music of singer-songwriter Cathy Elizabeth aka Rain, supported by her band of Urban Bohemians, this group has been able to weave together many different influences and styles to create something quite unique and beautiful.

Peppered with contemplations of our existence and the fleetingness of time, Rain & the UBs bring the magic with a folk-rock edge and an alluring authenticity at its centre. Spiritual undertones and overtones give way to an uplifting joyfulness, of triumph over difficulties and life lessons learned and expressed through music.

With Cathy Elizabeth on vocals & acoustic guitar, Chris Ewers on bass, Murray James on drums and Izzy and Dion on guitars, these guys have got the goods and are ready to deliver!

So come along and allow yourself to be immersed and transported, moved and entertained. It’s going to be a very special night all round!

This particular SOMATIC YOGA program is to assist you in getting unstuck, opening your energetic potential and learn real grounded foundational tools to help you stay Human ;) 
These sessions are designed to work deeply and subtly in decluttering stagnant energy in your nervous system due to adrenal response to life stressors, control programs, and repressed life force. 
Decompress the Vagus Nerve, release trauma (any adaptive response to change, stresses the nervous system) deprogram the PSOA, access your inner fire, creative expression, voice, and power, through holistic movements, breath work, and bioenergetic movement.
 4 Sunday weekly group sessions 1.5 hrs -  Starting Sunday 21st of  September 2025  for 4 Sundays  at 4:30pm-6pm

you can also bring cash on the day but commit to all sessions please.

description:
Steps To Success - The tools to unlocking your potential, Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you be the best you can be. No matter what aspect in your life you want to level up, this workshop has the recipe to start living life at your best. You don't even have to be a member of the Fitness Portal. Just need to have a mind willing to learn.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and visualization with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Teaching Well - Supportive schools for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), With the growing emphasis on staff wellbeing there is a plethora of workplace mental wellbeing programmes on offer. However what is meant by staff wellbeing is not often clearly defined, with many programmes focusing on work related 'stressors' for staff or using staff wellness approach.  
As part of a well school, it is just essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Take the opportunity to learn the underlying principles of wellbeing that inform a sustainable and impactful staff wellbeing plan.  
Designed specifically for the school context, the workshop examines the theory and the practice of promoting wellbeing through the lens of of being part of a school staff in 2025.
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Equipping individual staff members skills or resources to cope more effectively with the stressful or distressing aspects of their jobs or providing an employee assistance programme is only one aspect of a comprehensive staff wellbeing plan. It is common for schools to start their development of their plan at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum. Consequently the plan developed is more a welfare / wellness plan. Learn the difference between welfare, wellness and wellbeing approaches and the strengths and weaknesses of each approach. 

Meta-evaluations of workplace mental wellbeing programmes indicate that there is little evidence around the efficacy of many workplace wellbeing programmes because they do not address the organisational and systemic factors that act as either enablers of or obstacles to wellbeing. Just as it is recognised that supportive environments are foundational to wellbeing of students, so is it also for a well staff. An effective staff wellbeing programmes responds to the needs of the staff and reflects the cultural make-up of the staff, the values and character of the school. 
Drawing on collective impact and transformational change theory and Te Whare Tapa Whā, a conceptual model will be introduced that outlines the eight pou on which a staff wellbeing plan should be based. The strength of this model is that it settings or occupation specific. It requires a depth analysis of the nature, dynamics and demands of the work and the inter-relationships that occur in the work
Building of the learnings from previous workshops and feedback from participants, the workshop now offers a template to guide the development of a staff wellbeing plan
If you are wanting a workshop that will give you a pre-packaged wellbeing programme, then this workshop is not for you. Countless evaluations have shown the limited efficacy of wellbeing programmes that are "inserted" into a school. A staff wellbeing plan must grounded in and responsive to the learnings made out of the reflective analysis and staff consultation stages. In fact, the staff consultation is, in itself, is a wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 30% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs. 
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.  He currently sits on the Health and Disability Ethics Committee.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention. He wrote the first national guidelines for suicide prevention in Australian schools and undertook a review of the NZ guidelines.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
The Check-in Men's Group Tuesday 23 Sept, To join this community, and book your Tuesdays - please sign up here first, and we will email you the event access code. (our venue address will be emailed with your ticket).

This is a space for men to talk honestly, listen deeply, and figure some things out together. It’s not about having it all sorted. You don’t need to be a certain type of guy. Just show up as you are, with no pressure to speak or share.
Open group: new faces are welcome
Flexible: book to come when it suits you. Each Tuesday is a new event. Most will try for fortnightly.
Small groups: 8 men + 2 experienced hosts
Inclusive: all ages, backgrounds and identities (18+)
It's about connection and showing up, instead of going it alone. It makes time for meeting our various challenges, while learning and growing us into better friends, partners, dads, sons and humans. 
It isn’t a boys or bros club, therapy or a self-help seminar, religious or new-age. No fixing, preaching, or pressure. It’s not a crisis service or a substitute for professional care. The sign-up form explains this in more detail.
You can expect to:
Practice listening and learn communication skills for life
Discover greater integrity and self-accountability
Be supported in building your emotional intelligence
Become a part of a hearty and diverse community
Have a good time - it’s often uplifting and inspiring.
Joseph and your team of hosts have all been in regular men's groups for many years. The group sometimes offers simple proven inquiries that draw on NVC, MBSR, active listening, gratitude and more.

Nestled in the hills beside the Lotus Yoga Centre rests a sacred Meditation Sanctuary
a place where many come to reconnect, find inner stillness, and bathe in peace.

Built in 1999, this Sanctuary serves as the spiritual heart of the Centre’s activities.
The location itself was chosen with great care, resting at the meeting point of powerful ley lines, its energy deeply aligned with Kapiti Island and the Maungakotukutuku ranges to the east.

The octagon-shaped structure is crafted from natural timbers, crowned with a glass pyramid roof that amplifies and channels healing energies. Around its frame, tinted windows radiate the seven colours of the rainbow—each one carrying a unique healing ray. On a bright day, the play of colours is nothing short of spectacular, filling the space with a living rainbow of light.

description:
GDNZ 2025 Shelly Bay Cleanup, Join Ghost Diving New Zealand for a community cleanup!

This will be an ocean and shore based clean up targeting rubbish in and around the Wellington foreshore.

Scuba divers, free divers and shore crew all needed! Be prepared to get wet and dirty!

DATE: Saturday October 11th 2025

TIMES:
9.00am - Registrations open
9:45am - Briefing
10.00am - Divers in the water
2.00pm Clean-up and pack down

LOCATION: Shelly Bay - look for the GDNZ signs.

Scuba Divers who wish to participate must have a minimum of 30 logged dives and be comfortable working in low / zero visibility.
Scuba and Free Divers must provide their own gear and tanks. If you also have your own catch bag(s) or float boat for collecting rubbish, please bring this along and ensure they are named.
If you would like to join in the fun and participate as part of the shore crew, you will need to make sure you are wearing fully covered shoes and bring a pair of gardening gloves... also be prepared to get dirty!

ALL PARTICIPANTS, SHORE CREW AND DIVERS MUST REGISTER ON ARRIVAL.

PLEASE NOTE:
• This is a free, family friendly event, but children must be supervised at all times by an adult.
• Closed toe footwear must be worn for safety.
• Please bring your own hand protection (gardening gloves or similar).
• Don’t forget your own water bottle and bring sunscreen if it’s a warm day.
• Dress for the weather (warm clothes and jackets)
• There will also be plenty of work for non-divers to get involved.
Should the event be cancelled due to circumstances out of our control, notification will be given on the Facebook page the night before. Please remember to check prior to the event.
We look forward to seeing you there!

description:
Steps To Success - The tools to unlocking your potential, Steps To Success is a seminar, helping you be the best you can be. No matter what aspect in your life you want to level up, this workshop has the recipe to start living life at your best. You don't even have to be a member of the Fitness Portal. Just need to have a mind willing to learn.
What:
This seminar is a fundraiser to get the Rocking Robins Top team to Nationals this year in Rotorua.
When: August 29th 2025 6pm
Where: Tawa Fitness Portal
Cost: $25 Per ticket
Purchase your ticket here: https://docs.google.com/.../1FAIpQLSfMyBy9iQsriz.../viewform
Bonus: Each ticket comes with a $5 voucher to the Fitness Portal Cafe.
Sausage Sizzle: There will be a sausage running during the sausage sizzle so you won't go hungry.
Please make payment into the following account:
Account Name: Rocking Robins Rock N Roll Club
Account #: 06-0773-0877111-00
Particulars: STS
Reference: First + Last Name

What is this event?
Rotate through each 20–30 min session (with 5-min breaks between):
1. Mindset & Visualization – Mental prep and visualization with Jordan
2. Injury Prevention - Progressive load and how to avoid injury with Devin Glover
3. Fuel your body right - Talking fueling and supplements thanks to Scorpion Supplements with Rebekah Glover and Liz Monrad
BBQ will be running on the night so be sure to bring your loose coins!!
Proceeds from this event go towards helping the Rocking Robins top team get to national in October!!
Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.
Jordan is the founder of Being You, a coaching practice grounded in authenticity, connection, courage, simplicity, and going rogue. She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Jordan has coached competitive gymnasts, doctors, dancers, and first responders (to name a few) - people who need to stay mentally strong in high-performance spaces.
Devin Glover: Owner and Founder of The Fitness Portal Limited. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day, The Rhythm of Wellbeing ~ Simple Ayurvedic Rituals to Support Your Day
We’re super excited to be collaborating with the lovely Radha Iveta from Heart Awakening. Plus - there will be an amazing plant based dinner included in your ticket!
This will be insightful, down-to-earth and inspiring.
It’s the art of aligning with the natural rhythms. And see how your wellness takes shape with just a few simple adjustments. It’s the small things that compound to develop your wellbeing!
This workshop is an introduction to Dinacharya, the Ayurvedic practice of daily self-care routines that harmonise mind, body, and spirit.
In the workshop, we will cover:
Understanding Dinacharya: What it is and its importance in Ayurveda.
Morning Routine: Simple, effective practices to start your day with balance.
Evening Routine: Techniques to wind down and promote restful sleep.
Eating & Digestion: Ayurvedic recommendations for meal timing and digestion.
Self-Care Practices: How to incorporate oil pulling, tongue scraping, and more into your day.
Seasonal Adjustments: How to tweak your routine according to the seasons.


Meet Radha, your host
Radha Iveta is a meditation and yoga practitioner, certified teacher, Ayurveda practitioner and therapist, cacao lover, and the founder of Heart Awakening and True Nature Ayurveda. Her work was born out of a profound love for these teachings and her desire to invite others on a journey toward more meaning and fulfilment, guided by the direct experience and knowledge that Love is our true nature.
Her heart is invested in helping people reconnect to their hearts and reveal their true nature by bringing sacredness and simplicity into all aspects of life.

description:
Wellington WikiCon 2026, WikiCon is the annual gathering for editors of Wikipedia, Wikidata, Wikimedia Commons, and other Wikimedia platforms. Organised by Wikimedia Aotearoa New Zealand (WANZ), our local chapter of the Wikimedia Foundation, this conference brings together Wikimedians from across the country. In 2026, WikiCon will be held in Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington.
This event will provide opportunities for editors and contributors to connect face-to-face, helping to build collaborative relationships. The conference will also provide opportunities for editors and contributors to share and develop their skills and knowledge in working with Wikimedia projects. All are welcome, from complete beginners to highly experienced editors.
Conference sessions will be run on Saturday 2 and Sunday 3 May 2026, with informal welcome activities kicking off on the afternoon of Friday 1 May.
Further information will be posted on the event page.
If you’ve got a project you’d like to share with other Wikimedians, or suggestions for topics you’d like to learn more about, please feel free to get in touch at info@wikimedia.nz — we’d love your input.
We are offering grants covering registration, travel, accommodation and meals. Apply now by contacting info@wikimedia.nz with the following information:
Location
Occupation
Areas/topics of interest
Wikipedia editing experience

description:
Wellington Photographic Society - Annual Exhibition 2025, The Wellington Photographic Society’s annual exhibition is a highlight of our year, bringing together the creative work of our members and sharing it with the wider public. For us, it’s not just a chance to hang photographs on the wall – it’s an opportunity to celebrate the art of photography, showcase the talent within our community, and invite others to discover what makes photography such an inspiring and accessible pursuit.
This year’s exhibition offers a diverse collection of images captured both close to home and further afield. You’ll see photographs from all around the world – landscapes, portraits, street scenes, and wildlife – but the heart of the exhibition is firmly rooted in Wellington. Our members have drawn inspiration from the beauty and variety of our own backyard: dramatic coastlines, majestic mountains, vibrant cities, and the small, fleeting details that make life unique.
We are also proud to display images created during our group meet-ups, workshops, and learning sessions. These gatherings are at the heart of what we do as a society, offering members the chance to connect, experiment, and grow their photographic skills in a supportive and friendly environment. The exhibition is therefore more than just a showcase of individual work – it’s a reflection of the shared learning, encouragement, and passion that our community thrives on.
Visitors can expect to see a wide range of styles and techniques, from classic black-and-white to bold digital artistry. Whether you are a seasoned photographer, someone with a casual interest in the medium, or simply curious to see the world through a different lens, there will be something here to inspire you.
Opening Night: 29th September, 7pm (private event, by invitation only)
Public Viewing: 30th September onwards
Opening Hours: 10am – 6pm most days, extended to 8pm on Friday/Saturday
We warmly invite you to join us, explore the exhibition, and experience the world as seen through the eyes of our members. Who knows – you may even feel inspired to pick up a camera yourself and consider becoming part of the Wellington Photographic Society.
For more information, visit: wps.org.nz

description:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025, Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025
Unleash your inner ghoul! Join the Halloween Nightlife Crawl in Wellington on Oct. 31, 2025. 4+ venues, specials & costumes!

About this Event


Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Wellington 2025 🎭

On Friday, October 31st, 2025, the Halloween Nightlife Crawl brings you through a curated mix of Wellington’s top bars, lounges, and clubs. One ticket gives you access to 4+ venues, exclusive Halloween drink specials, and a night full of music and costumes across the city.




What’s Included

Digital crawl map for easy navigation

DJs and entertainment at every stop


Event Schedule

🍹 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars and lounges at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Everyone meets at the closing venue for the big finish.



Quick Details

👻 Costumes encouraged — from glam to scary, the night is yours.

18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the Digital Crawl Map link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
Jazz in Martinborough 2025, Big Band Brings Back the Swing
Jazz in Martinborough 2025

Jazz in Martinborough is thrilled to be bringing you the Royal New Zealand Airforce Jazz Orchestra as our feature act on Saturday at the festival for 2025.

“We’re delighted to be able to fill the stage with a full-sized big band of fabulous musicians, and the Town Hall with the fantastic sounds of the big band era,” says Jazz in Martinborough Music Director Lee Quayle.

Jazz in Martinborough is back for their 13th edition during the first weekend in September with ticketed shows on Friday 5th and Saturday 6th and other gigs around town as usual. “The RNZAF Jazz Orchestra will be one of our ticketed gigs, featuring on the Saturday evening,” says Lee. “And on Friday night we invite you to Be Transported back in time to a speak easy club with the superb swing and blues combo that is April’s Fools,” adds Lee.

Staying true to the tradition of swing and improvisation the RNZAF Jazz Orchestra draws on their own rich history dating back to the original ‘swing era’. The Orchestra is a national trailblazer in big band history and features New Zealand compositions, and a classic repertoire from the golden era of big band swing jazz of Ellington and Basie.

The band benefits from a depth of talent that most military bands around the world would only dream of and is made up of Wellington’s most exceptional musicians.

“The line-up will be a who’s who of the Wellington jazz scene,” says Lee. “It’s a while since we had a big band at the festival, so we’re elated to have the Airforce Jazz Orchestra back with us again. They last played at the festival in 2014. Many of the band members have been here since, but not as part of a big band,” says Lee.

Be Transported by April’s Fools
Imagine stepping back in time to a speak easy club. A smoky, dimly lit room where the anticipation is electric but the vibe is laid-back and relaxed. . .

From the stage a jazz swing and blues band begins to play, their instruments blending seamlessly in a harmonious symphony of sound. The rhythm section, with its upright bass and snare drums, lays down a groove that's impossible to resist, while the saxophone punctuates the air with soulful notes.

At. the forefront stands a captivating female singer, her voice rich and velvety, weaving tales of heartache, joy, and everything in between. Her vocal prowess brings both swing and blues to life, effortlessly moving from sultry, slow blues ballads to energetic, foot-tapping swing numbers.

This band doesn't just play music; they create an experience that transports the audience to another era, where the essence of jazz and blues reigns supreme.

Welcome to an evening of superb swing jazz and blues brought to you by the band that is April’s Fools. “We’re absolutely wrapt to be bringing this ultra-talented and experienced combo to the festival,” says Music Director Lee Quayle. “Whenever, and wherever this group of musicians have played reviewers have to search the thesaurus for new superlatives to describe the show, and audiences leave reluctantly, but happy.”

April’s Fools are April Phillips (vocals), Greg Crayford (drums), Zak Dikvert (guitar), Nicholas Bauke-Maunsell (saxophone), Miles Crayford (keyboards) and RoryMacartney (bass). They will be playing at Jazz in Martinborough on Friday 5 September 2025 as the opening of the ticketed festival gigs to be held in the Town Hall.

Dress code: Party Animals (think jungle creatures, leopard, snakeskin, zebra, cheetah. Get wild!)
See you in the jungle!


***Please Respect the Venue***
*** Important Information ***
• At Jungle Juice we will not tolerate any form of discrimination.
• Look out for each other and please report any antisocial behaviour.
• Remember we all come from different walks of life and we don’t know what others have/are going through. Never judge anyone by who they are.
• We share our time with you in a loving and respectful way and we want everyone to feel this every minute they are at a Jungle Juice event.
• Consent is key – always.
• Have fun and please find us on the decks if you have any issues.

Pottery for Tweens & Teens, This course introduces a range of hand-building techniques for pottery/ceramics and is appropriate for teens ages 11-16.

In this course you will learn to:

- prepare clay for use
- learn slab, pinch pot and coil construction techniques
- learn how to glaze your creations
- learn techniques to create art that will withstand the firing process.

Creations will be fired at the end of each term and ready to collect at the beginning of next.

description:
Yoga Nidra: Ocean Waves of Rest, Yoga Nidra: Ocean Waves of Rest
Slow down, settle in, and let the gentle rhythm of the ocean carry you inward.
This calming evening will centre around the deeply restorative practice of Yoga Nidra—a guided meditation designed to bring your body into a state of deep rest while your awareness gently drifts between waking and dreaming. Known to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce stress, Yoga Nidra supports emotional balance, mental clarity, and a profound sense of ease.
This ocean-themed session invites you to immerse yourself in the tranquil energy of the sea—its steady waves, expansive horizons, and peaceful depths—a time to soften, release, and simply be.
After the practice, we’ll be sharing a nourishing plant-based dinner together. It’s included in your ticket and is a lovely way to gently transition back, connect, and enjoy wholesome food in good company.
Comfort note: Mats, cushions, blankets, and eye masks are provided, but feel free to bring your own for extra comfort and coziness.
Meet Karuna, your host
Trained as a primary school teacher, she also has a background in psychology and Spanish. But her heart is in connecting with others, and she always brings a lively and warm energy to the space.

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Astronomy on Tap
Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.

This September at Astronomy on Tap, we’re diving into one of the biggest questions in science: Are we alone? Our theme is The Search for Life and Water. Wherever we find water on Earth, we find life. Could the same be true beyond our planet?

From icy moons in our Solar System to distant exoplanets, scientists are searching for the conditions that could support life. Join us as we explore the potential for discovering life in the universe and the technology helping us get closer to the answer.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.

Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.

$45pp | 8PM – 10PM | R18 | Space Place

description:
Mystery 35mm Movie Marathon, Details
UPDATE - We have added some Half Marathon ticket options for those can't make the whole event. You can either select 'Daytime' or 'Evening' which will let you watch three features total. Daytime tickets are from 1:30pm until the dinner break (around 7:00pm). Evening are from the dinner break until the end of the last film.

Surprise we are running a 35mm Mystery Marathon very soon! We have had some exciting news that we cannot share for now but as a result we must move our beautiful 35mm from its usual location into storage for a bit. We are not sure when it will be set back up so to celebrate we are running a marathon of six 35mm features across one Saturday!

We will kick off the first film at 1:30pm sharp on Saturday and will have a short dinner break after the third film. All going to plan we should be done by around 12:30am.

In terms of the features, we have films from the 1960s through to the early 2000s with a mix of comedies, sci-fi, horror and cult classics! Granted not all of these films would be considered masterpieces but there is nothing more fun than sitting in a crowd not knowing what could be coming next!

We will have a snack menu you can pre-order before the first film so aim to arrive around 1:00pm to order. The breaks between films will be very short (probably just enough time for the projectionist to thread up the next film) so make sure you come prepared for back-to-back screenings.

This event has strictly no digital projection, it’s all film all the time. Now in theory it should all playback without a hitch as we are bringing in some of the best projectionist’s Wellington has. But 35mm is a strange beast that can sometimes throw up the odd issue.

Full marathon tickets (Admit) are $50
Half Marathon - Daytime are $30
Half Marathon - Evening are $30

Seating is general admission and cinema entrance will be determined by earliest ticket purchase times.

Te Huarahi Passionfest, Te Huarahi: The Pathway of Faith + Justice
Te Huarahi Passionfest is a grassroots festival for young adults chasing after Jesus and justice in Aotearoa. It’s about camping under the stars, worship and kōrero, music and art, shared kai and whanaungatanga.
We want to form a new generation of Jesus-followers who care deeply about people and creation. Alongside you will be families and older adults who’ve walked this path for decades — cheering you on and sharing the journey.

description:
DRAG BINGO with Homer Neurotic @ Dirty Little Secret, This is not your grandma’s bingo night. Wellington’s resident sad boy and pint-sized powerhouse, Homer Neurotic, is taking over the rooftop at Dirty Little Secret for a night of unhinged chaos, cocktails, and camp realness.
Get ready for an evening dripping in glamour, glitter, and glorious nonsense as you soak up the skyline views from one of the capital’s most iconic rooftop hideaways.
What to expect:
• Free entry, all you need is a table booking and good vibes
• Over $200 worth of prizes, including a $100 bar voucher for the grand winner
• Spot prizes, cheeky antics, and bad decisions encouraged
• Live drag performances that’ll leave you confused, flustered, and deeply entertained
• Dad jokes, dance-offs, and plenty of double entendres
• Drink and kai specials to keep you going
• After the Bingo stick around to boogie down with one of the resident DJ’s, spinning your tracks all night long
Bookings essential:
Tables available from 7.00 pm with balls dropping no later than 7.30. Walk-ins are very limited so grab your spot now:
https://dirtylittlesecret.co.nz/events/drag-bingo/
Safe and inclusive:
Dirty Little Secret is proudly LGBTQIA+ friendly. Our staff and security are trained to make everyone feel welcome and safe. Elevator access is available, but some tables are on raised flooring, so please reach out if you have accessibility needs and we’ll make sure you’re well looked after.
Heads up:
This is an R18 event. Expect colourful language, cheeky antics, and wholesome masculinity served with a side of mischief. Consider yourself warned.
Follow me for more nonsense:
Find me on Instagram at @homerneurotic for a peek behind the scenes and more of the drama, glitter and tears.

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #7, Sign up here: https://luma.com/ftstwellington7
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://luma.com/ftstwellington7
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/

description: Care, anarchy, and mutual aid,  Care, anarchy, and mutual aid: responses to crisis and disaster by the community, for the community  (a community proposed event) We will walk through tangible examples from Monica's experiences of mutual aid organizing for different crisis contexts in Chicago (USA), dispelling disaster myths, what anarchist approaches to community care look like, and brainstorming around what we can do together around what we face as community members in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.  Zines and kai will be shared.
label: Community & Culture

description:
Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!, Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.

Pitta Patta Pitta Patta, Fine Wine Social Club plays cool music and the bees matter. Heaps of instruments, Heaps of euphoria, we play good music until we snoreria. Modern Soul for your Jazz and Funk-Reggae for your hands

Beaut poster by Vanessa Cone

https://www.instagram.com/finewinesocialclub/
https://www.instagram.com/daymoon.band/
Pōneke is home to an incredible diversity of artists and music lovers.
We want Eyegum Wednesdays to be a space that everyone can enjoy with care and respect.
We have no room for transphobia or racism, sexism, homophobia, and disregarding consent.
If you see or experience anything concerning, no matter how small, please let our crew or San Fran staff know.

description:
Crochet - Christmas Special!, In this half day crochet special, you will get the patterns to make stars, and icicles, mini wreaths, a mini Christmas jumper, Christmas tree and gifts bunting and a cute mini Christmas hat. Please bring some 4 or 8 ply smooth yarn and a crochet hook - see full description for suitable types of yarn.

Description

Join Monique in this half-day crochet workshop where you will learn how to crochet a range of little projects suitable for the holiday season. Choose from stars, icicles, mini wreaths and Christmas jumpers, Christmas trees and a mini Santa hat! There will be a booklet of patterns for you to take home, to enable you to complete in your own time the projects that you didn’t have time to make during the workshop.

You will also learn how to crochet and decorate Christmas baubles! While you might not finish all the patterns this day, the aim is to have a go at making as many as possible!

You will need to know some basic crochet stitches such as single and double crochet. You’ll also need to have some understanding of how to read a pattern and work with diagrams, as taught in the beginners’ crochet course.

Please bring yarn that you enjoy working with (cotton, acrylic or wool, 4ply or 8 ply) in a variety of colours (red, white and green, a neutral colour for the mouse, and glittery yarns are all good options for the Christmas projects) and a matching crochet hook. You’ll also need a pair of scissors and a darning needle.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".
