description:
Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025, Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025
Friday raises a pint. Saturday unleashes the horde. Two nights, one wristband, all of Wellington's Halloween energy.

About this Event


👻🍺 Boos & Brews + Feeding Frenzy 🧛🧟‍♀️Weekend Pass – Wellington 2025

Two nights. One pass. Non-stop Halloween madness.
Friday kicks off with Boos & Brews — pints, cocktails, and costumed pub crawlers packing the city’s best bars. Saturday unleashes Feeding Frenzy — a zombie-fueled bar crawl where DJs, shots, and wild costumes keep the night alive until 2 AM.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
🎟️ One wristband for both crawls (Friday + Saturday)
🚫 No cover charges at any venue
🍹 Exclusive Halloween drink specials
🎶 DJs + entertainment at every stop
📱 Friday + Saturday digital crawl maps 🕺 Two huge closing parties




PARTICIPATING VENUES
Lineup announced soon. Each stop brings themed drinks, DJs, and a full Halloween vibe.


👻🍺🧟‍♂️🧛 Double your Halloween fun. One ticket gets you two back-to-back crawls, two closing parties, and hundreds of costumed partygoers.
🚨 Early bird weekend passes start at $25 — grab yours before they’re gone.




HALLOWEEN CRAWL TERMS & CONDITIONS
ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
This is a 18+ event only. Government-issued photo ID is mandatory at the door. No ID, no participation.
WRISTBAND POLICY
Your wristband = your access. It must be collected at the official check-in location during posted hours (before 10:30 PM).
If you miss check-in, your wristband will not be available and you will not be permitted into crawl venues. No refunds.
If you can’t make it, you may designate a friend to pick up your wristband on your behalf.
VENUE PARTICIPATION & RULES
Crawl schedules, bar times, and specials are listed on the Digital Bar List.
Your ticket is only valid during the scheduled crawl hours — not outside of them.
Digital Crawl Map: Always check it the morning of the event for final venue confirmations and any last-minute adjustments.
Venues may close early, reach capacity, or have staff unaware of the crawl — if so, simply continue to another participating location listed on the map.
All venues reserve the right to deny entry based on intoxication, dress code, behavior, or safety concerns. Standard security checks still apply.
TICKETS & SALES
All sales are final. Tickets are non-transferable and non-refundable.
If an event is fully canceled without a replacement date, a refund (minus processing fees) will be issued.
Events run rain or shine, and lineup, specials, or bar participation may change without notice.
COSTUMES & CONDUCT
Costumes are encouraged, but anything resembling a weapon or considered offensive may result in denied entry with no refund.
Disorderly conduct, harassment, or damage to property will result in removal without compensation.
LIABILITY RELEASE
By purchasing a ticket and joining the crawl, you confirm that you are participating at your own risk. You accept full responsibility for any injuries, illnesses, property loss, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death that may occur before, during, or after the event.
You hereby waive, release, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, volunteers, affiliates, and all participating venues from any and all liability — whether due to negligence, gross negligence, breach of duty, or otherwise.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless all released parties from any claims, damages, or legal fees arising from your actions or participation.
By attending, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and accepted this waiver. It is intended to be as broad and enforceable as permitted by law.

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington, Fright Night Halloween Bar Crawl Wellington
Dance, drink & crawl through Wellington this Halloween! 4+ venues, DJs, spooky vibes & no cover charges. Oct 31, 18+ only.

About this Event


🦇 Fright Night Crawl 2025 – Wellington🌙
When Halloween Friday rolls in, Wellington belongs to the night owls. The Fright Night Crawl isn’t just a bar hop — it’s a moving costume party across the city’s nightlife. On October 31st, 2025, expect packed dance floors, creative costumes, and drinks that only appear once a year.




Ticket Perks
✔️ Admission to 4+ participating venues
✔️ Wristband for access and drink deals
✔️ Zero cover charges at crawl stops
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your route
✔️ DJs and entertainment throughout the night


What to Expect
From vampires to movie icons, everyone shows up ready to make a scene. Grab friends or roll solo — either way, you’ll be part of a city-wide takeover with:
🍹 Crawl-only cocktails and shots
🎶 High-energy sets from DJs spinning Halloween remixes and party favorites
👻 Venues transformed with spooky themes and live entertainment




Bar Hop Schedule
Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM: Pick up your wristband at the opening venue.
Main Crawl | 8:30–11:30 PM: Explore middle stops at your own pace.
Finale | 11:30 PM–2 AM: Everyone comes together for the closing party.



Venues
The official list drops closer to the event. Each location will feature its own atmosphere, music, and specials. On event day, open the Digital Crawl Map for the full schedule and details.


Extra Tips
Be early: no wristband pickup after 10:30 PM.
Can’t make check-in? A friend can pick yours up.
Costumes encouraged — just leave the props that could be mistaken for weapons at home.
Check the Digital Map morning-of for any last-minute changes.


Tickets
🎟 Early Bird from $15 (limited supply). Prices increase as Halloween nears.
🔒 Capacity capped at 500 people — once sold out, that’s it.




Important Disclaimers
Age & Entry
18+ only. Valid government-issued ID required at every stop.
Wristbands
Your wristband is mandatory for venue entry. Pick up during the check-in window (7:30–10:30 PM). No late pickups.
Tickets & Refunds
All sales are final. Non-refundable, non-transferable. If the event is canceled, refunds will be issued automatically (excluding processing fees).
Venue Rights
Venues may refuse entry for intoxication, capacity, dress code violations, or inappropriate behavior. No refunds if refused.
Capacity
Entry is first-come, first-served at each stop. Wristband does not guarantee instant access if a venue is full.
Self-Guided
This is a self-paced crawl. Use the digital map to move between venues. Not all venue staff may be aware of crawl details — use the event contact info if needed.
Drink Specials
Offered by venues; may change without notice.
Conduct & Costumes
Offensive or dangerous costumes may lead to denial of entry without refund. Disorderly conduct can result in removal.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket, you agree to participate at your own risk, including but not limited to alcohol-related incidents, injury, illness, property loss, or actions of other guests. Organizers and venues are not liable for damages before, during, or after the event. By attending, you waive any claims against the organizers, partners, and venues.
Event Changes
Venues and times may shift. Crawl runs rain or shine. Always check your email and the digital map for updates on event day.

4 rounds of play
Event Timing: Saturday 1st November and Sunday 2nd November 2025
Event Address: Harcourt Park - Upper Hutt
Contact us at:

The Event
Players will play a combination of 18 holes from two short but technical courses, (Harcourt Park and California Park). Course Map will be available closer to the time and will include the opportunity to play all of the harcourt holes in either a split round or full round depends on pool numbers.
The maximum number of participants will be capped at 90 people, so get in quick so you don't miss out (there will be a waitlist if required). Participants that register before the 10th August 2025 will be eligible to receive 5 free throws with the tech disc at the event.

Greater Wellington Disc Golf Club is responsible for all refunds and cancellations.

REFUND POLICY
100%: refund (excluding transaction and DG Scene fees) will be issued for anyone pulling out before 8pm on 1st of October.
50% refund (excluding transaction and DG Scene fees) will be issued for anyone pulling out before 8pm on Sunday 19th October.

description:
Get to Know Your Sony Camera, Join us for a relaxed evening in store with Sony Digital Imaging Advocate Rebecca McMillan and get hands on with the latest Sony gear.

Rebecca is Wellington-based professional photographer who has been shooting with Sony cameras for over a decade. As an award-winning, NZIPP-accredited, portrait and film stills photographer, she knows how to capture incredible images using Sony Alpha cameras and lenses!

Rebecca also runs events for the local photography community, including coffee meet-ups and photo walks.

Feel free to bring in your Sony gear on the night, or just try the equipment we have in store. Rebecca and the Photo Warehouse staff will be happy to answer any questions you may have.

Everyone who registers and attends this Scene Festival event will go into the draw to win a trip to Rome! There will also be Sony spot prizes given out during the evening.

description:
Glow in the dark titiwai tours - New Zealand glow worms, A fascinating tour into the world of titiwai, New Zealand's glow worms, in Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā. This outdoor night-time tour takes about an hour, and all are welcome to join. If bringing children, we find it most suitable for those aged 7 years and older.
Meet at the Founders’ entrance to Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā on Glenmore Street. Please bring your ticket, a torch, and an umbrella if it’s raining. We'll see you there!
This tour is operated by the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden.
Glow Worm Tour Ticket Refund Policy
• No Refunds: We do not offer refunds for Glow Worm Tour tickets.
• Ticket Transfers: If you can’t attend your booked tour, we will put you on a future tour, subject to availability. Please contact us as soon as possible to arrange this.
• Weather Conditions: Tours operate rain or shine. In the event of extreme weather or unsafe conditions, we will reschedule your tour or provide a refund.
For any changes or enquiries, please get in touch with us in advance at Treehouse@wcc.govt.nz or call 04 499 1400.

description:
Glow in the Dark Paint Party: Aurora Lake Scene, Ultra Violet lights and neon nights. Prepare to experience Paintvine like you’ve never experienced it before - in the dark!

Paintvine After Dark is New Zealand’s first glow in the dark paint party!

Grab a drink in one hand, a brush in the other and get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going with ultra-violet lights, glow in the dark paint and nothing but laughs all night long!

Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, neon acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night you will leave with your own fluro painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website ⇒ paintvine.co.nz

description:
Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington, Haunted Halloween Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington
Two nights, one ticket, endless Halloween chaos in Wellington. Join both crawls with drinks, music, and costume madness.

About this Event


🎃🍺 Halloween Madness Weekend Pass 2025 – Wellington 🎃🍺

Two nights of crawls. One ticket. Zero excuses.
Halloween in Wellington isn’t just one party — it’s a whole weekend. With the Halloween Madness Weekend Pass, you’ll unlock access to two epic bar crawls:
Friday, October 31st → Haunted Halloween Bar Crawl
Saturday, November 1st → Beer & Spirits: Halloween Booze Crawl

Double the venues, double the specials, double the fun. Whether you’re into pumpkin brews, tequila shots, or just want an excuse to rock your scariest (or funniest) costume twice, this pass is your best deal for Halloween weekend.




WHAT’S INCLUDED
✔️ Entry to both Friday & Saturday night crawls
✔️ No cover charges at participating bars & clubs
✔️ Crawl-only drink deals at every stop
✔️ Digital crawl map to guide your night
✔️ DJs, themed parties, and Halloween vibes until 2 AM
✔️ Two big finale parties — one each night


HOW THE WEEKEND FLOWS
👉 Wristband Pickup: Check in between 7:30–10:30 PM each night at the opening venue to collect your pass.
👉 Bar Hopping: From 8:30–11:30 PM, explore multiple walkable venues — pubs, clubs, and breweries — all offering specials.
👉 The Last Stop: Each crawl closes at a featured nightclub from 11:30 PM–2:00 AM with DJs and dance floors packed.




WEEKEND VIBE
👻 Costumes aren’t required but highly encouraged — expect the streets to be packed with zombies, witches, superheroes, and some of the funniest DIY outfits you’ll see all year.
⚡ Early bird tickets start at just $25 for the full weekend. Prices rise as Halloween gets closer — secure your spot now.


PARTICIPATING VENUES
The full lineup of bars and clubs will be released closer to the event. Expect high-energy DJs, themed rooms, and Halloween drink specials at every stop.




⚠️ EVENT RULES & DISCLAIMER

ENTRY REQUIREMENTS
18+ Only: All guests must be 18 years or older with a valid government-issued photo ID. No exceptions.
Wristbands Required: Your wristband is your ticket. Present your Eventbrite ticket/QR code at check-in to claim it. Wristbands must be worn the entire night for access to crawl venues. If you miss the pickup window (before 10:30 PM at the listed check-in), you forfeit entry.


CRAWL GUIDELINES
On-Time Check-In: Arrive during designated hours (7:30–10:30 PM). Late arrivals cannot be accommodated.
Proxy Pickup: If you can’t make it, you may authorize a friend to collect your wristband.
Venue Timing: Specials and entry are only valid during the timeframes listed on the Digital Bar List.
Day-Of Updates: Always check the Digital Crawl Map on event day for the latest venue info, changes, or closures.
Self-Guided Crawl: No hosts will lead groups. Use the crawl map to navigate between bars.
Venue Capacity: If a location is full, you may have to wait. Access is not guaranteed at every bar.


VENUE POLICIES
Right to Refuse: Venues may deny entry or remove anyone due to intoxication, dress code violations, offensive costumes, or inappropriate behavior.
Security Checks: Wristbands do not exempt you from ID or bag checks. Standard venue security applies.
Drink Specials: Offered at the discretion of participating bars; they may change or end without notice.
Venue Awareness: If staff aren’t aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the crawl map. If unavailable, proceed to another participating venue.


TICKET & EVENT TERMS
All Sales Final: No refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled outright (without reschedule), refunds excluding fees will be processed automatically.
Rain or Shine: Crawl will proceed regardless of weather. Venues and lineup are subject to change.
Late / Wrong Venue: Tickets are valid only during scheduled crawl hours. No refunds for late arrivals or showing up at the wrong check-in.
Costume Policy: No weapons or weapon-like props. Offensive costumes are prohibited and may result in denied entry.


LIABILITY WAIVER
By purchasing a ticket, you acknowledge that participation is at your own risk. Risks include but are not limited to: injury, illness, property damage, theft, accidents, alcohol-related incidents, or death.
You hereby release, waive, and discharge Events Per Se, its owners, staff, contractors, sponsors, affiliates, and participating venues from all claims or liability, whether caused by negligence or otherwise, for any injury, loss, illness, or death occurring before, during, or after the event.
You further agree to indemnify and hold harmless Events Per Se and all released parties from any expenses, claims, or legal costs arising from your actions during the crawl.
By attending, you confirm you’ve read, understood, and agreed to these terms in full.

description:
Downunder - NZ & OZ Experience, Get ready to celebrate the soundtrack of Australasia with Downunder – Kiwi Oz Experience – a powerhouse live tribute band that brings to life the biggest and most iconic hits from Australia and New Zealand.

Featuring charting artists from New Zealand and Sydney, Australia, this high-energy show takes audiences on a journey through decades of unforgettable music. From Kiwi rock anthems and classic pub singalongs to Aussie radio staples that defined generations, the Downunder experience is pure trans-Tasman magic.

With soaring vocals, dazzling musicianship, and a stage presence that lights up every venue, Downunder delivers the songs you grew up with and still love today – performed with passion, authenticity, and plenty of Kiwi-Oz flair.

description:
(Re)generation next: The Poet Laureate steps down, Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate Chris Tse marks the end of his term in this exciting evening with fellow poets Ken Arkind, Cadence Chung, Gregory O’Brien, Chris Price, and Ruby Solly.
Reflections on the future
Join Chris at the National Library to mark the end of his time in the role with his reflections on the future of Aotearoa New Zealand poetry and readings from special guests.
"I left the doors to the past and the future unlocked ... "
Chris Tse’s three-year term as Aotearoa New Zealand Poet Laureate ends on Phantom Billstickers National Poetry Day, when the next Poet Laureate will be announced: https://www.nzbookawards.nz/nat.../2016-national-poetry-day/
About the speakers
Chris Tse (he/him) was born and raised in Lower Hutt, New Zealand. He studied film and English literature at Victoria University of Wellington, where he also completed an MA in Creative Writing at the International Institute of Modern Letters. In 2022, he was named the 13th New Zealand Poet Laureate. His poetry, short fiction, and non-fiction have been recorded for radio and widely published in numerous journals, magazines and anthologies. He has published several collections of poetry and his latest book Super Model Minority (2022) was longlisted for the Ockham New Zealand Book Awards 2023.
Ken Arkind is an American poet, author, performer, and educator originating from Steamboat Springs in Colorado. He holds the 2006 title of the American National Poetry Slam Champion and the 2010 title of Nuyorican Poets Cafe Grand Slam Champion. Ken now resides in Auckland and is a recent graduate from the Manukau Institute of Technology’s Creative Arts Programme.
Cadence Chung (she/they) is a poet, student, and musician from Wellington, currently studying at the New Zealand School of Music. Her poems started being published in her junior years of high school, and her debut chapbook anomalia was published by We Are Babies Press in April 2022. Her writing takes inspiration from antique stores, Tumblr text posts, and dead poets.
Gregory O’Brien is a poet, painter, author, curator, and editor. His most recent poetry publication is a collection of poems and paintings, House and contents (2022). Other recent publications include a book-length meditation on the Pacific, Always song in the water (2019) and the Ockham award winning book Don Binney: Flight Path (2023).
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Celebrating Mahuru Māori: He wheako reorua o He Tohu and Pipitea walking tour — Mahuru Māori 2025, This Mahuru Māori, join a reorua (bilingual) He Tohu experience and hīkoi around Pipitea to celebrate te reo Māori and the unique hītori (history) of Pipitea. Deepen your understanding about ingoa tūturu (original place names) and the wāhi where He Tohu currently sits.
A reorua | bilingual tour of He Tohu and Pipitea
Join us and embark on a haerenga (journey) together to connect to the ancestors and our shared past. The tour will begin at He Tohu — a permanent exhibition of three iconic constitutional taonga that shape Aotearoa New Zealand.
* 1835 He Whakaputanga o te Rangatiratanga o Nu Tireni — Declaration of Independence of the United Tribes of New Zealand
* 1840 Te Tiriti o Waitangi — Treaty of Waitangi
* 1893 Women’s Suffrage Petition — Te Petihana Whakamana Pōti Wahine.
These taonga are significant because they shaped who we are as a nation and will shape what we become in the future.
"Ka mua, ka muri | Walking backwards into the future"
A hīkoi around Pipitea
After the He Tohu tour, join us on a half-hour bilingual hīkoi (walk) around key sites in Pipitea of cultural significance.
There are slight inclines in places, but we will be walking on the pavement for the tour. If the huarere (weather) is looking inclement, please bring warm clothing, a raincoat, or an umbrella. If the weather is too bad, we will postpone the event, so please register so that we can notify you about the cancellation.
Shared kai
During the kaupapa, knowledge, pātai (questions), and reflections will flow between us. At the end we’ll have kai timotimo (snacks). You are welcome to bring snacks to share.
This event is suitable for all ages. Please meet at our waka reception desk on the ground floor before the tour starts.
Nau mai, haere mai!
Book your spot
Places are limited so email us to book your spot.
Please include your contact details and the number of people in your party.
Email — events.natlib@dia.govt.nz
Celebrate te reo Māori
Reorua (bilingual) speaking kaimahi will host your taenga mai ki te whare, visit. Some will be kaimahi tangata whenua and some will be kaimahi Pākehā, Tauiwi rānei. Like us all, this mahi (work) is for us and our descendants — mō tātou, me ō tātou uri, haere ake nei.
Toi te kupu, toi te mana, toi te reo Māori! | Hold fast to the word, to the mana and to the Māori language!
Image: Kaiārahi leading the hīkoi through Pipitea. Photo by Mark Beatty

Lucid Dreamin', Lucid Dreamin’ with Camp Low Expectations 🌜
Step beyond the veil and into the realm of lucid dreaming, where sound becomes sensation, and movement becomes vibration  🌪️
Camp Low Expectations invites you to drift through an immersive night of sonic exploration, guiding dreamers and dancers alike with deep grooves, hypnotic rhythms, and bass-heavy journeys.
⚡ Set Times ⚡
8:00pm - Bababear (House)
9:00pm - ZipZap (Tribal Progressive)
10:00pm - Queenie (Tribal Techno & Psy)
11:00pm - 93silva (Experimental Techno)
12:00am - Dexi (Primal Bass)
Dress to theme and step into the dreamscape. Think otherworldly, strange, or surreal. Express your dream-self and let your outfit become part of the collective vision.
Special thanks to ZipZap for lighting, Gold for Gold (Blair & Fortuna) for the sound system, Chelsea for her graphic design, and Ruby speciosa var. Photography, who will be capturing the night through her lens 📷
Camp Low Expectation values enthusiastic consent. We have zero tolerance for anti-social behaviour, if you or someone else needs support, please reach out to the nearest camp member.
Photos and videos will be taken through the night, please let us know if you prefer not to be involved.
As always, resect each other, the venue, and most of all.. have fun! 💞
All proceeds help bring Camp Low Expectation’s vision to life at Kiwiburn 2026 🌞

description:
Chloe's Revenge, Chloe's Revenge
Written and performed by Chloe Bettina.

Part love letter, part exposé, Chloe’s Revenge is a musical theatre-inspired show that pulls back the curtain on the pro-am musical theatre “industry” in Aotearoa. With biting wit, Chloe lays bare the heartbreak of rejection from the world she adores, and turns that pain into power. This is a story of survival, self-discovery, and the ultimate comeback: becoming the best version of yourself when the system says you don’t belong. You don't have to be a "musical theatre person" to enjoy this show. In fact, it's better if you're not.

description:
Jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Wednesday mornings - Wellington, This NEW block of morning classes is the best way for beginners to get into jewellery-making in a lively, warm and friendly environment.
It starts on Wed 8 October and runs for 8 weeks until Wednesday 26 November, 10am - 12.30pm.
This class is mixed-level, allowing beginners to work alongside advanced students.
Beginners start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Level 2 students explore chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. Their silver project can be a pendant on a handmade chain or a piece of their own design.
Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver, an extra $8 for stones and fine silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.
Course fee is $440, Early bird $396 till 17 September.
Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or AfterPay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton, Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton
Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand's best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables.
Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ's best known folk songwriters. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma­cLean. A guitarist, he is known for both his open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle style and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.
From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing and the perfect foil for Bob's lyrical songs.
Don't miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their footstomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.
Tickets $25 from Eventfinda or book by text to 02102361951
label: Music & Concerts

description:
James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington, James Nokise: One Night Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.

One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.


About James Nokise

A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.

Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.

James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Intro To Standup Comedy, Have you always wanted to try stand-up comedy? Or do you just want to learn how to be a funnier, more confident speaker? Let's get you started in this fun, interactive one-day workshop. No experience, preparation, or talents required!

In this class you will learn to:

Develop creative practices to generate and explore comedic ideas
Craft your ideas into standup comedy jokes and routines
Maximize laughter with great delivery
Overcome your stage fright and become a more confident presenter
During class, we’ll write together, craft bits, play games, share material, and give you some fun, low-pressure practice on the mic.

By the end of the day, you’ll have heaps of your own ideas to explore further onstage, an understanding of tools used by professional comics, and the motivation and skills to brave your first or next open mic.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!

Music, stand-up, poetry, storytelling, movement, experiments. If it's performable, it's welcome.
No genre too strange, no format too small.

description:
Aurora Distillery Gin Experience, Create, make and take home your own gin with us at our Gin Experience sessions at our beautiful Wairarapa site, just 10 minutes from Martinborough. Our experienced distillery staff are on hand throughout to guide you through the process and give as much or as little advice as you want. We have hundreds of satisfied customers who have made some really exciting gins.

You’ll begin by foraging in the distillery gardens then we move to the gin-making room to learn about the gin making process and the ingredients involved. You’ll sample loads of botanicals then you will choose what you want to put in your very own gin recipe. After weighing out your recipe, you’ll move to your very own still and begin distilling!

While your gin is distilling, we’ll do a gin tasting of some of our own Arrival brand gins and some surprises from our other spirits.

At the end of the session you’ll bottle and seal your own 500ml bottle of gin to take home!

Please note each Experience attendee must have their own ticket. To ensure all participants have a great time and get our full attention we cannot accept spectators.

description:
"Le Malade Imaginaire" by Les Incompressibles - Wellington, "Le Malade Imaginaire" by Les Incompressibles - Wellington
Les Incompressibles from New Caledonia bring a playful, improvised twist to Molière’s Le Malade Imaginaire this October in New Zealand.

About this Event

🎭The New Caledonian theatre group named Les Incompressibles, will be performing in New Zealand in October with a playful reinterpretation of Molière’s classic Le Malade Imaginaire.
Lucie Dorio and Sam Kagy, two actresses from New Caledonia are performing the timeless comedy with their own vibrant energy, surprises, and a generous dose of improvisation.
Synopsis: Two actresses, running late, arrive to perform Le Malade Imaginaire. In their haste, one of them forgets the costumes and props. Not wanting to cancel the performance, they rise to the challenge of performing without costumes and proper props, using all means at their disposal to make it work.
📅 Saturday, 11th October 2025
🕕 2pm-3.30pm
📍 Alliance Française Wellington | Level 3, 78 Victoria Street, Wellington
🎟️ Free entry
Many thanks to our sponsors and partners for their support: The French Institute, The French Embassy, The Government of New Caledonia, CREIPAC, The French Ministry of Culture, The Federation of French Alliances in New Zealand

description:
Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games, Pokemon: League Cup @ Cerberus Games
Pokémon TCG League Cup tournaments give players an opportunity to earn Championship Points and practice their skills for larger competitions.

Here are the details:

Entry Fee: $25.00
Format: Standard
Tournament Structure: 3-5 Rounds Swiss followed by a Top 4/8 Cut Single Elimination

Decklists will be required. You may fill out a deck registration form on paper or submit one digitally to:


Each participant will receive a booster pack and a Pokemon Prize Packs on entry. A booster pack will be added to the Top Placers Prize Pool per participant.

The champion of each age division will be awarded one (1) League Cup-Branded Champion playmat.

Pokemon Trainer Club and Player ID will be required to participate. Don't have one? You can create an ID at the following link:

https://join.pokemon.com/

Championship points are also awarded. Refer to the website for more information.

https://www.pokemon.com/us/play-pokemon/pokemon-events/pokemon-tournaments/tcg-league-cup/

description:
Planetary Parade - Free event, Six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!
Please note we will postpone the event to if the weather is uncooperative.
If you want to support our Society by becoming a member, please go to https://www.was.org.nz/join-us/
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Spring Floral Display Accessible Self-Drive Tour, Spring Floral Display Accessible Self-Drive Tour
Gather your friends, whānau, or neighbours who might find it tricky to access the gardens, and enjoy a relaxing, self-guided drive through a spectacular spring floral display at Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.

Simply drive along the one-way route past the Display Garden and soak in the colours of tulips, forget-me-nots, dianthus, primulas, chrysanthemums, daffodils, and more.

How it works:
• No registration needed — just turn up and enter through the Glenmore Street gates.
• Follow the designated one-way route through the gardens, keeping within your vehicle at all times.
• Exit through the West/White Gate to return to Glenmore Street.
• Feel free to enjoy the route as many times as you like during opening hours.

Please note:
• Drive slowly (maximum 10 km/h), and watch carefully for pedestrians, especially children.
• Stay in your vehicle for the entire tour to keep everyone safe and comfortable.
• Follow all signage and do not turn around within the garden grounds.

This event is self-guided and unstaffed. If you need assistance during your visit, please call 04 499 1400.
For enquiries, email or call 04 499 1400.


This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
Pearls & Pints - Adults Social Club, Meet new people, make new jewellery, and enjoy your first drink on the house! Pearls & Pints is a faction of our Village Beads Social Collective, which aims to connect people of similar interests as you bond over creating some new pearl jewellery and enjoy some pints (or other beverages!). Come solo and meet new people, or bring some friends along for a fun night at Abandoned Brewery! No beading skills required, our team will help out with all the technical skills at the end.

Create either two freshwater pearl bracelets or one freshwater pearl necklace in this session. We’ll bring a huge selection of different freshwater pearl beads with us, and Abandoned have a huge selection of craft beers, wines, and other delicious drinks to choose between! Snacks available for purchase too.

Bookings and payments required in advance for people aged 18+. Valid ID required upon entry.

Book in Online https://NZpoihakenaportraits.as.me/porirua23

* Portrait Session time
* Kakahu & Taonga

During the session we will style whanau, apply moko stamps, photograph a variety of poses and arrangements depending on your requests and family cooperation.
After the portraits have been taken, whanau will change back into their clothing and then view the unedited photos and order their package.
For payment of packages we accept cash, eftpos, zippay & Afterpay through our eftpos machine using the Afterpay card on your phone.

description:
Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, TICKETS ON SALE NOW!
Tickets for the Post-Match Dinner: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy are officially on sale as of today (1 August) until 1 October, unless they sell out prior. So don't leave it till the last minute!
Priority will be given to financial members of Club Garibaldi and Club Italia Nelson.
Non-members will be wait-listed in order of application date and confirmed after the 1 October cutoff.
The cost of the tickets are as follows:
Financial Club Members (from both Clubs):
- 12 years and over: $25.00pp
- 6–11 years old: $12.50pp
- under 5 years: Fre
Non-Members:
- 12 years and over: $50.00pp
- 6-11 years old: $25.00pp
- under 5 years: Free
Please email, text or call Rosina to secure your tickets now.
rosina.vanderaa@gmail.com
021-621-245
Once your FY25/26 membership status has been confirmed, Rosina will send you the bank account details.
A presto!
Disclaimer: Photo not taken at The Pines, but captures the essence of what we expect to the night to be like.. full of laughter.. and lots of loudness..
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.



** If your gender is showing as sold out, join the waitlist! You’ll get a notification if there are cancellations or additional tickets released!

description:
Roll for Hope 2025, A tabletop roleplaying games event, all proceeds will go to Make-A-Wish. Please visit our website for more information on games and times - https://rollforhope.nz

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings

description:
Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre, Aussie medium, Simon Hay at the Palmy Conference and Function Centre
An Evening of Live Mediumship and Healing with Aussie Medium, Simon Hay

Simon is a psychic medium, medical intuitive and healer. He travels throughout Australia and New Zealand doing private sessions and events. His down-to-earth style of mediumship is accurate, surprising, and entertaining.
At these events, Simon shares messages and accurate information from spirit, but he's passionate about educating about energy healing and mediumship so he also answers audience questions about his career. If you’re curious about communicating to spirit and energy healing, you’ll love this event.
Enjoy…
• A demonstration of psychic mediumship readings in the Elwood Room
• Q and A — ask questions about spirit and energy healing
Arrive to be seated by 7:15 pm.
$55/ticket
Re ticket purchasers, we have a no refund policy. Be certain about attending before purchasing.
Not all attendees will receive readings (attendance doesn’t guarantee you’ll get a reading)
This is an adults only (16 years +) event. Parents, be aware that I often talk about topics suitable only for adults.
To be polite and respectful, turn off your phone during the event, and do not video or record any part of the event.
Prior to attending this event, visit Simon Hay's website, read all the information there and the disclaimer in its entirety. Thank you.

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Magical Dragonflies, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - October, Social Sewing Saturday - October
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts!

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)

description:
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars
Tap for Healing Trauma & the Nervous system
Our nervous system is shaped by more than just big life events — hidden wounds and micro-traumas from childhood can leave lasting imprints that show up as stress, anxiety, and repeating relationship patterns. When triggered, these unconscious “programs” hijack our reactions, leaving us feeling stuck even when we want to move forward. In this workshop, we’ll explore how trauma influences the nervous system and why awareness alone isn’t enough to create lasting change.
In this 75 minute workshop, you’ll discover how trauma impacts the nervous system and learn FasterEFT tools to release triggers, reframe old memories, and reset your stress response. You’ll walk away with simple, science-backed practices you can use every day to build resilience and emotional freedom.
“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others. It’s a powerful reminder that, beneath the surface, we generally share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”
Meet your host, Krishnaloka
Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.


6.15pm Tuesday 7th of October
End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.
Tickets available here~ bit.ly/eventTickets
Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz

description:
Friends AGM with guest speakers, Join the Friends of Wellington Botanic Garden for our Annual General Meeting and a pair of inspiring botanical presentations. You don’t have to be a member to attend — everyone’s invited!
Programme
Each presentation is 30 minutes, with time for questions.
Paul Bell-Butler
Botanist and PhD candidate, Paul is delving into the hidden world of leafy liverworts (family Lophocoleaceae). His research combines modern molecular techniques with traditional botany to reveal how these overlooked plants shape ecosystems and influence seed germination.
Clare Shearman
Plant Collection Team Manager at Wellington Botanic Garden, Clare brings a career spanning historic English estates to iconic New Zealand gardens. Fresh from the prestigious Longwood Gardens Fellows program in the USA, she shares insights into garden design, conservation, and how public gardens nurture wellbeing and connection.
Come along to hear their stories, celebrate our beautiful gardens, and meet fellow plant enthusiasts.
Located in the Treehouse Seminar Room, Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.
For more info about the Friends: https://friendsofthewellingtonbotanic.wordpress.com/

description:
Wellington Maritime Sail Heritage Exhibition, Wellington Maritime Sail Heritage Exhibition
Petone's seaside art & gift gallery will host an art exhibition of Wellington’s rich maritime sail history including Pamir, Bolton, Huia, Echo & settler ships

The exhibition will feature oil paintings and prints by guest artist, Paul Deacon from Nelson.

Paul is a world renown marine artist particularly well known for his skill and knowledge of sailing ships and has especially painted some magnificent new paintings for this exhibition. Included will be paintings of some of Wellington’s favourite sailing ships as well as a selection of first settler ships and later immigrant ships.

Gallery owner, Alfred Memelink, will also exhibit a selection of watercolours and prints alongside Paul's masterpieces.


Gallery Opening Hours during the festival are Tuesday to Sunday 10.30am - 4pm
Cost: Free

description:
Pebble - Love In Every City, Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.
Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Unity Book Club October 2025 | Cursed Daughters, About the book: 
No man will call your house his home. And if they try, they will not have peace...

So goes the family curse, long handed down from generation to generation, ruining families and breaking hearts. And now it's Eniiyi's turn - who, due to her uncanny resemblance to her dead aunt, Monife, is already used to her family's strange beliefs, as well as their insistence that she is a reincarnation. Still, when she falls in love with the handsome boy she saves from drowning, she can no longer run from her family's history. Is she destined to live out the habitual story of love and heartbreak, or can she escape the family curse and the mysterious fate that befell her aunt?

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In October we will be discussing Cursed Daughters by Oyinkan Braithwaite.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Unity Book Club September 2025 | Flesh, About the book: 
A propulsive, hypnotic novel about a man who is unravelled by a series of events beyond his grasp.
Fifteen-year-old István lives with his mother in a quiet apartment complex in Hungary. New to the town and shy, he is unfamiliar with the social rituals at school and soon becomes isolated, with his neighbour – a married woman close to his mother’s age – as his only companion. These encounters shift into a clandestine relationship that István himself can barely understand, and his life soon spirals out of control.
As the years pass, he is carried gradually upwards on the twenty-first century’s tides of money and power, moving from the army to the company of London’s super-rich, with his own competing impulses for love, intimacy, status and wealth winning him unimaginable riches, until they threaten to undo him completely.
Spare and penetrating, Flesh is the finest novel yet by a master of realism, asking profound questions about what drives a life: what makes it worth living, and what breaks it.

Melissa and Eden will be hosting our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.

In September we will be discussing Flesh by David Szalay.

We have limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner rather then later and tell your friends and whānau.

Drinks and snacks provided. If you have any specific allergies, let us know and send an email.

If you have any further queries send us an email to wellington@unitybooks.co.nz and address it to Melissa.

WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL, WSKN Christmas Event / SKISL
Hi everyone - welcome to the WSKN Christmas SKISL / Paddle to Mana!

On Saturday 13th December we will have a Christmas event on Mana Island, departing Titahi Bay at 10am (so arriving at 9:30) getting to Mana around 10:40, keen ones can do stuff prior to lunch around 12:00, then there might be groups that head back at different time slots, but we can work that out on the day. Return could therefore either be 1:30 or 2:30 with the latest return to Titahi Bay being 3pm.

We've made this event later than the normal SKISL so that it's easier for folks to drive down from Palmerston North, and also because it is a lunch event.

The lawn on Mana is really nice, sheltered and pleasant and there are also good walks. Mana is of course a sanctuary so you must check your boats for any wildlife especially ants that may have gotten in past the hatches. Also we cannot have any fires

Plan B: If weather nukes Mana, we'll try for Green Point or Onehunga Bay in Whitireia Park by driving there.

Plan C: We will postpone to 21 December
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
The Waikanae Beach Monthly Indoor Market, Enjoy a Sunday outing with your family by visiting this great Community Market where you will discover handmade treasures and local creativity by highly talented stallholders where every piece tells a story.

You will find a huge variety of quality items and GIFTS plus local natural Honey, Prenzels, Oils and Sauces.

Bring the Kids along so they can meet local author Michael Peryer and view his latest Children's Adventure Books. Jane will also be there with her hand made Crochet Toys along with Helen and her incredible range of Children's Dress Ups and Dolls Clothes.

Meet up with Friends and enjoy a day out on the Kapiti Coast and visit this great friendly Community Market then spend the rest of the day at other events and attractions including a visit to our awesome cafes.

Don't miss it... support local!
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!", Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Brush up on your Tequila knowledge and your Salsa recipes because the next Wellington Cocktail Competition is just around the corner!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “Tequila and Salsa food pairing” The hero spirit this time around will be a surprise tequila on the night, but I can tell you it will be a reposado. The catch is, you have to pair it with a salsa that you make yourself. There are no limits on the style of cocktail you want this time around, so get creative!
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan ASAp as we were running low on time to organize this time around.
Minimum 30ml of Tequila must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two drinks for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make two servings of your cocktail and serve your salsa.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 28th of September and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Tequila and corn chips for your salsa will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus and sugar syrup. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the winner.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!

description:

The role of school boards

description:
Wairarapa Social, Fancy catching up?
I'd love to see our Wairarapa members get together more regularly. I thought we'd start with a social and work our way up from there. Jill Murphy and I both attended conference which was an absolute blast and hoping we can share a little about that.  I've stepped down from the National Executive and am looking forward to catching up locally more often.
Free for all CANZ members, pay your own way for meal and drinks.
Look forward to seeing you there!
Arohanui, na Rachel
Past President for Celebrants Aotearoa
(Note: When selecting a CANZ Member ticket for this event at checkout, you are going to need your CANZ membership number. To locate your membership number, log onto the CANZ Website, select your profile in the top right-hand corner, your membership number will be displayed underneath your name.)

Bring your friends and whānau along for a Nixmas like no other as the Phoenix men take on the Central Coast Mariners. With kick-off at 3pm, it’s the perfect way to spend a summer afternoon full of football, fun, and festive cheer.
Let’s pack the stands, lift the noise, and make this a Nixmas to remember! Get your tickets now.

description:
Tough Guy Book Club - Lower Hutt NZ Chapter, Join us for the Lower Hutt NZ Chapter of Tough Guy Book Club.
You can find out this month's book here https://toughguybookclub.com/books
If you have the chance, try to pick up the book and read a couple of pages before the night. If you haven’t, come anyway, no one gives a damn. We are not your boss.
If you got one, make sure to bring your copy of the books down, it’ll help you talk about bits of it, we suggest underlining stuff that sticks out to you as important.
Also like all months, we will be announcing next month’s book at the meeting and handing them out to those of you who were wise enough to pre-order last month.
See you there.
Want to know more about Tough Guy Book Club? Read this -
http://toughguybookclub.com/about-us

description:
Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s, Stitch & Butch @ Blondini’s!
A casual meet up of crafters within the rainbow community
New members welcome.
Bring your knitting/crochet/cross stitch/embroidery/crafting/art or just come and have a chat.
Feel free to come partway through the time or leave early as needed.
Stitch and butch is a playful twist on the stitch and b!tch name to reflect the queerness of the group. Attendees do not need to be in any particular subset of the queer community to be welcome.
Usually gathered around one of the tables in the lounge area upstairs. Often near the walls for the brighter lights to better see our stitches.
There is a lift as well as stairs and Courtenay place bus stops across the road.
Held on the 2nd and 4th Mondays of the month with a summer break.

Perfect your writing skills with Andrew Thomson of The Academy of Dramatic Arts. In this workshop tamariki will work in small groups to write a script based on a one-page prompt. You bring the enthusiasm and creativity, we bring the pencils!
label: Family Friendly

description:
Draw It Out - Adults workshop 25 Nov, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.
Theme: Re-finding your spark
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop focuses on the theme of re-finding your spark, and connecting to what it is that is driving you. Great if going through change or curious about something new.
Date
This is a single workshop
6.30pm-8.00pm
Tuesday 25 November
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
WOW Train VIP Experience ex Christchurch : SOLD OUT, Transcend the ordinary on a journey like no other, to a show like no other. This extraordinary experience brings you the Greatest Stages on Earth.

Departing Friday 26 September, 2025

Beginning in Christchurch or Kaikoura, you'll witness the unique landscapes of the pacific coastline aboard the Coastal Pacific WOW Train and Interislander Ferry. A very special service, full of all things WOW, you'll be treated to a VIP welcome, special WOW garment appearances with an accompanying commentary, a WOW goodie bag and full catering during your journey. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into extraordinary with a Gold ticket to see the 2025 World of WearableArt (WOW) Show. This is a WOW experience like no other!

You'll love this break
If you are looking for the ultimate WOW Show experience, then this is the ticket!

Indulge your senses with a unique WOW Train experience, journeying along the coastline and over the strait past marine habitats aboard the Coastal Pacific and Interislander. In Wellington, you will continue your journey into the extraordinary with the Gold ticket to see the World of WearableArt Show.

This magical 3-day experience is set to be one of the greatest journeys of all time!

Inclusions
A 'Gold' ticket for the WOW Show performance on Saturday 27 September and a WOW Show Programme
Exclusive WOW Train aboard the Coastal Pacific (where everyone on board will be going to WOW in Wellington!) and VIP Ferry journey on the Interislander on 26 September
Onboard WOW entertainment and a goodie bag
Morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea aboard the train
2-nights accommodation including breakfast
Hotel transfer
Return flight with Air New Zealand
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae - Midnight Kitty, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Waikanae! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wellington Frocktails 2025, Wellington Frocktails 2025
Frocktails: a night of sewcialising, cocktails, delicious snacks and fantastic me-mades!

About this Event

Wellington Frocktails, with our headline sponsor The Fabric Store, celebrates the making of garments. Whether you sew, knit, crochet or stitch, September 6th is the evening to show off your proudest make! Frocktails is a worldwide movement, celebrating me-mades for over 10 years.
Mingle with new sewing friends and say cheers over a shared passion of this craft. Whether you're an expert or beginner, this event is for you.
Included in the ticket price is a welcome cocktail (or non-alcoholic beverage), second beverage, light refreshments, a goodie bag and the chance to win one of the many sewing related prizes. A photographer will be on hand to capture the event and all of your wonderful me-mades! With exclusive use of the venue, the option to purchase other beverages will be available.
You will need to be 18+ to attend this event.

Please note: A photographer is present at this event. Photos taken may be used for marketing purposes in future event promotions
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Watercolour and Wine Night in Wellington - Midnight Kitty, Turn wine into watercolour! Take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other, and let’s paint a watercolour masterpiece!
Join us for a beginner's watercolour painting event full of fluid colour mixing and delicate brushwork where you’ll craft your own bespoke watercolour artwork. One of our watercolour experts will guide step-by-step through the watercolour process and will encourage you to add your own unique touch.
Drinks: No drinks are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.
Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.
What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!
We provide all the materials you need (high-quality watercolour paper, watercolour paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). All our events are in licensed venues, so you can purchase drinks to sip as you create! At the end of the night, you will leave with your own watercolour painting!
For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to
[[https://paintvine.co.nz/]

description:
Yu-Gi-Oh!: Saturday Genesys Format (100pt) @ Cerberus Games, WHAT IS GENESYS?
The Genesys rules are simple:
No Link Monsters or Pendulum Monsters are allowed. All other cards are allowed. The original field layout is used, with no Extra Monster Zones nor Pendulum Zones.
The standard Forbidden & Limited Cards list is not used. All those cards can be used, except Link Monsters and Pendulum Monsters. Usual limit of 3 copies max of any card still applies.
Deck construction uses a point system. Some cards are assigned a point value; most cards cost zero points. The total point cost of cards in your Main Deck, Extra Deck, and Side Deck (combined) cannot exceed the point cap for that event.
Here are the details:
Start Time: 12:00pm
Entry Fee: $15
Format: 100pt Genesys (3-4 Rounds)
Format details including points lists can be found here:
https://www.yugioh-card.com/en/genesys/
Prizing:
Each player receives an OTS Tournament Pack on entry. One Core/Deck Builder Booster Pack is added for each player to the top placers prize pool.

description:
💃🕺 October Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺, 💃🕺 October Salsa Hutt Dance Party 💃🕺
Daylight Saving is here (with more lovely sunlight!) so we're starting 30mins later - at 7:30pm 💃🕺😁

Come dance the night away with your like-minded friends, and loads of classic Salsa songs from years ago, as well as a “dash” of Bachata and a “sprinkling” of Kizomba…..

• One fantastic wooden dance floor with a mix of Salsa, Bachata, and Kizomba music

• Easy to find venue off a main street in Petone (72 Cuba St)

• Plenty of parking in surrounding streets

• On main bus routes (#83 from Wellington, or #110 from Upper Hutt), or short 8min walk from Ava Train Station

• Water station provided however bringing your own water drink bottle is recommended. Also, BYO soft drinks, fruit juices, non-alcohol drinks, etc. (NB/ No alcohol allowed on premises!)

• Please wear high heel/stiletto caps to prevent damage to the venue’s wooden floor – For example, from https://www.beclickless.com/pages/faqs

• Only goes until 10pm so get there early to have a decent "fix" of dancing and socialising 😊

• Only $10.00 at the door (cash), or bank transfer (preferably at least 24 hours in advance):

Account: 06-0507-0092784-05
Account Name: Kasia L Wypych
Particulars/Code/Reference: “Your 1st and last name” - Salsa Hutt – “date of Salsa Hutt party”
******* (If you have prepaid on the night, please take a screenshot and show proof of payment at the door).

• Invite your friends to this event…and see you there! 😊

Corner of Cuba and High Sts, Petone, Lower Hutt (Entrance from High St)

description:
Trap-NZ Workshop, Trap-NZ Workshop
Join us for a hands-on workshop that empowers you to make a difference in your backyard and beyond!



Whether you're a seasoned trapper or just starting out, this free community event will teach you how to use TRAP NZ, New Zealand’s leading predator control platform.



Reino Grundling will show you how to track pests, record trap data, and support conservation efforts that protect our precious native species like kiwi, tūī, and kererū.

📍 Where: Carterton Courthouse, Holloway Street Carterton
📅 When: Saturday 20 September 2025 10am -12 noon
🎟️ Cost: Free
🧰 Bring: Smartphone or tablet (if you have one), enthusiasm, and questions!

What you'll gain:

Tips for setting and managing traps effectively

Skills to use TRAP NZ for recording and reporting activity

Knowledge about the impact of predator control on local biodiversity

Connections with like-minded conservation champions

🌱 Let’s work together to protect what makes Aotearoa unique. Light refreshments provided. This workshop is made possible with funding from WBS.

Spots are limited — register now by emailing

description:
Spring Floral Display Accessible Self-Drive Tour, Spring Floral Display Accessible Self-Drive Tour
Gather your friends, whānau, or neighbours who might find it tricky to access the gardens, and enjoy a relaxing, self-guided drive through a spectacular spring floral display at Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.

Simply drive along the one-way route past the Display Garden and soak in the colours of tulips, forget-me-nots, dianthus, primulas, chrysanthemums, daffodils, and more.

How it works:
• No registration needed — just turn up and enter through the Glenmore Street gates.
• Follow the designated one-way route through the gardens, keeping within your vehicle at all times.
• Exit through the West/White Gate to return to Glenmore Street.
• Feel free to enjoy the route as many times as you like during opening hours.

Please note:
• Drive slowly (maximum 10 km/h), and watch carefully for pedestrians, especially children.
• Stay in your vehicle for the entire tour to keep everyone safe and comfortable.
• Follow all signage and do not turn around within the garden grounds.

This event is self-guided and unstaffed. If you need assistance during your visit, please call 04 499 1400.
For enquiries, email or call 04 499 1400.


This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.
label: Community & Culture

description:
2025 Open Day and Plant Sale, Our annual open day with entry by donation and fundraising plant sale is always a popular event!
The house will be open 10am-4pm with entry by donation, including our current exhibition '75 Tinakori Road: 'This marvel had come to the lane".
From 10am plants from our garden raised by our wonderful volunteers will be sold as a fundraiser for Katherine Mansfield House & Garden. Plants priced from $5. Cash and card accepted, you may like to bring a box or bag to carry your plants home in.
At 11am Gabor Toth, local and New Zealand history specialist at Wellington City Libraries, will give a talk about Thorndon during the years Katherine Mansfield and her family lived on Tinakori Road.
Throughout the day you'll be able to see members of Wellington Urban Sketchers creating new works.
At 2pm the Wellington Embroiderers' Guild will host our monthly Stitching Circle, feel free to bring along your WIP (work in progress) and join in!
label: Markets & Fairs
