description:
Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington, Wesley Huff | Leaders Lunch | Wellington
This September Wesley Huff is joining Thinking Matters for the Truth Matters Tour in Dunedin, Christchurch, Wellington and full-day Conference in Auckland.

While in Wellington, he will be doing his only Christian Leaders Lunch.

Proceedings
Doors will open 11:15 am
11:30 am - the event will begin with a short powhiri/mihi whakatau
11:50 am - Kai
12:20 pm - Wes will present his talk and do q and a
1:30 pm - Conclusion of event
About Wesley Huff
Wesley Huff was born in Multan, Pakistan, and spent a portion of his childhood in the Middle East. After being diagnosed with a rare neurological condition at the age of eleven that left him paralyzed from the waist down, Wes experienced a miraculous recovery for which the doctors themselves had no medical explanation. This experience, along with a great deal of study and soul searching in his later teen years, solidified his interest in faith and in engaging the beliefs and worldview perspectives of others. He spent his high school years in Northern Ontario and currently lives in Toronto, Canada, with his wife and three children.

Wesley is currently the Central Canada Director for Apologetics Canada and has been a guest on a variety of public platforms, from The Joe Rogan Experience and Piers Morgan Uncensored, to Apologia Radio and Daily Dose of Wisdom. He has participated in numerous public dialogues, debates, and interfaith events on issues of belief and religion globally.

He holds a BA in sociology from York University, a Masters of Theological Studies from Tyndale University, and is currently doing a PhD in New Testament at the University of Toronto’s Wycliffe College.
label: Religion & Spirituality

description:
Sound Journey - WELLINGTON, Sound Journey - WELLINGTON
This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements.�A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.

VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN, VISIONING DAY RETREAT FOR WOMEN
Come and join Bryony from Heartsong Healing for a powerful Vision Board and Voice Empowerment workshop as we move through the energy of the Celtic festival of Beltane!

This is a Women's Retreat.

This workshop includes powerfully transformative Voice and Energy practices which support manifestation of your dreams and visions.

New dreams, new possibilities and celebrations, all seen within the light and power of this late Spring full moon. Invoke the Source of healing, growth and positive change and new beginnings.

#vsionboard #creativity #healing #specialtimes #transformation

JOIN US FOR A DAY OF DEEP CREATIVE DIVING INTO OUR VISIONS - with specially chosen and composed healing songs, chants, conscious sound practices.

These are enjoyed alongside intuitive drawing, collage and fully guided vision board creation. All of this will be held within a sacred space of Spiritual connection, ritual and energy work.

We will make this sacred space in our lives to explore, clarify and strengthen our visions for our lives, for our selves, for our fullest and highest embodiment on this beautiful and precious Earth.

Sunday 9th November 2025 10am-4.30pm

This special day retreat will draw on the strong astrological energies available at this time, connect with our Spirit teams and Angelic forces and channel in the creative and opening force of Blessing, Balance and Alignment.

Through valuing what we are harvesting in our lives we make space for the next step, the new direction, the new possibility.

Supported by meditation and a guided practice we will each create a new image or personal vision board to focus us and assist us in drawing new energies into our lives as we move further into the new year. We will then use wonderful voice and extremely powerful energy practices, and healing songs, to strengthen and empower them and bring them closer to manifestation.

The day includes a powerful group Reiki healing session, Specialized Voice exercises, supporting materials and follow up resources and support. You will be nourished with a delicious, healthy, fully organic lunch and refreshments

description:
Foundations of Leadership - Extended, The purpose of this course is to provide you with a solid foundation in leadership principles and practical skills to apply in real-world situations. 
By understanding these fundamental aspects, you will be better prepared to take on leadership roles and inspire your people. 
The course spans two days, covering eight modules that focus on the most important knowledge a new leader requires. These modules deliver hands-on skills rooted in leadership theory. 

Key audience
This course is suitable for people who are new to leadership and would like the theory and practice that provides a foundation for a successful leadership career. It is also beneficial for those who have been in a new role for a while that requires some leadership expertise. 

Learning outcomes
Understand the basic concepts of leadership
Develop effective communication skills as a leader
Learn how to confidently empower your people and build effective teams
Demonstrate good decision-making and problem-solving skills
Identify effective ways to manage conflict as a leader
Understand the importance of self-awareness and continuous development

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Course details
Duration: Two day, in person course.
Time: 9am–4pm, both days

Course includes:
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch, and afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends, Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.

Welcome to the 2025 New Zealand Road Relay Championships, a high-energy, baton-passing, van-cheering, team-powered race through the beautiful backroads of Manawatū.

Whether you’re chasing the podium or enjoying the journey with your crew, there's a relay for you:

⚡ Six-Leg (35km) – Social runners, clubs, workplaces – this one’s for everyone

The journey starts at the Feilding Clocktower and ends at the Halcombe Rugby Grounds, but the real magic happens in between.

Grab your crew. Pack the van. Let’s go racing.

description:
24-hour Squash Marathon for Wayne, 24 Hours on Court for Wayne.
This time I’m picking up my squash racket for a challenge like no other: 24 hours of nonstop squash. Why? Because someone I care for has been facing a far tougher battle.
My father-in-law was recently diagnosed with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL). For years he lived undiagnosed, pushing through symptoms without answers. Now that we finally know what he’s fighting, I want to turn my energy into something that can help him—and others—on their journeys.
According to CLL Advocates NZ, only 10-15 people out of 250 on average per year benefit from the budget allocation. And many are not even able to receive the same treatment options here in NZ.
Squash has always been a sport of endurance, resilience, and determination. Playing for 24 hours is my way of honoring his fight, raising awareness, and bringing people together to support the cause.
You can help by:
Donating: Any amount you would like to.
Predicting: Predicting how many points and games will be played in 24 hours.
Joining me on court: Book a slot to play a game, cheer from the sidelines, or come be part of the atmosphere.
Buy raffle tickets, or sponsor a prize towards the raffle.
We would like to give a shout out to our current sponsors;
Hair Phoria,
Aimee Photography,
X-Potential,
Mitchells,
Meaters,
CBD Eatery,
Forrest Wines and
Fat Tony's
No matter how small, your contribution will make a difference. Together we can transform his story of late diagnosis into one of community, awareness, and action.
I’ll be pushing myself through the night, but I won’t be alone—your support will keep me going with every serve, rally, and game. Let’s make this 24 hours count.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
2025 Road Relays, 2025 Road Relays
The ultimate team run is back! 🏃‍♀️🏃‍♂️💨

Welcome to the 2025 New Zealand Road Relay Championships, a high-energy, baton-passing, van-cheering, team-powered race through the beautiful backroads of Manawatū.

Whether you’re chasing the podium or enjoying the journey with your crew, there's a relay for you:

🚩 Seven-Leg (66km) – The senior championship race with hills, gravel, and serious bragging rights
⚡ Six-Leg (35km) – Social runners, clubs, workplaces – this one’s for everyone
🚶 Five-Leg Walk (31km) – Scenic, social, and seriously fun
🔥 Four-Leg (17km) – For our U16 legends and 70+ warriors

The journey starts at the Feilding Clocktower and ends at the Halcombe Rugby Grounds, but the real magic happens in between.

Grab your crew. Pack the van. Let’s go racing.

description:
2025 Corporate Challenge Wellington, Team work makes the dream work at Corporate Challenge Wellington! join us on Wednesday, 12th November for a fun-filled night of team building, fitness and friendly competition.
Nestled between Te Papa and Chaffers Dock, right in the centre of the city, our event HQ at Waitangi Park unlocks the gorgeous Wellington waterfront. The course takes in all the sights - Te Papa, Whairepo Lagoon and the Well_ngton sign - as it follows the wide public esplanade around the harbour. Views forever and usually (always) a decent wind to chase you to the finish line.
After you finish your 5k - running or walking a flat, two-lap course around the waterfront - grab a banana and water or sport drink before heading back to your tent to see how your mates did. The best performances of the day - plus our amazing team managers - are acknowledged at the Awards Cermony at 7:30pm. Spot prizes wrap up around 8pm and there's time to exchange war stories as you pack down.

description:
Blenheim Trail Runners Presents - Crush The Vernon - V2, Blenheim Trail Runners Presents - Crush The Vernon - V2
The Second coming of the "Crush the Vernon" Vert Day is just around the corner, We had such a great time last time and its smack bang into the point where everyone needs elevation for events so i thought it would be silly not to bring it back!

"Crush the Vernon" is a couple of fun endurance challeges to get us up into the Wither Hills for a big vert day!
This event will push you to the red line, boasting both as much high-level uphill suffering as you can possibly endure whilst building a steady accumulation of regret over 6 hours on the trails.
It’s an event that's built to stretch the boundaries of what you think you can do uphill, but overall, it’s a chance to get out there and have some fun, whether solo or in a team. Whilst there is some faster efforts needed to come out on top of any of these “disciplines”, the aim of the game is just to get out there and enjoy yourself at whatever pace suits you.

The added extra this time is not only an extra hour, explained below, but the plan is to tie this into the elevation for a group effort for a BTR Everest Challenge, more details around this when I can get a team entry together, but really keen to try and pudh the limits of what has been done before.

Details:
Date: 26th October - Backup date is the week after
Time: 6am-1pm - (1 hr per week it too Hialry to conquer everest!)
Location: The Wither Hills, Basecamp: Sutherland Stream picnic area - this will be where we have the whiteboard & a bit of an "Aid station/Bag drop" situation going on.

Disciplines:
- "Vernon Vert Masters" Highest total elevation (solo/team) - pretty self explanatory, but between the hours of 6 am- 1pm any elevation in the Wither hills farm park accumulated within these hours on this day (solo or in a team) counts towards your total for the “Total Elevation” part of the challenge

- “Crush the Covenant” loop (solo/team) - Crush the covenant Loop is a 3.75km, 300m vert loop running from Sutherland Stream Picnic Area to the Mt Vernon Summit & then back down again, the loops can be run in whichever direction you would like, just be aware that this is a 2-way track and there will be a bit more traffic than you would usually see up on it. The aim of the game here is to get as many laps in as possible between 6 am-1pm; this will also count toward your elevation total for the "Vernon Vert Masters"

The Basics:
- This is an open event to anyone who wants to participate
- The event is open from 6am-1pm - any elevation in the Wither hills farm park accumulated within these hours on this day counts towards your total for the “Total Elevation” part of the challenge
- We will have a basecamp/aid station at the Sutherland stream picnic spot. This will be the hub for the meet-up and the start/finish line for the laps of “Crush the Covenant”.
- No minimum time, you can start whenever you like in the 6 am-1pm timeframe and go for as long as you would like.
-You can do as many laps/summits/cumulative elevation as you like/can within the timeframe.
- Teams - Teams can be between 2-5 people for the overall elevation challenge, and your total elevation will be your total accumulated. You will need to pre-register your team with Mikey before the day so that we can have you on the scoreboard.
- You will need to confirm your solo/teams total elevation with Basecamp by 1.30pm on the day, in person. If you are unable to do this for whatever reason, you will need to confirm and prove details via message or screenshots so we can add them to the total tally.


Who's up for some hills?



Disclaimer
We at Blenheim Trail Runners don’t see ourselves as event organisers and as such, do not have any consent or insurance; we deem this as a “Club Meet-up”.
With that, the expectation is that you are 100% responsible for yourself and take part at your own risk.
Be aware, as this isn't a formal event, there won't be any official timekeeping, marshals or trail markers. There will be DIY DIY-type whiteboard to note down your shared laps & elevation, and we will provide details via trail maps for the “Crush the Covenant” loop.
We are unable to provide any/can not be held responsible for: Urgent medical attention (we will however, assist wherever possible, there will be a first aid kit at base camp), nutrition, hydration ( there is public access throughout the hills and in two points on the “crush the Covenant” loop), the condition of the trail on the day or the weather.
label: Sports & Fitness

AIDA Freediving New Zealand Pool Nationals 2025, AIDA Freediving New Zealand Pool Nationals 2025
The Lazy Seals Freediving Club is proud to host the AIDA Freediving New Zealand Pool Nationals 2025 at Te Ngaengae Pool, Wellington

Dave the dates for competition, sign up will open shortly.

Don't want to compete? Volunteers are always welcome, as is billeting, get int ouch if you can help with these.

The competition will comprise three sessions over three days:

Friday 19 September: Statics (STA), with athelete's briefing in the morning

Saturday 20 September: Morning Dynamic with Fins (DYN/DYNB) in the 50m Main Pool

Sunday 21 September: Morning Dynamic No Fins (DNF) in the 25m Main Pool

FNZ Club Members
Recreational Grade – $115 Early Bird / $150
AIDA Grade – $130 Early Bird / $165

Non-FNZ Club Members
AIDA Grade – $155 Early Bird / $190

Entries close on 12th September 2025. To enter, you have to be 16 years old or older.

The competition will be in Lower Hutt, Wellington, at Te Ngaengae Pool at 12 Everest Avenue, Naenae. This new, bigger facility was reopened in December 2024 and boasts a 50m Olympic pool with two moveable bulkheads.

Sign up for the rec grade here: https://lazyseal.helloclub.com/public/event/6870f53876ccded11d1abb28/aida-fnz-pool-nationals-2025-rec-grade?fbclid=IwY2xjawLgEs1leHRuA2FlbQIxMABicmlkETF3d01nRkVnOU9LOGt1MlJmAR4pTdwmJJdOghxZuHqciJnPaTNWCmjq7rwQqlLOerilnzlIqi9TP2Tb2zgP1A_aem_n6rStLtYNHoE_28h4Z3Vbw

Our games are designed for teenagers and adults. Younger kids can play along with the rest of the family , but we don't take bookings for groups of under 12's.

This offer is only available Monday to Friday, from Monday 22nd September to 3rd October 2025 .

Visit https://escaperoomswellington.com to check availability and make a booking.

Normal pricing applies at weekends. ie $38 per adult and $28 per child.

description:
ELIXIR CLOSING Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition VII x WCC x Diplomatico Rum, 𝐈𝐭’𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐚𝐬𝐭 𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐥, 𝐥𝐞𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐝𝐬 — 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐰𝐞’𝐫𝐞 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐚 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐠.
For the SEVENTH consecutive year, we're bringing back our legendary Blindfolded Daiquiri Competition and YOU are all invited!
Calling all movers, shakers, and daiquiri dream-makers: your mission is simple…
Make the best daiquiri. While blindfolded. In 60 seconds. In front of a crowd. No pressure.
After almost four years of shaking, stirring, caffeinating, feeding, and occasionally corrupting Wellington, Elixir Cocktail Apotheke is throwing a glorious, FINAL 𝐁𝐋𝐈𝐍𝐃𝐅𝐎𝐋𝐃𝐄𝐃 𝐃𝐀𝐈𝐐𝐔𝐈𝐑𝐈 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐏𝐄𝐓𝐈𝐓𝐈𝐎𝐍 before we ride off into the cocktail sunset.
This year, we are pairing up with 𝐃𝐢𝐩𝐥𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐨 𝐑𝐮𝐦, courtesy of 𝐇𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐬 AND the 𝐖𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐂𝐨𝐜𝐤𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐂𝐥𝐮𝐛
https://www.facebook.com/groups/246872129390986
Competitors will be given four mystery spirits, juices, and sugars in unmarked bottles, pick their fight song, then step up and shake like the future of cocktails depends on it.
Expect some Elixir closing-party nonsense: specials galore, questionable games, family pricing, and memories to last.
There’ll be laughter, probably some tears, and definitely some questionable dance moves. This is our last hurrah — one more night to raise a glass, hail Satan, and make some chaos together.
𝐒𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚𝐧 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐝𝐞𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐬
𝐖𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐩𝐞𝐚𝐭, 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧 𝐮𝐩𝐬 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐨𝐨𝐧, 𝐬𝐨 𝐤𝐞𝐞𝐩 𝐚 𝐠𝐨𝐝𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐧 𝐜𝐥𝐨𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐲𝐞 𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐩𝐚𝐠𝐞.
𝑭𝒆𝒓𝒏𝒆𝒕 𝒊𝒔 𝒃𝒊𝒕𝒕𝒆𝒓,
𝑪𝒖𝒓𝒂𝒄𝒂𝒐 𝒎𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕 𝒃𝒆 𝒃𝒍𝒖𝒆,
𝑾𝒆'𝒓𝒆 𝒉𝒚𝒑𝒆𝒅 𝒇𝒐𝒓 𝒕𝒉𝒆 𝒏𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕

description:
Bunnings Warehouse NPC: Lions v Bay of Plenty, Bunnings Warehouse NPC: Lions v Bay of Plenty
Don’t miss this one! The Wellington Lions face Bay of Plenty in a rematch of last year’s epic final, this time at Porirua Park. With their last two clashes locked after 80 minutes, this round robin match is bound to be a ripper!


GATES OPEN: 1:00pm
KICK OFF: Wellington Lions vs Bay of Plenty - 2:05pm


SHUTTLE BUSES: Skip the parking hassle and jump on our FREE Rambler shuttle bus to the next three Lions home games at Porirua Park. Take the bus and be into win awesome golf spot prizes from The Morgans Golf Course & Judgeford Golf Club. Buses will run from the eastside of the Porirua train station to Porirua Park commencing at 1:00pm, 1:20pm and 1:40pm. Buses will loop from Porirua Park to Porirua train station for one hour following the game.

Get ready for one of the most popular events on our calendar – Dads Drags is back!
A fun day out where first-timers, regular racers, families, and fans all come together for a relaxed but action-packed day at the strip. Bring the daily driver or your classic or muscle car - you don't have to have a fast car to win! So long as it has a current WoF and Rego, a helmet (see links below for info) you can race all day!

Gate entry: Adults $20
14 years & under free (bring the kids!)

Full day of racing action, plus a great atmosphere for Father’s Day.

Racer Info:
Race entry: $50
Day licence available for $30 (if you don’t already hold a current licence)
Passenger rides allowed – you’ll need a completed passenger form, $20 per passenger.

Everyone racing (including passengers) must wear a compliant helmet, long sleeves, long pants, and enclosed shoes.

If you’re new to drag racing, check out our Getting Started guide on the website – it has all the details you’ll need to know before race day.

Hot Rod & Classic Car Display:
Preferential parking is available for hot rods and classics – roll up and be part of the show in the pits and display area.

Make this Father’s Day one to remember – whether you’re on the start line, riding shotgun, or watching from the stands, Dads Drags is the place to be this Fathers Day!

Te Papa Foundation Gala, Te Papa Foundation Gala
Wellington’s premier fundraising event, the Te Papa Foundation Gala brings together Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading supporters of arts and culture for one spectacular night in the museum.

🖼️ Enjoy handcrafted cocktails, discover new favourites in the Toi Art galleries, savour an exquisite three-course dinner paired with premium local wines, bid in our live charity auction, and then dance to live performances from acclaimed local musicians.

👋🏼Thanks to Webb’s, the Gala features a special live auction of once-in-a-lifetime experiences, including Sake & sushi with Dick Frizzell, a stunning carving by Tim Steel (Ngāi Tahu), and luxury escapes.

🎟️Tickets cost $3,000 for a table of ten, or $300 per person.

🌱All proceeds from the Gala supports Te Papa’s work across art, culture, history, science, and nature, ensuring that our much-loved national museum continues to thrive for generations to come.

💸Can’t make it? Our digital auction will be hosted by Webb’s from 28 August until 10 September. More information at tepapa.nz/gala.

description:
Lampshade Making, Liven up your living room or bedroom with your own drum lampshade - get that professional finish, even if you have no previous sewing experience.

Description
Come along and learn how to make your very own drum-shaped lampshade – a classic style very much on trend at the moment

Bring up to $40 cash to pay the tutor for the lampshade frame and other materials.

You will also need to bring 1 metre of a firm fabric of your choice (a patterned fabric with a light background is effective in reflecting the light), a pair of fabric scissors, measuring tape, tailors' chalk and a 30cm ruler.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll be able to:
- Mark and cut out the shape of the lampshade onto the backing
- Sew or glue seams of the fabric
- Attach the fabric to the frame

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Inter-Club Football Match: 30th Anniversary of the Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy, This year marks the 30th anniversary of the annual football game between Club Garibaldi (Wellington) and Club Italia (Nelson).
We would like to invite past and present players to be a part of this event.
Please save the date. Details to follow in due course, including the time and location of the game and the after match function.
***
Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Wellington NZIPP Annual 10-10-10 Evening, The annual 10-10-10 NZIPP evening is a wonderfully varied and fascinating look at photography from around the Wellington region.

Ten photographers. Ten images. Ten minutes.

You’ll hear from ten photographers for ten minutes each, showcasing ten images from their portfolio. It’s an engaging show-and-tell style night, with something for anyone interested in photography.

Join us from 6.30pm for a 7pm start at the Penthouse Cinema in Brooklyn. There will be a short break halfway through for pizza, with non-alcoholic drinks provided and buy-your-own alcoholic beverage options from the Penthouse bar.

We’ll be introducing this year’s presenters one by one, so keep an eye on our Facebook page for details.

The evening is always popular, so make sure you register to reserve your ticket and encourage your friends too. We’d love to fill the cinema for our ten photographers!

This is an awesome social occasion for the NZIPP and wider photography community.

description:
Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026, Kāpiti Run for Youth 2026
We’ve checked the tide timetable – Anchor your calendar now to take part in the 2026 Web Genius Kāpiti Run for Youth on Sunday 29 March 2026 – Raising funds for rangatahi in Kāpiti since 2011 while having fun strolling or running along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Kāpiti Run for Youth is a lively, family-friendly event focused on fostering community spirit and supporting organisations that encourage and uplift local young people. RAIN or SHINE, get ready to have fun!

We know Kāpiti Run for Youth helps to support amazing community work done by local fundraising partners. We have 13 incredible fundraising partners you can choose to support and raise funds for. We are very proud of them all and the work they do to uplift the youth of Kāpiti. Each partner brings something unique to the table, from providing essential resources and mentorship to creating spaces where young people can thrive. By supporting rangatahi through education, creativity, employment, and well-being initiatives, they ensure our youth are not just supported but empowered to reach their full potential. Our partners are creating a brighter tomorrow for the young people of Kāpiti!

In the beginning Kāpiti Run for Youth was created by Web Genius as their way as a local business to ‘give back’ to the community so, more than a decade on we can proudly say the event is sustainable and is popular with all sorts, young and old, the fit and not so fit. Kāpiti Run for Youth has raised $280,003 for rangatahi since inception in 2011. In 2025 the event raised $25,531 which was remarkable.

Kāpiti Run for Youth will be open for sign up early in January 2026 >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/signup

At that time, we will be seeking individuals and teams to get together to walk or run from Paraparaumu Beach (Maclean Park) to Raumati Beach and back. For those choosing the 12km walk or run, they will do two circuits of the course.

Choose your adventure – a 6km or 12km run or walk along the beautiful Kāpiti coastline. Whether it's a leisurely stroll or a mad dash to be the first across the finish, you choose the event that suits you best, and which of our amazing fundraising partners you're going to raise funds for. On race day grab your dog and your mates and head down to the beach for fun, family and fitness. Registration takes place from 8.30am to 9.45am with a briefing at 9.45am and all walkers and runners starting together at 10am.

Once your profile is set-up online, let your family, friends and work mates know so they can sponsor your efforts. We encourage every participant to raise $20 through sponsorship instead of paying an entry fee. All entrants receive regular campaigns to motivate their sponsorship efforts along the way.

Kāpiti Run for Youth prides itself on being a sustainable, family-friendly event that is all about supporting each other and having fun. Join your community for a feel-good morning on the beach. Your fundraising makes a difference in the lives of our young people! BYO sunhat, sunscreen, and water on the day, and there are sponsored spot prizes, treats for the kids, certificates for participating and free Paekākāriki Mini Pops for everyone at the end.

Checkout our FAQs over on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/faqs

Closer to the event, go to our website to sign up or sponsor someone that you know who is participating >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/search

All registrations and sponsorship are handled securely and confidentially on the Kāpiti Run for Youth website that is powered by Raisley and supported by Stripe online payments.

---------------------------------------------

BUSINESS SPONSORSHIP
Platinum $1,000+, Gold $500, Silver $250, Bronze $125 is available for businesses who want to support the underlying work of this event and rangatahi youth of Kāpiti. In 2025 we were grateful to 58 local business sponsors to the value of $15,125 that can be viewed on our website >> https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/sponsors

Sponsorship for the 2026 campaign will open late in January 2026

---------------------------------------------

FUNDRAISING MODEL
We focus on returning as much money as we can back to the Kāpiti community to those working with rangatahi. All funds raised are split 70% to the official Fundraising Partner chosen by the participant at the time of registration and 30% is retained towards running and promotion of the event.

FUNDRAISING PARTNERS
Birthright Kāpiti, Challenge for Change Kāpiti, Kāpiti Basketball Association, Kāpiti College, Kāpiti Kindness Trust, Kāpiti Youth Support, No 49 Squadron Air Cadets Kāpiti, Ōtaki College, Paraparaumu College, The Shed Project Kāpiti, Whirlwind Kāpiti, Work Ready Kāpiti, ZEAL Kāpiti >>
https://www.kapitirunforyouth.co.nz/fundraising-partners

---------------------------------------------

WELLNESS UPDATE
We operate within the Event Sector Voluntary Code. Please don’t attend if you are feeling unwell.

REGISTRATION DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth carries comprehensive Public Liability event insurance for a period of 48 hours that includes set-up, pack-down and during the event. We maintain an Accident & Incident Register at the Registration Gazebo and local GP, Paraparaumu Medical Centre, handle any medical emergency on the day of the event. We dial 111 if there is an incident beyond their resources.

We remind participants to take self-responsibility and those they are with when on the beach course and to alert officials as needed. It is important to listen to all instructions given on the day of the event at the pre-course briefing, and to report any incidents however minor they may seem. To report an incident, dial 027 244 9585.

PHOTOGRAPHY DISCLAIMER
Kāpiti Run for Youth reserves the right to use any image captured by our official photographer for promotional purposes in any media, in perpetuity without compensation, unless not consented.

---------------------------------------------

IN-KIND EVENT SPONSORS
24/7 Fitness, Beach FM, Captured By Friday Photography, Coffee to Die For, Kāpiti Business Projects, Kāpiti Chocolate Factory, Kāpiti Law, Kāpiti Party Hire, NZME, Paekākāriki Pops, Peter Jackson Plumbing, R-Line, Shoe Clinic, SignCraft Kāpiti, Speedy Signs Kāpiti-Porirua, Wellington Water Filters & Kāpiti Pure Water and Founder, Web Genius.

CAMPAIGN MANAGER:
Helene Judge | 027 244 9585

description:
NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series- 2025 Round 4 - Faultline Wellington, Get your gains in the capital for the NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series grand finale. NiBS at Faultline in 2024 was the biggest climbing event ever in NZ so don’t miss out.
The NZAC National Indoor Bouldering Series is all about having fun and giving it a go! Whether it’s your first climbing competition or you're a seasoned pro, you'll find challenges suited to your skill and confidence level, all within a friendly and supportive atmosphere.
Once the self-scored main rounds are done, the top 6 ranked female and male competitors in the open category advance to the finals. This is where the energy and music volume ramp up and we get to witness some incredible climbing from the best in the game.
Summary of Changes in 2025
- New online registration and scoring platform
- Scoring change, points awarded to each boulder divided by the number of successful tops
- Age group changes to reflect IFSC categories
- Finals format updated to 2025 IFSC Boulder rules
- Youth round (U11, U13, and U15 and caregivers) on Sunday morning
Please read the rules and info page below for more details on the changes: https://www.nibs.nz/rules-and-info
Don't forget to unleash your creative genius and set your own route using our amazing new logo! Try it here:
https://www.nibs.nz/routesetter

description:
Leadership Play Day - Wellington, Leadership Play Day: Wellington 17th October 2025
Friday 17th October 2025 | 8:30am–5:00pm
Location: Nairn Street Cottage, 68 Nairn Street, Mount Cook, Wellington 6011

What this day is all about
Leadership Play Day is a full-day, game-based learning experience that takes leadership development out of the boardroom and into play. Instead of being talked at with boring slides, you’ll step into three carefully designed games that let you actually practice leadership.
You’ll be experimenting, problem-solving, laughing (a lot), and walking away with insights that stick because you’ve lived them, not just heard them.
This isn’t theory. It’s leadership in action.
Learn more at our website.
How it works
The day is made up of three 2-hour games. You can book individual sessions ($99 each), or join us for the full day ($297) to play all three and unlock The Leadership Playbook - a bonus 60-minute facilitated debrief where we connect the dots and help you take away a clear set of personal leadership shifts.
Here’s what’s on in Wellington:
The Moonlit Market (8:30–10:30am)
Pitch, trade, and negotiate under pressure. Build agility, creativity, and bold decision-making in a playful, high-energy marketplace.
The Broken Bridge (11:00am–1:00pm)
A fantasy quest to practice difficult conversations. Explore courage, clarity, and how you show up when the stakes feel high.
The Inner Tides (1:45–3:45pm)
Use the Emotional Culture Deck in a role-playing game to strengthen emotional awareness, resilience, and confidence in leading with empathy.
The Leadership Playbook (4:00–5:00pm)
Available only with a full-day pass. A guided reflection session to connect your learning, extract insights, and leave with a practical playbook you can use back at work.
Why you should join
Practical skills, not theory - you’ll walk away with tools and insights you can use immediately.
Safe practice, real challenges - rehearse tough moments without real-world consequences.
Energy + engagement - no sitting back, you’ll be on your feet, in the mix, learning by doing.
Unique approach - game-based leadership development you won’t find anywhere else in NZ.
Whether you’re a leader, facilitator, HR/People professional, or just someone curious about growing your leadership edge - this day is designed for you.
Tickets
Individual game session: $99
Full day pass (all 3 games + Leadership Playbook debrief): $297
👉 Ready to roll the dice on your leadership?

Spots are limited - grab your ticket today.

description:
Porirua Parkrun, What is Porirua parkrun? It is a free 5km walk or run event - It’s not about coming first or winning. You can go at your own pace and just enjoy being with other people. It is inclusive and the perfect way to start your weekend in the outdoors chatting to people.

The start occurs just upstream of the Bothamley Park carpark. This car park is off Champion street, opposite the intersection with Windley Street. Head to end of carpark where the concrete ends and there is a gate. For location see https://goo.gl/maps/wEohfp9bRu82.

The course is following the old coach road (circa 1870's) established for the early farms in the area. Today this historic track is located within a park, away from cars and now used by walkers, runners and cyclists.

The track is generally 3 metres wide with a gentle gradient and a compacted gravel surface beside the Kenepuru Stream through a picturesque wooded wild valley. (Note there is a pinch point for a short section after the 2km marker where participants need to go single file each direction for approx 30 metres)

The valley runs east-west with mature trees which means this has to be one of the most sheltered places, out of the wind to exercise in Wellington.

What does it cost to join in? Nothing - it's free! but please register before your first run or walk, so you can get your timing results. You only need to register with parkrun once, to participate at any of the parkrun events around the world. Don't forget to bring a copy of your barcode. If you forget it, you won't get a time.

How fast do I have to be? Walking is fine as long as you can finish the 5km. Please come along and join in whatever your pace!

One dog per adult is welcome, as long as it is on a short hand held lead.

Children welcome but those 10 years and under need to be kept within arms reach of a supervising adult.

Note there is no toilets in the park, so go before you go.

We're friendly! Every week we grab a post park run/walk coffee/tea at Get Fixed within Kai Tahi at 20 Parumoana Street, to mix exercise with socialising.

There are volunteering opportunities even week. So those doing Duke of Edinburgh or similar challenges can get volunteer credits. Ensure you contact us well in advance at "porirua@parkrun.co.nz"
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Art @ The Cathedral: Celebrate the Fabric, Exquisite pieces of needlework are on display and in use every day at Wellington Cathedral of St Paul: beautifully decorated fabrics that hang at the front of the altars, spectacular robes and stoles worn by priests at services, and fine linens used at every service of Holy Communion. You’ll learn much about this remarkable fabric artistry when Jo Dixey talks to the Friends of Wellington Cathedral of St Paul and guests on Wednesday, 24 September at 10.30 am.
Jo is an internationally regarded embroiderer who graduated from the Royal School of Needlework and now lives permanently in New Zealand. She teaches, exhibits and sells her work, as well as accepting commissions. She has had contracts from the film industry, working on the Disney film Mulan and most recently on season 1 of Lord of the Rings TV series. Jo’s collection of embroidered 3D viruses, created during the 2020 Covid lockdown, are now on display in The Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa.

After four years of patient making and aging, the corks on the most sparkly of all our wines are ready to be popped and the liquid gold consumed on the Alexia terrace!

The man, the myth, the mollusc maestro Martin Bosley is back with his Oyster Saloon between 12pm - 3pm shucking fresh oysters for the occasion so get in early for these or miss out!

Oysters not your thing? Fear not, the Alexia kitchen will also be turning out some delicious delights to match to your Blanc de Blancs – everyone will be happy!

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.
label: Food & Drink

Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a toilet cleaner in Tokyo.
Outside his structured daily routine, he enjoys music, books, and photographing trees he loves.
A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more about his past. A deeply moving and poetic film about finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
Awards & Recognition
Best Actor (YAKUSHO Koji) – Cannes Film Festival 2023
Prize of the Ecumenical Jury – Cannes Film Festival 2023

Japan Academy Prize for Best Actor
Nominated for Best International Feature Film – Academy Awards
A deeply moving and poetic reflection on finding beauty in everyday life.

Sealed Autocross - Round 3 - The Lost Duck, Neil's Wheels presents the continuation of our Autocross. With Winter now here, we're switching to Tarmac on the back half of the Masterton Drag strip. So no rain delays!
This is the final Round of a 3 Round Rubber Duck Series and is a WMSA Kim Naylor Round!
Online entries via Motorsport NZ and are open!
If you don't have a Motorsport NZ Login, get in touch and we'll be happy to help you out, nearer the event time we will upload a form you can fill out.
Treaded tyres only, so semi slicks are okay. No full slicks!
Helmet and overalls requirements haven't changed for events of this level. Just make sure you're wearing cotton or wool under it, and leather shoes please.
To avoid any refuelling rule headaches we suggest you bring your car with enough fuel already in it. There is a few choices of petrol stations close by in Masterton.
No competition licence required.
Car club membership required unless this is one of your first two events ever.
Please follow official guidance when travelling over the drag strip, and do so at low speed and maximum care when entering the track.
The pits are our usual spot on the grass. We are not to use the concrete pads.
$60 entry plus to possibility of some lunch provided. Will confirm nearer the day.

description:
Springbokke vs All Blacks 7pm, Update 29/8:
We have a few spots left over after some cancellations. Please let me know if you are keen to attend and how many.
Update 23/8:
We are now at capacity for this event.
I have sent PMs to everyone that commented in the chat that they were interested to confirm if they are attending or not. Please come back to me ASAP as I have a waiting list. If you are keen to go on the waiting list, please send me a PM so I can add you to the list.
The cost to hire the club is $200 so I will appreciate it if you can do a gold coin donation (or more if you are so inclined that we can give as tips to the bar staff) for every person that attends.
You can bring your own food/snacks for the game but all drinks are to be bought at the club. Knowing Peter (club manager), he will have a brandy and coke special again like last time. I will ask him for his latest drinks price list and post it here for you to see. Their prices are very reasonable.
Looking forward to seeing you all there in your best Bokke outfits as the warm up for the following weekend's game in Wellington!
As you may be aware, the Bokke will be playing two games in New Zealand in September. The first game will be in Auckland on 6 September and the second on 13 September right here in Wellington.
I have booked the Tawa Squash Club to watch the game on the 6th of September. Please mark the event as interested to get the notifications of what will be happening.
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Tami Neilson - Neon Cowgirl Tour - Wellington, Tami Neilson - Neon Cowgirl Tour is coming to Auckland, Wellington, Nelson and Christchurch - hot on the heels of Tami's US festival shows with Willie Nelson & family, Bob Dylan and more.
2025 has been a landmark year for Tami Neilson, with invitations to perform at the Outlaw festivals, Merlefest, Willie's Fourth of July Picnic, The Grand Ole Opry, and a European tour.
Her huge, glorious voice and powerful live performances have won the admiration and support of some of country music's biggest names and fans worldwide.
Neilson’s album Neon Cowgirl (out 11 July) is one of the year’s most highly anticipated releases, following the success of singles You’re Gonna Fall, and Borrow My Boots.

description:
TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship, TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship
Entry form is live:

Back again for 2025, the TRC Tractors Manawatu Offroad Racing Championship! This year, we are doing it a little differently - each class will take part in four heats as usual, but two of these will be 'Quick Fire Sprints' (5 laps) and two will be 'Super Sprints' (9 laps). That is over 40km of racing, for bugger all cost!
Entry fee: Adult Classes $50 / KiwiTrucks $30. Spectator entry by gold coin donation.
Be part of an action-packed day of short course racing at everyone's favourite offroad racing track!
This event gets bigger each year with drivers descending on Feilding from across the North Island. Will a local regain the title, or will another out-of-towner take it away in 2025?
One thing is for sure - you've got to be in it to win it!

description:
Drop-in session | Reserve Management Plan, Council manages over 130 parks and reserves on your behalf – from playgrounds, sports grounds, and esplanades to scenic and native reserves.
We’re drafting an omnibus Reserve Management Plan to set out objectives, polices and rules that guide their use, management, protection and development and want your help. Tell us what you value about your favourite parks and reserves, what might impact their use, protection and enjoyment, and what ideas do you have for their future.
There's lots of ways to have your say - online, on paper and in person.
Come and chat to our Open Space Planning team
Thursday 28 August, 4pm–7pm, Coastlands Shopping Centre
Saturday 30 August, 9am–1pm, Maclean Park, skatepark
Saturday 6 September, 9am–1pm, Waikanae Park, old skatepark
Sunday 14 September, 9am–1pm, Ōtaki Centennial Park
Further information and ways to provide feedback can be found at haveyoursay.kapiticoast.govt.nz/RMP

description:
Monthly Mission - The Ned for sunrise, Monthly Mission - The Ned for sunrise

We have lovingly been granted access on Sunday, the 14th of September, to run up and down The Ned for Sunrise. I'm super excited as I've never been up there before and this is a great wee chance for us to get the trail up and down to ourselves......rather luxury!

It should be a great wee mission, around 3.5hrs return from what I have heard, so looking to set off from the bottom between 4.30-5am to time the sunrise perfectly.

Coffee & treats at the top and back, hope for a great day, feeling energised and ready to go!

See you all there.

P.S. This one's subject to numbers on the day, so please confirm vias the group here with your interest, and I will get confirmation from everyone the week of.

description:
WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 21 September 2025, WHAC Presents: Honest 10 - 21 September 2025
Join us at 8:30am on Sunday 21 September for the next edition of the Honest 10 taking in Wellington's beautiful waterfront. The Honest 10 is the perfect chance to test your 5km or 10km fitness and maybe have a go at walking or running PB.
EVERYONE IS WELCOME NO MATTER WHAT YOUR LEVEL OF FITNESS. The is an optional 8:15am early start for those who think they might need more time (eg over 70 mins for 10k)

Organised by WHAC, the Honest 10 provides a fast, fun and friendly environment. The race course has been officially measured and there will be pacers running 40min, 45min, 50min, 55min and 60min to help you run your best.

Cost: Just $10 for 10km, $5 for 5km!!

How to enter:
1. Pre-register by email (recommended) BEFORE 5PM on Saturday 20 Sept. Payment methods for pre-registrations include online bank transfer (an email with your reference will be sent back to you) or pay cash on the day.
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
Use "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"
OR
2. Sign up on the day from 8am (cash only).

Photos are free of charge and posted online (on the WHAC website) alongside results after the race. https://whac.org.nz/wp/honest-10/

Where: At the Whale's Tail next to Freyberg Pool, Oriental Bay

When: Registration from 8am. Race starts at 8:30am Sunday morning. Let us know when you register, if you request an early 8.15am start, eg if you are walking the 10km or are likely to run slower than 70mins.

***Pre-registration details***
Email the following details to BEFORE 5pm Saturday 20 Sept 🙂 You will receive a confirmation email back with your race number. If you select 'N' for prepaid, just bring cash to the race with you. If you select 'Y' for prepaid, pay via WHAC's bank account details below.
- Name
- Age
- 5km or 10km
- M, F or D (unfortunately we are currently unable to give age-calculated results for the gender-diverse (D) category, as our source currently only provides age-calculated result data for M and F)
- Phone number
- Prepay Y or N

BANK ACCOUNT DETAILS If you select "Y" for Prepay when you register via email, transfer your $10 entry fee (or $5 for 5k) to
Account Name: Wellington Harrier Athletic Club
Account Number: 12-3493-0058553-00
using "H10 [your race number]" as your reference. Eg "H10 #23"

Looking forward to seeing you on Sunday 21 September :)
label: Sports & Fitness

description:
Photography - Travel, Planning a trip? Unhappy with the photographs from the last one? Get the skills to turn disappointing holiday snaps into stunning travel photographs. Includes a Saturday field trip.

We'll combine practical skills with artistic use of light to develop your travel photography for that next trip.

Note: Not for beginners - you should be competent using your camera in manual exposure mode and be familiar with basic principles of photography. Includes a Saturday field trip, check individual courses for details.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Critically examine travel photographs
- Explore techniques for better landscape travel photographs
- Explore techniques for better portrait travel photographs
- Use light creatively to enhance your images
- Be better photographically prepared and more confident for your next trip
- Bring your camera to the first session.

5 session: 4 x Tue 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM plus a field trip.
Presenter: John Williams
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025, Wellington Foraging Workshop 14th September 2025
Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.

This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.

We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.

This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.

Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit

www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.

For questions, email .

Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Beeswax Candle Making, Come along and find out how easy it is to make your very own beeswax candles to give your home a delightful ambience!

Have you always admired the beauty and fragrance of beeswax candles and wondered how they are made? Join Jill in this 2-hour workshop where you will learn how to make three different styles of these candles using beeswax sheets. Come along and immerse yourself in this fun and relaxing workshop as you discover how to create your own candles. These are great for gifting as well!

All materials included in course fee, bring a pen and paper to take notes if you wish.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Make three styles of candles
Know where to source wax and wick to continue making your own at home
Be proud of a home-made product created with your own hands

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Thu 31 July 7:00 PM – 9:00 PM
Wellington High School
Presented by Jill Askew
$59.00 incl. GST

label: Classes & Workshops

description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course, PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 

PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

It’s an easy-going, beginner-friendly space where conversations flow, laughter is encouraged, and there’s something grounding about feeling clay in your hands. It’s a chance to step away from the usual routine, relax into a slower pace, and take joy in making something from scratch.
After the crafting is done, the evening continues with a beautiful plant-based dinner and dessert shared together — wholesome food to round out a wholesome night. Spend an evening unwinding with paint, good food, and good company. This beginner-friendly class is designed for everyone—you don’t need to be an artist to enjoy it. It can get a bit messy, so come in clothes you don’t mind getting paint on, and tie your hair back if it’s long.
After the painting, relax over a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, the perfect way to finish a creative and relaxed night.
Meet your host, Alannah
Alannah has been fascinated by blacklight art since she was 15 and has been exploring different mediums to find what really stands out for 20 years. She takes inspiration from all the wonderful artists she encounters in the real world and online. She noticed that this particular type of fluid art hadn't really been done the way she does it, so she has developed her own unique style utilising blacklight reactive and glow-in-the-dark paints. Let her colour your world and explore the possibilities of fluid art together.

description: Inaugural Professorial Lecture - Professor Angela Ballantyne, Inaugural Professorial Lecture "Making things right". What does it mean to make things right? Medicine and science often turn to bioethics for concrete solutions to ethical challenges. But in reality, there is rarely a single, obvious ‘right’ answer. Human systems are inherently messy, and challenged by a legacy of injustice, unequal distributions of power, and declining social trust. This talk will describe the potential for bioethics to help clarify and navigate ethics dilemmas; pragmatically inching us closer to making things – if not right, then at least – better.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Wankernomics — Just Touching Base, At work, do you struggle with simple tasks like using the phrase “circle back” in every email? Have you never used the word “synergies” in a LinkedIn post? You might be a failure at office life and need a pep talk. Luckily, some Australian satirists have a solution. ‘Wankernomics — Just Touching Base’ live at The Opera House reveals the secret to workplace success through the ancient art of being annoying.   
The shows are hilarious and include many ‘oh-my-god-that’s-exactly-what-happens-at-my-workplace’ moments. You’ll get a demonstration of the buzzwords, bureaucracy, banality, and baloney of modern working life. You’ll get tips on how to speak at work, how to look like a genius in meetings, and how to get promoted by simply dropping the phrase ‘360 degree all-hands ideation session’ into an email to your boss. 
So, pop some time in the diary for an outcomes-focused, value-added, best-practice, deep-dive into the realities of the working world.

description:
Anyone Can Draw - Structural, In this course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids. Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.

Geometric shapes can simplify a subject, unify a drawing and make compositions dynamic. Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.

A good working knowledge of the concepts of perspective will help you draw any subject with correct dimensionality. It can also help in your realist drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments. These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

8 x weekly morning or afternoon sessions. All basic materials supplied.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course, POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

description:
6-12 In person PLD, 6-12 In person PLD
The story of Communication and Signs is one of the five great stories which scaffold the learning in Montessori classrooms for the 6-12 year old child. It traces the beginnings of human communication and the development of writing.

How can we as educators encourage writing in our Montessori environments and ensure collaborations and an understanding of the basic writing processes, bring success and enthusiasm to the telling of powerful stories?

What are some of the stumbling blocks for children when researching? How can we provide strategies and structure to enable lively and informative information writing?

In this day-long face to face workshop, with a focus on guidance for narrative and information writing, participants will be invited into the world of learning to write. Strategies and exercises to stimulate interest and action for writers will be given, alongside challenges and advanced crafting lessons for more fluent writers in 6-9 and 9-12 classrooms. We will examine elements of structuring, elaboration, character and place, revision, and author techniques. Note taking and writing for research will be included in an information writing session.

Day 2: Sunday 14th September
Come prepared to share your collective wisdom while we align NZC History curriculum to what we do in our classrooms to ensure that everything is covered. By September we will also have a better idea of where the conventional system is headed with the new-look maths coming out. We will spend time unpacking the the WHY we do what we do.

This is an opportunity for you to discuss, share ideas and gain ideas for ways forward.

description:
CMNZ Series From Scratch, New Zealand’s oldest and most avant-garde chamber music ensemble, From Scratch, has been performing nationally and internationally since 1974, principally under the leadership of sound and intermedia artist Phil Dadson.

From Scratch have developed an original and innovative sound/performance style that includes large sculptural invented instruments (primarily percussion), and innovative hocket-style rhythms – where the performers’ individual parts interlock to create complex rhythmic and melodic structures.

The current collective core-group consists of Adrian Croucher, Shane Currey, Phil Dadson, Darryn Harkness and Chris O'Connor.

description:
Nota Bene and The Bach Choir of Wellington - Quiz Night, Nota Bene and The Bach Choir combine for a quiz night fundraiser to be held at the 1852 pub in Brooklyn on Sunday 31st August .

Please, invite friends, form winning teams in advance but remember you can also just build a team on the night with unaligned quizzers. Such randomly formed teams are great fun and have won on previous occasions.

The Quiz proper starts at 7pm but you can also have dinner there from 5pm by calling 1852 in advance and making a booking (04 801 9544)

This is the first opportuity for the two choir collaboration, and our Chamber orchestra Chiesa Ensemble to get together as we start rehearals leading to a performance of the masterwork, Weihnachts Oratorium (Bachs's XMAS Oratorio).

That concert will happen at 7pm on the 15th of November at St Mary of the Angels.

description:
Shawn James - Wellington, Shawn James – New Zealand Tour October 2025
Christchurch • Wellington • Auckland
For the first time ever, acclaimed American singer-songwriter Shawn James is bringing his powerful, soul-stirring music to New Zealand. Known for his raw vocals, heartfelt lyrics, and a genre-defying blend of folk, blues, rock, and soul, Shawn has captivated audiences around the globe.
Following a massive international tour and the rise of his hit song "Through the Valley" -featured in the critically acclaimed The Last of Us series - Shawn is thrilled to announce his debut run across Aotearoa.
Catch him live this October for three unforgettable shows:
Wednesday, October 15 - Loons, Christchurch
Thursday, October 16 - San Fran, Wellington
Friday, October 17 - Double Whammy, Auckland
Tickets are on sale this Friday the 30th of May at 1:00 pm
Pre sale starts tomorrow, Thursday the 29th of May at 1:00 pm
Don't miss this rare chance to experience the intensity and emotion of Shawn James in an intimate live setting. Tickets are expected to move fast - secure yours now!
"Hey there, this is Shawn James. I’ve had way too many writers think they could sum me up & relay what I’m about from an hour long conversation so they could write my “bio” but I’ve had it. Screw that. I’ll tell it in my own words.
I was born & raised in Chicago, Illinois. I grew up on the south side of the city where I attended a gospel church. I was always around a lot of heartfelt soulful music & hardworking, real, down to earth people. Although I no longer abide by any religion, I value the times I had and how they shaped me to be what I am now. I’ve moved around quite a bit living in all different parts of the US.
While absorbing all sorts of different cultures from here & around the world, I’ve developed my own sound. I started releasing my own music in 2012 and haven’t stopped since. I play a wide range of music from folk to blues, r&b, Gospel to rock, metal & alotta things in between. The main constant amongst all the genres would be that it’s all done with emotion, feeling, heart & a lotta soul. I mean what I say & deeply feel what I play.
I play covers of songs I dig sometimes and although some people may only know me because of those, I’m hardly just a cover artist.
If you come see me play live and expect just one style or aspect of what I do, you may be disappointed to learn that our shows are a roller coaster of emotions, musical styles, intensity & energy. I get bored easily & love to mix things up. Be ready & bring your ear plugs just in case..
I’ve always been the underdog so to speak since I’ve never had the backing of a large record label, big marketing firm or massive PR company & I truly like it that way. I feel as though I’ve earned what I have through hard work, determination, a good bit of luck & the great relationships with people I’ve made along the way. I’ve learned a lot of lessons the hard way being in this “music business industry” and that’s alright by me.
I’ve seen that with your support (the listeners out there) I can make my wildest dreams come true.
If you want to listen to an artist that’s authentic, genuine & original then you’ve come to the right place. I hope you enjoy the music & will join me on this journey that I’m so extremely grateful to be on.
Thank you all so very much.
Love,
Shawn James"
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BRANT BJORK TRIO, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

Doors at 8pm - Tickets: $60 from WaxstarTouring

description:
WELLINGTON - Opera House Wellington, We invite you to join us for a night of Creedence Clearwater Revival and John Fogerty, as we celebrate the music of one of the world’s most iconic bands – from the songs they wrote, to the songs covered, to the songs they wrote for others.
From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972, CCR was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.
No other band has created such an impact in such a short time.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective brings to the stage a band that captures the unique CCR sound.
You do not want to hear through the grapevine that you missed out on this fun, hit-packed live concert.
Join us, a real-life travelling band.

description:
TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON, TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON
~ DON'T GET F.O.M.O ~

Tarn PK is bringing his new EP ’F.O.M.O’ to live audiences in Wellington on the 14th of September 6pm at MOON, with support from Sig Wilder & Friends and Josh Glennie.

With his newly formed 3 piece band, they’re stripping his sound down to the essentials; funky drum breaks, soaring synths and crunchy guitars, bringing a whole new dimension to the sound from the EP.

F.O.M.O, is a reflection on burnout, ambition, and identity in a digitally overwhelmed world. It draws inspiration from urban isolation and the weight of expectations. Tracks from the EP have landed on major Spotify and Apple playlists. Reflecting the office environment, familiar to many, this performance will bring to life the themes from the EP in a host of ways.

With over 2.2 million streams across platforms and 1.8 million on Spotify alone, his impact is growing. Releases have landed on global and regional editorial playlists. His EPs—Fantasy, Monarch, SugarCoated and now F.O.M.O —have consistently showcased his range and evolution as an artist.

Sig Wilder & Friends blend kiwi authenticity with American grit, bringing you a well-worn handwritten journal of lived experiences rendered through metaphor, poetic prose, and the stylistic conventions of folk, alt-country and late-night heartbreak radio.

Josh Glennie is a soulful singer/songwriter based in Wellington, New Zealand. He's made a name for himself playing in bands around Wellington and is now striking out with his own solo material. Together with Tarn, they have produced a new EP of songs that cut to the bone, focused around acoustic guitar and Josh's striking vocals. His New EP is expected late 2025/early 2026.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESH IX RETURN - LILA TIRANDO A VIOLETA, MESH began in 2018 as a queer collective looking to provide a playful space for live experimentation in Te Whanganui a Tara. We’ve finally heeded the call to bring it back to life and are beyond excited to host none other than sonic innovator Lila Tirando a Violeta.
With an extensive and varied output including releases for hallowed labels such as Hyperdub and N.A.A.F.I, Lila has been dubbed “one of the greats of modern electronic music.” As explained in a review of her most recent album Dream of Snakes, “her ability to traverse ambient, industrial, psychedelia, bass, and club music, as well as the various rhythms of her native Uruguay without ever tripping up on any one of them rates somewhere well beyond impressive.”
Lila will be joined by local artists Juniper May, Kolya and TOČKA for a night of all live sets, plus a spatial audio intervention by Metaxis. As always, please remember to respect the space and the people you share it with. This means being mindful of how you contribute to the collective experience and how your actions might impact those around you.
Feel free to send us a message on instagram if you have any questions. See you there x

description:

Expect blues, soul, boogie and swing, you’ll hear Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Fats Domino, Ray Charles and more. The emphasis is on having a hugely good time, with the brass enabling the dynamic energy to be turned up to 10!

Laura is joined by some of her long-time Wellington based musical companions, Wayne Mason, Kiwi music icon, being utilised here in his capacity as a master of boogie keys, John O’Connor on sublime lead guitar, George Barris and Richard Te One bringing a powerhouse rhythm section. Adding that soulful uplift, the brass /horn section are Manawatu locals, James Tait Jamieson (saxophone), Craig Collis (trombone) and Neville Lauridsen (trumpet).

Get your bling on and come out for a blast! We will be!

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.
