description:
Greg Crayford's Jazz Night for 20th August - Erna Ferry, Kia ora jazz lover,
This coming week at Wellington’s longest-running jazz residency Greg is thrilled to bring one of Aotearoa’s top vocalists to the stage – the one and only Erna Ferry.
About Erna
Erna, associated primarily with the mighty Rodger Fox Big Band, is a Jazz’n’Blues afficionado from Manawatū.
Erna started her career in amateur musical theatre, discovering, alas, that a thespian she was not - but that she loved to sing! She has performed at all the leading NZ jazz clubs and festivals throughout the country and includes as highlights her ‘tribute to Peggy Lee’ show that toured throughout NZ, and playing support for Al Jarreau and George Benson – not to mention performing at the Monterey Jazz Festival in California with the RFBB.
Erna loves to sing the blues and works regularly with a Whanganui blues band called “Blues Buffet” – and now and then teams up with Wellington vocalist Julie Lamb under the moniker of “Two Bluesy Blondes”.
On a good day she also plays a mean harmonica.
We are SOOOO looking forward to her engagement at The Realm with her ‘A’ team of musicians:
• Oscar Laven (saxophones)
• Duncan Haynes (piano)
• Rory McCartney (bass)
• Greg Crayford (drums and host)
Join us!
Table bookings 04 974 2207 or info.therealm@nzvenueco.nz or therealm.co.nz and click on ‘book a table’
Great ambience, good company, superb kai and stellar music. What more could a jazz fan want?
Jamming and sit-ins more than welcome. Bring your horn/axe/favourite toy.
Hope to see you there
Mark your diary!
Twenty Years of Realm Jazz Variety Concert/Gig – Many Acts!
30th August 2025 from 2pm-10pm

description:
NZSSC @ Te Raukura ki Kāpiti !, NZSSC @ Te Raukura ki Kāpiti !
NZ’s best young singers to perform first full-length public concert of 2025 at Te Raukura ki Kāpiti this September

The New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir (NZSSC) will perform their first full-length public concert of 2025 on Saturday 27th September at Te Raukura ki Kāpiti, in the stunning Coastlands Theatre. Concert starts 6pm

The NZSSC has achieved considerable success since its formation in 1986. Bringing their “infectious joy for music-making” to the Kāpiti coast for the first time since 2022, you will see and hear exactly why the NZSSC has won titles such as 'Children's Choir of the World' at Llangollen Eisteddfod and embarked on 16 international tours, including Canada, Singapore, China, USA, South America, Australia and South Africa, during their almost 40 year existence!

Under the direction of Sue Densem, the NZSSC gathers our finest young voices (14–18) throughout Aotearoa and offers a once in a lifetime opportunity – a two-year membership that sees students learning from some of the country’s top choral teachers and composers, as well as performing throughout Aotearoa. The 2-year experience culminates in an exciting international tour in July of the 2nd year, before singers part ways.

As with all their concerts, the repertoire for this Kāpiti concert will be a wonderful mix of cultures, featuring Māori waiata ā-ringa and Pasifika songs with a sprinkling of choral cannon plus some classics like you’ve never heard them before!

Bring the whole family for an evening of choral excellence and entertainment!

Get your Early Bird Special before 29 August 2025 to secure a great concert at a great bargain!

--
For accessibility seating information and wheelchair space bookings please email: or call 04)9740535 during office hours.

description:
Slow Jazz Ensemble w/ Antipodes Quartet, Two of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s favourite ensembles have teamed up for an exciting cross-genre! Antipodes’s innovative textural approach to string quartet playing meets the explorative improvised landscapes of Slow Jazz Ensemble.

Tickets go on sale Friday, 7th of August at 12 pm.

Slow Jazz Ensemble
Slow Jazz Ensemble is an atmospheric jazz group aimed at creating new improvised textural landscapes. Inspired by the likes of Lucien Johnson, Alice Coltrane, and Jasmine Myra, Slow Jazz Ensemble brings together some of Pōneke’s favourite musicians to bring to life a unique expression of heart-stirring cinematic compositions.

Antipodes Quartet
The Antipodes Quartet was founded in 2025, bringing together the brightest emerging string players of New Zealand. Named after the Antipodes, a term that signifies New Zealand’s geographical position on the opposite side of the world from Europe, the quartet embraces a unique perspective on classical music. From the Southern Hemisphere, they approach the rich traditions of the string quartet with fresh energy, drawing from their diverse experiences across the Asia-Pacific and Europe while remaining deeply connected to their musical roots at home in Aotearoa. With a commitment to innovation, accessibility, and artistic excellence, the quartet explores diverse repertoire, from beloved classics to contemporary works.

Their upcoming engagements include side-by-side performances with the New Zealand String Quartet and Orchestra Wellington, as well as appearances at the 2026 Adam Chamber Music Festival. Antipodes champions a bold, engaging approach to performance, education, and outreach, fostering meaningful connections with audiences across Aotearoa.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington - This week, BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
BØLZER - SOUTHERN TEMPEST TOUR
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla
21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar
Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr
An intuitive art project born from raw passion;
musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition
and enactment. Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical
medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Raven Mavens Quartette in concert, Raven Mavens Quartette
Suppose you can imagine the sound of the blues, spiced by flavours of the American songbook, folk, country, and even the rock and roll of Jerry Lee Lewis, driven by the unmistakable sound of boogie woogie piano. In that case, you have the Raven Mavens Quartette.  

It is both an accident and it isn’t that this is an all-female group. The group had its genesis a decade ago when piano player and singer-songwriter Cindy Muggeridge encountered the singing and clarinet skills of Marian Carter. They formed the Raven Mavens as a duo that included a core of folk and blues, and exploited the singing talents of the pair through finely crafted harmonies.  

The success of their combination in playing local gigs and folk festivals opened up opportunities with other musicians, and the next step was the inclusion of drummer Anje Glindemann, who has played in a list of local bands, including Tin Pan Alley, Hen Picked and more recently the Salty Hearts. Anje can also be seen performing with Kapiti Coast singer-songwriter icon Andrew London.  And finally, the addition of multi-instrumentalist Kate Marshall. “Kate is an amazing player”, Cindy says. “She can move as easily from piano accordion, to fiddle or flute, depending on what the song calls for - or she feels like playing!” And of course, like the other members of the group, she sings.  

The instrumental diversity of the line-up was now established, but what also distinguishes this group is the addition of Cindy Muggeridge’s original songs to the set. “Writing my own songs has been part of the musical journey for me”, says Cindy, “and it just led naturally to offering some of them to the other singers in the group”. The “fun” of their music and the unmistakable presence of four female musical masters is what they will be sharing when they play at The Offering as part of Greytown ArtTown.

Buy tickets in advance here or txt bookings to 02102361951.

Please note The Offering is fully licensed and will be serving snacks and drinks. Please note this concert replaces Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton due to illness.

Opening Weekend Floor Talks, Opening Weekend Floor Talks
Join us as we walk you through two exciting and vibrant new shows here at The Dowse.

Wing and a Prayer blends humour with reverence, with fast food fountains and a holy water vending machine. Featuring works by Isabella Lepoamo, Sacha Lees, Scott Eady, Sian Torrington and Sophia Smolenski, join curators Chelsea Nichols and Milly Mitchell-Anyon as they explore the tension between adaptation and authenticity alongside some of the artists.

SOFTY is an exhibition of textile works from The Dowse’s permanent collection, including recent acquisitions, revealing The Dowse’s softer side, and our steadfast commitment to collecting craft. Milly and Chelsea will talk you through the pieces in the show, as well as give a wider view on how these pieces fit into The Dowse Collection. With works by Gordon Crook, Malcolm Harrison, Areez Katki, Maungarongo Te Kawa, Turumeke Harrington, Jakob Rowlinson, Daegan Wells and Steven Junil Park, SOFTY showcases the variety of textiles collected by The Dowse.

Saturday Laughs with Samantha Hannah and Wilson Dixon, Saturday Laughs at Abandoned Taproom Petone is a showcase of some of your favourite comedians in the heart of Petone

September features guest headline act, Wilson Dixon
Hailing from Cripple Creek Colorado, country music legend, Wilson Dixon’s melodic philosophies on life have seen him become one of the most loved characters on the Aust, UK and NZ circuit.
He has had sold out season’s at The New International Comedy Festival and has won awards for Best Show and in 2010 he won the supreme Festival Award The Fred for outstanding artistic achievement.
Before sweeping the New Zealand International Comedy Festival his show ”Wilson Dixon’s American Dream” played to rave reviews at the Edinburgh Fringe and Melbourne International Comedy Festival. Directly after the Edinburgh Fringe Wilson went on to appear in his own 4 part radio series for the BBC – The Wilson Dixon Line.
An unmissable act!

With MC Samantha Hannah
From her homeland in Scotland to her new home in NZ, Samantha has had audiences laughing around the globe. A class act.
Host of award-winning podcast Are We Pals? and as seen on the NZ Comedy Gala
“a talented raconteur” - Fringe Biscuit “Expert stand up throughout“ - Chortle “One of the funniest ladies on the planet” - Remote Goat

Kapiti Coast, NZ – Prepare to swap your Netflix night for something far funnier—All Roads Lead to Kapiti rolls into the Kapiti Playhouse on 20 September. Doors open at 7:30 pm, the laughs land at 8:00 pm.

Line-Up That’ll Make You Snort-Laugh

Richie Faavesi – "The 2024 Raw Comedy Quest finalist (and Whanganui’s chocolate-humour king) brings brutally honest, father-and-husband-life tales with enough grit and heart to dark-horse the dark side of comedy."
NZ Herald

MC Marc Hamilton – The smooth operator keeping the laughs rolling and the mic mayhem in check.

Emma Jean – A raw new voice and one of the Raw Comedy Quest finalists for 2025—expect freshness, edge, and zero filter.

Reon Matterman – Thrives on weaving truth bombs with sharp wit—something you’ll want to laugh and think about.

Advait Kirtikar – "Qualified actuary by day, Billy T-nominated comedian by night. His super-dry delivery and razor timing earned him awards, accolades, and the uncanny ability to make actuarial science sound sexy. He’s also a two-degree black-belt rock-climber-ex-gymnast blend of absurdity."
Scoop

Why It Matters

This isn’t just comedy—it’s a cross-section of NZ's freshest and fiercest comedic voices, from local legends to rising stars. Whether you're in for the belly laughs, the smart quips, or just wondering if an actuary can be funny—this is your Saturday night.

Will the puppet be a friend? Or will they cause chaos that the kids will need to clean up before mum gets home?

Created by Francesca Browne, It's Alive! is brought to you by Improverished, the improvised theatre company behind family friendly shows like Can I Get an Underground Location and a Mythical Creature? and Random Fairytale Generator. Combining theatre, comedy, science, and improvisation, It's Alive! is full of silliness and joy.

All science experiments have been designed with careful consultation with chemists to ensure the safety of the audience.

description:
ROADKILL: The Uber-cool Musical - TAHI Festival: CANCELLED, Hey everyone- we have a little change of plans!
Unfortunately, ROADKILL: The Uber-Cool Musical won’t be happening this time around, but we’re already cooking up something even better for the future. All ticket holders will receive a full refund and we can’t wait to welcome you to our next big adventure.
Thank you for your excitement and your support.

CANCELLED-


ROADKILL The Uber-Cool Musical takes you on a wildly immersive journey through love, life and rock ’n’ roll — all from the back seat of a van. This intimate one-man musical combines humour, heart and unforgettable tunes for an experience like no other.
Strap in for the rollercoaster ride of your life as we take a regular mundane occurrence of driving in an Uber and blow wide open the private life, memories and miss happenings of our hero, and driver, Terry.

Carpool karaoke meets intense love story meets wild murder mystery.

Much more than a musical, its an experience, its a journey and an attraction!

In the space of a usual cabaret show and with the help of the passengers in the van, you will witness and be part of, childhood dreams, births, deaths and marriages, high drama, dark comedy, all sung live with a kickass, original, meatloaf-esque rock soundtrack. Surprises and magic ensues as we push the van, and Terry, to the limits of what is possible.

This will be an intimate, sensory overload, in a van. A full grand musical with all the bells and whistles.

With only 9 seats available each ride, grab your mates and have a private experience in the fast lane!
The hottest ticket in town- be sure to experience the ride of your life!

The show is in the style of a musical crossed with karaoke songs you have never heard before...

The van will be stationary and parked for this initial season.

Winner of BEST IN FRINGE and EMERGING ARTIST OF THE YEAR at the Dunedin Fringe and Winner of MOST INNOVATIVE at the NZ Fringe awards this year!

The bold narrative explores identity, self-expression, and the transformative power of music. Expect jaw-dropping choreography, infectious beats, and a visually stunning performance. 
Featuring a cast of over 300 passionate young performers, Beauty and the Beat showcases the talent and creativity nurtured at Pump Dance Studios. The studio runs hip-hop, jazz and contemporary dance classes for all ages. The team of coaches include some of Wellington’s top performers. There are two chances to catch the performance on 1 November.

Whether you're a fellow artist, an art lover, or just curious - everyone is welcome!

Created by Īhaka Martyn. Play read by Kaisa Fa'atui.

Tired of having no room for self love? Maybe burning 50kgs in 50 minutes will change that.

Join our inspiring fitness guru as he shows the audience how to shed your ego and excess fat. By utilising the power of manifestation, you too can change your pathetic little impulses. In fact, when was the last time you went to the gym? Maybe you should just skip this show and hit the treadmill instead, yeah?

Filled with self-helpless tips, banging tunes and kōrero hōhonu, this playreading will dissect the fraught relationships we have with our tinana, and where those nasty thoughts are really coming from.

description:
‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW, ‘Where there’s smoke’ Legacy Tour - UPPER HUTT SHOW
‘Where there’s smoke’ is a powerful new theatre production grounded in 10 years of creative wānanga with rangatahi across Aotearoa. The script is backed by evidence and forms parts of Charlizza Matehe’s doctoral research on rangatahi suicide and mental health. It pays tribute to our very first suicide prevention show, Smoke & Mirrors, which toured Aotearoa in 2015 and ignited a kaupapa that has stood the test of time, while suitable for whānau audience, parental guidance is advised due to sensitive themes around suicide and grief. This show was created to open honest, hopeful conversations around mental health and to remind our young people they are not alone. We warmly encourage people working with youth, youth groups and community rōpū to attend together. Email for more information and group bookings
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington, James Nokise: One Right Rant | Wellington
Irreverent, incorrigible, and just ever so outraged, award-winning comedian James Nokise lets loose in Wellington for one night only!

About this Event

Politicians, policies, preachers, and protests are all in the line of fire as Nokise brings his fast paced, semi-chaotic, always cathartic, blend of humour and hot takes back to NZ for a hilarious hour of big laughs and the occasional frustrated scream.
One Night Rant is political comedy at its sharpest. From parliament scandals to global chaos, Nokise rips into the news cycle, mixing big laughs with bite-sized truths. This is a one-hour comedy special designed for anyone who’s ever shouted at the TV, despaired at the headlines, or secretly enjoyed watching politicians squirm.

About James Nokise
A multi-talented comedian, playwright, columnist, podcaster, theatre maker, and social commentator, James Nokise is known for his fearless approach and his ability to give a voice to underrepresented issues.
Over the course of his illustrious career James has been nominated twice for the Billy T Award (2005, 2006) and the Fred Award for Best New Zealand Show (2013), which he subsequently took out in 2019 for his show God Damn Fancy Man. He won Best Male Comedian at the NZ Comedy Guild Awards (2013), Spirit of the Festival at the 2021 NZ Comedy Fest and the Topp Prize (2024). James was also the winner of best documentary at the 2025 NZ radio awards for his series The Last Voyage of the Rainbow Warrior, and winner of the Best International Podcast at the 2025 Asia Podcast Awards.
James has an extensive touring career, including over a decade of shows in the NZ International Comedy Festival and multiple Comedy Gala performances, as well as years on the international Fringe Festival circuit, performing successful seasons in Edinburgh, Perth, and New York.

description:

Come hell or high water, the team is locked in and ready to bring you two all new hellarious, hellish, and almost certainly heretic filled adventures. Join our four budding demonologists as they stumble their way into a summoning ritual, argue with a devil and, if they aren't careful, face the heat of hellfire.

Each night brings an all new adventure and new challenges, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp to hell and back (handbasket not included).

This show follows the success of Dungeons and Delinquents, Dungeons and Da Vinci, and Dungeons and Decades, shows that had TTRPG nerds and novices alike laughing along.

description:
Kiwis Big Hararei, Kiwis Big Hararei
Written by Catriona Tipene & Ryan Cundy
Produced by Horse With No Name with GRIDLEY by Victoria
Directed by Catriona Tipene

From the Land of the Long White Cloud to the Land Down Under!

Kiwi is going on his first big holiday from Aotearoa across to the golden shores of Brisbane. He’s got his backpack, a pocket full of worms, and a head full of dreams. The most exciting thing of all is that he might even get to go on a rollercoaster! With his Mum, Kiwi navigates air travel, hotels and conversations with marsupials as his world stretches from the home he knows, to the world over the horizon.

A tale that celebrates the connection between our two countries, featuring stunning costume designs by GRIDLEY by Victoria and fresh waiata by NZ singer-songwriter Benny Tipene. Brought to the stage by the multi-award winning companies Horse With No Name and GRIDLEY by Victoria, Kiwi’s Big Hararei is a story about spreading your wings and flying into the unknown.

description:
Book Launch | All Her Lives by Ingrid Horrocks, Book Launch | All Her Lives by Ingrid Horrocks
Join us to celebrate a new work from Ingrid Horrocks, and her first book of fiction!

🌿 Thursday 9 October, 6pm
🌿 Unity Books Wellington
🌿 Free event – all welcome!

All Her Lives follows women across generations as they resist, nurture and transform. These are lives shaped by love and politics, motherhood and memory, constraint and defiance.

From girls raised in the garden of Plunket founder Truby King, to a queer university student at a mid-2000s Berlin rave, to a mother facing the cost of her son’s climate rebellion, the women of All Her Lives are complex, resilient and deeply human. Shadowing their stories is the early feminist writer Mary Wollstonecraft, whose journey of grief and revolution will become a vessel for what endures – and for finding hope.

Vast and intimate, All Her Lives explores the layered selfhood of women – all that they inherit, sacrifice, imagine and carry forward – and the power found in unravelling and reweaving those selves on their own terms.

'A wonderful collection that swims in and out of women's lives across time, exploring the struggle for freedom and love. I'll be thinking about it for a long time - a book of quiet force.' —Emily Perkins, author of Lioness

Ingrid Horrocks’s books include the memoir Where We Swim (2021), a literary history, Women Wanderers and the Writing of Mobility (2017), and two collections of poetry. Her writing has appeared in Lithub, The Ninth Letter, The Sydney Review of Books, The Spinoff, Landfall, and the Guardian. In 2024 she was the Kaituhi Tarāwhare CNZ Writer in Residence at the International Institute of Modern Letters, and in 2025 she was awarded the Michael King Writers Centre Australian Residency at Varuna. Ingrid lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Wellington, with her partner and twin daughters.

Cover: Sarah Wilkins

description:
Homicidal Pacifist - Dust Off Your Guillotines, Created and performed by Sameena Zehra

This sold-out Pōneke favourite returns for one night only at Hannah Playhouse!

Three haunted sock puppets leading government. Shit-for-brains liberals peddling ‘both sides’ fucknuggetry as the people march for peace and their governments pour gasoline on fire. And WT actual F is a ‘lesser’ evil? Sameena Zehra is back to explore whether it's time to dust off your guillotines (even for a pacifist, it’s definitely time) with dark comedy and delicious storytelling that will make you gasp and guffaw as you channel your inner homicidal pacifist to pen a culling list of your own.

“As a piece of political theatre, this is one of the more entertaining and potentially moving with a flair for the dramatic... a remarkable raconteur with amazing stories to tell…” - Nicholas Holm, The Post

Audience care and considerations: This show is accessible to blind and low vision audiences without the need for audio description. The venue is fully accessible. Sameena may occasionally raise her voice, but won’t shout. There is some direct audience interaction, but if you avert your gaze or shake your head, you will not be engaged directly. Contains adult themes, political and confrontational material, and coarse language.

General admission - choose your price: $8 - $100

description:
Painted Past: Tribute to the Heritage City of Ahmedabad, An exhibition Sandip Prajapati celebrating the architectural heritage of Ahmedabad, India.
Opening Hours
Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm
Sunday: 11am - 4pm
Ahmedabad, designated as a UNESCO World Heritage City in 2017, is renowned for its rich architectural heritage and cultural significance, showcasing a blend of Indo-Islamic architecture and vibrant local traditions.
Born in Patan, Gujarat, Sandip Prajapati has always been fascinated by the rich history and culture of the region.
An architect by profession, he uses his knowledge of design and structure to capture the essence of the pol houses. Pol houses are traditional residential buildings that are clustered around narrow streets and courtyards in the old city of Ahmedabad. They date back to the 18th century and reflect the influence of various communities and religions that coexisted in the city. Pol houses are known for their intricate wooden carvings, ornamental facades, and colorful decorations. They are also a living testimony of the social and harmony that prevailed in the city.
CONTACT
Website: sprajapati.com
Instagram: @sandipprajapati1
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Substance, Substance
You Wanted the Truth? Here's Three.

About this Event


A triple bill that isn’t afraid to get under your skin. Flight, Bedaman and Molly confront the beautiful, broken, and brutal parts of being alive… freedom chased, feminism commodified and the party that never really ends. It’s bold. It’s messy. It’s uncomfortably – beautifully - real.

Flight - Emily Holden
Sit back and allow yourself to be lulled by the blend of voices and instruments in this mini-concert. Flight tells stories of personal turmoil and a deep yearning for freedom through movement and a talented group of musicians.
Bedaman - Georgia Woodrow
She sold feminism in a bottle, now she’s ready to burn it all down. Welcome to FEM CORP, where empowerment is a product, and revolution is a PR risk. Witness the unraveling of Cassandra Bedaman, the face of feminism. After a decade of empty promises, she’s finally ready to make a change…
Molly - Jenna Otway
Molly reveals the reality of party culture, the good, the bad and everything in between. This piece captures the essence of the nights that feel like they’ll never end, the crazy moments, the people you meet, and what happens when you take things too far. U coming? Cyu tn x

Added to the mix is Sandy, who is now a Nun, Dianne, married the school nerd and is a mother of eight sons, Rachel, a runaway teenager on a mission to dig up some dirt on her mother, and Shaun, the greasy motel janitor, who ends up in a compromising position in the ladies’ wardrobe.

description:
Māori Sidesteps – Māori Made Mischief, Contemporary showband The Māori Sidesteps are serving crooning and comedic goodness. With soulful harmonies, satirical skits, and superb song parodies, these fullas have won rave reviews, alongside their hit webseries and TV show – and now you can catch them live on stage at Circa Theatre!

The Sidesteps flip comedic nostalgia on its head and weave stunning harmonies with theatrical play, skewering social idioms and shining a cheeky light on what it means to be Māori in 2025.

Celebrating connection and the richness of our differences, The Māori Sidesteps bring pride in identity, the strength of mana motuhake, and the reminder that joy is the best antidote to division. From government blunders to policies ripe for the picking, these top-notch entertainers take aim at the kaupapa of the moment. Expect fearless satire, wickedly subversive humour, and a refreshing dose of truth-telling disguised as hilarity.

If you’ve ever wished someone would sing what you’ve been thinking about the current political climate, The Māori Sidesteps are here to deliver Māori made mischief through waiata that wink!

Reviews:
“Never did satire and self-deprecation go hand in hand and so cleverly and entertainingly” Alan Scott – Theatreview
“A night of whakawhanaungatanga – aroha, not (too much) hōhā.” Flat City Field Notes

description:
Club Tropicana, This August, Beach Babylon becomes Club Tropicana, a retro, romantic escape inspired by 1960s tropical honeymoons, classic tiki bars and vintage beach glamour. Picture golden sunsets, flamingos, thatched umbrellas and the carefree buzz of a sun-soaked getaway, right in the heart of Wellington. No passport required.

The menu is vibrant and full of escapist flair. Start with coconut prawns and banana blossom kokoda, then dive into mains like mango glazed  pork rib rack or the tropical tofu paneer curry. Save room for dessert: pineapple upside-down pudding or a coconut rum fondue to bring the tropical fantasy to a sweet finale. Behind the bar, the tiki and kava-spiked cocktails flow freely, from Blue Hawaiian’s to retro rum punches, all dressed to impress with flamingo stirrers, umbrellas and tropical garnishes.

A golden-age soundtrack sets the mood, featuring the smooth calypso of Harry Belafonte, beachy vibes from The Beach Boys, and sun-drenched classics by Astrud Gilberto.

Club Tropicana is a winter getaway, fun and fabulously over the top.

description:
96 Originals, Celebrate a quarter-century of culinary excellence at Logan Brown’s 29th anniversary lunch, where the past meets the present in a delicious fusion of food and stories. Join Steve Logan and Shaun Clouston, alongside original Logan Brown team members Francois Febvre (La Cloche) and Shepherd Elliott (previously of Ti Kouka, Leeds Street Bakery, Shepherd, Concord and The Test Kitchen), for a special afternoon filled with fantastic kai and plenty of memories.

As the doors of Logan Brown first opened in 1996, it quickly became one of Wellington’s most beloved dining destinations. Now, this unforgettable event offers a chance to reminisce with the chefs who helped shape the restaurant’s legacy, sharing tales from the early days while serving up a feast of flavours inspired by their storied careers.

For any longtime Logan Brown fan or someone curious to the whakapapa of Wellington food, this is a celebration of the friendships, milestones, and moments that have defined one of New Zealand’s most iconic dining experiences. Expect a menu that reflects Logan Brown’s rich history, prepared with passion and paired with great conversation, laughter, and a few tall tales.

description:
NZCFS Wellington Branch October Meeting: Mooncake Making, The Mid-Autumn Festival (simplified Chinese: 中秋节; traditional Chinese: 中秋節), also known as Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is a traditional festival celebrated by Chinese people and also other East and Southeast Asian people. It is the second-most important holiday after Chinese New Year with a history dating back 3,000 years.
The festival is held on the 15th day of the 8th month of the Chinese luni-solar calen-dar with a full moon at night. On this day, the moon is at its brightest and fullest size, coinciding with harvest time in the middle of Autumn. This year, the Moon Festival is on 6 October. We will be making mooncakes at our October monthly meet-ing to celebrate this festival.
Our secretary Vera will demonstrate the flaky Suzhou-style savoury mooncake with pork. We will also make some sweet ones using redbean paste filling.
If you are coming to the session, please bring $5.00 entry fee, a plate and cutlery for the mooncake tasting.

Bakery & Brewery, Step into the world of baking and brewing with this unforgettable experience. Join owner Tim Tracey at the Dough Bakery HQ for an interactive hands-on class where you'll master the art of sourdough. Learn the techniques behind creating the perfect loaf, from mixing to baking, in this immersive workshop.

After you’ve perfected your sourdough skills, it’s time to head over to Upper Hutt’s Brewtown via the Tradesman Entrance, where you’ll get an exclusive tour of Boneface Brewery. Discover the secrets behind their craft beers, and enjoy an inside look at the brewing process, from hops to pint.

The adventure culminates with a delicious BBQ smoked-meat dinner, where you can unwind, savouring expertly smoked meats in a relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Whether you’re a culinary enthusiast, a craft beer lover, or simply in search of a great night out, this event offers a perfect blend of hands-on cooking, beer appreciation, and mouthwatering food.

Add a cheeky mimosa or two, and you’ve got the perfect start to your weekend. Whether you’re with your brunch crew, shaking off a hangover, or chasing the crispy bits, this is a morning made for indulgence. It’s all about good food, loud laughs, and that first sip of something strong with your best mates by your side. description:
NZIFF: Young Mothers, The Dardenne brothers return with a deeply affecting drama exploring the lives of five teen mothers. Hopes and fears steer the young women towards bettering their lives for themselves and their children.

Young Mothers examines the lives of underprivileged teenagers as they come to terms with motherhood for the first time. Living together temporarily in a group home, they are taught how to care for their babies, while grappling with very different personal circumstances. The Dardenne brothers treat the characters with delicate respect while humanising the tumultuous reality that often comes with teenage motherhood.

Jessica, raised in an orphanage, cannot imagine abandoning her child and desperately seeks closure from her birth mother. Julie considers giving up her daughter for adoption, yet her own troubled mother wishes to raise the child to atone for her past mistakes. Brought up by an alcoholic mother, Perla dreams of a stable family, but her delinquent boyfriend wants nothing to do with her or their child. While Ariane has the privilege of a loving partner, both are recovering drug addicts which presents its own challenges.

This is a story of hope told through characters looking for a future free from their past. — Madison Marshall

description:
Martial Law Film Screening, In remembrance of the victims of human rights violations and extrajudicial killings during the Martial Law in the Philippines, please join us for a free/koha screening of the "Batas Militar" documentary in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
NOTE: For a list of trigger warnings, please see this document. Since we will be viewing and discussing potentially sensitive topics, the event will have an Open Door Policy, which means that you may leave the venue any time, for any reason, and will not be judged for doing so.
WHAT IS MARTIAL LAW?
"Martial law refers to the replacement of civil rule by military rule. This may be characterized by curfews, the dispensation of military tribunal rulings on civilians, and the suspension of the privilege of the writ of habeas corpus. The writ of habeas corpus, which in Latin refers to “having the body”, is a citizen’s protection against unlawful imprisonment. This is suspended in times of crisis to expedite justice" (Martial Law Museum).
WHY IS IT IMPORTANT TO TALK ABOUT TODAY?
Human rights violations and extrajudicial killings are still on-going in the Philippines under President Bongbong Marcos, the son of the dictator Ferdinand Marcos Sr. who proclaimed Martial Law in 1972, and Vice President Sara Duterte, the daughter of former President Rodrigo Duterte who spearheaded the violent War on Drugs in 2016 (Karapatan).
WHY WOULD I WANT TO JOIN THE FILM SCREENING?
The film screening is for anyone who is keen to learn about the Martial Law Era, wants to share their experience during the Martial Law (or something similar) through group discussion, wants to meet new people, wants to watch a Philippine film/documentary, or just wants to have snacks.
I WANT TO JOIN BUT I'M FROM TĀMAKI MAKAURAU / CHRISTCHURCH / THE PHILIPPINES.
We will stream the film through Zoom for viewers outside Te Whanganui-a-Tara, however, there may be internet and other technical difficulties during the event itself. Also please make sure to select the "Online" ticket option when RSVPing.
HOW MUCH IS THE TICKET?
The film screening is free but we appreciate koha for the venue/snacks/donations to Philippine non-governmental organisations (NGOs).
NOTE: This is an LGBTQ+ friendly event.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The History of Sound, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Festival de Cannes 2025 -

Based on the acclaimed book by Ben Shattuck, Paul Mescal (Aftersun, All of Us Strangers) and Josh O’Connor (The Crown, Challengers) play star-crossed lovers in this sweeping, moving and tender romance from Oliver Hermanus (Living).

In 1917, Lionel (Mescal) — a young, talented music student — meets David (O’Connor) at the Boston Conservatory, where they bond over a deep love of folk music.

Years later, Lionel receives a letter from David, leading to an impromptu journey through the backwoods of Maine to collect traditional songs. This unexpected reunion, ensuing love affair, and the music they collect and preserve, will shape the course of Lionel’s life far beyond his own awareness.

Paul Mescal and Josh O’Connor’s star turns received rave reviews when The History of Sound premiered at the Cannes Film Festival earlier this year, making this quiet but powerful drama a must-see at the British and Irish Film Festival 2025.
Rating
Sex scenes & suicide references
Director
Oliver Hermanus
Cast
Paul Mescal, Josh O’Connor, Chris Cooper

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Glenrothan, When his beloved Chicago blues club burns down, Donal (Cumming) returns to his family-owned whisky distillery in the Scottish Highlands for the first time in nearly 40 years.

Donal didn’t leave Scotland on the best terms, having wound up in a violent exchange with his brother Sandy (Cox) and their father on the day of their mother’s funeral.

Joined by his daughter Amy (Alexandra Shipp, Barbie), Donal returns to his homeland in the hopes of making amends with his brother. But with old wounds running deep and the fate of the family business on the line, can inner peace finally be found before it’s too late?

Written by David Ashton (The Last King of Scotland) and accomplished TV writer Jeff Murphy (Hinterland), Glenrothan explores the complexities of familial bonds, set against the proud and timeless tradition of whisky making.

Cumming gives one of his best on-screen performances, opposite Cox who brings gravitas to every scene - both in front of and behind the camera.
Director
Brian Cox
Cast
Alan Cumming, Brian Cox, Shirley Henderson, Alexandra Shipp

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - A Room with a View, A Room With a View captured the attention of the world upon its release, bringing the novel by E.M. Forster to dazzling life in the Florentine countryside and in the well-appointed homes of the English Edwardian upper classes. A comedy of manners with a quick wit and impeccable comic timing, A Room With A View is also a portrait of the quiet solitude that lies beneath Forster’s characters, and of the need for human connection in a world of rigid convention.

The young Englishwoman Lucy Honeychurch (played by Helena Bonham Carter), arrives in Florence on a Baedecker-style grand tour with her aunt Charlotte Bartlett (Maggie Smith). Through a series of events involving English expatriates Miss Eleanor Lavish, an unflappable novelist (Judi Dench), and the Emersons, a free-thinking father and son (played by Denholm Elliot and Julian Sands), Lucy’s life is changed forever under a loggia in Florence and in the Tuscan countryside.

Ivory’s delicate and playful direction spirits us from an adventure in the back alleys of Florence, lost with Dench and Smith, to the lace-parasolled rigidity of English lawn parties. Shot on location in and around Florence (including unforgettable scenes in the Piazza della Signoria and at Giotto’s frescoes in Santa Croce), A Room With A View made stars not only of Bonham Carter, Day Lewis and Sands, but of the Tuscan landscapes and Puccini arias (as sung by Kiri Te Kanawa) featured throughout.

Director
James Ivory

Producer
Ismail Merchant

Cast
Maggie Smith, Helena Bonham Carter, Denholm Elliot, Julian Sands

When they start playing, they free Alan Parrish (Robin Williams), who's been stuck in the game's inner world for decades. If they win Jumanji, the kids can free Alan for good -- but that means braving giant bugs, ill-mannered monkeys and even stampeding rhinos! ---

description:
Seen The Film - Wellington, NZ. A Fundraiser for Te Aro School., We live in an age where, as parents and caregivers, there is more information than ever before. How much screen time is the right amount of screen time for our children? How best can we manage our children's daily meltdowns? Time in, time out, clear boundaries, feel all the feelings - what's best? We are hearing more and more reactive advice on how best to manage our children, yet we are missing the root cause and solution.
SEEN is a groundbreaking feature-length documentary that not only explores the transformative power of personal healing for parents, but also delves into the scientifically supported effects of such healing on parenting and its impact on child brain development.
movie trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZPQXpw6kT0
movie website with all the beautiful info: https://seenthefilm.com/

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The Choral, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Toronto International Film Festival 2025 -

From BAFTA-and-Tony-winning writer Alan Bennett and director Nicholas Hytner, the team behind The History Boys and The Lady in the Van, The Choral explores the humour and humanity at the heart of a community facing an uncertain future.

Academy Award® nominee and BAFTA-winner Ralph Fiennes heads up a cracking cast of character actors in this touching period piece.

As war rages on the Western Front, the Choral Society in Ramsden, Yorkshire has lost most of its men to the army. The Choral’s ambitious committee, determined to press ahead, decides to recruit local young males to swell their ranks.

They must also engage a new chorus master, and despite their suspicions that he has something to hide, their best bet seems to be Dr. Henry Guthrie (Fiennes) – driven, uncompromising, and recently returned from a career in Germany.

As conscription papers start to arrive, the whole community discovers that the best response to the chaos that is laying waste to their lives is to make music together.

With a knockout performance from the always-reliable Fiennes, and a compelling story to boot, The Choral is guaranteed to be a hit at this year’s Festival. Book your tickets quickly to avoid disappointment!

Director: Nicholas Hytner
Cast: Ralph Fiennes, Roger Allam, Mark Addy, Alun Armstrong

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Re-Creation, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Tribeca Film Festival 2025 -

Part courtroom drama, part true crime documentary, the extraordinarily inventive Re-Creation delves into one of Ireland’s most shocking unsolved crimes.

In 1996, French filmmaker Sophie Toscan Du Plantier was murdered at her holiday home in West Cork. English journalist Ian Bailey was investigated by Irish authorities, but never faced trial in Ireland - despite the fact he was tried and convicted in absentia by the French government.

Re-Creation directors Jim Sheridan (My Left Foot, In the Name of the Father) and David Merriman have constructed a fascinating mix of fiction and reality that explores the question: what if Bailey had been tried in Ireland?

The film skilfully brings audiences into the room as a fictional jury sorts through the facts, inconsistencies and inconvenient truths that make the case so intriguing to this day.

With spectacular performances from the ensemble cast, headed by the remarkable Vicky Krieps (Phantom Thread), Re-Creation is an unmissable entry in this year’s line-up.
Rating
Offensive language & content that may disturb
Director
Jim Sheridan and David Merriman
Cast
Vicky Krieps, Jim Sheridan, Aidan Gillen, Colm Meaney

description:
Waifilmfest Presents Never Forgotten: the Marines of Masterton, Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton – Special Screening

After sold-out shows in May 2025, we’re bringing back Never Forgotten: The Marines of Masterton for one more special screening in Martinborough!

This feature-length local documentary tells the story of the United States Marine Corps’ 3rd Defense Battalion, who were stationed at Solway Showgrounds in Masterton in 1943 during World War II. Director Mark Pacey explores the Marines’ visit, the deep connections they formed with the local community, and their lasting legacy—including the journey to constructing a memorial in their honour.

Presented by Waifilmfest in partnership with Circus Cinema, Restaurant & Bar and the Wellington Historical Festival 2025, this is a unique opportunity to experience a powerful story of history, community, and remembrance.

Come and be part of this special event — one last chance to see it on the big screen!

🎥 Rochelle (2024)
A brazen young man takes it upon himself to send his friend’s busted-up car, Rochelle, out in style by entering it in a local demolition derby. But to get there, he needs help from an unexpected source. A bold and surprising new story of friendship, loyalty, and going out with a bang.

description:
Terror-Fi Presents: THE LONG WALK (NZ Premiere - Wellington), How far could you go? Be the first in New Zealand see the stunning new dystopian thriller/horror THE LONG WALK – from the mind of Stephen King.
“A group of teenage boys compete in an annual contest known as The Long Walk, and keep walking faster than three miles per hour — or risk being shot.”
Early reviews back up claims that this intense and emotional exploration of boyhood is one of the most powerful Stephen King adaptations ever made – one that will stay with you long after you leave the cinema.
Based on King’s 1979 novel, the film is co-written by JT Mollner (‘Strange Darling’) and directed by Francis Lawrence (‘Constantine’, ‘The Hunger Games’ franchise) – features a sensational young cast alongside living legend Mark Hamill as our sinister antagonist.
Come to the cinema early to enjoy our themed lobby and custom pre-show… and don’t forget to drink plenty of water beforehand
Directed by Francis Lawrence, THE LONG WALK stars Cooper Hoffman (‘Licorice Pizza’, ’Saturday Night’), David Johnson (‘Alien: Romulus’), Garrett Wareing (‘Dead Sea’), Judy Greer (‘Halloween’), and Mark Hamill (‘Star Wars’).
Huge thanks to the team at StudioCanal NZ for this exclusive.
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Broken English, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Venice International Film Festival 2025 -
- OFFICIAL SELECTION: BFI London Film Festival 2025 -

Broken English is a bold and imaginative documentary portrait of the inimitable singer, songwriter and icon Marianne Faithfull.

A survivor, provocateur and true original, Marianne spent more than six decades defying expectations, releasing over thirty-five albums while constantly reinventing herself.

Made with her full involvement, Broken English is an intimate and unflinching exploration of a fractured yet unbreakable life shaped by fame, creativity and relentless public scrutiny.

The film unfolds within the “Ministry of Not Forgetting”, an imagined, cinematic institution where memory and mythology collide. The Ministry is presided over by Tilda Swinton as The Overseer, and George MacKay (also starring in & Sons at this year’s Festival) serves as The Record Keeper, poring over Faithfull’s life and career.

Broken English is a genre-defying act of resilience and rebellion — Marianne Faithfull’s final fearless declaration, her defiant swan song.
Director
Jane Pollard, Iain Forsyth
Cast
Marianne Faithfull, Tilda Swinton, George MacKay, Zawe Ashton
label: Film & Media

description:
Wairarapa Cinematheque presents Rear Window (1954), Step into the world of Alfred Hitchcock’s timeless classic REAR WINDOW (1954) and help us celebrate the launch of the brand-new Wairarapa Cinematheque 2025 Season.

Cinematheques exist all over the world and are dedicated to presenting films as both cultural heritage and artistic expression. The Wairarapa Cinematheque brings this tradition to our region with monthly screenings on the last Sunday of each month, showcasing classics, contemporary gems, world cinema, and cult favourites.

We begin with REAR WINDOW (1954) starring James Stewart and Grace Kelly, a masterpiece of suspense and one of Hitchcock’s most enduring works. When a photographer confined to his apartment begins to suspect that one of his neighbours has committed a murder, he sets off a chain of events that keeps audiences on the edge of their seats 70 years later.
label: Film & Media

description:
Flying a tattered flag for New Zealand film: Rudall Hayward’s 60-year career, Flying a tattered flag for New Zealand film: Rudall Hayward’s 60-year career
In this month’s Friends of the Turnbull event, author and lecturer Annabel Cooper will talk about researching New Zealand filmmaker Rudall Hayward, best known for his silent films but also his later feature films ‘Rewi’s Last Stand’ and ‘To Love a Māori’.

Join us at the Library or online. Register if you’d like to join this talk and we'll send you the link to use on the day:

Rediscovering Rudall Hayward
Join us for a fascinating talk by historian and author Annabel Cooper as she delves into the life and legacy of Rudall Hayward — a trailblazer of New Zealand filmmaking.

Although not widely known today, Rudall’s career spanned from the early 1900s to the 1970s. He made four feature-length films during New Zealand’s silent film era, later navigating the financial challenges of accessing new sound equipment to make documentaries, educational films, and two more feature films — Rewi’s Last Stand (1940) and the first New Zealand film to be shot in colour, To Love a Māori (1972).

Drawing on research for her biography of Rudall Hayward and his family, Annabel Cooper will explore his enduring contributions to cinema, his collaborative work with his wives Hilda and Ramai, and the cultural legacy he left behind.

A Friends of the Turnbull Library event
The Friends of the Turnbull Library, Ngā Hoa o te Whare Pukapuka Turnbull, offers a monthly programme of free public talks. These talks are held in the National Library in Wellington and on Zoom. Some of these talks will be repeated in Auckland. The public programme highlights the work of researchers who draw on Turnbull material for their projects and staff who care for and research the collections.

About the speaker
Associate Professor Annabel Cooper taught at the University of Otago for 30 years, and published on a number of New Zealand topics including gender history and film. Her last book, Filming the Colonial Past: The New Zealand Wars on Screen, is the subject of an exhibition, He Riri Awatea: Filming the New Zealand Wars, curated with Ariana Tikao for the New Zealand Portrait Gallery and now showing at Canterbury Museum.
label: Film & Media

description:
Mother Tongue: A Sri Lankan food story • WLG screening, Motivated by things that are very tasty, Bhagya and Carl travel to the motherland of Sri Lanka to document forest gardens, coconut mills, rice paddies and Aachi’s house. After a couple years bringing Lankan flavours to the people of Ōtepoti - and armed with the cultural knowledge of diaspora kids - they want to know: Who grew this and why is it so delicious?
Follow us on IG: @media_syndicate
A true labour of love, this film was created to honour the people who put so much work into the food we eat. To this end, proceeds will be donated to our friends at The Movement for Land and Agricultural Reform (MONLAR) so that they can continue in their work for a cooperative, ecological and just food system.
MONLAR's mission is to "cooperate towards building a peoples movement by capacity building and mobilizing of small farmers and marginalized communities, who have become victims of the globalization structures, to protect natural resources and human rights and to lobby for change and implement alternative policies that are favorable and sustainable."
Running time: 42 minutes + QnA with filmmaker Bhagya Herath

Presented by the National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa in partnership with Ngā Taonga Sound & Vision and Manatū Taonga Ministry for Culture and Heritage.

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Four Mothers, - WINNER: Audience Award, BFI London Film Festival 2024 -

Edward (James McArdle, Mary Queen of Scots, Mare of Easttown), a novelist saddled with caring for his elderly mother, Alma (Fionnula Flanagan, Waking Ned Devine) finally finds himself on the brink of literary success.

With pressure to go on a US book tour mounting, the last thing Edward needs is his friends jetting off to Spain for an impromptu Pride holiday, leaving their mothers on his doorstep!

Over a chaotic weekend, he has to juggle his burgeoning career with the care of four eccentric, combative, and wildly different ladies.

An Irish twist on the acclaimed Italian hit Mid-August Lunch, this uplifting comedy and tender drama takes an unlikely found family on an emotionally charged journey of self-discovery and acceptance.

Book your tickets now for this Irish charmer, winner of the BFI London Film Festival Audience Award!
Director
Darren Thornton
Cast
James McArdle, Fionnula Flanagan, Niamh Cusack, Dearbhla Molloy

description:
Rongotai Labour Film Evening, For everyone who missed the showing of "Prime Minister' - a film about the extraordinary term of Jacinda Adern's leadership of New Zealand - at the NZIFF, Rongotai Labour is pleased to secure a showing to help to raise funds for the 2026 election campaign.
This film chronicles Jacinda Adern's tenure as Prime Minister and provides an insight into both the political and personal challenges Jacinda faced during those six years. The inclusion of considerable footage from Jacinda's partner Clarke Gayford provides a deeply personal view of life as the Prime Minister in very challenging times.
(Los Angeles Times review) 'Prime Minister' is not interested in wrangling, dealing and lawmaking, or even the nuts and bolts or her progressive views. .. But in the fleet, pacey manner of the editing, toggling between private and public moments with highlight-reel efficiency, the film is a stirring glimpse of top-down kindness as a winning leadership style.

description:
24-hour Squash Marathon for Wayne, 24 Hours on Court for Wayne.
This time I’m picking up my squash racket for a challenge like no other: 24 hours of nonstop squash. Why? Because someone I care for has been facing a far tougher battle.
My father-in-law was recently diagnosed with Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL). For years he lived undiagnosed, pushing through symptoms without answers. Now that we finally know what he’s fighting, I want to turn my energy into something that can help him—and others—on their journeys.
According to CLL Advocates NZ, only 10-15 people out of 250 on average per year benefit from the budget allocation. And many are not even able to receive the same treatment options here in NZ.
Squash has always been a sport of endurance, resilience, and determination. Playing for 24 hours is my way of honoring his fight, raising awareness, and bringing people together to support the cause.
You can help by:
Donating: Any amount you would like to.
Predicting: Predicting how many points and games will be played in 24 hours.
Joining me on court: Book a slot to play a game, cheer from the sidelines, or come be part of the atmosphere.
Buy raffle tickets, or sponsor a prize towards the raffle.
We would like to give a shout out to our current sponsors;
Hair Phoria,
Aimee Photography,
X-Potential,
Mitchells,
Meaters,
CBD Eatery,
Forrest Wines and
Fat Tony's
No matter how small, your contribution will make a difference. Together we can transform his story of late diagnosis into one of community, awareness, and action.
I’ll be pushing myself through the night, but I won’t be alone—your support will keep me going with every serve, rally, and game. Let’s make this 24 hours count.

Aldo Cuccurullo Memorial Trophy
Each year Club Garibaldi of Wellington and Club Italia of Nelson interact through a soccer game between representatives of the two clubs.
The game is in memory of Aldo Cuccurullo, a young member of Club Italia who tragically died at a very young age.
Aldo was known as a gentle giant who gave of his time not only to play rugby league himself, but also to coach children.
The game, as you would expect of Italian football, is a tense one. Member supporters of each club travel to be at the game but the weekend is as much an opportunity to socialise and build friendships as it is to play football.

description:
Export Ready: Strategies and Lessons for International Growth, Whether you're exploring new markets, refining your export strategy, or preparing to scale globally, this practical workshop will equip you with the tools, insights, and confidence to take your business international
What’s in store
Join export expert Pete Torrington for an interactive, 2.5-hour workshop designed specifically for local producers and manufacturers. Drawing on over 30 years of global experience, Pete will guide you through the essential steps to becoming export ready.
You’ll learn how to:
Assess your export potential and avoid common pitfalls
Choose the right international markets for your product
Build effective distribution and retail strategies
Navigate food safety, packaging, and compliance requirements
Price and promote your product for global shelves
Whether you're just starting your export journey or want to sharpen your approach, this workshop offers real-world advice and actionable strategies to help you succeed.
Who should attend
Food and beverage producers
Consumer goods manufacturers
Agribusinesses and primary sector entrepreneurs
Anyone considering export as a growth strategy
About the Facilitator
Pete Torrington is the founder of Ask Pete Advisory and brings over 30 years of international commercial experience in food and consumer goods, including senior roles at Colgate-Palmolive across Europe, Asia, and Australasia. He now works with New Zealand manufacturers and producers to help them grow in overseas markets.
More information: www.askpete.co.nz

description: Customer Service Excellence, A fantastic one-day course to get staff communicating professionally and confidently with customers. Keep your customers coming back by empowering staff with core communication and customer service skills along with a ‘can do attitude’. For the better part of every day, we are communicating to and with others. This workshop will equip participants with the skills and techniques required to transform how you manage relationships with customers, colleagues and stakeholders. Have you ever thought about how you come across to others and what it’s like to be on the receiving end of you? This workshop will help participants to understand the different methods of communication. Whether it’s the speech you deliver to your customers and work colleagues, the level of attention you give your spouse when they are talking to you, or the look that you give to the cat, it all means something! Each and every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not. Maybe you’re in a frontline position serving the people who buy your products. Perhaps you’re serving staff members in other departments within your organisation. Learn ways to communicate with customers in a professional and positive manner, build rapport authentically, provide a great customer experience each and every time, build loyalty and repeat business, handle conflict and much more. This course also covers telephone etiquette, email and face-to-face. To book: email - info@biztrainers.co.nz or call 04 974 8790.

Register Today by contacting Crown Leadership International Group: Website: www.crownleadership.com.au Phone: +64 9 889 7217

About this Event

Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Electra Business After Five - 4 November 2025, October/November Electra BA5 
Electra BA5 Business Under Pressure
How to safeguard, secure and stay ahead 
Join us for an informative evening designed to help local businesses navigate the financial and legal landscape of 2025. Our expert panel featuring a leading insurance broker, bank representative, lawyer, and accountant who will unpack the key issues shaping business resilience today.

Our panel brings together experienced professionals who work daily with New Zealand businesses navigating financial, legal, and operational challenges to provide insights. 

Topics include overviews on the latest Trust legislation and whether your trust is truly protecting you, the IRD’s $100 million investment in increased audits, and why 88% of liquidations and receiverships involve IRD debt. You’ll also gain crucial insights into insurance risks, and what movements in the OCR and interest rates mean for your business planning.

Hear from speakers from CS Law on trust protection, Grant Thornton on accounting and compliance trends, Insure Group on mitigating business and risks, and BNZ Business on preparing for lending and cashflow pressures.

This is a must-attend session for business owners, directors and advisors who want to stay informed, protect  assets and make smarter financial decisions in the year ahead.
Electra Business After Five
Tuesday 4th November 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf

description:
Painless Presenting, Full day presentation skills workshop in Wellington. Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
Who's it for?
You work in a technical field. You’re great at your job — but struggle to get your ideas across the business.
You often:
Dive into technical detail that loses or confuses your audience
Overload people with too much information, which makes it harder to get the results you need
Find it tough to explain complex areas of your role in a way others can easily understand
Spend hours planning presentations, yet still feel stiff and uncomfortable when delivering
Feel nervous when presenting, and wish you could speak with more ease and confidence
If this sounds like you, Painless Presenting will help you cut through complexity, present clearly, and build the confidence you know is vital for your career growth.
What you will learn:
A proven step by step process that will take the pain out of planning presentations and set the foundations for becoming a more engaging, natural and effective business presenter.

Participants are taught how to write a valuable business presentation, how to manage their nerves, design useful visuals and are given key delivery techniques to help deliver their presentations in a natural and engaging way.
You will come away with:
an understanding of how to use the SpeakerMap™ system, a step by step, proven approach to planning presentations quickly and effectively
a new appreciation of purpose when speaking
an understanding of how to quickly design useful presentation visuals
how to easily overcome the problems of speaking too fast, um-ing and ah-ing, and losing your place
a tailored strategy to dissolve the anxiety that so often accompanies presenting
three delivery tricks that will help you come across as credible and confident
Note: You will not need to present to the group on this course. If you are interested in a more intensive training option, including one on one coaching, check out our 2 day workshop The Effective Speaker.
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8

description:
Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe, Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe
Event Details
📅 Date: Wednesday, 22 October 2025
🕐 Time: 5:00 PM – 6:30 PM
📍 Location: SiteSafe Headquarters, 23-25 Jarden Mile, Ngauranga, Wellington 6035
👥 Capacity and Cost: FREE, with a maximum of 20 attendees (NAWIC and non-NAWIC members welcome - bring a friend!)
🦺 PPE Requirements: No PPE required.
Join us for an engaging evening with SiteSafe, New Zealand’s leading experts in health, safety, and wellbeing. This session will offer a unique behind-the-scenes look at how SiteSafe cares for their own people, providing insight into the innovative initiatives they’ve implemented to support staff wellbeing, health, and safety.
This event is especially relevant for consultants, designers, and office-based professionals who want to see how a safety-focused culture can be successfully embedded within an organisation — even outside a construction site.
 Why attend:
Learn from their approach: Discover the specific HSE and wellbeing initiatives SiteSafe has introduced for their staff, including mental health support, proactive safety programs, and team engagement strategies. See how these approaches create a positive, resilient workplace culture.
Practical insights for your team: Whether you manage design teams, consult on projects, or work in office-based or site-based roles, learn actionable ideas to enhance wellbeing, safety awareness, and engagement within your own team.
Explore their offerings: Gain an overview of the courses, training, and advisory services SiteSafe provides, which can help organisations of any type embed stronger health, safety, and wellbeing practices.
Network in a relaxed environment: Connect with fellow industry professionals over snacks and drinks hosted by SiteSafe. Exchange ideas, share experiences, and enjoy informal conversations in a friendly setting.
SiteSafe is more than a site-safety organisation — they are a model for how to embed effective HSE and wellbeing practices that benefit staff, improve organisational culture, and support long-term project success. This event is an opportunity to see these practices in action, gain practical ideas for your own team, and connect with like-minded professionals in the industry.
🙏 Huge thanks to SiteSafe for offering us this opportunity!
 Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
Compliance made SME-asy: Employment basics with ATH Consulting, Are you confident in navigating the complexities of employment relationships in today’s ever-changing workplace? Join us for a comprehensive workshop designed for managers, employers, and business owners who want to deepen their understanding of employment fundamentals and people management best practices.
What You’ll Learn:
Foundations of Employment Relationships:
Explore the essential components that shape every employment relationship, including relevant legislation, terms and conditions, and the pivotal role of workplace policies and procedures.
Understanding Employment Types:
Distinguish between permanent, full-time, casual, and seasonal roles, and learn how each type impacts your obligations and management strategies.
Employment Legislation Essentials:
Get a practical overview of the 10 key employment laws that influence your workplace, ensuring you stay compliant and informed.
Good Faith and Agreements:
Discover the importance of acting in good faith and the differences between Individual Employment Agreements (IEA) and Collective Employment Agreements (CEA), including mandatory clauses and recommended “nice to have” terms.
Managing Change:
Learn best practices for handling variations to employment agreements and implementing effective workplace policies and procedures.
People Management Mastery:
Gain insights into the employee lifecycle, building a strong employment brand, and managing common workplace issues such as performance improvement plans (PiP), disciplinary processes, attendance, and health and wellbeing.
Leadership and Succession:
Identify the hallmarks of poor leadership and develop strategies for effective succession planning to future-proof your team.
Support Systems:
Know where to get help—learn when to trust your gut, when to rely on facts, and how to access the right support at the right time.
This workshop is your opportunity to build confidence, reduce risk, and enhance your leadership toolkit. Whether you’re new to managing people or looking to refresh your knowledge, you’ll leave with practical insights and actionable strategies for every stage of the employment relationship.
Don’t miss this chance to strengthen your employment management skills and connect with peers facing similar challenges. Register now and take the next step toward becoming a more effective, knowledgeable, and resilient leader.
When: Wednesday 10 September 9.00 am - 11.00 am
Where: Carterton Community Courthouse (next to Events Centre) Holloway Street, Carterton
Cost: Members $65 + GST, Non-Members $120 +GST
This workshop needs a minimum of 15 attendees to go ahead.

description:
Managing for value: building a strong financial advice business-Wellington, Building a valuable financial advice business means you have a resilient business to support your clients and a strong asset. Transactions – acquisition and disposal support the long-term growth and sustainability of financial advice provider businesses. Transactions take many forms, going concerns regularly acquire and dispose of clients, business units, lines of business, have investors buy-in, bring key staff together – and split businesses up. Only a small number of our transactions are the classic market exit.
Our aim is to spend time talking with advisers about how to grow their business and manage for value – making their business more valuable by explicitly thinking about valuation in addition to the other metrics such as profit and cashflow.

description:

A 4 hour, practice-based session with Hildy Gottlieb.
Who this is for
People whose mahi is to help organisations do their best work: capacity builders,
advisors, funders and philanthropy staff, backbone and collective impact teams,
council and agency community advisors, sector peak bodies, governance support roles, coaches, consultants and trainers.
Why come
When you support others to thrive, the questions you ask can unlock entirely new
pathways. In this interactive session, you’ll learn practical, question-led approaches you can apply immediately in meetings, workshops, coaching and governance development.

description:
Behind the Scenes with VicASA: BDO Wellington, 🔥 Behind the Scenes with VicASA x BDO 🔥
Exams are coming - so why host events now?
Because your future doesn’t wait for finals.
Exams test your memory, but these events sharpen your career. While exams last weeks, the connections you’ll make at BDO last a lifetime.
Here’s the truth: top firms don’t just recruit; they provide support, advice, and insider tips to help you thrive as a student and future professional. These events aren’t distractions - they’re an investment in your success.
Therefore the VicASA exec made sure these events (just like the rest) are taking you beyond the lecture halls and giving you exclusive access inside the most influential firms in the accounting world. And yes, it’s all completely free.
Wednesday 24 September – BDO Open Office & LinkedIn Headshots from 2:30pm to 3:30pm! Arrive at 2:15pm to get the full experience!
Join us for an hour long experience to talk one-on-one with the most professional bodies from both the capital and international offices. And of course, 🍴 free food — because good conversations happen best over kai.
✨ What makes this event different from any other?
Most student events stop at surface-level networking. This goes further:
At BDO, you’ll step into an open-office tour led by BDO reps, chat one-on-one with professional buddies, and even get a professional LinkedIn headshot for free by selecting the "BDO - LinkedIn Headshot" option alongside your ticket (first in, first served!) to boost your personal brand.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
First-in, first-served — spaces are extremely limited
Genuine behind-the-scenes exposure you won’t find at standard info sessions
Practical takeaways: real answers, real connections, and a polished LinkedIn profile
💡 These are not your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic inside look at the top firms, preparing you for your next steps in a way that’s practical, personal, and powerful.
