description:
The Effective Speaker, Wellington, 18th & 19th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)
What past participants say:

"The overall experience of the course far surpassed my expectations. I came in hoping to gain some valuable insights and tips for better public speaking, but what I received was so much more. I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. It's not just another course; it's a transformative experience that will empower you to become a more confident and persuasive speaker" Alex Goryachev, New Zealand Green Building Council
“This course not only met my expectations, but it completely exceeded them. This has been one of the most transformative courses I’ve attended. Jane totally revolutionised the way I now approach presentations. Having felt fear in the past each time I have to present to large groups, for the first time I now feel like I have the tools, understanding and ability to approach presentations and conquer my fear. I can’t thank Jane enough.” Nadia Marsh, Head of Bids, Tonkin & Taylor
"I have never been in such a well-run course (I've done a lot) Jane was amazing she held our attention from start to finish each day. I feel we all learnt so much and I will definitely be taking her advice on how I can improve myself. This course was well above what I expected, Jane had a great way of communicating. Typically, people tune out or lose interest by the end of the day. This was not the case for us. I honestly thing it’s the best course I’ve been on in my 4 years with WCC." Joshua Harding, Team Leader Consents, Wellington City Council

“The course is awesome. The balance between talk time, practical learning and feedback is perfect. The trainer really made the course for me - she is sensitive and responsive to people’s needs and is genuine in her approach to give the learners as much out of the time as possible. A very polished and well-planned course.” Huia Grey, Department of Conservation

This workshop covers a wide range of core customer service skills that will equip your staff with the expertise and techniques required to provide superior customer service every time.   
Every one of us serves customers, whether we realise it or not.  Together we will look at all types of customers and how we can serve them better and improve ourselves in the process.  
State what customer service means in relation to all your customers.
Recognise how your attitude affects customer service.
Identify your customers’ needs.
Create a great first impression

Use outstanding customer service to generate return business.
Build good will through in-person customer service.

description:
NZ Drum & Dance Camp, NZ Drum & Dance Camp
Join us this 24th to 27th October for a West African musical immersion at our annual NZ Drum Dance Camp.

Set amidst 38 acres of native bushland just a short drive from Wellington, this weekend is a celebration of unity, rhythm, and the soul-stirring power of African drum and dance, curated for the NZ African drumming community.

We are excited to announce that Epizo Bangoura will be back to join us again in 2025!

Epizo Bangoura is a celebrated master musician from Guinea, West Africa, known for his extraordinary versatility on the Kora (African harp), Balafon (African tuned percussion), and Djembe/Duns.

Epizo will be joined by Ghanaian Master Drummer Yaw Asumadu and special guest Jimi Dale.

Camp Highlights:

♪ Djembe and Dunun Workshops: Suitable for all skill levels, from enthusiastic beginners to advanced drummers, guided by our awesome team of teachers.
♪ Traditional Dance: with the effervescent Epizo Bangoura.
♪ Group Jams and Musical Sessions: Strengthen communal bonds through captivating group jams and impromptu musical sessions.
♪ Tranquil Setting: Enjoy the native bushland environ - build mind, body and spirit whilst enhancing our weekend of music and togetherness.
♪ Catering – Breakfast, Lunch & Dinner included on Saturday and Sunday, as well as breakfast Monday. Please bring a shared (pre-prepared) plate for Friday evening kai.

Featured Instructors:

Epizo Bangoura: A master of the djembe and traditional dance, Epizo brings profound knowledge and vibrant energy, embodying the essence of West African music and dance.

Yaw Asumadu: A Master Drummer from Ghana, Yaw has performed globally and taught African drumming for 25 years, collaborating with legendary artists.

Jimi Dale: A pioneer of African music in NZ, Jimi has been teaching African Drum and Dance classes since 1995 and formed the world music and dance group, Tamani. We are excited to have Jimi back again teaching us a dun dance piece.

Pricing Details:
♪ Early Bird: $450 (Reserve by Sunday 31st August 2025)
♪ Adult rate: $495
♪ Kids 9 – 14 years old: $250
♪ Kids 8 and under: $175
♪ Family Packages available on request
♪ Single Day & night $220 (includes 3 meals and full day tuition)
♪ Drum Hire: $15

Event Schedule Snapshot:
♪ Friday, 24th October: Arrive from 4pm - A warm welcome sets the stage for a weekend filled with rhythm and learning.
Bring a share plate for dinner.
♪ Saturday, 25th October: Engage in enriching drum and dance workshops. Participants will be grouped into their appropriate levels.
♪ Sunday, 26th October: Continue your musical journey with drum and dance sessions, leading to a group performance that encapsulates the weekend’s shared experiences.
♪ Monday, 27th October: Morning All in Drum & Dance ceremony, then it's time to hit the road.

FAQs
♪ Getting Ready: Bring your drum (if available), snacks for the weekend, dance-appropriate shoes, sleeping gear (pillowcase & sheet, sleeping bag/ doona), warm clothes, and an eager spirit.
♪ Beginners are warmly welcomed – our camp is a nurturing space for newcomers to discover the joy of African drumming and dance, bolstered by a supportive community.

For more information and tickets -
https://africandrumming.co.nz/tours-and-retreats/nz-drum-dance-camp/

More questions?
Contact - Tulletha at or call: 028 474 1123

description:
POP Go the Festival Singers: Island Bay Presbyterian Church, The Festival Singers invite you to a enjoy unforgettable music in POP go the Festival Singers – a dazzling celebration of popular songs from the 1920s right through to today. Expect energy, variety, and entertainment as we journey through swing, rock ’n’ roll, Motown, disco, soft rock, and contemporary pop.
The programme sparkles with classics and favourites: a Beach Boys Medley full of surfside sunshine, Ruru Karaitiana’s iconic Blue Smoke, Elvis Presley’s Hound Dog, and Bobby Darin’s Beyond the Sea. We’ll groove with Pharrell Williams’ Happy, cheer to Survivor’s Eye of the Tiger, and celebrate Kiwi pride in Crowded House’s Weather with You. Heartfelt beauty shines through Simon and Garfunkel’s Bridge Over Troubled Water and Billy Joel’s And So It Goes, while fun abounds with The Lion Sleeps Tonight and Gershwin’s sultry Summertime.
Swing makes its mark with Glenn Miller’s Chattanooga Choo Choo and In the Mood, while a rousing Queen Medley and an exuberant ABBA Medley bring the concert to a thrilling close. Along the way, enjoy contemporary sparkle with Dua Lipa’s Levitating and the timeless artistry of these unforgettable hits.
With the incomparable Jonathan Berkahn at the piano, every piece shines with character and style. This concert promises nostalgia, joy, and toe-tapping fun – a true trip down memory lane with something for everyone.
Join us and be part of a celebration of music that entertains, connects, and uplifts.

description:
Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025, Rathkeale College Christmas Fête 2025
Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025!
Now in its 22nd year, the Fête offers shoppers loads of inspiration. Stallholders will be selling festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, as well as flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.
Gourmet food is also a highlight – with freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries and icecream available for purchase. Devonshire Tea served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular home baking stall features again this year, and visitors are encouraged to get in early as the Christmas cakes, in particular, often sell out by midday.
The beauty of this Fête is it is a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus indoor and outdoor stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children with face painting and three magic shows during the day to round out the fun.
Visitors can meander around the beautiful campus and enjoy the unique surroundings including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.
The Christmas Fête is the school’s biggest fundraiser of the year and comes about thanks to an amazing collaboration between the Friends of Rathkeale College, staff and students.
Koha/gold coin entry
Eftpos available but we strongly recommend bringing cash.
More information: https://rathkeale.school.nz/community/#friends-of-rathkeale

description:
Te Papa Foundation Gala, Te Papa Foundation Gala
Wellington’s premier fundraising event, the Te Papa Foundation Gala brings together Aotearoa New Zealand’s leading supporters of arts and culture for one spectacular night in the museum.

🖼️ Enjoy handcrafted cocktails, discover new favourites in the Toi Art galleries, savour an exquisite three-course dinner paired with premium local wines, bid in our live charity auction, and then dance to live performances from acclaimed local musicians.

👋🏼Thanks to Webb’s, the Gala features a special live auction of once-in-a-lifetime experiences, including Sake & sushi with Dick Frizzell, a stunning carving by Tim Steel (Ngāi Tahu), and luxury escapes.

🎟️Tickets cost $3,000 for a table of ten, or $300 per person.

DJ tunes from Vinyl & Proud. Cash bar and yummy treats by Paekākāriki School PTA.

This year's proceeds from Paekākāriki Pride Festival 2024 will be donated to Wellington Pride as they navigate their court case against LAVA. For more information follow this link: https://www.wellingtonpridefestival.com/news-1/an-update-on-the-hrrt-case

Our kaupapa:
Paekākāriki Pride exists to support Takatāpui and Rainbow communities in the Kāpiti Region and beyond.
We firmly hold the position that trans women are women and trans men are men, and that non-binary identities are valid. We recognise the harm caused by colonisation to Takatāpui communities. As an organisation we work to become better Treaty Partners

description:
Rathkeale Christmas Fete 2025, Welcome to the Rathkeale Christmas Fête 2025! Walk through the gates of Rathkeale College on 1st November and be welcomed by a diverse range of colourful stalls, the aroma of freshy cooked food and plenty of festive inspiration.

Now in its 22nd year, the Christmas Fête has become a must-do event on the Wairarapa spring calendar. Stallholders travel from around the North Island to sell their wares and offer Christmas shoppers loads of inspiration. From festive decorations, clothing, arts and crafts, to flowers, toys and plants – there is something for everyone.

Gourmet food is always a highlight at the Fête - think freshly made gourmet burgers, lamb & mint sausages, wraps, curry, salads, and the ever-popular berries & ice-cream - there is always a huge variety of flavours to tempt the taste buds. Devonshire Teas and home baking served in the Rathkeale Homestead rose garden is a time-honoured tradition while refreshing cold drinks can be sipped on as visitors listen to live music performed by students at various times throughout the day. The popular Christmas cake stall features again this year - but visitors are encouraged to get in early as the cakes often sell out by midday.

The beauty of this Fête is that it’s a day out for the whole family. In addition to the 120 plus stalls, there is plenty to entertain the children including facepainting and magic shows throughout the day.

Visitors can also explore the beautiful, expansive grounds of Rathkeale College including the school gardens designed by Alfred Buxton, the Greek Amphitheatre and the 3km eco-trail which weaves through large stands of native trees, including ancient kahikatea.

Eftpos is available, but we strongly recommend that visitors bring cash.

Koha/gold coin entry.
Rathkeale College is a five-minute drive north of Masterton in the Wairarapa.

description:
Day of the Dead Celebration - Dia de los Muertos, Join Claudio for this special occasion we will be celebrating one of the most important holidays in Mexico, the day of the dead or “Dia de los Muertos”.

The Day of the Dead is one of the traditions that has remained alive throughout the centuries; the main holidays are November 1 & 2, which UNESCO designated and cataloged as an Intangible Heritage of Humanity in 2003.

This special celebration dates back to prehispanic times before the arrival of Europeans to America, and has been alive and widely celebrated over the years.

Expect:

Cleansing copal and herbal welcoming.

An opening ceremony to acknowledge the Tlalmanalli (offering and altar) with the deep sound of the conch shell in the four directions and drums sounds.

History of the day of the dead celebration.

Explanation of the altar, and the main elements for an ofrenda.

Storytelling: learn of Mexican legends like Catrinas and Xoloitzcuintle (the Mexican dog that helps the dead to find their way to Mictlan, the Aztec underword).

Remembering and sharing histories about the loved ones that passed away (optional but encouraged)

Traditional Mexican chants for remembering the loved ones

Atole de Chocolate, a traditional prehispanic drink - amazing in flavour, consumed cold or hot

Music to invoke emotion and imagery of contemplative natural and mystical environments

Finish with a shamanic atmosphere of relaxation and traditional chants.

description:
Teaching Well - Supportive schools for a well staff - Wellington (TWS2025/04), With the growing emphasis on staff wellbeing there is a plethora of workplace mental wellbeing programmes on offer. However what is meant by staff wellbeing is not often clearly defined, with many programmes focusing on work related 'stressors' for staff or using staff wellness approach.  
As part of a well school, it is just essential to have a well staff as it is to a well student body. Take the opportunity to learn the underlying principles of wellbeing that inform a sustainable and impactful staff wellbeing plan.  
Designed specifically for the school context, the workshop examines the theory and the practice of promoting wellbeing through the lens of of being part of a school staff in 2025.
From Remedial to Sustainable Action
Equipping individual staff members skills or resources to cope more effectively with the stressful or distressing aspects of their jobs or providing an employee assistance programme is only one aspect of a comprehensive staff wellbeing plan. It is common for schools to start their development of their plan at the remedial end of the wellbeing continuum. Consequently the plan developed is more a welfare / wellness plan. Learn the difference between welfare, wellness and wellbeing approaches and the strengths and weaknesses of each approach. 

Meta-evaluations of workplace mental wellbeing programmes indicate that there is little evidence around the efficacy of many workplace wellbeing programmes because they do not address the organisational and systemic factors that act as either enablers of or obstacles to wellbeing. Just as it is recognised that supportive environments are foundational to wellbeing of students, so is it also for a well staff. An effective staff wellbeing programmes responds to the needs of the staff and reflects the cultural make-up of the staff, the values and character of the school. 
Drawing on collective impact and transformational change theory and Te Whare Tapa Whā, a conceptual model will be introduced that outlines the eight pou on which a staff wellbeing plan should be based. The strength of this model is that it settings or occupation specific. It requires a depth analysis of the nature, dynamics and demands of the work and the inter-relationships that occur in the work
Building of the learnings from previous workshops and feedback from participants, the workshop now offers a template to guide the development of a staff wellbeing plan
If you are wanting a workshop that will give you a pre-packaged wellbeing programme, then this workshop is not for you. Countless evaluations have shown the limited efficacy of wellbeing programmes that are "inserted" into a school. A staff wellbeing plan must grounded in and responsive to the learnings made out of the reflective analysis and staff consultation stages. In fact, the staff consultation is, in itself, is a wellbeing activity.
Take the opportunity to hear from an award winning wellbeing specialist about:
the wellbeing continuum and the difference between mental illness prevention and wellbeing approaches
the key determinants that impact on staff wellbeing
effective strategies to respond to fatigue, burnout, depression and trauma
why one size doesn't fit all and how to scope and design a staff wellbeing programme responsive to the specific needs of your school
developing a staff wellbeing programme based on proven wellbeing outcomes
making informed decisions on your school’s staff wellbeing policy and activities
Workshop Format:
The content will be delivered over two workshops.
In-Person 1 day workshop in Wellington
Friday 31 October 9am to 4pm
On-Line Workshop
Wednesday 3 December 1 - 3.30pm

Topics covered in this practical workshop:
what is meant by wellbeing and its role in addressing stress and mental distress in staff;
the difference between a welfare and a wellbeing approach;
staff wellbeing as an industrial relations / conditions of employment issue
resilience, coping, thriving? - identifying desired wellbeing outcomes
the interface between personal and professional stressors and distressors
the impact on staff wellbeing from exposure to trauma and poor mental wellbeing within the student body
the key determinants that facilitate wellbeing in the teaching environment
what does and what doesn’t contribute to a supportive environment where staff thrive
the key components that should be in a staff wellbeing programme
designing, implementing and evaluating a staff wellbeing programme
School Group Participation
Schools are encouraged to have more than one staff member participate in the online workshops. Past workshops has shown that having more than one staff member has maximised the benefit of the workshop activities which can then been continued post-workshop. To promote school group participation, there is a 30% discount off the total registration fee when three or more participants per school are registered.
Who should attend: 
Senior leadership team members (especially those with responsibility of staff wellbeing)
OHS representatives or union delegates
Heads of Departments
Boards of Trustees representatives
School Counsellors / EAP providers
In-House Delivery:
This workshop can also be delivered in-house, school clusters, or organisations such as prinicpal assocations or unions. Post workshop consulting services such as mentoring the development of or reviewing a staff wellbeing plan can also be provided.
Post Workshop Consult:
Schools and Kuras have the option of a 90 minute consult with Barry in 2026 to review their staff wellbeing plan.
Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention/postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.  His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programs. 
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in mental wellbeing both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas.  In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award.  He currently sits on the Health and Disability Ethics Committee.
Barry has lectured on wellbeing both nationally and internationally and been appointed to numerous government advisory committees on mental wellbeing and suicide prevention.  He brings to this workshop extensive experience in advising communities and government on post-disaster recovery in terms of both mental wellbeing promotion / community resiliency and suicide prevention. He wrote the first national guidelines for suicide prevention in Australian schools and undertook a review of the NZ guidelines.
As a Health Sociologist and Public Health practitioner, Barry has a long-term interest in the social and cultural determinants of wellbeing, especially the role of gender and he brings a wealth of knowledge and passion for promoting wellbeing in men. He has examined the impact of discrimination, internalised stigma, social exclusion or inclusion on mental wellbeing along with the role of human rights as an enabler of wellbeing.
He embraces a holistic understanding of wellbeing and has an interest in the role spirituality and ecology contributes to a person's wellbeing. He uses a population health and systems change approach, drawing on transformational change theory and collective impact.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to promote well whānau, workplaces and communities and for the incorporation of wellbeing principles in public policy and social outcomes such as education, training and employment.
WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration
School & Kura Discount: Enter SCHOOLKURA20 to the Discount Code box at the beginning of the registration process for a further 20% discount off the registration fee.
Payment: Payment is by either:
Credit Card (Visa or Mastercard) or 
Instalment payment (ZIP and Afterpay)
Invoice - Schools and kura have the option to pay by invoice. At payment method click on Invoice,
Terms for Payment By Invoice
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $35+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund
Disclaimer: The information and professional advice delivered in the workshop and the associated printed material is provided solely on the basis that before relying on this material, participants should obtain appropriate advice relevant to their particular circumstance to evaluate its accuracy, currency, completeness and relevance for their purposes. TaylorMade Training and Consulting will not be liable for any damages of any kind to any person or entity arising from the use of this information. Your attendance at this workshop reflects your acceptance of this statement.

description:
Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me Wellington Central, Tautoko Tāne is hosting Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me - a nationwide series of free presentations for agencies, service providers and professionals to share information and insights about working with male survivors of sexual abuse to get the support they need.
There will be two sessions on 12 November at Rydges Wellington CBD - 10am and 2pm.
The presentation includes:
Safe access and effective engagement of male survivors with support services
Dispelling some of the common myths about male victims of sexual harm
Navigate the misunderstandings that create barriers to engagement with support services
Highlight the role of lived experience as an effective engagement model
Collaboration and partnerships to welcome and embrace cultural and gender diversity within the male survivor community
Supporting complex trauma requires a shared response from several organisations, each with different skills and experience – no single agency or organisation can do it alone.
As more male survivors present with complex trauma, New Zealand will need even more collaborative sector partnerships to provide the wrap-around services necessary for recovery.
Hoake Tātou | Walk With Me is about bringing those different organisations together to hear from those with lived experience, and share information and understandings about working with male survivors of sexual abuse and violence, to help them get the support they need.
We hope you will join us. Please REGISTER here to attend
https://tautokotane.nz/hoake-tatou-walk-with-me/
label: Health & Wellness

description:
She Rises: Spring Edition, When was the last time you truly paused?
Not just for a moment between tasks, but long enough to breathe and focus on your own wellbeing?

On the eve of Spring, join us for an afternoon, designed to nourish your soul, rejuvenate your energy and awaken the inspiration you need for the season ahead.
As a business owner, Leadership Coach and active mum of four, Sina Mikaio knows the importance of taking the time to escape the hustle and reset each season. That’s why she created She Rises - Spring Edition. An opportunity for you to step away from the noise, let go of the schedules and reconnect with your own inner wisdom.

Who Is This Workshop For?
This intimate gathering is for the women who:
Feels like she is holding it all—career, family and relationships—and is yearning for a space to finally let go.
Knows she wants more from life, but is seeking clarity on what that is and how to get there.
Is ready to release the stories of self doubt and exhaustion that have been holding her back.
Craves connection not only with herself, but with a circle of like-minded women who just "get it."

What To Expect: Your Journey
Your journey through this immersive afternoon will be woven through three powerful pillars:
Movement: Beginning with a nourishing yoga flow designed to release stored energy from the body, clear your mind and open your channels to receive your own guidance. (All levels welcome).
Mindset: A deep dive into your personal energy. You will learn how it impacts your presence, identify where you are leaking energy, release what no longer serves you and get crystal clear on what you want to call in.
Manifestation: A powerful guided visualisation to connect you with your deepest intuition. This practice will help bring your ideas forth, give you clarity on your next steps and provide you with the tools to build a purposeful pathway towards your goals.

You Will Leave With:
Clarity on your path for the season ahead
Unshakeable Confidence in your own wisdom, intelligence and power
The Courage to take aligned action towards a life you truly love
Actionable tools to regulate your nervous system and manage your energy daily.
A profound sense of feeling grounded, inspired and aligned within yourself.

Tickets available to purchase via eventbrite link below:

https://www.eventbrite.co.nz/e/she-rises-spring-edition-tickets-1550395166679?aff=oddtdtcreator

description:
A free workshop for the General Public: Dying to Know about Dying Matters?, Please note, this is a FREE workshop availble to the public and is not designed for health professionals to attend.
Many people find it difficult to talk about dying, yet dying is an important stage of life and is inevitable.
We plan for the birth of a child, yet when it comes to the end of life, we don’t often want to think , or talk about it.
Come along to our workshop and find out more about dying matters, how an Advance Care Planning (ACP)can benefit you and your family/whānau and what to expect at the end of life.
Having a plan outlines our care preferences for the future. Having an Advance Care Plan (ACP) that aligns with our beliefs and values, is a gift that we can give to our family / whānau.
We will explore:
Why is it hard to talk about death and dying?
What to expect when someone is dying
Supports available
Advance care planning processes
Date: Friday 5 September 2025
Time: 9.00 am - 12.30 pm
Presenters: Mary Ann Hardcastle Advance Care Plannining Facilitator & Chris Dunn Clinical Nurse Educator Nelson Tasman Hospice
Cost: Free
Limited attendees: Registration is essential
Who can attend?: General Public (This workshop is not designed for Health Professionals)
Venue: Nelson Tasman Hospice, 331 Suffolk Road, Stoke, Nelson

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System
If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for high-achieving women ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.
You might notice these signs:
Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep
Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive
Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body
Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax
Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.
What to bring/prepare:
Comfortable clothing for movement
Water bottle and journal
Yoga mat provided
Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils
Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in
Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.
Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:
Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)
Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)
A history of seizures or epilepsy
Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)
Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)
Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement
You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.
About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing women overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”

www.lynofuro.co.nz

Silencing the Inner Critic - meditation course
with Kadam Birgit

We can easily develop the unhelpful habit of harsh self-criticism, disturbing our mental peace and holding us back from being the person we want to be.
Learn to recognise this inner critic as it operates in your life and relationships and discover through meditation how to let go of this painful habit.

At this workshop, Kadam Birgit will guide us in practical and effective meditations and ways of thinking, that enable us to become happier, more content and comfortable in our self and our life.

WHAT TO EXPECT
These classes are based on Buddha’s teachings on the mind, but you do not need to be a Buddhist to attend, or to benefit from them. There is no physical exercise involved and you can choose to sit either in a chair or on a cushion. These classes are suitable for all levels of experience.

Registration starts at 9:30am. This course includes a vegan, wheat-free morning tea (we cannot guarantee gluten-free).

description:
The Overthinking Mind - Break Free From Mental Loops, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

The Overthinking Mind - Tap to break free from mental loops

This workshop explores why our thoughts get stuck in loops of worry, doubt, and replay.  Drawing on the insights of Carl Jung, we’ll uncover how the unconscious mind, shadow, and how unresolved inner conflicts fuel over-thinking. You’ll also learn how the body and nervous system become conditioned to repeat these mental patterns, creating the familiar cycle of racing thoughts and restless emotions.

Through a guided exercise, you’ll experience practical tools from FasterEFT and the science of neuroplasticity—methods that help rewire the brain and bring the mind back to calm clarity.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll not only understand the deeper roots of over-thinking, but you’ll also walk away with simple, repeatable techniques to interrupt mental loops, ease the nervous system, and create a lasting sense of inner peace.

“This is an interactive workshop where you’ll connect with others and see that many of us face the same challenges beneath the surface—making growth and healing easier when we explore them together :)

“This is an interactive workshop that offers the chance to connect with others on a similar journey. It’s powerful to know, that beneath the surface, we often share the same challenges and struggles—and that healing becomes easier when we explore them together.”

Meet your host, Krishnaloka

Introducing Krishnaloka, who is driven to help others overcome their issues within their mind and pyschology. As a mind technician trained in eutaptics (Faster EFT), she employs the fastest and most powerful method to create lasting change by addressing the root causes of issues rather than just the symptoms. Her warm and caring nature makes every interaction with her both comforting and transformative.

description:
Conscious & Connected Breathwork, Conscious & Connected Breathwork
Conscious & Connected Breathwork

Step out of autopilot and into your own rhythm — this session is about tuning in again.

We begin with gentle movement and mindful stretches to awaken the body, open the breath, and release tension. You’ll then be guided through two complementary styles of breathwork, allowing you to explore what feels most nourishing for you:

A dynamic, flowing breath to energise, release emotion, and move through internal blockages

A slow, steady breath to cultivate stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches create a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and clarity of mind. The session closes with a quiet, nurturing meditation, helping you integrate the experience and leave feeling steady, connected, and present.

Stay afterwards to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a simple way to nourish your body and complement your practice.

Meet Your Host: Karla

Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group, Nutrition - Masterton Cancer Support Group
The Cancer support groups offered by Wairarapa Cancer Society are a great place for people navigating cancer to connect with others who have gone through similar experiences.

These groups provide a safe and supportive environment where individuals can share their emotions, experiences, and knowledge.

Not only do these support groups offer a sense of belonging and understanding, but they also provide practical advice, encouragement, and hope during what can be a difficult and challenging time.

This group provides an inclusive and open environment for individuals to attend and participate in the discussion topic. There is no pressure or expectation for attendees to stay for the entire open floor support session.

Structure of group meetings as follows.

- Welcome
- Topic presented and discussed.
- Open floor support
- Closing

This month our focus is on nutrition to support cancer prevention and recovery during treatment. We’ll look at how food choices can help maintain energy, support overall wellbeing, and aid the body through treatment and beyond.

All are welcome. If you would like particular questions covered in the session, please let me know ahead of time.

The support group places a strong emphasis on maintaining the confidentiality and ensuring the safety of attendees.

Please RSVP
There is no cost to attend this meeting.

Rose McKenzie & Nicole McKinnon - open your world of wellness!

First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand® - Unlock the Secrets of Nature’s Sacred Wisdom with Rose McKenzie

Have you ever wondered what a flower essence truly is? Or how it can support profound transformation at every level of your being?

Join us for an illuminating introduction to First Light Flower Essences of New Zealand®, revered as Sacred Plant Medicines for the soul. More than just remedies, these vibrational essences are potent allies in the journey toward holistic healing and self-realisation.

In this special session, we’ll delve into Nature’s Healing Matrix©, a powerful framework that reveals how these essences work in harmony with the natural world to support balance, healing, and inner evolution.

Discover how these sacred tools can help you to:
🌿 Transform emotional imbalances, outdated mindsets, and deep-seated conditioning
🌿 Clear trauma held in the energy field and cellular memory
🌿 Energise, protect, and harmonise the chakra system
🌿 Release fear, limiting beliefs, and inherited patterns stored in your DNA
🌿 Support your soul’s purpose and evolutionary path

Whether you’re new to vibrational medicine or ready to deepen your journey, this experience offers a beautiful gateway into the healing intelligence of the plant kingdom.

Second part of the evening ✨

Holistic Beauty Therapist & Founder of Phorest Inspired Skincare with Nicole McKinnon

Nicole is a holistic beauty therapist with over 30 years of experience, based in her peaceful home salon in Paremata. With a deep belief in the power of intuitive, supportive skincare, she helps women reconnect with themselves and their skin as they age—focusing not on “fixing” wrinkles, but on nurturing vitality, health, and self-confidence.

Alongside her hands-on expertise, Nicole has completed post-graduate studies in cosmetic chemistry and product development, allowing her to blend science with soul in her practice. Her Phorest Inspired Skincare approach is centered in daily grounding rituals and moments of pause—encouraging women to take time for themselves and honour the natural changes in their skin.

Meet your hosts:
Jordan Shearer: Coach. Trainer. Space-holder for rebels, dreamers, and high end performers.

She blends her background in mental health, life coaching, and human behavior with no-fluff, deeply human approach to performance. Having competed herself, Jordan understands the pressure that comes with stepping out, showing up, and giving your best when it counts. Devin has been a personal trainer for 10+ years, and has competed either Nationally or Internationally in the following sports: Underwater Hockey, Olympic Weightlifting, Rock N Roll Dancing, CrossFit, Swimming and has dabbled in endurance sports like Ironman and Road cycling.
Rebekah Glover: Rebekah has gone through a huge lifestyle transformation. After losing over 30kgs and keeping it off, she became a Weight Watchers coach, then she started personal training in 2021. Rebekah has learnt through trial and error, about how important it is to fuel correctly to achieve your goals and that it isn't always about weight loss. If you you want to perform you need to fuel correctly. She is now an avid runner and competes Nationally in Rock n Roll Dancing, after only three years of dancing she holds one national title, and two regional titles.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
From Sad Blokes to Well Men: Changing the focus in male suicide prevention - Wellington (FSB2025/01), From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan.
Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2025? How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.

IT'S TIME FOR A SERIOUS RETHINK IN HOW WE PREVENT MALE SUICIDE AND TO TAKE SUICIDE IN MEN OUT OF THE TOO HARD BASKET
Hear a comprehensive critique of why the suicide rate in men continues to rise despite numerous prevention initiatives, the reasons why we need to focus more on men and what are proven effective strategies for preventing male suicide.
BE PART OF THE SOLUTION
DURING THE MONTH OF MOVEMBER TAKE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE  IN A WORKSHOP WITH INTERNATIONALLY RESPECTED AND AWARD WINNING MALE SUICIDE PREVENTION SPECIALIST BARRY TAYLOR
It matters that men are able to optimise their wellbeing.  Well men contribute to well whānau, communities, workplaces, economy and society
Drawing on his lived experience and his extensive experience in engaging, assessing and supporting suicidal men of different cultures, age groups, genders and sexualities, he offers practical and time proven approaches to both preventing male suicide, engaging with a suicidal man and effective initiatives to optimise men's wellbeing.
"Helping men and boys to transition from sad blokes to well men must be our focus"
Topics covered:
Overview of suicide in men
The Suicidal Moment - Men's thoughts, emotions and behaviour in the "suicidal moment”
Masculinity for the 21st Century - Are traditional notions of masculinity meeting the needs of men in 2024?  How the changes in men’s roles and identity contribute to suicide in men.
Intergenerational suicide among men and its impact of whānau and hapū
From anxious boys through to lonely old men: Tracking male suicide across the lifespan
A vision for men’s wellbeing: An holistic approach to conceptualising men’s wellbeing and key mental wellbeing messages for men.
Tāne Ora: An Online Masterclass in creating a movement of wellbeing for men by men
Participants would benefit from also registering for this online workshop series which takes a deep dive into the determinants of wellbeing men and what is required to shift very ingrained understandings in men about being a man.  How do we move from a program approach to mens wellbeing to a movement of change that engages men in conversations of the heart and the walrua. Click here for more information and to register
Previous participants’ feedback
"The best and most informative workshop I have attended in 27 years of mental health nursing”  Community Mental Health Nurse
"This workshop should be compulsory for anyone working with men”  Male Family Violence Worker
"It was as if Barry was talking about every young man I see at school”  School Counsellor
"I have much better understanding about depressed and suicidal men. Going away with lots of ideas of how work with the men in my community”  Rural Community Support Worker
"Thanks for being so inclusive of older men. They are so often forgotten”. Aged Care Worker
"The incorporation of Te Ao Māori into the training was excellent and made it relevant to the men I work with” Kaiwhakatere
"Most helpful workshop I have been to in regards to suicide”  Mental Health Recovery Programme Facilitator
"Appreciated how inclusive the presenter was of different cultures and his analysis of how culture influences what it means to be a man”  Refugee Health Worker
An opportunity for a day of learning with award winning suicidologist, Barry Taylor

Barry has worked in mental wellbeing promotion and suicide prevention / postvention for 36 years at the local, national and international levels.
His extensive experience includes sitting on state and national government advisory committees; designing, implementing and evaluating suicide prevention programs; writing suicide prevention guidelines, training packages and community resources; providing technical advice to and evaluating  community based and national mental wellbeing and suicide prevention programmes.
He has led multiple ‘firsts’ in the context of suicide prevention and postvention both in Aotearoa New Zealand and overseas. In recognition of his outstanding contribution to mental wellbeing and suicide prevention, he was awarded in 2016 the NSW Mental Health Commissioner's Community Champion Award. He currently sits one of the Health and Disability Ethics Committees.
As a health sociologist, Barry offers an unique insight into the phenomenon of male suicide in the Aotearoa-New Zealand context, the role of gender construction and the critical social and cultural determinants that have influenced men's distress and impaired wellbeing. Insights that very few others trainers or training programs in this country provide. He has had an interest on the impact of social exclusion, alienation and discrimination on mens's wellbeing and advocates for a human rights based, systems change and person-centred approach to wellbeing.The workshop is enriched by the learnings from Barry's own lived experience of depression and suicidality and his pathway to recovery.
After a number of years overseas, Barry is living back in New Zealand and is passionate about building the knowledge base, competence and capability within our country to effectively respond to the unacceptably high rate of male suicide in this country.

WORKSHOP DETAILS
WORKSHOP PLACES ARE LIMITED. REGISTER EARLY TO AVOID DISAPPOINTMENT
Places in the workshop are limited. If the workshop is full please register your name on the waitlist
Group Booking Discount: Book 3 or more participants in one booking and receive 30% discount off each registration

Terms for Payment By Invoice
Payment by Invoice is only for NGOs, Government Departments, Te Whatu Ora, PHOs, Schools and tertiary organisations, businesses.
By selecting to pay by invoice the organisation agrees to the following conditions:
1.  Your place in the workshop is not confirmed until payment has been received. Payment of the invoice must be made within seven days of registering to avoid having your registration cancelled. Late payment fees apply.
2.  A Tax Invoice from TaylorMade Training and Consulting will be sent to you separately which will contain bank details for payment.  
3.  By registering for the workshop, you agree to the cancellation and policy. (refer below).  Organisations who cancel within seven days of the workshop and have not paid the invoice for the outstanding registration fee are still obligated to pay the outstanding debt.

Cancellation and Refund Policy
Workshops can fill quickly. If you are no longer able to attend the workshop please cancel your registration as soon as possible. The following refund policy is strictly adhered to.
Cancellation up to seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop:  Full Refund less $45+GST admin fee
Cancellation within seven days prior to the commencement of the workshop: No refund but registration can be transferred to another person. To transfer your registration log on to your registration and update the name and contact details to the new person attending.
Non attendance:   No refund

description:
Healthy Hospo Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo - Christchurch, Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo
Get peak season ready — with tools to take back control of stress.
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and even serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for performance, resilience, and wellbeing?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, there’s no better time to reset and equip yourself with tools that help you stay calm, focused, and in control. No matter how busy it gets.
At Healthy Hospo, we know the pressure this industry faces. That’s why we’re bringing you an interactive session designed to help you and your teams:
·       Understand the science of stress (and how it can work for you)
·       Experience guided breathwork to reset your body and mind
·       Walk away with practical tools you can use in everyday hospo life
Join us for a 2-hour interactive workshop with our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, and discover how to transform stress from something that drains you into something that fuels you.
Yoga mats provided.
What you need to bring:
·       A notebook.
·       A pen.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $35 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited, and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!

description:
Embrace the Breath, Embrace the Breath
Join Sarah for an evening of mindfulness, breathing and meditation.

Breathwork is a conscious manipulation of the breath to bring about a change in consciousness.

The doors open at 7.15pm (when you arrive, please wait in the waiting room at the entrance, Sarah will come and get you when the studio is ready), with the journey beginning promptly at 7.30pm, with mindfulness, a 45-60 min journey with the breath, followed by connection and sharing.

Sarah Bradnock is a local multi-modality practitioner of energy, bodywork, plant medicine, now working utilising the the breath with SoulSide Breathwork.

Book your space today! Only 10 available.
$55 per person
bring a friend (2 tickets) $100

Registration closes on Wednesday 23 September, if not sold out before then!

What do you need to bring:
- yoga mat or other mat to lay on
- bolster (optional)
- eye pillow
- socks
- jersey or warm top
- water bottle
- journal and pen

If you've never participated in breathwork before, here are a few contraindications:
Physical Contraindications
-Cardiovascular issues
-Glaucoma
-High blood pressure (Over time, if untreated, it can cause health conditions, such as heart disease and stroke) Deep-breathing lowers blood pressure.
-Epilepsy
-Detached Retina (Retinal detachment separates the retinal cells from the layer of blood vessels that provides oxygen and nourishment).
-History of strokes or seizures
-Aneurysm or family history of aneurysm. (Burst blood vessels in the brain).
-Blood thinning medication. (Unfortunately, the blood thinners used to prevent such blood clots can increase the risk of bleeding in the brain, a cause of hemorrhagic stroke).
-Pregnancy or possible pregnancy
-Asthma
-Mental Contraindications
-Substance dependence & addiction (Deep breathwork journeys are not always appropriate for those who are still addicted to a substance, as it tends to raise suppressed or repressed material for processing. However, if you’re currently in recovery, this can be extremely healing, and help you discover the deeper patterns that gave rise to this addiction. (Grof, 1985: 267 – 268).
-Bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or psychosis
-Hospitalisation for emotional crises in the last 10 years
-Psychological conditions and diagnoses, which preclude safe emotional release.

If you are affected by any of the above, please inform Sarah.

*Tickets are non-refundable, but are transferrable with 24 hours notice required.

description:
Site Visit - Studio of Pacific Architecture - Te Aro Double-Header!, Join us on Wednesday 20 August, for an exclusive NAWIC members-only site tour of two very different but geographically close projects in Te Aro. The National War Memorial and FPC Martin Square are both undergoing major refurbishment - join us for a look behind the scenes!
National War Memorial: Refurbishing a Wellington Icon
Step behind the scaffolding and witness the National War Memorial Project – a complex seismic strengthening project where heritage sensitivity is of utmost importance. With construction works being carried out by Maycroft Construction, join us for the rare opportunity to explore a significant piece of the capital’s cultural fabric.
Known to many as the backdrop of ANZAC Day commemorations, this national memorial is undergoing a meticulous refurbishment to ensure its legacy endures for generations to come.
 What’s Happening On Site:
Seismic strengthening of the tower and bell frame 
Stone remediation to preserve its historic façade
Asphalt roofing works
The real challenge? Balancing modern engineering with heritage preservation. Every upgrade is being carried out with deep respect for the building’s historical significance.

Then, just around the corner, we will move on to another refurbishment project – at a much different scale and for a very different purpose!
 FPC Martin Square: from Workshop to Office Space
Leading industrial design-and-build specialists First Principles Constructors are celebrating seven years of innovation with a bold move - into a brand-new headquarters in central Wellington. Take a look inside the transformation of a former engineering workshop into the new HQ for FPC. With exposed services, raw materials, and an industrial aesthetic, this compact yet clever refurbishment shows how much can be achieved in a small urban footprint. Construction is well underway by Aoraki Construction, with completion coming up in September.
What’s Happening On Site:
•     Structural steel installation, new roofing, cladding, a new concrete mezzanine slab
•     Interior fit-out works
•     Full building services upgrades
 The Details:
🕒 DATE and TIME: Wednesday, 20th August, meet at 2.45pm for a 3.00pm start at the National War Memorial
📍 LOCATION: Meet at the National War Memorial (19 Buckle Street) to explore this site first. We will then walk over to 21 Martin Square as a group, for the next site visit.
🎟️ COST: Free to NAWIC members, with a maximum of 18 people on the tour, so please book your space consciously. Get in quick! You can join NAWIC here.
👷‍♀️PPE: Hard hat, hi-vis, steel-capped boots. (Spare hard-hats/hi-vis are available if required, please make sure you advise us of what you need on your RSVP.)
 🎉 After the site visits, unwind with drinks and nibbles sponsored by First Principles Constructors at a nearby venue (TBC) – a chance to connect, reflect, and chat all things design and construction.
🧡 Huge thanks to Studio of Pacific Architecture, Aoraki Construction, Maycroft Construction, and First Principles Constructors for teaming up to make this event possible.
Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
Objects as Treasures, Writer and weaver Flora Feltham's Bad Archive explores the space between what happened and what we can hold onto while Una Cruickshank's The Chthonic Cycle follows objects through time, from billion-year-old amber to floating Lego pieces, to bottles of Chanel No. 5. Join these two essayists for a conversation ranging from the intimately personal to the cosmically vast, about the overlooked, the buried, the things we save, and why we save them.

___
Special thanks to Booksellers Aotearoa NZ for supporting this event.

description:
Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39), Roll For Romance (AGE 25- 39)

Single? We have got you!



Highlights:

This unique event adds a playful twist to speed dating, allowing singles to connect through fun and games.
Enjoy simple board games like Giant Jenga, perfect for breaking the ice – even if you’re new to games!
Skip the awkward small talk and see how people interact in a relaxed, group setting. Match with someone and get connected for a second date.


You’ll start the night in mixed-gender groups and rotate around to see people of the opposite gender.



Feeling a bit shy? You’ll stay with your same-gendered group through the night, so bring a friend along for the ride!



Drinks are provided, and we have nibbles to keep you fueled. Because, let’s face it, gaming is thirsty work!





After the games wrap up, feel free to hang out with your new acquaintances till 9.15 and play other games.

A match form will be sent out the following day, and we’ll connect you with your matches in the coming days.

Perfect for singles looking to mix fun with the chance to meet someone special.





Recommended age 25-39.

Book now!



Not your vibe? Check out our other upcoming events on our website!
By purchasing a ticket you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms & Conditions.



** If your gender is showing as sold out, join the waitlist! You’ll get a notification if there are cancellations or additional tickets released!

It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

description:
New Zealand Game Developers Conference, New Zealand Game Developers Conference
This is more than just a conference; it’s a celebration of Aotearoa’s amazing game dev community.

Our theme for this year is The People at the Heart of Games and is inspired by the well-known Māori proverb “He aha te mea nui o te ao? He tangata, he tangata, he tangata” (What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people), emphasising the human side of game development.

It speaks to the importance of community, collaboration and the people who shape our industry - developers, storytellers, players, and cultural guardians.

We’ll have inspiring talks, engaging workshops, and vibrant panel discussions that highlight voices from all corners of our industry.

Whether you’re a veteran developer, an enthusiastic gamer, or just starting your journey, NZGDC 2025 is the perfect place to forge new friendships, exchange ideas, and ignite your creativity!

description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025, Halloween Nightlife Crawl Wellington 2025
Unleash your inner ghoul! Join the Halloween Nightlife Crawl in Wellington on Oct. 31, 2025. 4+ venues, specials & costumes!

About this Event


Halloween Nightlife Crawl – Wellington 2025 🎭

On Friday, October 31st, 2025, the Halloween Nightlife Crawl brings you through a curated mix of Wellington’s top bars, lounges, and clubs. One ticket gives you access to 4+ venues, exclusive Halloween drink specials, and a night full of music and costumes across the city.




What’s Included
Entry to multiple nightlife venues
Crawl wristband for access and specials
Digital crawl map for easy navigation
No cover charges
DJs and entertainment at every stop


Event Schedule
🔑 Check-In | 7:30–10:30 PM – Pick up your wristband at the first stop.
🍹 Crawl Time | 8:30–11:30 PM – Move between bars and lounges at your own pace.
🎉 Final Party | 11:30 PM–2 AM – Everyone meets at the closing venue for the big finish.



Quick Details
🎟 Tickets start at $15 (Early Bird). Prices rise as the event approaches.
👻 Costumes encouraged — from glam to scary, the night is yours.
📍 Venues announced soon. Full lineup will be available on the Digital Crawl Map.
🔞 18+ only. Government-issued ID required.



18+ Event / Valid ID Required


Helpful Tips
Arrive on Time: Wristbands must be collected at the designated check-in venue by 10:30 PM. Late arrivals cannot be accommodated — no wristband, no entry.
Send a Friend: If you can’t make check-in, you may authorize a friend to pick up your wristband so you don’t miss out.
Know the Schedule: Each venue’s times are listed in the Digital Crawl Map. Drink specials and crawl access are only valid during the hours posted.
Stay Informed: Always review the Digital Crawl Map link on the morning of the event for the latest updates and any last-minute changes.
_______________________________________


Important Terms & Disclaimers
Age Requirement
All participants must be 18+ with a valid government-issued photo ID. Entry will not be granted without ID.
Wristbands
A wristband is required for entry at all participating venues. You must present your ticket or QR code at check-in to receive it. Wristbands must remain visible throughout the night. If you fail to pick up your wristband during the scheduled window, no replacement will be provided.
Tickets & Refund Policy
All ticket sales are final — no refunds, exchanges, or transfers. If the event is canceled in full, your ticket (minus fees) will be automatically refunded. Venues, times, and drink specials may be modified without notice.
Venue Rules
Each venue reserves the right to deny entry or remove guests for intoxication, capacity limits, inappropriate dress, or disruptive conduct. No refunds will be issued if entry is refused for these reasons.
Capacity & Timing
Some stops may reach capacity during the event. Admission is first-come, first-served, and your ticket does not guarantee immediate access to any specific location. Late arrivals may face delays in entry.
Self-Guided Experience
This is a self-led crawl — no host will escort groups between venues. Use the Digital Crawl Map to navigate. If staff at a venue are not aware of the crawl, contact the rep listed on the map and proceed to another participating venue if needed.
Drink Specials
Promotions are determined by each venue and may change or end without advance notice.
Security & Dress Code
All venues conduct their own security screening. Wristbands do not bypass these checks. Costumes must not include weapons (real or replica) or offensive themes. Violations may result in denied entry without refund.
Behavior Expectations
Respect venue staff, security, and fellow attendees. Aggressive or damaging behavior may result in removal without a refund.
Liability Notice
By purchasing a ticket and attending, you voluntarily accept all risks related to participation, including alcohol consumption, injury, illness, property loss, or incidents caused by other attendees. You waive any claims against the organizers, affiliates, staff, and participating venues. You also agree to indemnify and hold harmless these parties from any expenses or claims resulting from your actions.
Event Continuity
This event will run rain or shine. Venues and schedules may change. Check the Digital Crawl Map and your email on event day for the latest information.
Acknowledgment
By purchasing a ticket, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agreed to these terms and accept full responsibility for your participation.

description:
EVolocity Pre-Scrutineering Day - Marlborough 2025, VEHICLE PRE-SCRUTINEERING
Students bring their vehicles and scrutineers assess them as fit-for-purpose for race day. It's important that all teams participate in pre-scrutineering to ensure you are on track for your vehicle to meet the technical specifications and safety requirements necessary for race day.
Many vehicles will not be complete and that is okay – students will be given feedback with time to make modifications or corrections before the regional final.
We strongly encourage all teams to attend pre-scrutineering, this is the second most important event of the year and all about making sure your vehicle is safe and that you get to race your vehicle at regional finals!
BRING ALONG WITH YOU
Your Vehicle - or start of it, whatever stage you are at
Any components and materials
Drink bottle, lunch and a snack

Marlborough Boys College,

description:
Hyakunin Isshu - Japan Society September event, Our meeting will be on hyakunin isshu, which translates to '100 people, one poem each'.
I will be bringing hyakunin isshu cards (each containing a poem each), which evolved from the 16th century introduction of European playing cards, which developed into the Japanese game karuta. Come learn about these cards, and play the simple card game 'bouzu mekuri' with these cards!
Please RSVP by Monday 1 September via this link.
RSVP is mandatory to attend this event.
There is a maximum capacity of 10 attendees, so get in quick!

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - September, Social Sewing Saturday - September
Join us for a fun day of sewing and socializing this September at Social Sewing Saturday - make new friends and create something amazing tog

About this Event

Social Sewing Saturday - September
Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.
Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Wilton Playcentre Open Week, Nau mau, haere mai! Come along on session and meet the crew. Each day for Open Week we run a different theme. You are welcome to come for each day, or just pick one. The theme of Playcentre Open Week this year is “Whānau tupu ngātahi – families growing together.”
We ask that you please bring a change of clothes, and a nut-free snack for your tamariki. Come along for as much or as little as you can. We are all parents so we know what it is like to work around sleep schedules and cajoling little ones to get out of the house. Come have a cup of tea and relax knowing your child is playing safely and having fun.
Monday - Hand prints (TBC)
Tuesday - Animal day! note no actual animals involved. Play themed around animals
Wednesday - Pāua playgroup for 2's and under will be cacao husk play
Thursday and Friday will make a decision on the week about the weather. One of the days will be Sandpit and the other day will be
obstacle course. We will update you via this page
Monday 9.00am - 12.15pm
Tuesday 9.00am - 12.45pm
Wednesday (younger tamariki) 9.00am - 12.15pm
Thursday 9.00am - 12.45pm
Friday 9.00am - 12.45pm
